title: Amazing views
text: We started our US trip at this hotel. Tracie, who was very kind and helpful, took care of us. She gave us a beautiful room on the 21st floor with a breathtaking view. The room was clean, the beds were amazingly soft, and there was a beautiful homemade message waiting for us in the room, which we will display at home. Archer set the bar very high for our trip. Thank you.

title: Can’t stop talking about it!
text: We were blown away by Archer Hotel. We took my daughter to New York for 13th birthday and they went over and beyond to make the stay with them special for us and her. My friend had told us about Archer hotel in NYC as one of her favorites, but it was beyond even what she described! Our view of the Empire State building was so worth it and was a big wow when we first arrived. The bed was SO comfortable, which is very important to me when staying somewhere. But beyond that the staff provided the ultimate experience in hospitality! We were greeted with friendly, smiles, and kind words every time we were coming and going. They gave us suggestions for what to do in the city, and when they found out it was my daughter’s birthday, they even gave her a gift and colored the sweetest card for her. I just don’t feel like I can say enough about how we loved Archer hotel. We’ve already been telling our friends!

title: The Archer is terrific.
text: The Archer was terrific!well located in mid town.  Rooms clean, bedding very comfortable. The roof top bar had panoramic views inc Empire State Building.  There was a feeling of camaraderie amongst us enjoying the ambience of the bar.  I’ll gladly return.

title: Great Accommodations and Service
text:
Staff was amazing and very accommodating. The rooms beautifully decorated and beds were very comfortable. 
On our last day, Jonathan made are travel to the airport seamless, ordering taxi at the right time, not letting us lift a finger. 
Many thanks for the great visit.

title: Great service, good rooms.
text:
The service there was unparalleled. Examples: our older one was sick, so we got food in via Uber eats. The hotel was gracious and provided plates, silverware and a space to eat. 
Another example: we asked about another room given the illness. I was told a manager would call, and within minutes, he did. These examples are intended to paint the picture of friendly and helpful service. Great locale, clean albeit small rooms. Would stay again.

title: Great hotel at a great location.
text: Great location to visit New York. The room was clean and very comfortable (bed, airco, silent). Beautiful top roof bar view at the Empire State building. Staff was very kind and helpful. We planned to eat at various locations but we ended up most of the time at the hotel. Clean and very good food. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Good room, excellent service in central location
text:
Comfortable rooms with good beds and equipment. Little space but normal for New York and manages to make good use of it to be very functional.
5 star service.
Excellent location. Enjoy the rooftop bar with views of the Empire State Building.

title: Archer is now our absolute FAVORITE hotel!
text:
Archer Hotel is by far our favorite hotel that we have ever stayed at in NYC!
This was our first time here but will definitely be our go to from now on!
Every single staff member that we encountered during our stay were all so very welcoming & always eager to help in any way
We booked an Empire view room & it did not disappoint the views at night are incredible!
The beds are very comfy & the pillows are amazing!
We loved receiving treats from our room attendant throughout our stay
Already looking to book another trip to NYC for the summer & Archer will definitely be where we stay❤️

title: Perfect Hotel in New York
text: We recently stayed at the Archer Hotel. The hotel is very clean and the facilities are in good order. We felt very comfortable and safe staying here. The rooms are small but very efficient and the housekeeping staff kept it clean. The front desk staff are super friendly and helpful, probably the friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in! The hotel is well located, off the busy streets and close to many attractions.

title: Great hotel in the Big Apple
text: The rooms were small, but no smaller than NYC hotels, but  were laid out very efficiently.  It felt like we were in a larger room and the king bed was excellent.  All around, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The location was perfect.

title: Forget the rest, stay with the best.
text: Everyone at the front desk were super friendly and accommodating. My dinner at AKB was amazing. Late night drinks at Spyglass were only outdone by the views of city and Empire State Building. The rooms were clean, shower was hot, and bed was comfortable. All and all great experience.

title: Great experience and a very convenient hotel.
text:
The service here was outstanding and the staff could not have been nicer. This is also conveniently located near shopping and Times Square. This is a boutique hotel so keep in mind the rooms are quite small, however there is ample storage room under the bed, which was smart planning.
My wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend in NYC … and we will most certainly stay here again!

title: Cleanest Boutique Hotel, Incredibly Friendly Staff
text: I’ve stayed in several midtown/theatre district hotels and this is by far the most consistently clean, beautiful room features (especially bathroom/shower), and the staff is the friendliest, most efficient among major competitors.

title: Great staff and location!
text: We stayed at the Archer for 5 days in March.  It was a birthday trip and my first visit to NYC.  The staff here was so friendly and welcoming that it totally made up for small room size.  They got us checked in early and even left me a birthday treat.  We had nice amenities, comfy beds and the ease of walking to many restaurants and tourist spots.  We enjoyed the rooftop bar, and the available coffee downstairs.  We were not bothered by street noise.  Kudos to the housekeepers, I left my sunglasses there and actually had them returned!  Thank you so much Jeffrey and everyone there for a great first trip to the Big Apple. Would stay here again!

title: Excellent place to stay in NYC
text: This hotel is perfect!  The location in Manhattan has several subway stations located in close proximity making it very easy to come and go.  The hotel is very welcoming and clean.  The front desk staff could not be any nicer or accommodating.  Definitely make this your "go to hotel" if you want a smaller, quaint, nice, welcoming and perfectly located hotel.

title: Good Boutique Hotel with an Excellent Location in Midtown Manhattan
text: Boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan. There are pros and cons to the Archer Hotel. Pros include an excellent location in Midtown Manhattan close to Bryant Park, Times Square and Grand Central and a short 10 min walk to the Empire State Building or Madison Square Garden. The front staff are very welcoming and helpful. The rooftop bar the Spyglass was enjoyable and offers excellent views of the Empire State Building. Good shower pressure, comfortable bed and the room was modern and clean. As for cons, the room was quite small (not unusual in NYC) but the walls were paper thin, so you can hear every word from your neighbors next door, and this creates a real lack of privacy. This is the only reason to not stay here again as everything else was terrific.

title: A Clean, Comfortable and beautiful place.
text: We loved the hotel, the rooms were always clean and with beautiful details. It is in a central location but away from noise and the place is beautiful and clean. Be sure to visit the Rooftop Spyglass.

title: Great hotel
text: My family and I stayed at the Archer Hotel for 4 days during March,  the location was excellent as we could walk to everything.  The staff were amazing.  They were friendly , courteous and very helpful.  The concierge provided excellent  recommendations on restaurants in the area.  The rooms were very clean and every evening we returned to some type of treat in our rooms. I found the bed very comfortable. We made a last minute request to see if we could have rooms near each other and this was accommodated.  I highly recommend the Archer

title: Archer Hotel
text: Excellent location and staff. Rooms are small but this was to be expected. Bathroom was lovely but the pressure in the shower wasn't great. Overall would definitely recommend and would stay again for sure

title: Weekend in NYC
text: My friend and I were visiting our sons, who live and work in NYC, and the Archer Hotel was the perfect venue for us to stay. It is centrally located to a lot of great restaurants and activities, and easy to get to from the train station and the subway. The room was immaculate and the rooftop bar offered yummy cocktails and fantastic views of the Empire State Building and surrounding city landscape. We will definitely be back again!

title: Great for being in the middle of it but tucked away
text:
Husband and I used chase points to book a night. 
We booked the king room with empire view. 
Room was lovely, but like all NYC rooms very small!
Staff are friendly and helpful. 
Sky view bar looking over the empire state building is a great spot. 
Will hopefully come back.

title: Tremendous
text: Archer Hotel . King sized bed . Stayed four nights. After the half marathon.  It was awesome . Slept like a baby.  Breakfast was amazing. !!! Drinks were incredible. .  Food was delicious.    Best friendly staff ever.  Comfortable and secure.  And would come back again and again and again.

title: St Patricks Weekend
text: Nice, comfortable hotel in a central location. Clean room with a view onto the street. Rooftop bar  was excellent, the lower bar was good but feel it requires a bit more love. Staff are very pleasant especially at the Desk - Jasmine and another girl (sorry)  were very pleasant. Austin early in the morning, late in the evening was a go to - full of information and advice!

title: Anniversary trip of a lifetime!
text: We spent 4 wonderful nights at the Archer Hotel for our 32nd wedding anniversary.  Upon entering the room, we were greeted with a sweet handwritten note and charcuterie for two.  During the stay, the entire staff, from managers to housekeeping, were friendly, genuinely kind, and extremely helpful.  We chose The Archer based on our son's recommendation after staying there this past summer.  He was right on the money about the hotel being safe, modern yet charming, plus beautiful with a fun vibe.  This boutique hotel has small rooms but they are immaculately clean, comfortable, and have everything you need, and then some (water bottles, toiletries, safe, iron, blow dryer, Nespresso, mini fridge, umbrellas, slippers, the most delicious caramels, etc.)  The rooms are very quiet with absolutely NO noise from the street or coming through the walls.  Everything we ate in their restaurant was delicious.  The rooftop bar is a must see/visit.  This will now be our "go-to" home away from home when visiting NY.  Special shout out to manager Scott for going above and beyond to make our trip extra special.   Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

title: NY Experience
text: This hotel was amazing. Location was centered to everything we wanted to see. Hotel looks beautiful and the service was immaculate. The SpyGlass rooftop bar is beautiful and of course the service was amazing. I wanted specified drinks that taste a certain way and omg the bartender was on top of her class on this, the taste on the drinks were so good. The only issue if you are out of town is that the parking lot is a block away from the hotel. The parking is not included and is a whole separate charge. The hotel will give you a sticker on the parking card but it's only for $15 dollars off. If you park at that lot the price per day is $90 so make sure you will make it worth it with the vehicle you come with to go sight seeing because parking in NY is very expensive.

title: WONDERFUL FIND FOR A STAY IN MANHATTAN!
text: The Archer Hotel was everything we could've asked for.  Excellent location in quiet street, tucked away from Times Square frenzy.  Very comfortable and immaculately clean, offered everything you could want or need.  Nice large outside seating area in front, nice lobby with front bar and breakfast, as well as back bar and great AKB restaurant.  We ate there several times with drinks, exceptionally good food.  Staff are all professionals.  The guest room was wonderful, fantastic beds like a cloud.  Beautiful bathroom with magnifying mirror and good light, great shower.  Large refrigerator for drinks & leftovers.  Nespresso coffee is a treat, different strengths with plenty of servings.  The SpyGlass rooftop lounge is exceptional.  Plenty of room, seating inside or out, spectacular view of Empire State Building and other architecture.  I can't believe we somehow found the Archer, but we'll certainly be back.  They pay attention to every detail and anticipate your needs and desires.  The Archer made our stay even more memorable.

title: Wonderful stay at the Archer
text: Another wonderful stay at the Archer! Such a wonderful, central location, and an absolutely amazing staff. Rooms are small but very comfortable and well appointed, with daily treats and service. Saturday brunch at the rooftop bar was delicious and a great view of the Empire State Building. I can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff are, they truly make the Archer experience exceptional. Thanks for a great St. Patrick's Day weekend!

title: Comfort and service will always be remembered!!
text: Weekend birthday trip was made exceptional by the service and care provided by the staff at The Archer. The hotel amenities including the rooftop bar        made our stay one to remember. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Excellent experience
text:
I had an excellent experience during my 6-night stay in the Archer Hotel. 
Mix between a business trip and leisure travel during the weekend. 
Great location, super friendly staff, comfy bed, and very clean. 
One highlight is the view from the rooftop - Stunning!

title: Excellent NYC hotel
text: An extraordinary experience!  I brought my grandson for his 10th birthday and 1st visit to NYC.  Found the Archer through my cc points and it was the best choice.  The staff go above and beyond, are friendly and genuine.  When we returned to our room after checking in and spending the day out doing the NYC thing, there was a handwritten bday card and box of candy for him :)  The room was spotless, beds and pillows comfy, and a great bathroom. Even the frig was a step up from the norm. We had breakfast at the bar, yummy French toast and yogurt parfait. I will be returning in April for a girls weekend.  Be sure to stop in the Spy Glass for an unbelievable view of the Empire State Building.

title: Jackpot!
text: First time and had a great experience. Staff was very friendly. Special thanks to Jonathan for such a great job. Room was a bit small, but manageable. It’s NYC 😂! Excellent location. Tried to get to the rooftop bar but had a private activity so we left, but still a good option at night.

title: Bday Getaway in NY
text: The staff are very welcoming and professional. They answered any questions we had and even recommended a great brunch spot in the city for us to enjoy. The room was comfortable and clean with a nice view of the Empire State Building. Overall it was a beautiful hotel and an enjoyable stay.

title: Archer or nothing for us! Archer oder nichts für uns!
text:
Archer Hotel or nothing!

We fly often and regularly to our beloved New York City and stay exclusively at the Archer Hotel!

The hotel is central, clean, safe, simply brilliant! 

The crew is as smart as they are charming and read every wish from the guest's eyes!

At this point, greetings go out to Scott 🤜🏻🤛🏻

You don't just feel welcome here, you feel friendly! The rooms are great, as is the food!

The rooftop bar with the view of the Empire State Building alone is awesome!

Guys, we already miss you and look forward to seeing you again in July and November!

If we could give it 150%, we would!

Thomas and Stephanie

title: Great place to stay
text: We loved staying at the Archer Hotel. Much quieter on this side of town. This hotel knows comfort and hospitality. Great place to stay! Great amenities from phone chargers to in room umbrellas that you may need for New York weather.

title: Great location, wonderful staff, fantastic room!
text: Great experience from the very first interaction with staff (Tracie and Joseph, especially) to the room (great sleep and view of the Empire State Building). Highly recommend it and can’t wait to go back!

title: Excellent location/Great design
text: Excellent beds & room layout; I especially like the bathroom with plenty of countertop space to layout cosmetics & toiletries.  Quiet & the shower was excellent.  The design of the rooms is well put-together.  Breakfast was great & the lobby well designed.  Front desk staff is personable & well-trained....I appreciate that.   Roof Top Bar, you need a reservation.  Otherwise, not a good experience.

title: Classy Hotel in a Great Location
text: Rooms are small, but it’s in a great location in NYC. We found it to be quiet for a city hotel, and our Empire view room had an amazing view of the Empire State Building. The rooftop bar was a really nice amenity. We’d visit again and certainly recommend to friends.

title: Friendly, well maintained, super roof top bar
text: A pampering hotel in the heart of Manhattan with a fantastic rooftop bar with a view of the Empire State Building, very friendly team, very well-kept building, small room with small bathroom, but everything you need is there. Very comfortable bed, Nespresso machine that is refilled daily, delicious food at moderate prices (for local standards)

title: Cozy and Convenient
text: My Husband and I stayed at Archer Hotel for a quick trip into the City.  The hotel is in a great location - we walked over from Grand Central.  Close, but not too close.  The staff was welcoming and friendly.  The lobby was clean and fully staffed.  Cozy seating area, two bars (one on the top floor with a balcony overlooking the Empire State Building).  We got in a bit early and checking in was not a problem.  The room was cozy and clean - just what we needed for a quick stay.  Complimentary water bottles and a candy treat in the room and coffee/tea in the bar area in the morning was a nice touch.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Not the Vegan-friendly hotel advertised on veggiesabroad.com
text: Friendly and comfortable hotel that was NOT vegan friendly. Menu at restaurant had few options and down/feather pillows and comforters are standard. Some treats provided in room were also not vegan. I have no idea why they were deemed vegan-friendly.

title: Birthday stay at the Archer Hotel New York
text:
We returned from Archer Hotel New York,with is a safe place to stay, with no disturbance from uninvited guests. They have taken many steps to keep the hotel safe. The Archer staff was professional and we had pristine accommodations. The Archer staff also pays close atttention to every detail and is courteous to all. We will definately return.
The Riegels

title: Perfect Location....
text: Perfect location to walk to all the hotspots and easy access to the Subway to get further afield. The staff were friendly especially Haresha (apologies if I spelt name incorrectly), he was so helpful advising us on breakfast and dinner recommendations. We booked a king empire view room which was small but easy to get around and store our clothes. The bathroom is nice and big and our view of the empire made the trip extra special. Our bed was so comfy and hotel added nice touches when they cleaned the room. We had a drink in the rooftop bar spyglass - definitely worth a trip as the empire views are really cool!

title: Hidden Gem in Manhattan
text:
Everything about the hotel was great. From the staff to the room and location. There isn't any complaints. The pricing too was great considering everything else surrounding was priced crazy high.

10/10 would stay again anytime we are in NYC

title: Very Good!
text: This boutique hotel is very nice and an amazing value. Room is small but very well configured for convenience and efficiency. The quality of materials is excellent and the staff was very friendly. I loved the candy they left in your room every night.

title: Look no farther
text: We just returned to LA feeling rested from a great week at Archer and exploring NYC. We walked everywhere with such a prime location! Friendly faces greeted us to welcoming clean rooms and provided tips on local favorite dining and sites. Fun amenities and view of Empire State Building that can’t be beat!

title: Nice hotel and rooms but TINY
text: My only complaint is that the rooms are tiny. In order to use the desk to work I had to disconnect the Nespresso station and move it to one of the night tables. For it to fit I had to move the phone. Just barely enough room for one person’s things. That said, I liked the property overall and would go back

title: Great Option in Midtown
text: This is a great boutique hotel located close to all of the touristy spots but far enough away to get away from the crowds. Bryant Park has a very cool winter wonderland that’s a 3 minute walk. Plus close to all of the transit options. Beds are very comfortable. Book this place now!

title: Very nice hotel
text: The hotel was clean and the staff was very attentive. The room was nice, but on the smaller side. The Spyglass bar was a cool place to relax for a cocktail. Location was good and within walking distance to almost all the main attractions. My only complaint would be it was noisy throughout the night on the street below.

title: Really wanted to love..
text: I was really looking forward to our little getaway at the Archer. I've had my eye on staying at this chain for some time now so it pains me to say that our stay was pretty subpar.  The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. Understanding that this hotel is located in the middle of NYC where everything is small, but this was shocking. Once we got past the size of the room, we were happy to see a decently sized shower and nice bathroom. Then we got to the beds. One was fine, the other one had such a severe dip in it that made it very uncomfortable, not exactly the 5-star bedding that I read about and was excited for.  To top everything off, the fire alarm went off the second night we were there, certainly not the hotels fault but frustrating nonetheless especially because it woke our 2year old up. On a positive note, the bar areas are very nice. So sad to have to write such a negative review, but this was my personal experience. Looks like many other people had wonderful stays, so still should consider this hotel if this is the area you are looking to stay in NYC.

title: My stay at Archer hotel was extremely satisfied
text: Fashionable and confortable hotel in the heart of Manhattan , wel located and with an incredible atmosphere. Fully recomended if you travel alone or with our couple. Rooms are not for families ataying.

title: Exceptionally Clean and Great Location!
text: The Archer is located in a convenient spot, in walking distance to all the Midtown sights, museums, Times Square, both train stations, Broadway, shopping, and dining. We had a fantastic rate due to a special, so we gave it a try for a couple nights in the City. Although the room was on the smaller side, it was extremely comfortable and exceptionally clean, and relaxing! A+ Fixtures and finishes are relatively new. We had breakfast there one morning—that was OK, but not exceptional. All in all, a GREAT stay for the price point. We would certainly stay again if the price is right.

title: Jackpot
text: Archer Hotel New York ticks all the boxes!  THE most comfortable beds and proper linens!!!!  Exceptional staff!!  Excellent location. Spyglass Bar on the top floor has a fabulous view of the Empire State Building.  I give it a definite 10 out of 10!

title: Great views, location and rooftop bar!
text: Travelled to New York Jan/Feb 2024 with my mum for 5 nights. Hotel staff were lovely from start to finish, room was clean and basic, not huge but plenty of storage space, 2 double beds and an incredible view of the empire state building from the room (we were on floor 21)! Didn't visit the rooftop bar until the last night but we should gone sooner as it was great! Small but very attentive staff, great cocktails, tasty food, great views, vibe and sunset with outdoor balcony too! Only 15 minute walk from times square so close enough but out of the way of the very busy touristy crowds, close to Bryant Park and the New York Public Library Would 100% stay and again and recommend to anyone visiting! X

title: Nice mid price mid town hotel
text: Decent mid range hotel. Small but well appointed rooms. Comfy bed. Clean. Modern. Good roof top bar with good food and wine. Ok staff. Friendly. Good reception. Not a place to stay for a ‘big experience’ but nice and good value. Would recommend.

title: Pure class for the ultimate NY stay
text: The Archer is pure class. First off, the location is unbeatable. Nestled on a quiet street between 5th and 6th Ave, it’s also right around the corner of busy and chaotic Time Square, but you wouldn’t even know it. The staff is wonderful, friendly and extremely knowledgeable. The rooms may be tiny but that didn’t bother us a single second. The design is classy, the beds are amazing and on top of it all, we had an incredible view onto the Empire State Building. The cherry on top of a perfect birthday (cake) weekend. We will be back!

title: Great spot no matter what you're in the city for!
text:
Highly recommend this hotel. Great location no matter what you're in the city for, sparkling clean, comfortable, and friendly service. We absolutely loved the vibe of the hotel from the moment we stepped into the lobby. 
Our room(s) were good sized and well-appointed. In my opinion, anyone saying they are small doesn't visit NYC that often because there are MUCH smaller rooms out there! These are average or even somewhat big, in my experience!
We ended up getting to try out 2 rooms due to an issue with the TV in the first room we checked into. Haresh at the front desk was AMAZING in dealing with this. He is superb! He conveniently texted me to handle the TV issue, which I appreciated because I wouldn't have wanted to talk on the phone at our dinner reservation. They couldn't fix the tv so we were able to upgrade to a room with a stunning view of the Empire State Building and had the perfectly relaxing night we came for. 
I definitely recommend booking directly through the hotel as it seems they offer a $25 dining credit. We used ours for brunch the next morning and the food was great! HUGE portions we could hardly finish! 
We can't wait to come and stay again.

title: Great Staff and location
text:
The service from the staff reminds me of pre covid days. They promptly answer the phone, they sent up the extra pillows I requested 30min after calling, the bar staff was attentive, the lobby was clean. Check in and out was easy and quick. 

Will definitely be back!

title: Nice Manhattan experience, convenient for work stays
text:
Comfortable room with a desk convenient for working, reliable wifi.
Coffee pods & expresso machine in the room  were really convenient.
Good in room dining.
One potential area of improvement, the bed lamp could have a higher intensity bulb, it was a bit too dim.

title: Not ideal if you actually want to sleep...
text: I normally only write positive reviews, so am disappointed to have to report our stay at the Archer Hotel was not a great experience. On the plus side, the reception staff was great, the bed was super comfortable, and the location was ideal. Unfortunately, sleep was elusive for 2 reasons: 1) The light in the bathroom goes on automatically which, given that it is literally 2 feet from the bed (the rooms are tiny!), meant that both the person using the facilities was forced to be fully awake the moment they entered and the person in bed was also woken up as the light flooded the room. Definitely a design flaw, especially for those of us who get up several times a night... 2) The HVAC was very noisy!! We had high expectations based on the other reviews, and were fully expecting the small room, but we also anticipated being able to sleep. We will sadly not be returning.

title: Great location and comfortable room and hotel!
text: Stayed for a weekend in mid December.  This was an ideal landing spot to see the sights of the city!  It was a quick and brisk walk to Rockefeller Center and the beautiful tree.  The reception staff was very friendly and greeted me warmly every day as I entered and exited daily.  I had a single king and thought the room was pretty well appointed for a NYC hotel. The bed and bedding was super comfortable. Although it was winter I was hot and asked for maintenance to adjust my setting to put cool air on. The staff was really sweet and accommodating as well.  Nice touch with the glass coffee and tea service as well as Fiji water. The shower was also very nice and spacious.  I didn’t get a chance to use the bar area but these spaces looked great too.  I would definitely stay here again when I return to NYC.

title: NYC gem
text: This is a small hotel in the garment district of NYC.  It's a find.  The staff is helpful and friendly, the room was clean, and the beds comfortable. The doorman went out of his way to find us cabs on a few occasions.  The front desk staff is very friendly, and surprising for NYC, they were smiling all the time.

title: Small but mighty
text: Great stay in this little hotel in center of activity but very quiet. Only complaint is that room was very small and hard to navigate. But quality and convenience make up for it! The Spyglass bar was fun, great view, excellent food and drinks.

title: I will stay at The Archer again!
text: Great customer service all the way around!  My only caution to others would be that if you have 2 people staying in the room, it may be a tight fit for luggage.  Fortunately, I was alone so no problem for me.  The room was nice and clean.  I'll definitely stay here again.

title: 5 days in NYC
text: Hotel staff are warm and welcoming, not just when registering but throughout our stay.  Rooms are a bit small but love the luggage storage space (see if you can find it).  I would recommend this boutique hotel to make you feel special during your stay.

title: Great central NYC Boutique Hotel
text:
I recently stayed at Archer Hotel New Year for 4 nights whilst over in New York with my girlfriend and we absolutely loved it. We were wanting a boutique style hotel on a mid-range budget and this hotel ticked all the boxes. The check-in process was quick and reception were very friendly and always willing to help with directions or suggestions about local attractions. The room itself was small but the majority of hotel rooms in New York are. It had a wonderfully comfortable big bed and TV that was well situated which showed both American channels and a few international ones. The room offered a complimentary Nespresso machine and tea and coffee making facilities. This was a lovely touch and meant that you could have a good quality hot drink after exploring New York. The bathroom was spacious, modern and had a powerful shower too with luxury soaps and shower gel. The room also had numerous power sockets and fast free WiFi which was available and very handy too. 
We never ate in the restaurant however in the morning they offered complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate in takeaway cups which was a lovely touch and set us up well for a cold December in New York. 

We visited the Skybar once however was too busy and the outside area was closed due to bad weather so we didn’t stay, The lobby bar downstairs was nice and we enjoyed a drink there once. 

I would return to this hotel as their central location and comfortable rooms means it makes it a great place to stay. There are plenty of restaurants near by and about 15 minutes’ walk from Times Square. 

Also this hotel is easy to get to from JFK Airport by public transport and a short 15 minute from Penn Station where you can connect to JFK which is a lot cheaper and faster than a taxi!

title: Archer is Amazing - Arrive as a stranger Leave as a friend
text:
We stayed at Archer hotel for 14 nights on December 2023.

After a couple of hiccups when we checked in we ended up having a wonderful stay. 

The hotel had presented us with a bottle of champagne and a card in our room for our 30th Anniversary, we were very touched by this thoughtful gift.

Our prior request for a quiet room was applied , we had a room on the fourth floor which faced the street, it was super quiet and very well appointed the beds are amazing, very comfortable and the bathroom is beautiful. So many reviews on here comment on the size of the rooms at this hotel, it’s NYC!!! The Archer have done a great job providing storage space under the beds. The size of the room was no issue for us.

The room was spotless and house keeping did an amazing job each day were there. 

The hotel is perfectly located in midtown, walking distance to great restaurants and cafes and several subway stations. 

The manager Haresh was incredible! He ensured we were well looked after during our 14 night stay. He was very welcoming to the feedback we provided early on in our stay  and was always available for a chat or to hear if we needed anything.

The SkyBar has the most wonderful views of the Empire State Building and on the times we visited the bar, it wasn’t busy and the staff were welcoming and friendly and make a delicious dry martini with a twist. 

On our last day Justin went out of his way to find us a large taxi , this was greatly appreciated. He was amazing! 

Other staff who were also very helpful during our stay were, Scott, Kyra, Tracie and Salma and the manager of the restaurant, apologies I can’t remember his name. 

A very big thank you to all the staff we interacted during our stay. 

I would not hesitate in recommending Archer Hotel to family and friends for a short or long stay in NYC. 

All the best for 2024 to everyone at Archer! 

Cheers,

Justin Compton & Mal Whitling

title: Manhattan Magic
text: The Archer is a beautiful boutique stile hotel, with amazing staff.  From the second you walk through the door to until you leave, the staff are super friendly, very responsive and continually go above and beyond to make the experience complete.  The Hotel is immaculate in all aspects and the dining experience is quality all round.  Whether traveling for business or a vacation, you'll love the guest experience.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: My son (8 yo) and I stayed here over MLK weekend and we had a great time. As we walked in, the staff was very warm and inviting. The check in process was very easy and the staff offered my son a "toy" from a treasure chest, which was a nice touch. Our room was on the seventh floor, next to the elevators, and view was the building next door.  The room itself was clean and I appreciated the nice touches like the daily treats. The room was tiny, I expected it to be small, but lets just say they were efficient with every square footage. We could hear people around the elevator, but being a smaller hotel, it wasn't too bad.  We had a peaceful night rest every evening. The location was great!  It was a 10 - 15 min walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State Building, etc. Overall, a great place to stay and only compliant would be the size of the room.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Our room was clean with a perfect view of the Empire State Building from our window. It was quiet, the beds were comfortable, and the staff were all very kind and efficient. The hotel was within walking distance of many tourist attractions. The room was a little small, but such is life in NYC!

title: Get the Empire State Building view room!
text: A wonderful stay! As soon as we walked in, we were greeted with a smile. Check-in was easy and friendly.  Rooms were very nice and beds were comfortable.  We lost an earring in the bathroom and had to look around in the floor for a while. - FLOOR WAS VERY CLEAN EVEN UNDER THE VANITY! Rooftop bar was very busy but we found a seat quickly - the view of the Empire State Building was beautiful! Thank you for a great weekend!

title: Warm, inviting, DELICIOUS!
text: My 13 yo daughter and I stayed here while we saw a broadway show and explored the city this past weekend. From the servers at both restaurants, the front desk, housekeeping - EVERYONE was so kind, attentive, and positively helpful with every interaction. Our room was perfectly supplied with water bottles, robes, candies and more they were all perfect touches that made our stay so extra special! We slept beautifully and were so cozy and comfortable. The view was great. The location was perfect. We could not have asked for more and, especially compared to what we paid around us, this value was extraordinary. We certainly got our money's worth here while feeling safe and welcome. It immediately felt like our home away from home.

title: Great location, quiet night sleep
text:
A few blocks from Grand Central, Bryant Park and subway.  Nice room, spacious bathroom, comfortable bed, quiet night's sleep.  Front desk staff very pleasant. Offers dining, roof top bar, and lobby with bar and multiple couches for seating.  
Would stay again.

title: Perfect honeymoon spot along with a great stay in NYC!
text: My husband and I enjoyed our honeymoon at Archer Hotel New York for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff was sweet - arranging it so a bottle of champagne on ice with two flutes was already in our room upon arrival. The rooftop bar is hands down worth your stay. Incredibly amazing views of the Empire State Building from the standing room only balcony. Some really good cocktails and the hotel food is excellent. The rooms, while small, were thoughtfully designed to utilize every last inch of space. The Nespresso machine in room, along with the daily artisan treats made us feel even more pampered. And having a fridge in the room was a huge plus! Just so many great little amenities! The robe and slippers were lovely as well! It was my first time to NYC and I loved every second of it. The location was phenomenal - so close to so many things, but with an entrance on a smaller, much quieter street! We will definitely stay at Archer again when we return - there just wasn't enough time to do everything on our list! The only very small negative was the daily cleaning service seemed to become more relaxed each day we stayed so by the last day we didn't even have a spare roll of toilet paper and had to call down for more. However, once I called, two rolls were promptly delivered, followed by another about 10 minutes later, which really surprised us. Thank you, Archer Hotel New York!

title: Decent Stay
text: My mom and I stayed here for a couple days the first week on January 2024, for a girls trip. Check in was smooth, staff was nice enough. When asked, they gave recommendations. The room was clean but incredibly tiny, even for New York hotel room standards. There were some nice touches like the welcome candies. Our room was on the fourth floor, facing the street. We could hear everything outside, it was hard to get a night of peaceful rest. The location is not too bad, only a ten minute walk from Times Square and other tourist spots. All in all, I probably wouldn’t staying here. There are others hotels in the vicinity with better rooms and better amenities, in the same price range.

title: Perfect place to stay!
text: I will return to this lovely hotel next time I go to NYC. It is a fantastic location! We had a room with a view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom was very clean and updated. The beds were extremely comfortable. We heard no road noise. Then to top it off the hotel staff were so kind and extremely helpful!

title: Exceptional hotel, staff, location. Will not find better in NYC
text:
Where do I begin…. This hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in whilst on vacation. It is certainly the best hotel my partner and I have stayed in NYC and between us we have visited the city 6 times from Scotland. 

We arrived in NYC on the 26th December for 10 days to get married all the way from Scotland. 

When we checked into the hotel and mentioned this to the staff we were given a complimentary room upgrade with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building on the 17th floor. The staff at reception were lovely and made us feel extremely valued, their customer service was exceptional. 

The hotel facilities were very modern, classy and made you feel very relaxed. The lobby bar was excellent as were the staff and the food. The rooftop bar was incredible. The view of the Empire State Building from inside and outside on the terrace was amazing. Again, the staff were also lovely and very welcoming and would always find you a seat during busy times. They really looked after their hotel guests. 

The housekeeping service we received in our room was excellent and the little chocolates left by staff each time our room was serviced was a lovely touch. 

The location of the hotel is great and is within a short walking distance to most of the main attractions and tourist spots including a 5 minute walk to the main hustle of Times Square. 

The management staff in particular, Scott and Evan, could not have been more personal and welcoming and couldn’t have done anymore for you. From checking in all the way to checking out, we were made to feel extremely valued by all the staff at the hotel which added to our overall visit to NYC for such a special occasion. The staff at reception also took the time to ask about our wedding day and asked to see photos we had taken, great from the staff taking a genuine interest in their guests. 

This hotel will be our first choice hotel for all our future visits to the city, in my opinion you will struggle to find better. Thank you to the staff at the hotel for making my partner and I feel so welcome and we are delighted we carefully researched hotels prior to booking because The Archer truly was the best. 

 Will definitely be recommending the hotel and will be back again in the near future!!

title: Excellent Hotel in a Perfect Location
text: Visited NYC to see a Broadway show and booked the Archer Hotel as it was conveniently located between Grand Central and the Theater District.  The hotel is stunning.  The staff was courteous.  Every bit of the hotel was spotless.  The room itself was small but extremely clean.  Ate at the hotel bar and the food was excellent and the service was great.

title: Perfect place to stay near Times Square
text: Outstanding experience, service is top notch, SECURITY really did an amazing job when we needed him!  Proximity to Times Square, Broadway, and Rockefeller Center is very walkable.  The food and bar do not disappoint.  Safe and stylish place to stay!

title: Location!!
text: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights and we chose this hotel for the location. We walked everywhere from MSG to Times Square to Rockefeller Plaza. It was perfect. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. We booked an Empire States Building view room and it was awesome. I would absolutely stay here again.

title: Perfect Location, Great Rooms
text: I loved this hotel and would 100% stay here again on my next trip to NY. This was a girls trip with my 80 year old mother in law and my two teenage daughters. We had two rooms with double beds in each. We requested rooms near each other and were in rooms right next door to each other. The rooms were not “big”, but had enough room. We had a view of the Empire State Building. The bathrooms were small but efficient - plenty of storage space. What amazed me was how clean the bathroom was. The hotel is 10 years old but it looked brand new.  Very cute black and white subway tile and marble. There was daily maid service and fresh towels everyday (even though we hung ours and would have used again). Since COVID most hotels have skipped daily cleaning. It was refreshing to have our room made up each day. They always left a treat - some caramels, chocolate, or cookies. The rooftop has a great view of the Empire State Bldg. The Spy Glass Bar was lovely - had a honey crisp margarita. Since it’s a bar after 4 pm, no kids allowed, but our check in agent told us we could go up during the day and take pics - which we did. I used to live in NY (on this very block which is why I chose the hotel). It’s a great location - walking distance to Macy’s, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, Madison Sq Garden, both Penn and Grand Central Stations and so close to several subway stations. The rooms were also so quiet. We were on the 11th floor and did not hear any honking or garbage trucks and could not hear noise from adjacent rooms either.  This will be my go-to hotel from now on. Great price for the quality and location.

title: Bday Weekend
text: Incredible views and stellar service. Very easy and great first desk service. We left bags with the front desk while exploring before check in and after check out and the employees were gracious and helpful.

title: Excellent hotel, very kind service and a winning location
text:
Great hotel, great location, close to Bryant Park. During Christmas there was a nice market there. The hotel is within walking distance of Central Station, Central Park, Times Square and more...
I would like to mention the reception staff who were extremely kind, they helped me with a lot of questions and gave excellent tips, I helped them on several subjects.

title: Fabulous hotel in midtown
text:
Great hotel in the centre of midtown so amazing / walkable for all of the places to visit in that area and convenient for the subways to other areas. 
We had two double double rooms with empire state views. The view really is fantastic so ask for a high floor (we were on floor 20). This also meant the rooms were quiet as not a lot of street noise could be heard, though there is a little. 
Rooms aren’t huge, you get the two double beds and a desk / one chair and that is it so if you’re wanting to spend a lot of time in your room this could be an issue - we were out from early morning til late evening everyday so fine for us. 
Rooms were very clean and serviced daily. Some nice complementary sweets which was a kind little touch enjoyed by the children. Ensuite facilities were spotless. 
Only a couple of slight issues; the lighting could be improved as the further you get into the room you have to rely on two small, weak bedside lights for the whole area. The side of the bed nearest the window is v close to the window so no room for a bedside table to put anything on. Also seemed to be very few plug sockets! 
Hotel staff were very helpful, friendly and polite.  We had a meal in the hotel which was also really nice. 
Would recommend and would stay again.

title: magnificent hotel
text: a remarkably good hotel, ideally located, with a extraordinary friendly staff. we enjoyed our stay so much - thanks to the whole team. for us there's absolutely nothing they could improve. too bad we couldn't enjoy the rooftop bar due to the age of my daughter

title: Fantastic spot!❤️
text: I’m in love - what a fabulous hotel!!! Prime location with eateries, pubs, shops, and tourist locations just steps away, clean (the bathrooms were spotless!), extremely comfortable, cozy dining on site, CVS on the corner for all your needs, and amazing views of the ESB from the rooftop bar! I’ll be back!!!

title: The perfect place to stay in midtown
text:
The perfect place to stay in midtown. Short walks to anything you'd want to see in midtown (or any of the subways, or either train station), but just far enough from the chaos of Times Square, etc.

Staff was wonderful, room was well appointed, the Spyglass rooftop bar is a treat. I've already recommended it to friends and will definitely stay again.

title: Great hotel, amazing experience
text: Couldn't speak more highly of the experience. Would recommend to book the empire state room with a view. Close to alot of the major things you would want to be attending in New York. The staff were always welcoming and we were provided with little treats from house keeping everday

title: Good choice
text: Hotel chosen to spend the Christmas week, excellent location that allows you to quickly reach the main points of interest. Comfortable rooms although a little small. Rooftop bar on the 22nd floor with a spectacular view of the Empire, too bad you couldn't see it from the 7th floor 😞. Very welcoming and helpful staff. I would choose it again for a new visit to BigApple

title: Great Spot
text: Great and safe spot around the corner from Times Square. It’s far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but centrally located where everything is easily walkable. Rooms are clean and quiet. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Can’t fault The Archer
text: Had a wonderful 10-night stay at The Archer Hotel over Christmas. It is conveniently located in Manhattan, close to major bus routes and the subway at Bryant Park. The rooms are comfortable, the bathroom is perfect for a hotel too. Service was faultless.

title: Perfect stay
text: The staff is superb - they took care of every detail of our stay. The location is excellent! And the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The beds are comfortable and we loved the amenities offered. Convenient restaurant and rooftop bar as well.

title: Extremely kind and considerate staff
text:
We have a daughter with special needs. This hotel has been trained and certified through KultureCity as a sensory inclusive destination. The staff was aware of our needs and were very kind and accommodating to make sure we had what we needed. I have truly never met a hotel staff that was so friendly.
The room was beautiful and clean. Bathroom products were very nice. The food in the hotel restaurant was really good. Check in and check out were very smooth and quick. Even during a busy time of year when they had a lot of people staying.

title: Great experience!
text: This was our second time staying here and loved every moment. We wanted to visit New York for the holidays and quickly booked our stay at the Archer.  The staff is very accommodating, food was excellent, and  the rooms were clean. Would highly recommend.

title: Amazing Hotel with kind employees and great food and drinks!
text: We visited the Archer Hotel during our familie trip to NYC together with our grand parents and little baby (1,5 y/o). It was a great experience and every one at the Archer Hotel was very kind and professional

title: Birthday in NYC
text: This is a nice hotel. Great location to everything. I enjoyed my stay very much. All the staff were friendly and accommodated any need I had. The rooms are cute and very clean. The bed is super comfy! I loved the rooftop bar. Tasty and strong drinks.  I'd definitely stay again while in Manhattan.

title: A great hotel!
text:
We stayed in the Archer for 5 nights over Christmas and the hotel ticked lots of boxes. The location was perfect in midtown. Just off 5th Ave, about a 10 minute walk from Times Square, 20 minutes to Central Park with many great bars and restaurants just a staggering distance away. 

We stayed in the Empire State Vjew room which was stunning. Slept with the curtains open every night and we were on the 21st floor (highest) so it was nice and quiet. 

The whole hotel had a nice atmosphere to it. It was high end without being pretentious and the staff were great and friendly. We also had a little treat left in the room each day…cookies, a bowl of fruit, a fortune cookie. I’m not sure if this was because of the time of year or if it was a standard, but it was a lovely touch. 

Definitely recommend.

title: Incredible
text: Highly recommend, friendly staff, brilliant location, comfy bed, great shower pressure, great tv options, rooftop bar is great, clean and tidy and room service was great, only very minor downfall was room is slightly small for a couple with 2 large suitcases but definitely manageable. Would highly recommend this accomodation.

title: Hidden midtown gem
text: A lovely boutique hotel with a quiet location yet close to everything. The room though small was well appointed with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was spotless with terrific lighting and a nice makeup mirror. The rooftop bar was intimate with a great view of the Empire State building, The staff were gracious and able to accommodate an early check-in at no charge.

title: Christmas at its best in N.Y.
text: Perfect location for a first stay in New York, a stone's throw from Times Square, view of the ESB from the roof top. Cleanliness, bar, catering 👌. Only small negative point, we had to remind that there were 3 of us despite our reservation of a room for 3 with 2 double beds so that the towels, bathrobes and small morning touches were only provided for 2. But great responsiveness of the staff every time you ask for it. A very good stay.....

title: Archer Hotel NYC
text: Great Hotel.  Wonderful staff, great food and beverage, very clean, accommodating details such as phone chargers in every room.   Perfect location for Midtown.  Just between 5th and 6th, easy to get transportation loaded and unloaded.  Room very quiet.

title: Great hotel from check in to check out!
text: Wonderful staff from check at check in! So welcoming and friendly! Our room was perfect with an amazing view of the Empire State Building, almost able to reach out and touch it!! Drinks at Spyglass rooftop bar were delicious with a great atmosphere and view! Definitely will stay there again!

title: A wonderful hotel experience
text: We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 9 days. Marvelous empire view. The rooms are not big, otherwise impeccably and clean, including bathroom/shower, the breakfast 5 stars, we tried everything on the menu, super helpful and friendly staff, made us feel safe, special, and like home, location one minute from 5th Ave., still so quiet, when you have been out all day, and you come back and want to go to sleep, you go out like a light. There is nothing I would want differently, I had one of my best experiences here. I would come back anytime.

title: A wonderful stay
text: Great hotel close to everything! Clean, quiet rooms, great beds and friendly helpful staff. We enjoyed a breakfast and dinner which were both fantastic. The complimentary coffee/tea/water was also a nice touch, as was your spectacular salted caramels.

title: Quiet, comfortable hotel in theaterdistrict
text: Very convenient, quiet despite the location, attentive staff, nice amenities and wonderful bar at the top of the building with outside viewpoint of Empire state building (gorgeous at night).  Staff were great.  Rooms were smallish but not unexpected in NYC.  Unforgettable pre-Christmas get away.

title: In love with NYC- Love the Archer Hotel
text: Where to start!  We had a superb experience.  It's a beautiful hotel, centrally located and 2 blocks from Bryant Park.  The front doors are locked at dark and only accessible with the guest room key.  Very safe.  The rooms were wonderful.  They're not huge but we found them very adequate.  The beds were so comfortable- great mattresses provided a wonderful sleep.  The pillows were as good as the mattress!  There are Nespresso machines in the rooms with a variety of espresso flavors- it's a great way to wake up. EVERYONE at the front desk was warm, helpful- just delightful.  Big shout out to Jonathan who is truly the ultimate concierge.  He left nothing undone!  This was my first time in NYC and I loved everything about it.  I want to go back to and have no reason to go anywhere besides the Archer for a wonderful stay.

title: Nice hotel in a great location
text: Nice hotel in a great location, everything was within walking distance. The room wasn't huge, but it was clean and adequate. There was a little sweet surprise every day. The staff are all super nice and helpful. We would love to come back!

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great hotel! Stayed here before a few years ago and I must say the hospitality is still the same which is a plus! The room was very clean and cozy!! Also, it's in the perfect location for if you want to do activities at Bryant Park.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Love this hotel. Have stayed here a few times. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, rooms are spacious and quiet compared to other NYC hotels. Spyglass rooftop bar has wonderful views. Always choose The Archer when in NYC.

title: Happy Customers :)
text: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel had wonderful staff, a comfortable bed, clean room, and a beautifully spacious bathroom and shower! Location was perfect. We loved our stay and would come back again in a heartbeat.

title: Don't book early!
text: We love The Archer; great location and love the exposed brick in the (small) room.  We made the mistake of booking early, thinking that during the Christmas/Holiday season availability might be limited.  We booked a non-refundable rate, only to find out that The Archer's competitors were offering steep discounts for the dates we were staying.  Would I stay at The Archer again?  Yes, but would wait to book last minute.

title: Great NYC experience!
text: We just spent a wonderful New York City Christmas weekend celebrating our 18 yr. old daughter/granddaughter's senior year!!   We stayed at the Archer Hotel, and I have nothing but good things to say about our stay there.  The rooms were extremely clean, great beds/pillows,  outstanding and safe location near Times Square (our group - all women included ages ranging from 18 - 70 years).  We felt extremely comfortable and safe.  The hotel also guaranteed adjoining rooms which  was important for us.  The staff (and I mean every single person) was more than welcoming and helpful.  The hotel kept our bags upon arrival  until check in and again when leaving until we headed to the airport.  They even took care of arranging a taxi for us at the end of our stay.  I would definitely stay at the Archer again and highly recommend it!!  Don't think you can find a better place to stay or staff anywhere!

title: The Archer does not dissapoint
text:
I researched a number of hotels in the area and settled on this one after hours of research. It had many very good reviews and for good reason.
From my experience, I found the staff  very helpful, the rooms were extrememly clean and the location was quiet and  convienient to major attactions.  The Archer is in a business district so on the weekend there were hardly any people there. Even though, I would remind any travelers to be aware of their surroundings anyway, since this is NYC and in my opinion lyfts or taxis are the best way to get back home for safety late at night. 
In terms of the hotel iteself, there was a restaruant downstairs, unlimited coffe, hot chocolate and water downstairs, room service and a rooftop bar. There were spots outside  to unload your luggage from your car and a parking garage nearby so  you didn't have to drive. NYC is very walkable. Our room had a stunning view of the empire state building which was lit up at night for the holiday season. 
Whatever we needed, the hotel staff was ready and willing to accommodate- an extra blanket at 11 pm, no problem:) A microwave to heat up some leftovers from the Italian dinner we ate and a fork and napkin? Granted. 
More importnatly, after checkout, I had a disagreement with the final charge from the booking agency and the hotel manager spent a good amount of time rectifying the issue with me in a fair and professional way.

Excellent hotel! This will be our hotel of choice on on next visit. Thank you Evan and all the staff at the Archer hotel for taking such good care of us.

title: Happy Memories
text: My daughter and I were in NYC to celebrate her 40th birthday and the holidays. The Archer is in a perfect spot, centrally located but just far away enough from the crowds to be quiet. We stayed in the Empire State Bldg View King room - it was a small room but the view was great! Very clean, super comfortable bed. Friendly, helpful staff. Would recommend! We will be back.

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text: We both felt very comfortable in the beautiful, clean and high-quality hotel with a great rooftop bar (top view of the Empire State Building). It is simply in the perfect location for a trip to NYC, close to Bryant Park. We would be happy to come back anytime!

title: Great experience
text: I arrived about 30 min prior to check-in and had no problems getting my room. The room was very small but nicely equipped (robes, slippers, and the typical higher-end bath and beauty products).  The nespresso machine was a nice touch and worked perfectly.  The king bed was spacious and warm, and there were plenty of towels. The bathroom was very clean and contemporary.  I was surprised by how small the room was compared to some other boutique hotels in the area; however, the location is prime, and the bar/dining space is beautiful.  We had a quiet drink around happy hour time, and the service was good.

title: Wonderful!!!
text: We stayed at the Archer hotel for four nights. Our stay was wonderful. The room was beautiful and offered a view of the Empire State Building. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was very nice.The staff gave wonderful and friendly service. It is in a good location close to Bryant Park, and within walking distance of Radio City Music Hall. We would most definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
I stayed at The Archer with my sister for a weekend of Christmas shopping and sightseeing. This hotel is a GEM! We arrived early at 9 AM and our room was ready…such a huge bonus. It is extremely clean, the staff is over-the-top friendly, and it is just the cutest. The room was adorable and just enough space for us with 2 comfy beds. We didn’t hear any loud NYC traffic and we slept soundly. 
I HIGHLY recommend The Archer and we will definitely be back again next Christmas for sure!

title: Perfect boutique hotel
text:
Stayed at the Archer for the first time in December 2023. Hotel was chosen based on its proximity to Madison Square Garden for a concert and Rockefeller Center for the Christmas tree 

Fantastic boutique hotel with the most comfortable beds! Not inexpensive but a great choice.  Great bar and restaurant. We were able to check in early (thank you!) which was unexpected. Staff were warm and efficient. Would absolutely recommend and stay again.

title: City break in New York
text: Stayed at the hotel for 5 days while visiting New York, all staff were courteous and helpful and a credit to the hotel , the room however was extremely small and had only enough wardrobe space for my wife , I lived out of the suitcase! The air conditioner was noisy when switching on and off. Hotel was clean and decor nice

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: Archer Hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Everything is within walking distance. We walked everywhere and always felt safe returning back to the hotel in the evening. The staff was amazing and the room was top notch. The bed was so comfy that after a long day out, you would just relax in bed. We never heard other guests and loved the corner room we had. Will stay here again when back in NYC!

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Fantastic stay in New York. Hotel is centrally located for the city. Rooms are a good size for NYC, we did have a double bed room which was quite dark but we needed to have this as we were mother and daughter travelling - maybe the other rooms are lighter. Good service from the front desk to support any queries we had during our stay. One excellent point to raise was the bed quality - fantastic beds, super comfy!

title: Great value,but a little cramped
text:
Great little hotel in a very good location 
Everyone is great, breakfast and bar are nice as well. 
The only down side is the size of the rooms. Pretty small especially with 2 double beds in there. It’s very tight.

title: Amazing hotel, great location
text: This is an amazing hotel in possibly the best possible location. Everywhere we visited (main sightseeing locations) was a short walk or quick subway journey away. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet. The terrace bar and lobby bar are very trendy.  My only frustration or negative comment would be that we paid extra for an Empire View room (15th) floor but the view was badly obstructed by an adjacent building. This was particularly disappointing because we called in advance stressing how important the view was to us

title: NYC at Christmas
text: The location and views are the reason we chose this hotel. I would 100% stay there again. The lobby is comfortable and offers a place to feast if you’re waiting on a taxi or getting plans together. The food and drinks from AKB were all very good and the service was attentive. The room was small (it’s NYC) but provided all the amenities we needed. The staff at the front desk were kind and the bell service very helpful.

title: The New York art of living
text: A New York hotel with a human face. An ideal location with the comfort of an industrial style room, not very large but very well thought out in terms of storage. Nespresso for a little morning coffee, every day a little attention, biscuit, chocolate, etc. Waking up in the shadow of the Empire State Building that we can see from our bed. Staff always attentive and smiling. A very nice experience.

title: Great Location!
text: This hotel is in an excellent location to visit all of the tourist spots!  Service was great.  Staff at the front desk were very helpful. Room was small, but was comfy, and had all of the amenities even an espresso maker!  The hotel has a restaurant, but has limited items.  We had a coffee and a dessert and it wasn't very good, so didn't eat any other food.  Would recommend and stay there again.  My only negative is that we paid for a room with a view of the Empire State Building, and it did have that, but the windows were filthy!

title: Excellent experience!
text: The hotel staff was amazing and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was seamless and enjoyable. Joseph at the front desk, and Johnathan were stand-outs and excellent brand champions for the hotel, making my arrival and departure experience memorable in the best way. Ask for the Archer’s homemade brownie - you won’t regret it…

title: Great Hotel & Even Better Staff!!!
text: This was our first time in NYC and the staff at the Archer Hotel made it extremely comfortable and welcoming!  The location of the hotel is excellent for being able to get to many of the attractions NYC has to offer.  Should we plan another visit to the city in the future, we will definitely be looking to stay at the Archer!

title: Great midtown Gem
text:
Location- midtown very central, safe area. near everything. 3 minute walk  Bryant park , 3 min Macys .  Out of the chaos of time square but central Lots of eatery’s, coffee shops restaurants bars 
Hotel- beautiful hotel, lobby and bar area great after day shopping. Food what you expect price wise - 20 dollars a wine / cocktail but it’s nyc 
Rooms- double double very spacious lots of hidden storage under bed / side of the bed. Very comfortable beds. Very clean . Bathroom spacious 

Only negatives which are small , no turndown service , only 1 in 4 nights . I was looking forward to it . I’m 
Noise on floors in morning. Also in check out no one to help with bags , trolley myself and to my car service, needed help with 4 heavy bags

title: Archer for NYC Christmas experience.
text: Great hotel with VERY attentive and gracious staff. The rooms are tiny so be aware but very clean and made up every day. Breakfast was delicious and the location simply cannot be beat. Short walks to almost anything you could want to see for the holidays which was why we were there.

title: Great hotel for a stay in New York
text: Great hotel in New York. As others have mentioned in their reviews the rooms are on the small side but are perfectly acceptable when you’re visiting the city. All of the staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. The Spyglass bar is well worth a visit and the views of the Empire State Building are spectacular. Had breakfast and lunch during our stay and both meals were excellent. Overall a fantastic base for exploring the whole of Manhattan.

title: Honestly, best hotel stay
text: From the moment we walked in until the moment we had to say goodbye, we knew we had found our home away from home. Amazing service, excellent location, delicious food and drink, fabulous rooms. Thank you everyone!

title: Cozy and Toasty!
text: I love the Archer due to it's boutique vibe and midtown location which makes my business appointment easy to navigate.  The room is small as expected but big in personality and where it counts (the bathroom).  Which can I say is the perfect size with wall to wall mirrors to get read in the am.  My favorite amenity is the Nespresso machine that I use every morning before hitting the pavement.  In the winter, the room temp is hard to perfect as the thermostat is tricky....but I usually have it down to a science by the end of my trip.

title: Outstanding Staff Sets Archer Hotel Apart From All The Rest
text: Three Cheers for outstanding staff.   Haresh and the rest of the crew manning the front desk know the city.  We received great directions and advice, complimentary umbrellas the night it rained and we walked to a show in a drizzle.  The hotel is in pristine clean condition and offers plenty of complimentary options.  Pro Tip: get your dress shoes shined for free for your night at the Theater!  Rooms are compact, this is a highly desirable location walking distance to a lot of what makes NYC show an amazing place to visit.  We found our room to be romantic and comfortable and I will absolutely be staying here again when returning to New York!  You should too.

title: Great service in a central location
text: Loved this hotel. Very centrally located.  Easy to get to my office and enjoy a bit of night life in Manhattan.  Service and staff were amazing.  The restaurant accommodated myself and some clients on two separate evenings and were excellent ! Thanks to Jonathan for storing my bags on my last day and making certain I got to the airport on time.

title: Exceptional Boutique Hotel with Great Service
text: 3trips in 2years and we have found the most fantastic hotel. Felt so safe, close to everything, restaurant/bar in hotel, impeccable service. The staff cares about their customers, so polite and genuine. While rooms are small had fantastic view of empire state building, rooms clean and beds are so comfortable. We had 2 rooms on the 19th floor and we were so pleased. Great staff , so customer oriented. Walked to parade at 38th and 6th. Thank you, thank you Archer Hotel!

title: Great choice in NYC
text: The Archer Hotel was a wonderful choice for our visit to New York City. It was centrally located, making it easy to get to any area of the city we wanted either by foot or subway. Room was spacious. Rooftop bar was awesome. Staff was exceptional. Highly recommend.

title: Fabulous hotel, highly recommend!!
text:
We had the most amazing 4 night stay here for my partners birthday, 
The hotel is gorgeous, in a superb location, and the staff are brilliant.  Our King Empire room was fantastic. Cannot recommend highly enough!

title: Archer Parking
text: The hotel is beautiful, rooms are quite small but very clean and quiet.  Bedding is comfortable, and bathrooms are very well equipped. Sky Top Lounge has a stunning view of the Empire State Building and service is beyond excellent.  Parking is very expensive and not that close.  I recommend you find alternate parking.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: We’ve stayed at the Archer four times and have always had a great experience. The hotel rooms are NYC-sized (compact), but lovely. The linens are great, the staff are all welcoming, professional and helpful. And they provided housekeeping services every day, even through Thanksgiving. It doesn’t always happen at other hotels post-Covid.

title: Great holiday stay!
text: Great hotel right in between 5th and 6th ave close to Bryant park and the New York public library. Nice treat for evening turn down. Holiday weekend and they let us check in early at 10am and gave us late checkout the day after Thanksgiving. Would definitely stay again!

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: Great hotel. They treated us to champagne for our engagement. Very friendly staff. Great location.  Nice bar downstairs and rooftop bar “Spyglass” doesn’t disappoint. Small rooms, but that’s typical for the city. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Macys Parade
text:
1st time in the big apple for the Macys parade which was a bucket list item.  Could not have picked a better location to the route other than being directly on it, just off the route (less than 200ft) easy access which was a godsend once the parade was done.  Spyglass rooftop Bar  was a surprise, didn’t realize it had an outdoor patio and you could take pictures of the Empire State Building and skyline so easily. 
Room was small, however not surprised with being in the city and it had everything we needed. It was clean,
comfortable, & updated.  Everything was wonderful, staff was incredibly pleasant and accommodating. I would stay here again on my next visit!

title: Thanksgiving in NYC
text:
The staff was great. The front desk clerks were very helpful and answered all our questions. The room was clean and bright and room service was always on time. We will be back!"
Stunning view of the Empire State building from the windows which is one of the reasons we chose to stay at this hotel

title: 5 nights in NYC
text:
If you are looking for a great night of sleep this is the place to stay. Rooms are exceptionally quiet for NYC. We upgraded to an Empire State Building View and it was worth it! The beds are comfortable. The rooms are tiny but there is under the bed storage for suitcases, and one small closet which worked mostly to hang coats and a few items. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed the fresh water on the first floor and the sweet treats left in our room each night. We enjoyed a drink on the rooftop with a great view of the Empire State. It was an easy walk to Bryant Park, MSG, Rockefeller area, Broadway shows. We hope to return again!

Thank you for the excellent service during our stay, especially to the staff, including Jonathan who provided guidance on food and bar recommendations and other local ideas for transportation.

title: Stylish, friendly and location is fantastic
text: Friendliest staff and cool vibes all around. Nothing was too much trouble and super convenient location. The bar upstairs is a perfect spot for a drink at sunset with The Empire State Building as a backdrop. Rooms are stylish and well appointed. Bed beyond comfortable and towels high quality

title: Excllent service and best location ever I had in NYC
text: Excellent service from staff, clean rooms, we had everything we needed and the location of the hotel is superb. We usually travel to NYC 4-5 times a year and this was one of the best stays we've ever had. Room space is a little small but our purpose was not to stay in the room but roam the city, so, for our purpose, it was perfect

title: A pleasantly amazing stay!!!
text: This is a hard review because my view won't do justice. This hotel and staff superseded our expectations from the moment I started communicating with front desk and hotel manager Scott, it was my first time at archer and my decision was based on other guests reviews and the views of empire state from bar/rooms. I booked a bit late and explained to the front desk of the reason of our visit and why this hotel but unfortunately there were no rooms available with such view, on arrival , Mr. Scott was not only able to accommodate us to a room with partial view of empire state building but also discreetly learned of our union celebration and gifted us a very nice surprised with a bottle of champagne and candy, this completed the night and stay for us.  Then, noticed through our 4 night stay how friendly and polite the rest of the staff was starting from the repair person encounter  on elevators, bell man, the young colombian waitress name Natalia who was super attentive every time we were at the restaurant to the front desk a.m/ p.m crew very professional and all represent this hotel extremely well. The hotel bar was awesome with amazing view off the roof top with great 80s 90s music, room and hotel was very clean and modern and no complaints there. Also, this hotel is close and walking distance to restaurants,  Broadway,  central park, Bryant Park,  the rock etc.. most importantly, a huge thank you to Mr. Scott Calderon for allowing me to fulfill my future wife's first new york experience and made a pleasantly relaxing and awesome stay, will make this my place to stay when in New York and will be back with my son first new york trip next month in December.  Thank you Archer Hotel crew and happy holidays 2023!!!

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Brilliant location, central to all attractions. Hotel staff were awesome, shout out to Kyra who helped us with directions. The hotel has everything you need, cafe, bar, rooftop bar. Room was great for 3 of us with two double beds. Would definitely recommend and we will return! Thank you Archer Hotel for helping to make our New York trip the best ever!!

title: Best stay
text: We had the best stay at The Archer! The staff went above and beyond. The bed and pillows were cozy. It was very clean. The rooftop bar is amazing with a perfect view of the Empire State building. This was our 2nd stay here and will definitely return! I even left clothing in room and they reached out to mail it to me. The location can't be beat- just a few blocks to Time Square and Bryant park.

title: Our stay in New York
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Archer Hotel New York during our trip to New York coming from France. Great service and professionalism. Thank you to Axelle in reception who did our checkin and checout. She was very nice and helpful, always with a smile which gives a great impression on arrival. We will definetely be back!!!

title: Outstanding hotel!
text: Outstanding service from the front desk ( renee) to the guest services were amazing . Anna and alex at both places the rooftop (with an amazing view) and the downstairs bar were amazing! I would highly recommend !

title: So many NYC hotels to choose from, glad I chose The Archer
text: It's always a bit overwhelming to choose a NYC hotel and I took "a chance" and booked The Archer. I could not have been happier. From the moment we arrived till we checked out was wonderful. The room is cozy but really cute and has everything you could ever need. We arrived early and the front desk staff offered us the option of a room on a lower floor right away but we preferred a higher floor.
