They whisked away our bags for storage, processed the info needed for check in and sent us off to enjoy our first day in the city. Every interaction from then on was equally accommodating and friendly. I would not hesitate to stay at The Archer next time I am in the city and highly recommend it to anyone who wants to be mid-town with easy access to all the city has to offer.

title: Great stay
text: Really great hotel in the perfect location. The staff were all very friendly. The bathroom products were luxurious as were the towels and the bed. The spyglass bar had amazing views and good drinks. Believe all the good reviews, this place is a solid choice.

title: Best experience and value in Midtown
text: This is my third stay at the Archer Hotel and it’s been another remarkable experience. First, I lived all over Manhattan in the 90s and early 2000s; Bryant Park is a very convenient spot for seeing all Manhattan has to offer. And late Nov and Christmas you’re just a block away from the Holiday Mart and ice skating. Just blocks away from subways and taxis uptown or downtown. The staff is well trained and attuned to guest service. The rooms are intimate (it’s NYC!) but extremely well designed and appointed. They went out of their way to celebrate my birthday every evening with little sweets and snacks. And even arranged for a special delivery to a friends room who’d come into the city for dinner and a show. The restaurant and rooftop bar are outstanding and the view of the Empire State Bldg took us over the top! Thank you to all the “Archers” who went out of their way to make our stay (me and my 16 and 11 year old kids) magical. We will be back.

title: Beautiful place
text:
Location is super convenient, there are a lot of places to walk to. Very good customer service, the beds and pillows are comfortable and the room was pretty clean. 

The rooftop bar is also beautiful and you get an amazing view of the Empire State.

title: Warmth and friendly service in a great location
text: Stayed for one night of a business trip . The team at the front desk were extremally warm and friendly. The food at breakfast was superb and as a result I invited some friends for lunch and it was very nice.

title: Midtown Style at the Archer Hotel
text: If you need a good "go to" option when staying in the midtown area of Manhattan, I would happily recommend the Archer Hotel. The staff and service were the highlight for me. The rooms vary in size and the smaller rooms are pretty small for a property of this level. I traveled for business and there is no fitness center on property, which I like to have available. The rooftop bar is worth the experience and the view of the Empire State Building. Overall, the service and cleanliness of the property make this a good option in NYC.

title: Old style service!
text: Love this place! It’s hard to find a clean hotel in midtown and with amazing staff. From the moment I stepped in they made me feel welcomed and refreshed. The rooftop bar was a grest place to catch up with friends and the proximity to my work was unbeatable. The salted caramel and cookies I received during my stay were a nice touch. Down to the moment I slipped into my taxi to the airport, this hotel had me covered. They booked my car and carefully handled my luggage. Thanks to Jonathan for taking care of me on the way out!

title: Weekend getaway
text: great location and attentive staff.  Pricey considering the size of the room which was on the smaller side  with little storage space and room to move around other than in and out of bed.  Bar / lounge was very nice but again pricey for cocktails.

title: Great luxury option in the heart of Midtown
text:
Great midtown location, easy access to all the wonderful energy of the city with all the shopping (convenience and high end) I could want within a 1/2 to 5 block radius. The decor is luxury, modern but not with the cold feeling some places can give off. Rooms are well appointed, comfortable, and QUIET! We heard NO noise ever from the street or the hallways in our 10th floor room.  If you use an accessible room for the roll-in shower, be VERY careful in the bathing areas - all the flooring was marble which is gorgeous but you can easily slip using the shower. I didn't let my elderly parent shower alone for that reason which provided us many laughs about reverse roles. 

The service is wonderfully responsive. Our accessible, double bed room, didn't have any suitcase racks or extra blankets. And we couldn't figure out how to turn the AC to heating. Each time we had to call housekeeping the response was less than 5 minutes to deliver the needed items or support to our room. Be prepared that the closet may be one of those half-depth wardrobes with very limited hanging space, and none of it for long hang. But we had two spacious hooks behind the entry door where we used the hangers to put our coats and event gowns. 

We picked the hotel in part for location but also multiple food options so my parent didn't have to travel to dine. There are two - the lobby dining space and the rooftop Spyglass indoor/outdoor bar. We used both and thoroughly enjoyed the food and the attentive service. Be prepared, the costs are high but that's typical of this quality of hotel and the portions are good so I had no issue with the pricing.

I loved our stay and will look for more Archer hotels in my travels.

title: Idéalement situé
text:
Magnifique séjour au sein de cet hôtel idéalement situé.
Accueil sympathique, chambre décorée avec goût, salle de bain spacieuse. Service ménage irréprochable ! 
Chaque soir, une petite attention est laissée sur le bureau pour vous réconforter après une journée de marche.

title: Comfortable and clean
text: I had a great stay at this hotel.  Even though I was only there for one night, the staff was great, the room was spotless, and it was actually quiet - which is quite a feat for NYC.  I'd stay here again with no hesitation.

title: UNE SEMAINE A NEW YORK
text: Séjour en couple à New-York. Super hôtel hyper central pour tout pouvoir faire à pied. Personnel très aimable et serviable, faisant tout pout vous satisfaire. Hôtel très confortable, très bonne literie, salles de bains très propres et design avec cette touche des US comme on l'aime ! Très belle vue sur l'Empire State Building depuis le lit...on a dormi rideaux ouverts tout le temps !!

title: Best birthday experience.
text: The hotel it’s very well located and it very quiet. It was my first time in New York and my first time staying there but definitely not the last. I’m very excited to come back and will recommend to anyone.

title: Perfect
text:
Hôtel très élégant et raffine 
Positionnement parfait au cœur de NY
Chambre spacieuse et bien équipée
Roof top très agréable 
Personnel aux petits soins
Hôtel à recommander à 100% !
Merci pour tout et à très bientôt

title: Archer Hotel - Perfect stay in NYC
text:
This is my second time in New York, and also my second time at the Archer I loved the first visit, and for me, there really was no choice where to stay! It has to be the Archer. This time with an Empire State Building view. I went to sleep and left the curtains open each night :)
The rooms are small, but very functional, clean and modern. Very comfy bed too. And all the staff are happy and helpful. The mid-town location is perfect for a holiday of sightseeing. I hope to come back to the city in the next few years, and once again, the Archer will be where I'm heading.

title: A NYC Gem where Hospitality is alive and well
text:
For so many of us traveling during and since the pandemic, the idea of hospitality has been lost and the fear I had was it wound never return.  Being hospitable is actually not that difficult, because it is not about saying yes all the time but being honest and transparent and just happy.  The foundation starts with each person a guest may encounter, and I can say that each and every person I encountered at the Archer was nothing less than spectacular.

The location of the Archer was great, the rooms were clean and efficient.  The noise was limited.  

But it was each an every person that made this place awesome.  

This may be the place I return as often as I can because I want to come back, I want to have a drink on the awesome roof bar, I want to have breakfast there, and I just want to feel like a group of humans want me to feel good.  

What not one person at this hotel realized was we came down from Maine and had a pretty awful week.  And each encounter we had made us feel just a little better.  For that, we thank you.

title: Very nice hotel, very small rooms.
text: I know it's Manhattan, but the rooms are really small for the price. Other than that, everything was great. The rooftop bar is really nice and the staff is great. Location was great for us. Very close to Bryant park and Broadway shows.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: Wonderful boutique hotel in the middle of everything! All the lobby staff were very friendly and attentive and a special thank you to Jonathan who had our bags and taxi waiting for us when we needed to leave for the airport! The rooms are a tad small but not by nyc boutique standard. The lobby is beautiful and breakfast in the hotel restaurant was great (thank you for having Gluten Free bread!)

title: Great Anniversary stay
text: The Archer was a great choice for our 25th wedding anniversary trip. Joseph started us off great with a room with a view of the ESB and a bottle of bubbly. The location was great for getting to the theater and many restaurants. Bryant Park was getting ready for the winter season so it was under construction but it was so easy to get to as well. Overall we had a great trip!

title: Fabulous stay in NYC
text: Lovely boutique hotel in a perfect midtown location . Everyone we encountered from check in to check out was not only super friendly but very attentive. No request was too big or small. Went to Spyglass for drinks which was such a nice experience and a great view.  Room was quiet and bed was the most comfortable we’ve slept in away from home. Love the Malin bath products in room. Will definitely stay here again on our next visit!

title: A hotel without foam pillow, gym too far away and no hash to be served in breakfast menu
text: A hotel without foam pillow, gym too far away and no hash to be served in breakfast menu.  Was told they do not have foam pillow as all their pillows are soft type.  The gym is a few block away hence a disappointment.  Asked the service staff on why no hash on their breakfast menu.  I was told that they don’t serve hash… hmmm.

title: Pluses and Minuses
text: Great location and a very helpful and nice staff. I had to wait to check in about 10 minutes after the 3:00 check-in time (the room wasn't ready they said). The room was small but very nice for my four-night stay (no complaints there). The rooftop bar, also small, has a killer view of the Empire State Building. Check-in staff said hotel guests didn't need reservations. When I went up on a Sunday evening, there were no seats available except for a seat in the back corner against the brick wall. Resigned to that, I tried to order several different types of white wine, but they were out of virtually everything. I left and went to a pub across the street for food and a decent glass of wine.  The other night I tried to go up it was closed for a private event so I never got to experience this part of their hotel. The breakfast food was really good and fairly priced (compared to nearby diners). I hate the daily rate changes for being in the same room. They varied from $399 to $659 FOR THE SAME ROOM.  Mysterious algorithm surge pricing is the scourge of travel. It always leaves a lasting poor impression.

title: Excellent Hôtel Archer NYC
text:
Séjour professionnel à New York, j’ai séjourné pour la 3 eme fois à l’Hotel Archer bon rapport qualité prix, et comme d’habitude il reste un très bon hôtel, service impeccable, personnel très professionnel.
La chambre est très confortable avec tout ce qu’il faut comme commodité, la literie parfaite, et la localisation est juste excellente. 
Il y a un rooftop avec vue sur l’Empire State Building qui est bien aussi. 
Ce qui est sur c’est que pour NYC ça sera toujours l’hôtel Archer.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Fantastic location and amazing service. Couldn’t have a better view!  Staff are so friendly and helpful. Hotel was spotless clean. I loved my time at Archer hotel. One of the most comfortable beds ever.

title: Accommodating, clean, cozy & convenient location
text: Super friendly and helpful staff and will definitely go back to this place next time I am visiting NYC. The staff even had a power adapter delivered to my door within moments of asking if one was available.

title: Excellent Lodging Choice
text: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Archer.  Location was convenient to subways, Time Square, restaurants, etc.  The hotel room was small but very nice and excellent use of space to provide adequate storage.  We particularly appreciated the underbed storage space.  Shower was terrific.  The staff was super nice and helpful.  Only minor issue was the heating system.  It was hard to keep room at a warm enough temperature, even when a nice engineer staff guy tried to reset.

title: Great experience
text: I stayed there 3 weeks ago for three nights and loved it. Check-in was easy, and the staff was helpful. The rooms were clean, and the bathrooms were spotless. Breakfast was great! A quick walk to Bryant Park, Times Square, and about a 15 minute to Central Park. I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it.

title: Excellent stay
text:
Excellent stay in well located hotel in NYC. 

Staff and service was excellent.

Room was small but adequate. Shower in bathroom could have benefitted from more power but was OK. 

Rooftop bar views over Empire State Building a bonus.

title: Simply the best
text:
Everything during our stay at the Archer was fabulous.  After a fun filled day in NYC, you walk thru the doors at the Archer and you feel like you walked into your home!  Joseph at the front desk is my new best friend and he greets you with his award winning smile and great personality.  
Let’s talk hotel beds - you can just sink into the bed and be surrounded by all sorts of softness and comfort!  How I wish my bed at home was as comfortable as theirs!
Now about the shampoo, conditioner and body wash - can I have a years supply please!  The peppermint shampoo - makes you want to wash your hair 10 times a day.
The rooms are on the small side but perfectly thought out for the space.  You are in NYC so you aren’t spending the day in your hotel room but when you get back to the Archer and your room - you are in the lap of luxury!  
Don’t miss the rooftop bar with the stunning views of the Empire State Building or just hanging out in the front with your favorite beverage watching the sights and sounds of NYC.
This is our 4th time staying at the Archer and will continue to be our favorite place to stay!

title: A guaranteed good stay
text: The onsite team is amazing and delivered excellent customer service. I was traveling with my daughter, and my friend and her daughter around Christmas. The girls loved the elf seek & find in the lobby

title: Staff and Service are great
text:
The staff and service are great. They're friendly, helpful, and quick. I like that they give you a little treat everyday. It's a fun surprise to come back to after a long day. 
Times Square was just a short walk away so we didn't need transportation to get to most of the things we did and we were far enough away to avoid all the street noise at night. 
The main problem I had with the room was that we were given one with a connecting room which may have contributed to noise level. We can hear all the sounds in the hallway and we could clearly hear our neighboring room's business conference call in the morning. Also, the AC is a little loud whenever it kicks in. 
I don't like how the door to the bathroom is a sliding barn door. It leaves a slim gap along one slide when slid closed and the lock is a little hard to use. Also, the sink in the bathroom is poorly designed and water usually ends up going everywhere. The faucet is right at the edge of the sink on the side of the basin. The spout is so close to the edge that they had to add an adaptor onto it so the water can be directed into the sink. Our sink also drained slowly so it would fill up a little and we would have to wait for it to drain to continue using it.

title: New York trip to see BJ at MSG
text:
Stayed two nights in late Aug-23. Didn't spend much time in the hotel. The rooms were very bijou and in hindsight I would have stayed somewhere else if I'd have known but manageable for 2 nights. Picked the hotel based on its location as we'd booked to see Billy Joel at MSG and stayed at the adjacent hotel (the Refinery) before.

Anyway, doing wrong with the hotel and it served it's purpose.

title: Best service, location and views!  Loved our stay at the Archer!
text: Wonderful stay at the Archer!  Great location, super convenient to get to 5th avenue shops, broadway, times square, grand central station, etc.  The staff was absolutely amazing and super helpful.  Jonathan even helped us carry our bags a block and found us a taxi to the airport when we were leaving because the streets were blocked due to a parade.  Both the lobby restaurant and bar as well as the rooftop bar were perfect and the service was top notch.  The view from the spyglass rooftop at night was incredible.  The empire state building backdrop makes for a great photo opportunity as well.  We will definitely be back.

title: Pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel is.
text: A pretty hotel with very friendly staff. The room was exceptionally clean. We chose this hotel for its proximity to Gotham Hall where we’re we’re attending an event. The front desk staff was welcoming and phone reservationist was helpful and patient.

title: Comfy bed
text:
Good hotel. Very small room for the price but very well appointed with robes, slippers, a Nespresso machine. Bed was one of the comfiest I’ve slept on!!!  Good  shower, clean bathroom.
My only issue was that housekeeping was so late (4pm!) that my room wasn’t cleaned as I was sleeping when they arrived. Not great. But as I only stayed 2 nights it was fine

title: Formidable
text:
Emplacement exceptionnel.  Une bulle de sérénité dans cette ville à 100 à l'heure ! 
Hôtel à taille humaine, personnel charmant,chambre calme de taille normale pour NY  ,mais bien agencée propre et literie très confortable.  Salle de bain très chouette et surtout un rooftop à la vue imprenable sur l empire state building ! 
Restaurant très bien également ! Prix raisonnable pour NY

title: What a great place !
text: A hotel is only ever as good as its staff and The Archer team is excellent. And everything else is up to that standard. The quality of furnishings, cleanliness, food and beverages. Of course the location also is very good. We shall definitely be back !

title: A great stay in New York City
text: Fantastic hotel central fir everything and transport could not be better staff perfect kind friendly and helpful. Roof terrace great and breakfast very good room with a view of the Empire State Building is a must

title: Amazing experience
text: Loved my time at Archer. Staff was extremely professional and helpful. Beautiful food and great food. All through my one week stay there, the staff ensured to be attentive and proactive. Room was always professionally cleaned and response time was fast.

title: Great spot in NYC
text: Archer Hotel was a great pick for a NYC getaway for my husband and I! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful from the moment we stepped into the hotel. The lobby offered free water and coffee daily. The rooms had lovely slippers, robes and even umbrellas for our rainy days! The room was clean, the bed was so comfortable, and even though our room was right next to the elevator it was very quiet. Spyglass is a gem and we spent each evening (and some day time) up there enjoying a drink and the view. The hotel is walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, theaters, and so much more. It was a great spot and we would definitely stay again!

title: Nice Hotel, with some caveats
text: Our stay was nice overall. The food we had was great and the staff we dealt with were awesome. The main downside is that we booked our stay excited to have access to the Spyglass rooftop bar in the evenings to have a few drinks before heading out for dinner and it was booked up for private events for the first 2 nights. We finally got to go up there on the last night and had a nice time, but it's annoying that they advertise access to this cool bar with a great view that you may or may not be able to actually go to.

title: Cool hotel, great location
text: Wonderful service and luxurious room. I especially liked the espresso machine in the room, slippers, robe, and comfortable bed. The room (king bed) was small, but very nice. The hotel is in a great location for exploring the city.

title: Excellent
text:
The archer hotel was brilliant.
Spectacular view from our window of the Empire State Building.
Front reception staff were all very friendly and helpful.
Bar staff got to know our drinks.
Spyglass rooftop bar was fantastic , and again looking strate at Empire State Building.
Rooms were small, as expected in NewYork , but it was all nicely decorated and clean.
Bathrooms were very nice.
Great position, could walk to everything.
Would definitely stay at the Archer again.

title: Great place to stay!
text: It was amazing. The staff was super friendly, helpful, and professional. I was very impressed by the cleaning of the rooms. I loved the mattress and the bathroom amenities! It is a close location to everything, and Times Square is a walk away. The atmosphere at the rooftop was great for late drinks, and the breakfast was delicious. We will stay again!

title: 1st time great,  2nd time chose another hotel due to reservations!
text:
Our room was very small but clean and modern. Gust services was great.
However, reservations needs to learn to communicate. I tried booking this hotel last weekend and couldn’t deal with reservations. I stayed at the Bryant Park Hotel and had a great experience.

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
text:
The hotel is lovely and you get a welcoming feeling when you walk in.  I had a well-appointed King room; while the room was small, the bathroom was ample.   My son had a double room, and the room was smallish, but the bathroom was ample enough for two people.  Both rooms were very clean.  If you're in Manhattan how much time do you spend in your room?

My son had breakfast int he hotel which he said was very good.

A bag was left behind when my son was packing the car and after contacting the hotel the following day they quickly returned our call that the bag was found and they would send it back to us.  We were very thankful for the honesty.

I would definately reccomend andstay there again.

title: Excellent stay
text:
Great hotel and very central location.  Very helpful staff who provided excellent restaurant recommendations and were very helpful when we departed with our luggage and taxi bookings.
Rooms were very well appointed - comfortable beds, well lit, bathroom was excellent - we had a double-double room and this worked great for 2 girls sharing.  Plenty of shelf space in bathroom, good hairdryer, mirror beside sockets - I stay in a lot of hotels and this one had everything I needed and all in the right place!

title: Hip vibe; small rooms; great bed
text: I typically stay at higher-end hotels in this area, but gave the Archer a try because others were sold out.  The overall vibe is very similar to an Andaz or Moxy (or W for that matter).  Front desk staff was very friendly, but it would help them to cross train some people on check in.  The hotel feels “cozy,” consistent with the boutique nature of the brand, and my room was quite small, although somewhat larger rooms are available, I think. My room definitely wouldn’t have worked for two people or a longer stay, but for one or two nights it is fine. The rooms are very modern, the bathroom has a nice tile shower, and my only complaint would be that the shower floor could’ve probably used a more thorough cleaning.  The staff was really friendly and helpful, though, and is the star of the show here. The bar staff at AKB was really friendly and welcoming, the bartender was very competent, and the bell staff was friendly, helpful, and efficient.  Lastly, the bed was excellent - and I rarely say that.

title: First Visit to NYC
text: A very nice hotel and superb location.  Situated within walking distance to Broadway, 42nd street, 5th Avenue and 6th Avenues etc. Super friendly staff. The MOST comfortable bed ever!!!!!  Roof top bar looks right onto the Empire State Building.

title: A Wonderful Place to Stay!
text: A wonderful hotel! Great bedding…….slept like a baby in such comfort! Front desk was awesome and the room was small, but clean and cozy! Location was perfect….walking distance to Bryant Park and other fun places. Will definitely be back:-)

title: Archer Hotel NYC Midtown
text: fourth time staying at this wonderful hotel.  They have always continued to impress me with their attention to detail and service.  One part that I love about the hotel is how little turnover they have.  A lot of their staff especially at the top have been there since the very beginning.  A true testament to a well run hotel.  I won't stay anywhere else! Johnathan at the front desk always a terrific help!!

title: Good Enough, Great Location
text: We stayed at the Archer Hotel in New York for four days and had a good enough experience there. The room size is what you would expect in Manhattan and it was clean and well appointed. The only complaint I have is that housekeeping attempted to clean the room at 4:30pm one day, after we arrived back. The next day they cleaned the room but did not refresh the towels, and the bath soap dispenser was empty during our whole stay. I would not say there was anything outstanding with this hotel. The main reason to stay at the Archer would be the location.

title: Archer Hotel highly recommended
text: Great rooftop bar, secure elevator, quiet rooms, comfortable beds, excellent breakfast, helpful staff, very clean, luxury amenities - location with easy walking distance (.5 miles) to Times Square, NYC library, Grand Central Station.

title: When in NY....
text: FIVE stars across the board!  Room was smaller than expected but it's doable. Bed and bedding was incredible, room was clean, amenities were top notch! Highly recommend Spyglass and AKB, staff was friendly and helpful. Would stay here again without hesitation.

title: Good hotel
text:
We were happy with our stay at the Archer. Booked a room with an Empire State Building view and we were not disappointed - the view was amazing. Loved seeing it at night and in the morning. The room was clean and well appointed and housekeeping did a good job. 
I was worried we would hear noise as we were on the 21st floor near the roof but it was quiet. 

The cons…room was small (it’s nyc but a bit small even by nyc standards). The lobby was a bit blah and breakfast isn’t included. Lastly, Time Square seediness is starting to spread and unfortunately Midtown is feeling it. It’s not great to have to step over people lying on the street to get to the hotel. Nothing the hotel can do about it but next time I may consider staying further uptown or downtown.

title: 5 stars
text: Room was small, wasn't aware of that so it was a little shocking BUT...bed was so comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud, decor was tastefully done, the room and bathroom were very clean and there was more than enough room for how long I was actually IN the room. Staff was very friendly and helpful, Spyglass was amazing as was AKB. Would defintely stay here again when in NY. Had a great time at The Archer!

title: Archer Hotel
text: First time in New York and we are happy we picked this spot to stay at. It is a very pleasant and relaxing hotel. It’s also in the middle of Manhattan, so a lot of our places we had planned to visit were pretty close to us either on the subway or walking distance.  Staff is also very professional and helpful!

title: Idéal à New-York
text: Le Archer offre un emplacement idéal à côté de Bryan oark et à 6 minutes à pied de Time square. Métro à proximité pour la plupart des lignes pour visiter NYC. Chambre génial vue empire state. Personnel au petits soins et bar en roof top … what else !

title: Nyc weekend
text:
Clean room, quiet, great memory foam bed and feather pillows. Check-in staff was very friendly and efficient  Horel location perfect to hit grand central. 
The Skytop bar had unbelievable views of the empirestate building. Drinks were good, but $$.

title: CREDIT CARD RESERVE AMOUNT - HELD FOR MORE THAN 2 WEEKS POST CHECKOUT
text:
The Hotel is being holding an amount from my credit card for super long. I checked out from the hotel 2 weeks ago. I sent an email asking for an update, and they are still holding certain amounts in my credit card. 

No answers to my email and no updates.

title: Great place to stay in New York City
text: This hotel has everything you would be looking for at a very reasonable rate. The rooftop bar is an amazing additional perk. The rooms are well laid out and the bed is extremely comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary toiletries that were provided and breakfast the next day was available on premises.

title: Yearly. Visit
text:
We come here yearly for anniversary. The staff is very attentive and cater to their clients ..near time square and if you want to see a Broadway show very convenient for you too.
It is clean and it has a terrific saver, as well as a great restaurant on the main level
We’d love for you women at the desk. They are kind, courteous, and always helpful.

title: Excellent service & a great home base
text: This hotel was excellent.  The room was clean the walk-in shower was amazing. The room size is typical for Manhattan/midtown area. It is small but the beds were comfortable. You got free water. Housekeeping cleaned up the rooms. We were able to store our bags without a charge. Everyone at the front best was very helpful and welcoming. Highly recommend. Would stay again for a future visit.

title: Will definitely come back to the Archer!
text: Nice place! Very friendly helpful staff. Rooms are nice, good amenities. Clean but small, kinda cramped for 2 people & 2 beds. Beautiful Skyline bar w/ great view. Location is really handy, can walk everywhere! Definitely recommend!

title: Great location, spectacular rooftop bar but petty niggles were annoying....
text:
The Archer was recommended by friends for it's location and that it was a lovely hotel - right on both accounts - rooms are very small, but this is Manhattan and we all have budgets and criteria for what we want. 
We had a 2nd floor double room - no view of Empire State Building (but that's OK we had not asked for or booked one) - booked for two of us but only one bath robe provided - small detail but nonsensical and petty if that is their policy - which it appears to be - this was rectified but we should not have had to ask.
Our room was not serviced on our second day - no replacement towels, no room tidy - obviously disappointed for a pretty smart Manhattan Hotel. 
Late checkout - told that a late checkout (as we were leaving for the airport later in the day) would incur a full day's room charge - if the room is available why not be flexible and helpful...just because you can be ! Perhaps offer a spare room for guests to change before onward travel as opposed to simply pointing to the toilet and telling us to get changed in there.
General impression was staff were perfectly OK but not interested in improving our stay or being especially helpful. Room not being serviced was an unnecessary failure and annoying
The rooftop bar is fantastic with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building and as stated it is a great location - we tried to walk everywhere within an hour or so just to get a sense of the City. I suppose the real test is would we go back to The Archer...and we would...location, location, location (and the rooftop bar), but we would be tempted to look at other options first (we didn't on this occasion as it was recommended).

title: OTTIMO Hotel
text:
Hotel molto bello proprio in stile New York City le stanze vista Empire ti offrono un emozione ogni sera,sono dotate di macchina Nespresso, prodotti per il corpo e arredate in stile moderno.. L'unica pecca forse un po' piccole. 
Ottima la posizione e lo Sky Bar alla sera offre una vista impagabile. 
Staff sempre sorridente e disponibile
Lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Excellent & Professional
text: Great hotel and staff/service. Housekeeping excellent. Returned a pillow we forgot in the room. The roof top bar has a wonderful view. Security after hours very good. Concierge service great and garage parking available nearby.

title: Nothing special, had to strain to see empire state from expensive view room
text:
We got two rooms for our family, a king and a double double, 1507 and 1508, both were advertised as having an empire state building view which we paid extra for. The empire state building was just about visible from 1508 if you stood right in the far corner of the room right up next to the window by the cupboard! I feel this was misleading compared to the website photos. The view in 1507 was slightly better with the building visible from the bed. 

The rooms were clean and serviceable but very small. The air conditioning was ridiculously loud, and none of the funky stuff pictured on the website existed in reality (e.g. moustaches on the slippers). We were there for 4 nights and the staff didn't make much effort with us at all.

It wasn't made clear on the website that kids aren't allowed in the bar, even to have a soft drink.

All in all, the website oversells the experience and it should be made clearer that its not really a family hotel.

title: Outstanding experience
text: We loved our experience here! The bar had an amazing view and even better chocolate cake. Our room was on the backside and very quiet.  It was the perfect size for two with a very nice bathroom.  The staff was kind and accommodating every time we entered or exited. We will be coming back in the future!

title: I just keep coming back! And you will too.
text:
I cannot speak more highly of the Archer Hotel or the staff. This was my second stay and I will continue to return. 

I was pleasantly surprised when the staff remembered me from my previous stay. Not only that I got a little welcome back treat which was very sweet. Jonathan was ready with a warm welcome and to help with my bags, he is always on the go and manages to stay on top of it all while be friendly and helpful. Joseph at the front desk is an absolute delight, his professionalism and kindness shows in all his interactions. Salma, Gabby and Tracie are lovely, full of knowledge about what to do and where to go based on what you're looking for. Each staff member at the Archer made my stay memorable and fun. Always up for a chat and always there when you need something. While I interacted more with some staff than others (schedules) the entire team are lovely and the manager Scott is also fantastic. 

I was fortunate enough to get an early check in which given the smoke was settling over NY from the Canadian bushfires and I'm asthmatic was incredibly helpful. The hotel was relatively free of smoke during this time as well which was great. 

The hotel is a good size, not too big not too small with a bar/restaurant downstairs and a rooftop bar with a view of the empire state. The hotel is in a prime location with easy access to attractions and necessities. There's plenty of seating in the lobby and just outside if you need somewhere to relax before you start your day. 

The rooms are clean and very well sized for NYC, full of natural light and a very functional bathroom as well. I love the bedding and want the pillows at home. The room has a coffee machine, fridge and locally sources treats daily which is very cute. There is plenty of storage. I stayed in an empire view king room and would highly recommend the view. 

I've stayed in quite a few Manhattan hotels now and this is my favourite. I absolutely adore the staff - do not hesitate to reach out to them if you need anything. The people make the place and while I love the Archer hotel for it's amenities, the staff are the icing on the cake. Thank you for the lovely experience.

title: Beat place to stay in NYC
text: This hotel is gorgeous and so centrally located to see all the sights and shopping.  The rooms are so clean and modern, the beds are like sleeping on a cloud and the employees were so friendly, helpful and eager to please.  Can't say enough good things about the Archer NYC.

title: Anniversary Stay 4 nights
text: Incredible stay!!! Service like no other!  From the moment we arrived, to the day we checked out, the staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable.  The rooms are beautiful, the drinks are incredible and the views are indescribable!!! The hotel made our 25th anniversary stay one we will never forget!!  Jackie in sales is amazing, Scott at front desk was so welcoming and the bartenders are the best around!!! We can’t wait for our next trip back to the city!!!

title: Well being
text:
It was as we expected and a little bit better ( example coffee, tea and milk are complimentary for breakfast and you’ ve also a nespresso machine perfectly working).
Staff is super friendly all the Time .
Room is tiny but ad all are in that area  of NYC . Anyway we didn’t found it so difficult ( and we We’re three with 3 suitcases and back pack).
We had a perfect Negroni at the bar and an excellent burger

title: Gem of a Boutique Hotel.
text: A gem of a boutique hotel. We wanted to be near Times Square but not in it since our plans were to see three Broadway shows over the weekend. The  vibe of the hotel was wonderful. Loved the outdoor lounge options outside the front door where I sat drinking coffee early one morning, the infused water and coffee station inside the lobby that was generously supplied and always stocked. I travel a lot and it was so pleasant to see our room was so well thought out. The beds were extremely comfortable, full size iron and board, robes, treats every day and a welcome birthday brownie were appreciated and delicious. Very generous sized bathroom for a city hotel room, plenty of room for toiletries, again a well thought out room.  Even though our room was near the elevator it was never noisy even over a weekend. We LOVED the rooftop bar!!! Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel for your visit to NYC if the location works for you.

title: Wonderful staff
text: Great experience. Very kind staff. I was surprised by the pro-activeness and support of the staff when I forgot something when I left. They've taken care of everything to get it back to me in The Netherlands. Very much appreciated!

title: Great hotel for an nyc getaway.
text: Great hotel and staff are exceptional.  The bedrooms are mostly bed but they are nicely appointed and heavenly mattress and and pillows. I was impressed with the special touches and hoodies left in the room in the morning, especially the Li-Lac high end chocolate, a famous and long time NYC tradition.  And don't miss the expresfo martini!

title: Great Location & Amazing Front Desk Staff
text: Conveniently located and within walking distance to Times Square, The Theatre District, Bryant Park, restaurants and shopping. The front desk staff is friendly and always made a point to speak to me when entering or leaving the hotel. Rooms are small...but doable for a few nights. Book a room with a city view otherwise you have a view of an office space which is VERY visible from your room. Had to keep drapes closed during the day. The bottom sheet is not fitted and untucked easily. Other than the view and sheet issues I had a pleasant stay.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great location and friendly staff.

title: Break in NY
text:
Hotel in good area to explore New York. Hotel okay but not the best really at all. Rooms clean but much smaller than expected. No drinks or food after 10pm for residents. Wouldn't want to
 stay here again.

title: INCREDIBLE HOSPITALITY!
text: FANTASTIC stay!  My husband and I took our 3 teenage daughters here for summer vacation.  The location (in the heart of the Garment District) was perfection.  It is just a short walk from Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, Times Square, & Rockefeller Plaza.  The rooftop bar has spectacular views of the Empire State Building!  The hotel was clean, well designed, the beds were extremely comfortable, and the air conditioner was phenomenal!  The BEST part was the hospitality and service of the staff.  Joseph, Scott, & Jonathan made us feel welcome and our every need was met with urgency during our stay.  Since our girls are underage and not allowed to go to the rooftop bar, Scott was kind enough to open it to us in the afternoon to give the girls an opportunity to take in the views.  He was gracious enough to take several family pics for us with the skyline in the background.  We were humbled by his generosity.  We will stay here again when we come back!  We recommend this hotel 10/10!

title: very nice hotel
text: It's a very nice hotel with a very good service, very clean and comfortable rooms, excellent location very walkable close to all amenities in downtown. staff is helpful and Friendly , loved it ,  definitely will come back.

title: Father son weekend get away
text:
Great hotel that’s centrally located, clean with friendly staff.  Times Square, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park and Central Park are close or fairly close.  We would highly recommend this hotel.      

We ate at their restaurant for one of our lunches. They had a special which was great value.  A burger/fries with a beer for only $20.00. Food was very well done. 

All staff were very helpful any time we call upon them.

title: Excellent choice
text: Just came from a four day weekend with my wife in NY and Archer Hotel was an excellent idea. Very well located, close to Bryant Park, with the amazing view of the Empire State Building. Modern facilities, perfect room size and amenities, cool design, very good service, warm staff. Great balance value vs quality of the product. Will be back for sure

title: Best hotel in NYC. The view was amazing.
text: We really enjoyed our stay at The Archer Hotel. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Joseph for finding us the special things that made our stay more comfortable. And thanks to Jonathan for happily taking care of our luggage, to and from storage, so effortlessly. Really appreciate everyone’s thoughtfulness. We hope to see you again soon.

title: Fantastic Trip to New York
text: The Archer Hotel has a very friendly and helpful staff.  They make you feel very welcome there. Derrick at the front desk was wonderful.  The Archer Hotel is in a great location in Manhattan, central to most attractions.   The only thing we felt we needed to take a subway/cab to was the 911 Memorial and area close to the Statue of Liberty, which would have been really far to walk to.  We felt very safe walking around here. The hotel is very clean.  We stayed in a room with two queen beds that had a beautiful view of the Empire State building.  The beds were very comfortable.  We'd definitely stay here again. I only wish the bar/restaurant upstairs was not just for adults, as my daughter was 18 and as such, was not able to go in there to eat.

title: Excellent hotel, excellent location
text: This hotel is the perfect location- close to amazing restaurants, time square and Broadway to on a quiet (NYC quiet) street. The hotel is as amazing as it looks! The rooms are small but cozy and set up for comfort.z the beds are so comfortable. The rooms are super clean. Everything was perfect! The food and drinks at the lobby bar/restaurant are INCREDIBLE! And the view from the rooftop bar is stunning. We enjoyed a drink while enjoying the city skyline. And this hotel is in the middle of 2 other hotels with rooftop bars on the same street! So we got to enjoy those easily as well. Highly recommend and can’t wait to return!

title: Perfect, consistent go to spot in Midtown
text:
Spent a quick stay again at the Archer, now our go to location when in midtown.

The hotel offers proximity to central Manhattan and most train lines. Elevators are efficient, front desk staff is warm and courteous. Water and Intellegensia coffee are available in the lobby.

Wi-fi is quick and reliable, water pressure is excellent, and the rooms are quite quiet,
albeit tiny. A classic king had space to walk around the bed but not much more - two suitcases could not lie open at the same time unless on the bed. Ours wasn’t a room to linger in - there wasn’t space to if we wanted to! - but the bed was comfortable and the common areas in the lobby and outside / in front are a fine space to wait for a car or a companion.

Outlets are thoughtfully located by the bed and the tiny triangular shower shelf, placed to accommodate shaving legs in the shower, remains an unparalleled highlight (seriously why doesn’t everyone do this?)

There’s no wow factor here per se but the Archer checks all the boxes and provides a consistently exemplary stay on repeat visits; honestly, for a quick in and out in the city, that’s everything I want and need.

title: Birthdate night out
text: Spent the night for my girlfriend’s birthday. We’d had a perfectly spaced king bed room on the 19th floor. The bed was so comfortable we almost didn’t want to go out for the evening. The AC in the room was perfect just the way we like it. Bathroom spotless. The front office staff was great during check in. We stopped for a quick drink at the lobby bar before we head out and the staff was amazing. We never made it up to spyglass but I’ve been up there before and it’s an amazing view of the Empire State Building.

title: HIGHLY recommend this hotel!
text: This hotel is perfectly situation in the city. The staff is exceptional. They were welcoming, incredibly helpful. The rooms were a good size, very clean. We fully enjoyed the rooftop bar; and the staff there was unbelievable. The AKB bar is also great and the staff was wonderful. Overall, a fabulous experience from start to finish! HIGHLY recommend. (The pillows are super soft, so heads up!)

title: Awesome Experience in the big apple
text:
Loved the location of the hotel!  Right in Midtown and just blocks from Bryant Park.
Beautiful hotel...our room was super clean and very comfortable.
The rooftop bar was spectacular...you felt like you could reach out and touch the Empire State Building
Most importantly the staff at Archer were so kind, helpful, friendly and very accommodating.   I can't thank all of them enough.....especially Selma.    
What a wonderful experience and I would highly recommend the Archer Hotel!
Thank you!!!!!

title: An Excellent Hotel
text: We took a family trip to New York City.  We had an excellent time at the Archer Hotel, and in NYC!  We went to Hamilton on Broadway, Billy Joel in Madison Square Garden, and saw a Yankees v. Mets game in Yankee Stadium - the Subway Series. We toured Chinatown and Little Italy. We tried to see all the other sites, too.

title: Great location
text: Very nice hotel with a beautiful view and a 20 foot ceiling in our room. Biggest complaint is only one outlet useable in the bedroom and no trash bin. The room was otherwise beautiful with a great view of the Empire State building.

title: Archer New York is a great stay
text: From the moment we booked the room we knew this hotel and it's team was special. I received a few follow-up communications from the manager(s) to ensure my reservation was correct. Each time we walked through the doors the front desk staff greeted us and asked how we were. The rooms were cozy and clean and the food and drinks did not disappoint. This hotel is located in a convenient spot for all of the destinations we planned during our stay. We highly recommend the Archer to you if you're in the area and appreciate the small gestures that are overlooked in the other larger chains.

title: Great location central to everything
text: Amazing view of the empire state! The staff were really lovely and helpful. Our hotel was nice and clean, surprisingly quiet despite being central to everything. It was within walking distance to time square, a lot of food places, empire state and the edge. Will definitely come back!

title: Room 1402 is European-size small.
text:
These people do almost everything perfectly, in spite of the tiny, European sie rooms they fill. First, a shoutout to Justin who knows everything, and treats guests as family. Next, kudos to all the other staff of whom there are never fewer than three to look after you. We would have liked the upstairs and ground floor dining facilities to be open all the time, but they're aren't. Staff and scheduling probably dictate those hours.

A couple of wonderful things to do: order pizza with chicken on Thursday when the (low) price for this delicious specially priced item will shock you. The pizza is big enough for two, and delicious as New York pizza is supposed to be. Go to Ole and Steen for pastry, and take it across the street to Bryant Park to enjoy.

The strange thing that happened was the response to our request for a checkout extension. The woman in the reception gave us the option of both rooms having 11:30 checkout, or one room having a 12:00 checkout. While there are different ways to rationalize that response to our request for a 12:00 checkout, it doesn't fit the caliber of this hotel.

title: Excellent location, rooms, and staff - and pet friendly
text: Great location in midtown and easy walk to a lot of nice attractions (i.e., Summit One Vanderbilt and Edge/Hudson Yards). Close to Penn Station too and great breakfast places (LE Pain Quotidien and Angelina Paris).  Next door to Bryant Park in case you want to take a break from the hustle!

title: Great Stay
text: I always read Trip Advisor reviews before I book a hotel but always fail to write my own review - until now. Everything about our 2 night, 3 day stay at the Archer Hotel was great. The location is really convenient. The staff at the front desk was welcoming, helpful, and super pleasant every single time we talked with them. Our room on the 2nd floor was clean, spacious & quiet. The welcome gift of 2 bottled waters & 2 caramels was a pleasant and welcomed surprise. Looking forward to our next stay here.

title: GRAN HOTEL Y GRAN SERVICIO
text:
Excellent hotel , with great location between 5th and 6th Av. 
My process for reservation was excelent, the attention of all the personel is awsome , I am very gratefull with all of the employees , special thanks to the manager and to Gabby in the front desk, she was always helping me, this is a hotel wich makes you feel like home, and it is a very clean hotel 

Exclenete Hotel, con una gran ubicacion entre la 5ta y 6ta avenida , mi proceso de reservacion fue sencillo y facil, la atencion del personal es excelente, estoy muy agradecido con todos los empleados en especial con el gerente y con Gabby, quien me ayudo en todo momento, es un hotel que te hace sentir como en casa, y es un hotel muy limpio

title: Great experience AND great hotel
text:
I just stay in this hotel for a week AND my experience was so nice 
Hotel Is very well located between 5th AND 6th av. The personel Is very helpfull AND SERVICE was incredible 
Thank you all , I Will be BACK Every Time Invisit NYC

title: Friendly staff,  short walk to Times Sq, Empire Building
text:
Within walk distance to Times Square, Empire Building, Grand Central Station, shops, restaurants etc 
friendly staff, always smiling.  Provided useful tour details & where to buy tickets. 
Internet is free and powerful.

title: Amazing boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan!
text: Everything about the Archer is amazing 👏  the staff , the rooms, the food, the drinks, the location all top notch! Its an intimate hotel where the staff knows who you are which is refreshing getting back from enjoying the hustle of the city. Jonathan was the best helping with our bags even in the rain and recommending places to eat! We'll definitely be back!

title: The archer hotel made our trip so special
text:
The staff is amazing. We had a complicated travel schedule, and they worked it all out for us!! The rooms felt clean and modern. We loved the little espresso machine. 
We will definitely stay here the next time we come to New York!!!

title: Mixed experience
text: Sheet had poop on it from prior visitor!!! Also, room 709 so small it’s like sleeping in a closet. Staff very accommodating and friendly. Rooftop bar is nice although limited outside space. Inside had windows though.

title: Helpful staff, good rooms, great bathroom.
text: Everything was great, except for the dirty windows that severely distorted our great view of the Empire State Building. We splurged for the view and the windows should have been clean. Otherwise, great location and beautiful building.

title: Archer hits the mark
text: Staff was super accommodating and helpful when I wanted to extend my stay. The restaurant staff was also super friendly. I usually don’t like to stay in Times Square but I would recommend and stay again.

title: Housekeeping Service - yay!
text: Nice hotel in Midtown – what I appreciated the most was that, unlike so many other place post-Covid, they are actually providing housekeeping services as a default - I didn't need to ask and someone actually came to clean my room! For that reason alone I will make this my go-to place in Manhattan. Plus the rooftop bar overlooking the Empire State Building has an outstanding view.

title: Great location
text: We did enjoy our 7 day visit in The Archer. Everything you will visit in New York is nearby.Grand Central Station is e short walk, so no problem if you arrive from JFK with the subway, Bryan Park all ways nice for one drink and don’t miss out on the rooftop at Archer

title: Friendly hotel and staff
text:
The bed was phenomenal we slept beautifully.  First time in months I was able to sleep longer then 4 hours sleep which I suffer from insomnia. 
Loved the rum shower gel 
Very close to Empire State Building, Times Square, Grand central station 

However bed room was very small 
Staff forgot to decorate balloons for my husband’s birthday on 5th July was disappointed when we went up to the room and nothing wasn’t set up
Bedroom not normally made up till afternoon 
Closed captions on TV didn’t work however staff quickly sent someone to sorted quickly

title: Archer Provides Excellent Accommodations without Hurting your Wallet
text: The archer Hotel in New York City is spectacular. My wife and I stayed in July 2023 for a couples vacation, and the archer made it memorable. Rooms are small, but very nice and well appointed. Staff was beyond helpful whenever we had a question about where to go and what to do. They would look up and call establishments to make sure our trip was memorable. I would definitely stay here again, even though the food was somewhat underwhelming.

title: Great stay in midtown
text: Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Room decor is modern and feels updated. Fantastic location near great restaurants and very centralized. The front office staff is very friendly and professional. Overall, an excellent stay. The Bar Gad a nice vibe on a Thursday evening.

title: The Archer is key to a great NYC experience
text: My family typically selects urban destinations for our vacations. And we always select boutique hotels. Our recent stay at the Archer was wonderful. The hotel was beautiful and clean. The shower had excellent pressure (it is a particular peeve of mine when the shower is sub-standard). And most importantly, the staff was very attentive and helpful. If you make the trip, do yourself a favor and reserve some time at the Archer's rooftop bar with an excellent view of the Empire State Building.

title: The excellent staff add to the overall good experience.
text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Easy check in and check out. Good location. Great roof top bar with lovely views especially at night.  Tasty food in the restaurant served quickly. Small but comfortable room.

title: Best Stay in NYC
text:
Ladies and Gentlemen, welcome to the hotel with the fastest elevator service in the city. Over 5 days including the July 4th weekend, the longest wait was 10 seconds with most waits being ~3 seconds.

The rooms were superb and the bathroom was of great size. Room service accommodated every morning sleep-in and performed service in the afternoons.

You honestly can't beat the location either, with close proximity to Times Square and all subways trains. Overall a must stay and I can totally see why this hotel was rated as one of NYC's best hotels a while back.

title: love this hotel!
text: We had a room with two double beds with a view of the Empire State Building.  I'm used to NYC hotel rooms being small and it didn't bother us at all.  The hotel made good use of the space.  The bathroom was a decent size with plenty of counter space for your toiletries.  Our room was a little warm and they sent someone from the engineering department right away.  We previously had a reservation for Spyglass and they had a private event during the time of our reservation.  When the event ended, they accommodated us a little later and we were able to have drinks while looking at the city views.  Everyone at this hotel was great during our stay.  The hotel was quiet and we slept peacefully.  This will be our hotel in NYC in the future.

title: Highly recommended
text: Room is tiny so be prepared for it. They were doing some renovation but it didn't bother us. We were hoping to enjoy the rooftop but they were having a closed event sos we didn'tget a chancetoseeit. Staff is very welcoming. Overall highly recommended.

title: Best hotel for Anniversary Trip
text: Absolutely would recommend this hotel! Great location, personable staff, beautiful room (we got the empire view), great vibes overall! We came here for our 10 year anniversary and the staff went out of their way to ensure we felt welcomed and enjoyed our trip! Would stay here again in a New York minute!

title: Derrick is a rockstar!
text: When we arrived, we were instantly delighted with our choice to stay at The Archer. The staff was so friendly and hospitable. Especially Derrick! Derrick honestly went above and beyond. He greeted us by first names every time we returned the hotel and made sure we truly enjoyed our stayed. Totally impressed and would definitely stay here again should we return to NYC!

title: Luxurious, friendly, relaxed, great location - perfect!
text: Could not recommended Archer Hotel NYC highly enough. Friendly, relaxed, welcoming, helpful staff. A fantastic location just seconds from 5th Avenue or Broadway - perfect for sightseeing, walking around and plentiful, easy public transport links close by (subway at Bryant Park and the beautiful Grand Central very conveniently located just a few minutes away). The hotel is gorgeous - friends joined me for a drink in Spyglass and it was such an incredible treat - the staff were top-notch, welcoming and attentive, bar staff excellent, we had fabulous cocktails, and that view of the Empire State Building is unbelievable - what a classy and fun New York City experience that was! The Queen Room (my view overlooked a Garment District building full of dressmaker's dresses and was beautiful!) - the room was small but very comfortable and was ample for my needs as I was either sleeping our out all the time. Extremely comfy bed, nice fresh comfortable bedding, there was enough storage space for my 6 nights stay (look for extra little places to stow things..). Fridge in the room is handy to store some snacks and cold drinks from nearby shops. There is an iron & board, easy to use Nespresso machine. Robe and slippers were nice to have. The bathroom with tub was very spacious, tub was good for a short soak and the shower power was exactly what's needed after a busy day / before a night out on the town! The complimentary toiletries were very nice, and good to have the large containers rather than tiny individual portions. Hairdryer worked perfectly, and there were plenty sockets around the room (I kept discovering more storage space and sockets up until I was leaving!). The provision of all types of charge cable beside the bed was a very convenient and helpful touch. It felt like a luxurious, relaxed and fabulous place to stay, so convenient, but also just so energetic, positive and friendly. Sitting chilling with a glass of wine or chatting with friend over coffee in AKB was lovely and relaxing, felt at home. I didn't eat here but the food looked first class. My only issue was that the Spyglass bar was closed for private functions on 2 nights I had hoped to visit it again, so was bit disappointed. So check about opening / closed times if you are on a short stay and plan to visit the rooftop bar! I hope to come back another time - I would love another f those magnificent Manhattans while gazing dreamily at the legendary ESB!

title: Not a hotel but a HOMEtel!
text: This HOMEtel was amazing. Family meeting you upon arrival and all of homes comforts to boot. Rooftop bar with breathtaking views of the Empire State Building. Greatest experience I’ve had! Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful Experience
text:
Great location to theater district Very nice boutique hotel. Small but comfortable rooms. Very clean and updated. Very comfortable beds. Strong shower water pressure. Treats and water in room, coffee In lobby 
The highlight was our concierge or check-in host Tracie. She was a wealth of information and her knowledge about Broadway and area was amazing.

title: Great Location! Clean! Modern! Wonderful Staff!
text: Great location!  Near great food; Keens Steakhouse, Zuckers Bagels, Dunkin, Starbucks, Whole Foods, Archer's own rooftop bar (Spyglass!) OMG Vanilla Ice Cream Salted Caramel Bourbon Shake - Gotta try this, Refinery Rooftop (almost next door) Lunch delish! Close to theaters. Close to best prices, fabulous jewelry shopping ever - Landsberg W 47th street.  Clean, modern rooms.  They are small rooms buy hey, this is NY...get up and go, eat, shop, come back, change, dinner at Tony's DiNapoli, fried zucchini (like potato chips, best pasta, eggplant and red sauce, see show "Some Like it Hot"...Can't Wait To Come Back!! Can walk to everything!! Theaters! Times Square!

title: Exceptional attention to detail
text: A world class experience from check in to check out. Staff was friendly, professional, helpful, and polite. The rooms were well appointed, with really comfortable beds, and pillows! The view from the rooftop bar can’t be beat. This is a fabulous centrally located boutique hotel, highly recommended!

title: The Archer is my new favorite hotel in NYC
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Archer Hotel in NYC.  What a great experience.  I was there for both business and leisure.  The atmosphere of the hotel is welcoming and cozy.  Staff is friendly and professional.  I experienced the rooftop bar - the view is unbeatable.  Food, staff and drinks were also amazing!   If your looking for a unique hotel and experience look no further!

title: Finally! A hotel that actually feels romantic enough for special occasions...
text: Our room had beautiful high ceilings, and I was very impressed with the kindness and professionalism of the staff. The entire stay felt luxurious, which was wonderful as this night was part of our honeymoon! Also, give the hotel restaurant a chance to wow you at breakfast. Our bagel sandwiches were delicious.

title: Location + Service + Drinks = All In For Archer!
text:
So many reasons to stay here but honestly the people on the team truly make the difference. Either suggestions to key attractions, reservations at your favorite restaurants or simply just giving you some toothpaste because you raced out and forgot it before your next meeting. It so nice when you spend the money to stay in the heart of the city you EXPECT a certain level of service, most often when expectation are high, the product doesn't always deliver. At Archer, its refreshingly different. 

The rooms are decent size and the rooftop bar, with its view never disappoints. Cheers to your next NY adventure! - Jason

title: Perfect Boutique Experience!
text: We were impressed with the friendly and helpful staff, the well-appointed room, the rooftop bar with view, and the lobby-level cafe and bar area. We enjoyed the breakfasts, cooked to order and delicious! The room was small, but had everything we needed, including a good size, attractive bathroom, a desk, and a roomy refrigerator which was much newer and nicer than most hotel fridges. A delightful touch in the room was a couple of recommended-reading books: an E. B. White essay on New York, and The Little Prince.

title: Amazing 2 night stay!
text:
I had an amazing two night stay at the Archer Hotel. The customer service was phenomenal, the lobby was comfortable and inviting. The rooftop lounge offered beautiful views of the skyline, and the Empire State building. I had breakfast one morning at the restaurant in the lobby, which was delicious. The rooms were lovely, abd had super comfortable beds.  Bathrooms also had kits in case you forgot your toothbrush, shampoo conditioner, lovely robes and comfy slippers.  This is a perfect hotel. Located close to many nice restaurants, Times Square, Grand 
Central, library ,  and of course Byrant Park.

title: Great hotel for a week of business
text: Beautiful view from room 2008. My room was so clean, the bed was super comfortable, the Malin+Goetz care products, the Nespresso machine and the daily treats were all very appreciated. There was a great desk for work, wi-fi was strong, food and beverage were great. Front desk staff was super friendly, Spyglass staff less so but the drinks and the view made up for it. Would stay there again!

title: Wonderful trip!
text: Lovely hotel, v comfy (proper king size) bed, good sized rooms. Shout out to Derrick who was a star, always super helpful.  Breakfast service bit slow and we found it odd being asked to tip for this as a resident but maybe the norm in NYC. Rooftop bar fabulous, always got a table and staff lovely.  Won’t stay anywhere else in NYC and have already recommended to everyone !! Thanks The Archer x

title: The food & cocktails were perfection
text: Best water pressure in nyc - everything was well appointed , clean, upscale.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The beds were comfortable, sheets high quality, pillows were just right, high end bath shower products, and 2 complimentary Fiji waters

title: Awesome hotel!!
text: 16th birthday trip for granddaughter. We were greeted with a sweet card/cupcake upon our arrival in the room. Friendly helpful staff. Late checkout accommodated when I asked. I cannot not say enough good things. Only thing I would add is a blanket in the room, duvet a bit thin. Everything else was great. Very clean, close to everything yet quiet. Will stay again.

title: Friendliest staff and perfect location
text: This was our first time to New York, and the location of mid town east was the perfect location for us. Close enough to walk to everything yet far enough away from the crowds. And Derrick was the friendliest staff person there, and made us feel so at home every time he saw us! He could not of been nicer, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Honeymoon stay
text:
Our recent stay was for our honeymoon after we got married in NYC last year.  The staff at the reception was friendly and welcoming.  Check-in was smooth and quick.  We were given a room on the third floor which was very clean and was a reasonable size.  The bathroom was a good size too and clean.  

Every day that we stayed there, all the staff were friendly and helpful (especially Jonathan) who did suggest a local pizza restaurant 2 blocks away, however, it must be very good as the queue to get a take out was around the block !! The bed was comfy and the pillows very soft that you sank into them.

When we had come to the end of our stay, Jonathan also arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport.  

We highly recommend this hotel and we will return to stay at the Archer soon.

Thanks to all the staff for our recent stay and see you soon.

title: great hotel, great service
text: Very friendly staff, room are ver well equipped even if smaller than average but they make up for it in the cleanliness and how well equipped they are. very pleasant stay overall. door men and reception staff are super friendly.

title: Special trip to celebrate a big birthday
text: A trip with my son to celebrate my birthday made very special by this lovely hotel. Friendly and helpful staff made us feel so welcome. Perfect location for theatres, shopping and exploring NYC. Small but comfy room with 2 doubles was perfect for my son and I. Lovely shower. Room & Rooftop bar with view of Empire State the icing on the cake!

title: I could sit here with this view all day……
text: Great view from our room for sure ! Comfortable beds and linens ! They were available to accommodate our needs at any hour, front desk associates were very very friendly and smiley and helpful, very welcoming. We didn’t get this same feel from the morning breakfast ladies sadly, more interested in rolling the silverware than filling our water glasses, also we thought it was a bit weird to be told we didn’t need to make a reservation for the spyglass restaurant and when we got there they had a hard time seating us and we noticed 2 areas that were reserved and nobody ever showed up while we were there, interesting. Definitely recommend the Archer and perhaps stay again on our next time around. Also, parking garage location close by, which is a plus for sure.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text:
Sad to be leaving after a fantastic stay at The Archer! All front desk staff were great, but special thank you to Jonathan.   Rooms were smaller, but were clean had more then everything you needed. Beds and pillows were probably the comfiest hotel beds we’ve ever had.  The Spyglass Rooftop is definitely a highlight at this hotel - lovely drinks, good food, great service and an unbeatable view of the Empire State Building! 

Would definitely recommend The Archer to anyone visiting NYC and we look forward to staying here again!!

title: Well located for seeing the city.
text:
The Archer was selected by the folks who booked this business tour.  The staff were friendly, helpful, courteous and available whenever I needed. 
The room had a great king bed (not too soft), was clean and the bathroom was perfect and spotless. I highly recommend the New York City Archer at 38 E and Fifth.

title: Amazing service and friendly staff
text: A family member recommended The Archer and I couldn't be happier with the service we received! The staff was so friendly and accommodating, and the views from the rooftop bar were spectacular! The location is fantastic and we will definitely be staying here again.

title: Hôtel superbe et personnel attentionné
text:
Superbe hôtel calme et très cosy, très bien placé pour visiter New-York. Jolie chambre confortable et très propre avec de petites attentions sucrées chaque jour. Machine à café et dosettes dans la chambre, ce que 
nous avons bien apprécié. Le personnel est d'une gentillesse incroyable et cherche toujours à satisfaire vos demandes. Nous avons adoré notre séjour à l'hôtel Archer.

title: A gem in NYC
text: A co-worker recommended this hotel and it was really great!  Centrally located close to Times Square and the Empire State Building.  Yes the rooms are small but that is to be expected.  We used the under bed storage and the smaller closet - forced us to be tidy!   Front desk staff is indeed very helpful and friendly- Jonathan & Joseph will take good care of you.  Saw Jonathan bring two kids a special gift and they lit up!  Eating area very nice in the lobby - good breakfast options.

title: Exceptional Service
text:
This small, elegant hotel is staffed by a caring, competent team the likes of which I've not experienced elsewhere . 

Although our room was smalI, which is typical for New York City, it wasn't cramped and the quality amenities such as chargers for our devices; lovely soaps, shampoo and lotions more than made up for the size of the room. As well, I was thankful for the daily kind gestures such as the quality chocolates, mints, delicious salty caramels, and the refreshing water with cucumber in the lobby. The seating areas were tastefully decorated with comfortable sofas and chairs for guests to relax.

In the mornings, we enjoyed an ample breakfast with beautifully plated dishes that were served by competent, professional wait staff, who were well trained. Similarly, the staff at the front desk were genuinely helpful, warm and friendly.

On my return home, I had my final proof of superb service when housekeeping notified me with no delay that I left my Tilley hat in the room. Before I could blink, Fabiola packed up my hat and arranged for it to be shipped to my home by FedEx. She emailed to reassure me that it was on the way home and provided tracking details.

I have never given any hotel or inn or BnB a 100% rating, and I'm prepared to do so now for the Archer. 

I would like to thank all of you for providing an exceptional stay for me and my daughter.

title: Great find while traveling solo!
text: The room was clean, comfortable and surprisingly quiet.  Bathroom was stocked with plentiful linens and hot water.  Bed was extremely comfortable though bedding was minimal.  I would have enjoyed an extra blanket.  Safe in the room worked well.  Breakfast, while not included, was delicious and all staff were phenomenal and extremely helpful.  The rooftop bar was such a nice find.  Great views of the Empire State Building, though I would have enjoyed it being open later in the evening.  Hotel was close to the subway and Bryant Park which was nice to relax in.  Centrally located to Broadway, not far from Central Park.  I will definitely be staying here again!

title: Wonderful experience!
text: The hotel was in a very good location. It is very clean and the staff is extremely nice and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable. They left special treats every night for us. The lobby is nice and the complementary cold water and coffee was very appreciated.  The outdoor lounge area is extremely nice and our large family could gather comfortably there every day during our stay. The restaurant food was delicious. I would definitely I stay there again.

title: Stunning, Midtown Hotel!
text: Beautiful hotel, in an excellent location, with stunning views of the Empire State Building. Rooms are small but are very comfortable. Breakfasts are very tasty, if a little expensive. The rooftop bar is also worth a nightime visit for the brilliant views.

title: Memorable hotel and stay
text:
Excellent midtown location with a stunning rooftop bar with spectacular views of the Empire State Building.  High quality bar and restaurant menu choices.  Staff very attentive and helpful, eager to please.  King room on the small side compared to similar types of hotel we have stayed in, however room was well appointed with an excellent bed.

Minor observations being super picky, the reception does on occasions get busy, the one bin in the room was small, no tea making facility, nespresso machine only.  Complimentary chocolates each day was hit and miss, one chocolate for two people.  There was no hotel introductory literature, this is helpful when arriving following a long tiring journey in our opinion.

None of the above spoiled what was a great New York experience.  We would recommend The Archer, we will be returning some time soon.

title: Small boutique style hotel in a fantastic location, clean rooms, good amenities and very friendly staff.
text: Fantastic hotel for our 6 night stay in New York. Room very clean,  rooms on the small side but two double beds which were extremely comfortable. Lovely bar area in reception and beautiful roof fop  bar. The staff were exceptionally friendly making us feel very welcome, a special mention to Derrick who went above and beyond on more than one occasion to help us.

title: PERFECT Midtown Hotel
text:
The Archer looked great when we chose a Midtown hotel for our week in NYC and absolutely exceeded that high expectation - in all the ways that mattered to us :
- Great, welcoming, friendly & knowledgeable team
- The perfect Midtown location to explore the city - walkable to lots of top sights (Times Square, Grand Central, the fab Bryant Park, St. Patrick’s, 5th Avenue, Broadway,….) and easy to connect to the rest of the city by Subway and bus
- one of the most comfortable hotel beds I’ve ever slept in and a great shower (both top priority for me to give a hotel a high rating),  very good housekeeping for a clean, freshened room with sweet treats every day
- and the Spyglass rooftop bar with a view if the Empire State that just made us stop and stare every time.

Perfect hotel, a bug part of our superb NYC stay. We feel pretty smug having chosen The Archer I can tell you!

Nowhere else we’ll stay if we come back to this amazing city.

title: Lovely little hotel
text: Really enjoyed my stay here. The room was small but it's New York. It was modern, clean fresh. I got a treat left for me every day after housekeeping had been around, Jonathan was really helpful after checkout looking after my bag and getting me a taxi. The only two  reason it's not 5 out of 5, the first it that one morning after a late night out housekeeping started knocking at the door at 8.30am. I learnt to put the Privacy sign out after that and was left alone, but that felt very early. The other was that I'd turned the air con unit off and one night it decided to turn itself back on at 1.30am, i managed to turn it off but was really freaked out for a while. Very minor inconvenience for a beautiful room within a short walking distance of Time Square and the all the theatres.

title: Need upgrade their service
text:
If the Empire rooms are nice even small ,and quiet for NY
If the  akb breakfast service and quality is very good
There are some misfonctions in the service

- i have to gl tinan emergency orthopedic center and they were unable to give me some adress -i have to search on Internet-le a foreigner them Ndwyorkers and I have to find a can by myself 
-that same day when we cale back from emergency acts we find out room not cleaned and we have to argue to get it asthe service saut down at 4 pm and they had other floors to do. Finaly we got it but i have to test in my daughter’s bedroom to stay quiet upon request of the medical team. 
- they were unable at that evening to get a can : just go in the avenue !!!
- Friday it was the room of my daughter which was not enterely cleaned…and we have to wait in our room 
And today while I let them 7500$ they did not authorize to check out at noon( policy us 11am) even if I have to make a medical appointment before my back flight in France.
