If you want to be considères as a luxury hotel then try to be perfect

title: Overall a nice hotel in a good location. Food is average but go check out the rooftop bar.
text: Nice hotel with a great midtown location.  Front desk person named Rosalyn was friendly and super helpful,  provided awesome detailed breakfast recommendations. Rooftop bar is great for drinks and the view of the Empire State Bldg.- skip the food. Rooms are very small as usual for NYC but some views are of the scaffolding and construction workers from the next door bldg. Downstairs restaurant was closed for dinner which was disappointing but the  pizza oven fire is always going strong which was confusing.

title: Top notch customerservice, clean, and hospitable!!!
text:
Loved everything about thos hotel! They were so sweet, cleaned my room every day giving fresh towelsand layingout my toiletriesneatly on the counter after cleaning, left treats every night.
I was on a big group trip from Nashville and they were top notch to us in hospitality!! While every employee was gracious,  I have to say Derrick was my favorite! He was always smiling and just made us feel welcome. He really looked as if he loved his job and was truly glad to see us!! Thank you Archer staff for a wonderful stay, I will be back and will recommend your hotel!!!

title: Amazing Visit
text: We had a fabulous first visit to NYC and we couldn’t have picked a better place to stay than the Archer Hotel! From check in to check out, the service was top notch. It didn’t matter who was working the front desk, a kind employee was always willing to answer a question and help. We can’t wait to go back and stay again!

title: Excellent customer service and comfortable bed!
text: From the moment we walked in, we had a pleasant experience at The Archer! Thank you to Tracie at the front desk for your excellent customer service and personality! We’d had a horrible flight experience and a cancelled flight - The Archer had a room ready for us at 11 am when we arrived to NYC after 24 hours of travel. They have the MOST comfortable hotel bed we’ve ever slept on! We were greeted with bottled water and locally made caramels and then every other day we had a fun candy treat in our room. They even remembered from our reservation that we were celebrating at big birthday and one day we had a cupcake in our room with a handwritten note. The hotel was clean, the rooftop bar was wonderful with an amazing view of the Empire State Bldg and the AKB restaurant was perfect for breakfast each morning. All the employees are kind and helpful. Great location, too. We will be back!! Thank you!

title: Will stay again!
text: Clean room, comfortable beds, terrific front desk staff. Rooftop bar offers a stunning view of the Empire State. Great midtown location.  Only negative was when we tried to have breakfast in the restaurant Sunday morning, and were completely ignored by the two servers for 20 minutes. We ended up going out in the rain to find coffee and food.

title: Excellent hotel in a central yet relaxed place
text:
We visited New York for nine days. This hotel provided a great accommodation with wonderful beds.
It is not too big, so you will not have to queue for anything. Although our rooms were on the ninth floor, there was hardly any noise from the street.
The hotel is in walking distance to the Madison Square Garden, so if you want to catch a Rangers or a Knicks game, no problem.
We would definitely book again here.

title: Excellent housekeeping and bar staff.
text:
The hotel is fairly compact and although we didn’t try the breakfast we did visit the rooftop Spyglass Barr on several occasions. The staff were all outstanding and very pleasant.

Only slight downside would be that we wouldn’t stay near Times Square again but that isn’t the hotel fault.

title: At 11:30pm someone attempted to enter my room and opened the door but was blocked by the bolts.
text: I am a young female professional travelling alone for work for 3 nights. On my last evening I got to my room at 11:30pm. I bolted the door and 5 minutes after entering someone attempted to enter my room. The door opened two inches since it was blocked by the bolts. I immediately closed it again and called down to the concierge to voice my concern. The front desk told me that sometimes housekeeping drops things off. They sent security to survey the hallway but at this point it was too late and I was concerned for my safety for the entire night. Thankfully I had bolted the door otherwise I am not sure what would have happened.

title: Had a great experience at The Archer
text: Great hotel in a great location. The rooms are a little too small for our liking though (yes, I know that this is New York but we’ve had larger rooms elsewhere in New York). Very clean. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Breakfasts were quite delicious. A night cap at the rooftop bar is a must.

title: Great Stay at Archer in NYC
text:
My wife and I just returned from a 4 day trip to NYC and stayed 3 nights at the Archer. From the time we walked into the hotel until the time we left we had a fantastic stay. It is a boutique hotel with all the amenities you will need for your trip and is centrally located to make everything a walk or short Uber away. Inside the rooms are well laid out with high end finishes and very comfortable beds. We had a great room on the 19th floor and found no noise from the streets in the evenings. Our favorite spot was the Spyglass bar on the rooftop of the hotel for both food and drinks...oh and the spectacular view of the Empire State Building and surrounding city. By the far the best part of the Archer was the staff at the Archer. They were 'over the top' friendly, courteous and helpful to us. A special thank you to Simon who was especially helpful and providing assistance to us to make our stay wonderful.
 
Greg from Toronto, Ontario, Canada
 
Visited April 20 -April 24, 2023

title: Central Midtown location, clean & modern hotel
text:
We chose this hotel for the location.  As first time visitors, it is perfect as it is so close to many tourist attractions, restaurants, Broadway shows, and multiple Subway/train stations.
The room itself was good - very clean and modern.  The bathroom is a good size with a rain shower.  Robes and slippers are provided, a small fridge, safe, and a local treat each evening.  
Housekeeping schedule seemed a bit weird - one day they missed our room.  But this was not a big deal as there are plenty of towels provided.
We stayed on the 7th floor facing 38th St so no view.  There was some street noise and the a/c can be loud.  Beds are comfy though so our sleep wasn't affected that much.

title: A very nice stay
text: Really impressed. All staff were helpful, warm and friendly. Our room was very comfortable with bathrobes, lovely towels and thoughtful touches like phone chargers, even a couple of books recommended by staff.

title: Great hotel. Chic and clean.
text: Amazing hotel, stylish, clean, friendly staff, the best caramels I’ve ever had. The only thing I didn’t love was the lack of view. My room directly faced a brick office building so I always had the curtains closed. But an otherwise fantastic stay.

title: Great location and service
text: Amazing hotel.  The service is top notch.  Rooms were very nice with great amenities and actually good dice for NYC.  Staff was so friendly and welcoming.  Location is great for Midtown, Broadway and Bryant Park.  Close to subway stations.  We will be back!!

title: Muy buena ubicación, muy amables
text:
Muy bien ubicado, habitaciones pequeñas como son todas en NY. Recomendadas las habitaciones con vistas al Empire State.
Tuvimos problemas el día de la llegada por un tema de tarjeta contact-less pero el
Encargado lo resolvió perfecto.
El bar de arriba con vistas perfectas al Empire.

title: Esperienza eccellente
text:
Tornare la sera in camera e poter rilassarsi con una vista sull’Empire non ha prezzo. 
L’illuminazione dell’Empire cambia ogni giorno e non vedevo l’ora di tornare in camera per ammirarlo.
Ma questo è solo la ciliegina sulla torta. Abbiamo avuto la necessità di chiamare l’ambulanza alle 3 di notte e lo staff è stato di grandissimo aiuto e supporto. Austin il direttore si è occupato di tutta la procedura e mi ha anche dato sacchetto con dell’acqua. 
Bevande sempre a disposizione nella hall, dolcetti omaggio ogni giorno nella stanza, ottimo hamburger e colazione alla carta di qualità.
È il nostro hotel a New York dopo la meravigliosa vista.

title: Stay From March 18 to 19
text: We Stayed At The Archer Hotel From March 18 to 19 2023 This Was Our 3rd Time  And It Was Nice We Came At 10:35am On March 18 And Our Room Was Not Ready Yet So We Walked Around The City Then We Came At 2:20pm and our Room Was Ready We Were In Room 1405 With A Nice view Of The Empire  State Building Staff Was Very Kind Thank You I Will Come Back

title: Archer Hotel NYC
text: What a great little boutique hotel, in a great locale with good spaces to relax in the common areas, nice rooftop bar to enjoy a nightcap. Clean rooms and excellent staff that were friendly and helpful throughout our stay.

title: Superbe !
text:
L'hôtel est parfaitement bien situé pour visiter NYC.
La vue si vous prenez une chambre avec vue sur l'ESB est incroyable et la literie est très confortable.
Le Rooftop est très agréable et le personnel est (mis à part le jeune ayant fait notre check-in à la réception qui n'était pas sympa du tout) très agréable et à l'écoute.
La literie est très très confortable
Je recommande vivement ce bel hôtel pour une escapade New-yorkaise.

title: Top Notch!
text: Loved this hotel. It was in a great location. The staff was helpful and always greeted us with a friendly smile. The rooms were very clean. I liked the decor and views to the Empire Stare Building.  I  will stay at this hotel on my next visit to New York.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: We had a great stay at the Archer hotel in NYC. Easy check in, cute room, comfortable beds, good location, quiet, and the entire staff was very accommodating and friendly. I appreciated the creative use of space in tight quarters such as a place to stash your suitcase under the bed, and the hidden drawer for clothes. We ate at the restaurant for several meals and the food was delicious with vegetarian options. A one point deduction because the room needed some minor repairs (broken latch on bathroom door, small hole in sheer curtains and dirty windows when I paid extra for the view). In addition, I would like to see a bit more attention in regards to sustainability such as no plastic water bottles in the rooms, no plastic water cups in the lobby, recycling bins, treats and coffee in sustainable packaging and the option to opt out of having your towels, sheets laundered everyday (I did appreciate the bulk shampoo, conditioner, body wash vs single use items). I found Manhattan to be very wasteful in general and not as progressive as other cities I've been to. It was actually a bit shocking.

title: Best  time in New York!
text: The  hotel had a nice NY vibe.  The staff was super friendly and helpful. Loved the rooftop lounge. If ever in the city again  will definitely stay again.  The Spyglass was  the perfect end to  our evening.  I will recommend  this hotel to friends  and family.

title: Hotel centrale e pulito a midtown
text: Ottimo hotel a midtown. Pulito e centrale. Vicino a briant park e Times Square. Abbiamo soggiornato in una camera basica. TornSsi indietro prenderei la camera vista Empire, ne vale davvero la pena. Macchina del caffè nespresso in camera. Personale Gentile e servizievole. Terrazza panoramica al 21o piano. Consigliatissimo.

title: Another great stay at a clean hotel with ok beds
text:
We stayed for four nights in a room with a view of the Empire State Building.
The room was clean, but the beds were a little to soft for me, I am 6f7 and wigh 245 lb.
The AC was a little to noicy, but worked ok. I do wish the temp. could have been a little lower, it was not possible to set below 68F.
Jonathan, one of the staff, gave excellent service, he helped a lot when I had to go back for my forgotten iPhone on the way to the airport.

title: Overpriced Hotel
text:
Very small rooms and beds. Don't book a 'double double room' for more than 2 persons. You can't sleep with 2 in such a small bed.
We booked a double double with Empire view but on the 12th floor you don't have any view...
We came with 3, so after arriving we had to book a 2nd room for the raison the beds are really to small to sleep with 2 in it. The room is also to small to stay with more than 2. Very noisy rooms. You hear really everything.
So this make our stay really very expensive. The hotel location of the hotel is very good, and the staff is very friendly and helpfull, but the hotel is very orverpriced and I wouldn't book it again. 
I even don't understand the rating of the hotel. For a rating of 8,7 and the payed price, I thougt having a more positive experience.

title: All around excellent stay
text:
All around excellent 7 night stay. Location was incredible, really close to Times Square and a subway to get anywhere in New York.
Room on the smaller side (as is most of New York) but it included the best bed I’ve ever slept in and the greatest nights sleep. Staff were incredibly friendly and very welcoming.
Daily sweet treats through house keeping was a really nice touch, would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Vistas a Empire
text: Perfecto salvo... Lo de siempre en los hoteles de NY. Las habitaciones son demasiado pequeñas. Eso sí, la cáma es muy cómoda, son muy compeltas y escogimos una habitación con vistas al Empire State Building que merecían la pena. Rooftop muy recomendable.

title: Great stay in Midtown!
text:
We stayed at the Archer hotel for 10 days with our teenage son and two younger children. We booked the King room interconnecting with a Double Double for the kids. This was just perfect for us. The rooms and bathrooms were  super clean and comfortable. Loved the well-thought out details:  storing our suitcases out of the way under the bed. The bedside lights that pulled out to be reading lights, charging cables, Nespresso machine, Malin+Goetz products, and the chocolate treats left in the room everyday.  
The staff were friendly and helpful always. The Spyglass bar had great cocktails and the best view of the Empire State Building. 
The central location made it so easy to walk to so many attractions from Bryant Park, the NY Library, Times Square, Macy’s, St Patricks Cathedral and more. Highly recommend the Archer and thanks again for a great stay!

title: One of the best hotels that we have ever experienced!
text: My daughter, granddaughter, and I recently stayed at theArcher Hotel in New York City. It was my granddaughter‘s first visit to NYC and we took in three Broadway shows in four days. The Archer was an excellent place to stay. It was close to everything, it was clean and we felt very safe. All of the employees that we encountered from the wait staff, concierge, front desk, and security were excellent, and went above and beyond to help us with anything we needed. We will definitely stay there again.

title: My new Hotel
text: Nothing is impossible at The Archer.  Staff goes above and beyond the pale.  Just abfab.  Received the best recommendation for a rooftop club for my German adult godchildren.  Just perfect.  Thank you my peeps.

title: Delightful
text: I came to NY for a business trip with a 330$ budget for a hotel. After careful research I chose the Archer based on reviews and location. This hotel was a delight in every way. While the rooms are small, there is everything you need. And a good size bathroom with classic black and white tile. Comfy bed, all the cords for charging anything you need provided, and even delicious caramels left with complimentary Fiji waters. This was a perfect experience and flawless example of what a boutique stay should be. Thank you.

title: Great Location, Great Room, Great Staff
text:
Everything about this hotel was terrific. Great location just off 5th Avenue. We arrived early and since our room wasn't yet ready, they found us one that was. While the room was small, it was immaculate and attractively decorated, with a very comfortable bed and great shower. Great view from the rooftop bar. 

I saved the best for last. The desk staff was absolutely incredible. Extremely friendly and helpful. Warm greeting from each of them each time they saw us. We would definitle come back.

title: Staying with Family is always the Best Way to Travel
text: The Archer Hotel treats you with care and kindness, making sure your stay is enjoyable, regardless of your reason for being in the City.  They know you by name, take care of requests, listen and even have some much needed fun with you.  All of the aforementioned items are how family makes you feel, and each guest at the Archer is treated as part of their extended Family.  I know they are mine!

title: Good weekend visit. The Archer helped to make it a success
text:
Excellent service, relaxed atmosphere. Room, although tight, had all the amenities

Bar area was cozy and conducive to have friends over for drinks and conversation 

Breakfast was good with a wide selection and good specialty coffees 

Great location and a must to come back

title: Nice trip
text: Nice accommodation including the rooftop with a beautiful view, careful staff and good location! time square is very close, as well as shops in the 5th avenue. Only 25 minutes walk to Central Park if you want to have a run.

title: Amazing and cozy Archer hotel 🏨 in the heart of Manhattan 🗽
text:
We had an excellent stay at Archer New York 🗽 
and definitely recommend this hotel for your next stay 🤙🏽 The service personnel acted on any requests, the mattress and the pillows were soooo comfy and the bathroom  🛀 carried Malin + Goetz premium body care as well as beautiful and high-end quality slippers, towels and bathrobes. Every evening, complimentary sweets 🍫 were served to round up the day. The room cleaning team did an amazing job as well. On top, the breakfast 🍳 is yummy and the drinks, bites and view on the spyglass rooftop bar are outstanding.
We will definitely come back.

title: Great experience with room block for business
text:
We booked a block of 20 rooms for a conference in NYC. Everyone in the group had great things to say about their stay at The Archer. They appreciated the room, the staff, the rooftop bar, and the proximity to so many Manhattan destinations (karoake in Koreatown anyone?).  

On our end, working with The Archer staff to secure the block and finalize the rooming list was a great experience. They were responsive and helpful, and we would work with them again in a heartbeat.

title: Best stay when in the city!!
text: This is my go to hotel when I visit the city. The accommodations are too notch and the staff!! Where do you find these people? All other hotels must be sad that you have all the best staff!! Jonathan is superb. He and Tracie were amazing as usual. Don’t ever let them leave! Jonathan calls me by name like I’m family! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Archer Hotel NYC was fantastic for our 2 days stay
text: This was a fantastic 2 day/2 night stay in NYC. We arrived late in the evening after a harrowing drive through a Nor'easter down from upstate NY and were greeted by a friendly staff member named Austin who had a warm smile and answered all our questions about nearby restaurants and sightseeing. The hotel has a great location in Midtown, near amazing eats ( try Best Bagel--don't be intimated by the line, as well as this yummy French bakery:Aux Merveilleux de Fred) both recommended by Austin.  Clean modern rooms, wonderful bathroom with rain shower head. We had a two double beds and although it was crowded for three people (this is NY after all) we felt very cozy and comfortable. Heavenly beds and we loved the nightly treats and the Nespresso machine that was always fully stocked. There is a garage available for guests at a discounted rate. The only negative was that the fitness facility wasn't onsite. Make sure you go up to the Skybar for a rooftop view of the empire sate buuldign which is literally across the street and beautifully lit up at night. Ask for a higher room (7th or higher!)

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
Stayed with a girlfriend for 5 nights and agree with all 5* reviews.
Location is great
Beds are super comfortable 
Spyglass, a favourite relax place after busy day
Attentive staff
Super clean and stylish

One little niggle for 2 ladies, no draw space, but would book again 😄

title: Would stay here again!
text:
My Partner and I stayed here Mid March 2023.  Hotel was very clean and looked great. Hotel staff at the front desk (especially Tracie) were very friendly, helpful and welcoming. Tracie went out of her way to help us and give advice and direction as this was out first trip to NY. 

The room was small - but that’s expected in NY - but it was clean and modern and had everything we needed. The bed was VERY comfortable!

Location was pretty good and only about 10-15 min walk to Times Square. Lots of local shops/food/coffee places with in walking distance.

title: Very good hotel, conveniently located
text: We stayed here for 4 nights. It is very central but slightly tucked away in a side street. Subway and restaurants are near by. We didn’t use the facilities in the hotel but the rooftop bar looked amazing. Checkin was good and friendly. Room was good, small (to be expected in NY), quiet. All in all a very good hotel.

title: Great Boutique Hotel in good central location
text:
We had a great stay at the Archer Hotel.  The front desk staff were always helpful and friendly. (Derek was really nice to our family group).  The rooms are small but stylish and bathrooms were great. Bed was really comfortable.

The Spyglass rooftop bar was wonderful, great food, great cocktails and of course that amazing view of the Empire State Building.

title: None
text:
Most excellent experience and super friendly and helpful staff. 
Got my room as early as 9am! Never had that with any hotel before.
Very nice rooms and amazing selection of amenities.
The best value vs price ratio in NYC!

title: Go to Hotel for Girlfriend weekend!
text: Came to New York for a girlfriends weekend!  Austin was the best help at the front desk.  He was so kind, attentive, and super thoughtful!  Justin was a wonderful help as well.  He helped us right away with our luggage and helped us hail a taxi in front of the Hotel.  So attentive to detail!  The Hotel itself was super clean!  Comfortable and many amenities.   The rooftop bar was awesome!  Wonderful views of the Empire State Blding.  We had the best time and will for sure make this our go to Hotel for our annual girls getaway!

title: Great room and service
text: This is my third time staying at Archer for my business trip. Nice shower and comfortable bed is everything to me when traveling. Their shower pressure is good (no water leaking! I stayed other 5 stars hotel in Manhattan before, the water leaking part drives me crazy), their bed is pretty comfortable, friendly staff and room service is excellent. The most convenient part is they have their own restaurant in the lobby, when you get so lazy or tired after work, you can just stay in and enjoy your meal downstairs and their food is delicious. They are my first hotel choice in Manhattan for sure (of course if they are not fully booked).

title: A quick get-away
text:
Thank you for a great experience.  Staff were welcoming and friendly.
Centrally located, 10 minute walk to the Theatre district.
Clean and comfortable and a great view.
The birthday cupcake was a nice surprise.
Looking forward to the next visit.

title: Feeling at home in NYC!
text:
I want to say to all of you only.... THANK YOU!
You have been great and everything of our staying at the Archer has been wonderful.
Special thanks to Tracie, Gabby & Dann (not sure to remember well his name), for their support and to make us feel like at home. Grazie! 
At the end, we had the best and highest rooms we could desire, at 21st floor. And the Empire State Building view was AMAZING!!!! Grazie davvero.

title: None
text: The Archer Hotel is in a great location with very few noise. You are consistently greeted by the front desk agents when you return to the hotel. The rooms are larger than most NYC hotels. However, the lighting in the rooms is a bit dim an the pillows are too soft and deflate completely. The comforter is thin as well and I don't think it's sanitary not having a mattress cover. My curtain liner had a hole in it and the shower head is missing one of the beads so the water sprays inconsistently. I don't like that they don't provide in room dining; that you have to go downstairs to get the food yourself. I did appreciate how most of the employees were masked. Everyone was kind though check in was kind of lackluster and the front desk agent I dealt with was a bit cold. Everyone else was great. I'm not sure if I would stay here again because of the things I found off-putting, but I will say, that the hotel has the potential to be great.

title: Book this Hotel!!!
text: The stay and staff were AMAZING!  Do not hesitate to book this hotel!  Clean, very well run and AMAZING! I can't wait to come back again very soon!  Shower was great, staff were helpful and accommodating.

title: Feeling Excited
text: We got a double queen. The blanket was so COMFY & the best part is seeing "The Empire State" right outside our window even at night it was beautiful & worth it. I wish we live so close just so this hotel can b our mini vacation. The only thing is the room is small but we barely stayed in there. There's so much to do in NY especially walking distance was AWESOME.

title: I can't say enough about this hotel, The staff is over the top with customer service, beds are to die for!
text: From the minute we arrived, the bell staff open the doors and greeted us with a smile, and a "how can we help attitude".  We checked in with the greatest staff at the front desk, in particular Josh, Tavares,  Evan and the night auditor, Roselyn.  They help us with Broadway tickets and what was in the area.  All the staff seems very dedicated to the hotel and the brand.  Scott is always a pleasure to see and bends over backward for you, and Johnathon was so very helpful as well.

title: Archer Hotel Feb. 2023
text: Wonderful experience.  Staff was extremely accommodating.  Room was fine.  Bathroom very nice. With discounted rate it was a good value.  Our first time in NYC post Covid.  Would definitely return.  Close to Grand Central Terminal.

title: Comfortable, clean, friendly and a great location!
text:
Wow what a hotel! We had the best time during our visit to New York. The Archer hotel and staff were simply fantastic. The staff were very helpful, friendly and welcoming. Always smiling, saying hi, asking if we needed anything. Just great! The hotel its self was clean, fresh, modern and most importantly comfortable. They have thought of every details in the rooms from a great brand of showering products to a darker towel to take your make up off with so you didn't get the white towels dirty. To top it off the daily little snack they left in your room once it was cleaned was very yummy!
100% would stay here again and have already recommended it to other people. 
Thank you for a fab stay!

title: Un hotel Boutique con encanto
text:
Estuvimos nueve días en el hotel, una maravilla, nuestra habitación con vistas Empire State , un sueño. El personal de recepción muy atentos y amables al igual que las camareras de la cafetería  Natalia y Elisa muy buenas profesionales.La limpieza de la habitación excelente. La ubicacíón es ideal entre la 5 Avenida y la 6.
Sin duda si vuelvo a Nueva York volveré a este hotel.

title: NYC Weekend Getaway
text: The hotel was beautiful. It was clean, comfortable, and centrally located to everything we wanted to do - walkable to many places. We had a pizza at the bar for lunch which was delicious and everyone was so friendly. Would definitely stay here again. Only thing we regret is forgetting to visit the rooftop bar…we’ll save that for next time I guess!

title: Disappointing and NOT RECOMMENDED
text: CUSTOMER SERVICE is one of the worst we ever had. First, upon checking in, we had to remind the host that we were eligible for a $25 credit because we booked the reservation directly through their website (although there was a clear sign right next to him advertising that promotion). Second, we kindly asked for a little later check out (12pm instead of 11). The receptionist, Tracie, was extremely rude and unaccommodating - claiming that they cannot extend because housekeeping has to clean the room.  Then we were told that they can extend by 1 hour for an extra $50. My partner and I travel very often, in the US and around the world. Never have we experienced such rigidity and apathy from the hotel staff. We completely understand and are aware that certain extensions cannot be accommodated, and/or are associated with fees. We asked for ONE more hour – which has always been accommodated in any other hotel we stayed it. unfortunately, this hotel is NOT RECOMMENDED.

title: Lovely and conveniently located hotel
text: Welcoming hotel near Herald Square. Lovely clean rooms with comfortable beds  robes, nice bathroom and amenities.  Water and treats in room at check in.  Very welcoming and friendly staff. Lobby bar was nice for a nightcap. Overall great atmosphere.

title: None
text: We had a quick overnight at your hotel to see a concert. We enjoyed talking with Madison at the bar and the delicious breakfast in the morning.  We left a phone battery in our room and housekeeping found it and mailed to our home.

title: Dear Friend Reunion for Cultural and Culinary Weekend in NYC!
text:
The concierge team is warm, welcoming and helpful! Every one of them and every day. I've never seen that in all of my travels around the world. Excellent service. 
Archer location is ideal - just a few blocks from everything and still tucked away enough to offer quiet, restful nights. Room was ideal - queen sized bed and bathroom with ample space. I'll be returning!

title: New York 2023
text: Great stay! Location is perfect! Easy walk to Times Square! Hotel staff is super friendly and helpful! Rooms are clean! Don’t miss the view of the Empire State Building from the Spyglass Rooftop Bar! Can’t wait to go back!

title: Fabulous hotel for a NYC weekend getaway
text: Super clean throughout.  Super friendly staff.  Incredible breakfast (see pics).  Great location, too.  Walkable to Bryant Park, GC Stn, NYC Library, The High Line, Chelsea Market, Times Square & Central Park.

title: Great hotel with perfect location and service
text: The hotel was great, service, food and the rooftop bar. Perfect location. We paid for a “classic king” my husband and I have a standard king at home. We have king pillows at home that stretch side to side. The room we got had standard pillows that stretched side to side….. most definitely was NOT a king. Much smaller than our bed at home that we sleep in every single night. It is not a California or European king it’s standard . However they swore I was wrong. Not that it’s a big deal in all Honesty because everything else about the stay was perfect. However, a standard pillow side by side would be shorter than the width of a king bed…. Those are facts. This bed was 100000000% NOT a king and I think there is a mistake in how they have this particular room labeled. Made me feel like I was going crazy at the front desk because I’d bet my life on it and I’d be correct.

title: Great stay at the Archer Hotel in NYC
text: Super location, in midtown Manhattan. Very modern rooms with complimentary coffee. Friendly and attentive staff, very service oriented and always meeting you with a smile. Great atmosphere. Complimentary fitness at the local sports club.

title: Extended Weekend in NYC
text: Our visit to New York City was amazing. It made all the better by our stay at this hotel. The location was superb and gave us easy access to everything we needed to explore the island. The rooms were all we could have asked for and more. Clean, spacious, and an excellent view of the Empire State building. I’m already planning my next stay for  another extended weekend…this time a girls trip.

title: The Archer Hotel and a great view
text: I booked a stay at the Archer Hotel for a last-minute trip to the City. I went off the rating I found online to make my decision and found myself to be pleasantly surprised. We had a room on the 16th floor with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. The room was small but perfect with a shower big enough to enjoy moving around in.  The Archer is close enough to walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, shops, and the train station. Thank you Archer Hotel for a great stay.

title: Our favorite hotel stay
text: We loved our stay here and hope to return again. The style, the view and the staff were fantastic! Laying in bed looking out at the Empire State Building was pretty special and I just can’t say enough good about the staff. They always greeted us with a smile and did anything they could to be helpful without even being asked.

title: A Fashion District Midtown Gem!
text: The Archer will surprise you!  10 out of 10 experience! Outstanding  location fabulous view in the fashion district. Concierge recommendations were excellent. The rooftop bar is an excellent venue for parties with a view !

title: Great hotel.
text: Great location in midtown with very easy access to everything around the area. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Cleanliness of the room was perfect kept very tidy everyday. Perfect spot for a weekend away. Would definitely recommend.

title: It is the people who make the difference between a good and a great hotel experience!
text: Was our room nice? Yes. The room is compact, but had everything we needed. It was clean, attractive, the bed was comfy, it had a safe, a Nespresso maker, robes, slippers, they even provide a wine opener. Was the hotel accommodating? Yes. It has a small footprint, but it maximizes the space it has, It feels like a cozy piece of home in a big city. The breakfasts and lunches we had in the hotel bar/restaurant were very good. And we loved the Spyglass rooftop bar. We went up every evening and enjoyed the beautiful views of the NY skyline. But all of these things aren’t what made this the best hotel experience we have ever had. It was the people who did that!  All of the staff went beyond being professional, which they are. But everyone we had contact with was helpful, kind and seemed to genuinely enjoy talking with us. We felt welcomed! Isn’t that what you appreciate when you are away from home?

title: NY Mini weekend vacation
text: Great service and comfortable and cozy room. Additionally Great midtown location to get to Broadway shows and stores without feeling you are in a tourist area. The staff were friendly and efficient, extremely and helpful with any questions we had.

title: Wedding Anniversary Treat
text: From walking in the door to check in to checking out 4 days later, my wife and I have had the best wedding anniversary and birthday vacation ever, booking The Archer Hotel is definitely the best choice, The friendliest staff and spotlessly clean hotel, Not to mention the Spyglass Roof Bar,what a view. We will now be saving up for our return visit as soon as possible. The Archer Hotel is the best location to stay, with Times square just a short walk and public transport very accessible in any direction. Until next time Thank you so much for making our stay fabulous. Chris & Melanie

title: 21st to 24th Jan 2023
text: The Room was good and  so was the food. A great location to all the main sites. Staff were very professional. The roof bar was a great extra, creating a good atmosphere. Only negative was our room was small but great views of the Empire State Building.

title: Lovely weekend stay
text:
Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. The room was quite small and compact  but had everything we needed and was very clean and good quality furnishings. 

Nice rooftop bar for cocktails. 

Would definitely come again.

title: Horror Hotel - never ever
text: Super bad service, this hotel treated guest like enemies. We was there with a large group, the service was Horror. We was there for the last years and was always happy, but the management decided to change. Horror Hotel

title: Functional and modern rooms in an excellent location
text: I reserved two rooms for my daughters and me. They got a room with classic Empire State Building view and I got the opposite room  with a view of regular midtown street. The hotel and the rooms felt modern, it may have undergone some kind of renovation or refreshment during the Covid-19 period. Although the rooms are small, they are very functional, for example you can store your luggage under the beds. We stayed 8 nights at the hotel and did not encounter any problems. The rooms were cleaned to our satisfaction every day and the staff was friendly and happy to help. The location is excellent, within walking distance to attractions to the north, east and south.

title: Excellent hotel
text: I searched so many hotels before booking and am so glad I chose here. Staff were great, location amazing (we were able to walk to all the main sights), great food, super comfy beds with well laid out rooms. Travelling alone with my children, I also felt very safe staying here. Would recommend anyone to book.

title: Archer Hotel
text:
I was so pleased with Archer Hotel! The rooms are small, but very clean with luxury bedding and nice modern baths. I’m a big fan of their industrial black and white decor. AKB serves a nice breakfast and Spyglass Rooftop bar has great service with a breathtaking view of the Empire State Building! 
The best feature, Archer has an awesome Guest Service crew!! Tracee, Scott, Joseph and Austin went the extra mile to help us have an amazing NY experience!

title: Great place to stay in the heart of NYC
text:
We just got back from a multi night stay at Archer NYC and I would stay again anytime. Easy distance from both Grand Central and Penn Station, as well as great access to the subway. Walking distance to really great food and shopping as well as Times Square if that's your thing. Rooftop bar has an awesome view of the Empire State Building as well. 

But more important was the staff. Every single member of the staff we talked to or interacted with were great. We were greeted every day by every member of the staff we saw, the cleaning team were hard working and efficient, the bar staff took excellent care of us as well. 

The rooms are small but laid out well, with storage space to help offset the size and they were surprisingly quiet. There were great little touches like books in the rooms, local treats each day, slippers to help with comfort in the rooms, etc. 

I highly enjoyed my stay and if we stay in this area of NYC in the future or other cities where Archer has hotels I'll gladly stay again.

title: Amazing hotel and staff
text: The hotel is in a fantastic location, near everything but not in a noisy part. Views of the Empire State building from our room. The staff were amazing, honestly can't rate them highly enough. Very clean, very comfortable bed, lovely bathroom. Would definitely stay there again if in New York again.

title: Mega! Top Lage-Top Service-Top Isoliert
text: Top Hotel! Wir waren im 17 Stock und es war super ruhig sehr gut isoliert (Wann hört von Rossmann das Fenster geschlossen ist nichts). Die Zimmer sind gut geschnitten es gibt Schrank, Föhn, Espressomaschine (Der Kaffee wird täglich aufgefüllt). Service und alles ist top und alles funktioniert einwandfrei. Super Zentrale Lage mit Blick auf das Empire State Building! Mega. Alles ist Fußläufig erreichbar. Service ist ebenfalls mega zuvorkommend. Wir können das Hotel nur jedem weiterempfehlen der Nach New York kommt und vor allem wer zum ersten Mal plant nach New York zu kommen!

title: Enjoyed My Stay!
text: My stay at the Archer was great! The staff were courteous, and the rooms were kept clean and tidy. The room and hallways always smelled fresh. The hotel was just off of the busy 7th Ave. but still within walking distance of other sites, like Bryant Park, ice skating and dining. The only downside is that the room didn't have a microwave; but that seems to be the norm in most hotels these days. I will definitely stay at the Archer during my next visit to the city.

title: AMAZING HOTEL
text:
everything was excellent : the rooms, the location of the hotel, the roof top bar and the cleaness .
The staff was amazing and always here to help.
Thank you because you make our journey unforgettable!

title: Joyful experience at Archer
text: We had three fantastic days in New York and the best starting point from the Hotel Archer. The hotel has fantastic friendly staff in all areas. Justin at the front desk solves any possible problems if no one else had gone before to solve them! The room and bars had excellent food and drink served with good and cheerful service. We will return......

title: AWESOME Experience
text:
We booked a room at the hotel the week prior to Christmas primarily because of the location.  Not only was the location great for getting to / from everything, but we can't compliment EVERY staff members enough for always showing us (and all the guests) exceptional, warm and friendly customer service.   
Due to the winter storm that swept the country and airline debacle our 1-week stay quickly turned into 2-weeks.   The hotel was beyond accommodating and once again made us feel so welcomed.   Many thanks to Archer Hotel NYC!!!!

title: Food manager is a joke
text:
Very friendly staff on the desk. Not everyone is friendly though. Getting laughed at by the food manager is a shame and a disgrace to customers. Needed to call almost every day to desk cause housekeeping forgot to replace the coffee cups, drinking glasses and Nespresso cups ( creme and sugar included).
About getting laughed at by food manager: we asked a glass of red wine by our diner that was tasting very bad and sour > we mentioned it to waitress en waiter > they changed it but was the same again > mentioned it again > no more reaction but giggling and amusing themselves at the bar > I went to desk to complain we didn't get reaction > food manager was called to come and see us > he doubted our knowledge about wine ( we live near France and are wine adepts) and made it his crusade to make fun of us > this person and the waiters at that moment are a shame for the rest of employees who are doing their best.
This happend on our last night stay, so our stay ended in bitterness.

title: New Years Visit
text: Everything was great. My only recommendation would be to perform a deep clean on all of the rooms. The areas like counter tops, desk tops, and bedding were fine. It was just the perimeter areas, nooks, and crannies, and less high traffic areas that contained quite a bit of dust, dirt, and debri. These areas don't need a specific cleaning every check out, but they should be maintained semi annually or annually. If this this get's taken care of, room rating would jump to 4/5.

title: Fabulous birthday at the Archer
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  I have stayed here before and also at other Archer locations.   Yes, as others have mentioned, the rooms are small (think riverboat cruise).   However, the bedding is luxurious, the electronics state of the art, and the service always with a smile.  Scott the manager  helped me with my reservation.  He was so charming as was his whole staff.  We did enjoy the Spyglass rooftop bar after a broadway show.  What a beautiful  view of the Empire State Building festively lit at night.  As a special birthday  treat they delivered wine and a giant cupcake to our room.  The hotel is located  near the train station , Broadway, and a short walk to midtown.  Coffee is served each morning downstairs (a Nespresso machine is in the room if you prefer).  It's a short walk to Liberty bagel or Angelina bakery for a quick breakfast.  We will definitely return.

title: Hôtel super TOP !!!
text:
C'est une SUPER expérience; hôtel très bien placé, récent et propre.
L'hôtel est très bien placé entre Times Square et l'Empire State Building.
Le personnel est très accueillant (particulièrement Brittney et son manager Scott à la réception) : un grand merci à eux.
Le service de ménage est fait tous les jours et bien fait; nous avons même eu des attentions chaque jour (chocolats, bonbons, etc..).
Nous avions une chambre au 21ème étage avec une vue Incroyable sur l'Empire State Building (même si nous avons naturellement payé plus cher pour la vue..); il y a un super Rooftop avec un bar au 22ème étage mais pas bruyant. Les photos du site internet de l'hôtel sont vraies.
Nous avons même pu laisser notre valiser la journée de notre départ avant d'aller à l'aéroport.
C'est VRAIMENT un bon rapport qualité prix pour NYC; j'y retournerai avec grand plaisir et bravo à l'équipe !

title: Wonderful stay at the Archer
text:
From the initial correspondence with Jackie from Archer in terms of booking our reservation, we've had nothing but exemplary customer service throughout.
Even before we arrived they were keen to offer suggestions for places to go whether that to be to eat,drink or just sightsee, if we asked.
The staff have all been brilliant, friendly and welcoming whether that was the concierge, bar staff, housekeepers or any other staff who we interacted with.
The hotel is in a great location, has lovely decor and the food was lovely. The spyglass rooftop bar is a nice bonus if you don't want to venture out of an evening and the view of the Empire State building is superb

I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a short or long stay. You won't be disappointed with the service or price.
I will certainly be returning and recommending it to people.

Thanks for the great stay and I wish everyone at the Archer a wonderful 2023

Matt

title: Great location but barely a 4 star hotel.
text: Overall, a good NYC hotel with great location close to Broadway, Empire State Building, Times Square and department stores. Rooms are quite small but not uncommon in NYC. Breakfast was exceeding expectations. Not delivering on the small details like replacing glasses, soap and napkins in the room.

title: Great staff service + clean room
text: The staff were really friendly, the room was clean and well appointed, and the location was great! The front desk staff made a point to welcome us back each time we returned to the hotel, which really stood out. The hotel felt up-to-date and the room was comfortable for NYC standards. We would stay again!

title: Bien mais…
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel pour les fêtes de fin d’année. Il est situé dans le quartier de Bryant Park, à 2 pas de l’arrêt de métro du même nom et de l’empire state building.
L’hôtel est pas mal, les personnes de la réceptionniste serviables (surtout le bagagiste).
La chambre est calme et propre avec une belle vue sur l’ESB (dommage que les fenêtres étaient très sales).
Les lits sont également très petits c’est dommage. 
Nous avions également demandé une tête de lit particulière lors de notre réservation, on nous a répondu qu’il n’y avait pas de problème, or, cette demande n’a pas été respectée. C’est dommage.

title: Wonderful Christmas Trip
text: Great stay. Our first time to NYC. Everyone was very helpful, friendly, courteous and kind. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay memorable and pleasurable. Highly recommend. Will definitely be back.

title: Great midtown short stay - would happily return
text:
The Archer is an example of why I wish TA gave 1/2 stars. Its not a 5 star experience (those are impeccable and one of a kind) but its better than "just a 4 star" which implies that it was inherently fine. Its very, very good and I'd be happy to return.

The noteworthy pluses:

-Yes the rooms are tiny, but they're thoughtfully laid out. At least mine was. There's storage, proper room darkening curtains, speedy wifi, strong water pressure and toiletries from Malin + Goetz in the restroom. Classiest small touch was the triangular shelf in the shower, about 6" off the floor, ideal for resting your leg if you're shaving or for keeping whatever you're bringing in there off the floor. WHY is this not everywhere?

-Very warm and accommodating front desk and service staff. Always pleasant and helpful and when we hit up the rooftop bar with a sizeable group without a reso, they made space for us without a peep.

-Location if you're basing in midtown can't be beat. Situated between MSG/Penn Station and Grand Central with easy access to Bryant Park/Rockefeller and all the train lines.

Smaller things that maybe aren't for everyone:

-Towels weren't threadbare but also weren't fluffy. That stood out only because everything else was very cushy. Thoughtful black "remove your makeup with me " towel was on the sink day 1 and I happily used it. After housekeeping came the following morning, it was gone. Not a big deal but hate to use white towel for mascara.

-No USB outlets (at least in my room) and only plugs near the bed were on top of the headboard in a very odd spot - if you want to rest the phone or charging electronics on the nightstand, a traditional USB cord is stretched to the max. Not a big deal, but if you're into small touches, searching for that ideal outlet (and coming up short) stands out.

-The room doors slam. I forgot, and closed mine loudly a few times. I heard my neighbor's doors slamming shut. There's got to be a way around that? It woke me both mornings of my stay. Floor noise, however, was minimal. Grateful for that.

But those are little things. Pros greatly outweigh the cons (thus the want for 4.5 stars) and I'd happily return and recommend to those in search of a clean, convenient and overall very pleasant midtown stay.

title: Great location
text: Great location, conveniently located near Empire State bldg, staff is wonderful, great views from rooftop bar. Only negative is that rooms are super tiny, even for NY. Great amenities with restaurant on site

title: Home Away from Home for the Holidays.
text: From the welcoming, personable staff, to the comfortable, well-appointed rooms, we couldn't have selected a better hotel for my daughter's first Christmas trip to NYC. After full days exploring the city, it was nice to return to the hotel's personalized level of service. Every time we came in, the front desk greeted us by name and asked about our day. The restaurant waitstaff was equally friendly and accomodating. The cozy rooms made it tough to get up in the morning, but the Nespresso machines and delicious lobby coffee helped get us on our way. Looking forward to returning in the spring when we can make good use of the rooftop bar. The clear view of the Empire State Building is awesome!

title: Great Attention to Detail, Care, and an Amazing Staff
text:
My experience at the Archer Hotel earlier this year was a magnificent one. The room proved to be a wonderful retreat at the end of the day when I returned, and the two restaurants/bars were great options for personal and professional meetings. 

What stood out the most was the terrific staff. These humans went far above the call of duty and ensured that my stay, and that of those who visited me were exceptional. A big thanks goes out to Scott, Jonathan, and Gabby. I can not wait until I visit NYC again, and I will certainly do so with Archer.

title: Amazing birthday getaway!
text:
We loved the room, the Empire view, the location of the hotel and management’s attention to every detail in making my girlfriend’s bday perfect!!

The food credit was very nice as well; however, there were no drinks available for purchase and that was a bit annoying to have to leave the hotel to go out to purchase.

Thank you for making our stay so memorable! We will be back!!

title: Best view of Empire State Building, outstanding service, located right in the middle of everything!
text:
Fantastic service from the time we arrived through to check out. A big thank to the front desk staff, especially Josh and whoever helped my son bringing drink bottles up one night.

The view of Empire State Building was impressive, we enjoyed the light show every night. The room was clean and the housekeeping team did an excellent job throughout our stay.

The hotel is close to everything you can ask for from midtown. We will definitely stay again when we are back to NYC. Thank you Archer :)

title: A gem of a find
text: What a fantastic hotel .. booked this little gem of a hotel on our first visit to NYC on a recommendation from a family member. I can’t recommend this hotel enough so helpful when we arrived a day later than expected due to a cancelled flight , sorted everything for us fantastic staff throughout the hotel . Thank you so much for making our stay so special

title: New York charming.
text: My son and I love staying at Archer New York thanks to the wonderful people who work there. They make each experience warm and special, going above and beyond to care for their guests. During our few-day stay, we felt like the staff cared to remember who we were and interact with us on a daily basis. The hotel also went above and beyond to welcome us back knowing it wasn't our first time at Archer. Not to mention, the rooms are nice and designed very efficiently—and our Empire State Building view was incomparable. Can't wait to go back!

title: Christmas vacation in NYC
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful, rooms were outstanding, very clean and comfortable. View of the Empire State building was amazing from the room. Rooms are small but efficient. Bathroom was nice with showers with great water pressure. Overall a really nice stay from start to finish

title: Perfect location!
text: Hotel is in a great location! Staff communicates with you and helps however you need them to! Very friendly. Hotel is clean. Rooms are a good size for 2 per room! The rooftop bar is amazing! Bartenders are amazing. I would definitely stay with them again! ❤️

title: Great location and staff but the rooms are so tiny
text:
The hotel is in a great location with Central Park, Times Square and lots of good restaurants all within walking distance. The staff are great, really helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Our Empire State view room on the 17th floor had a fab view and was worth paying more for. The downside was the size of the room which even by New York’s standards was tiny. There wasn’t enough space to open a suitcase and the limited storage meant storing a lot of things on the floor. The hotel offered to remove some furniture but that was limited enough as it was so didn’t want to make the room any worse in that respect. The shower room was however a good size but it had the brightest light so if you needed to use the toilet in the night you had to do so in the dark or risk waking your partner up. The door opened straight out onto the bed. 

We visited the bar on the top floor once but all the seats with a view were reserved with no one sat at them. We asked a few people how we reserved a table but no one seemed to know so that was quite odd. Only went the once because of that.

Overall this is a great hotel but the room sizes are ridiculous and for the price there are better hotels out there sadly.

title: None
text:
Well I wouldn’t rate it 4 stars. We arrived at 4.30 p.m and the room still wasn’t ready. The first room they gave us was not what we expected, they finally helped us out with a comparable room at the highest floor.
We couldn’t - as Hotel guests - make it to the roof top bar because there were private events or it was too crowded or not open yet. The bar at the lobby - well the staff seemed a little unorganized and not really familiarized how to do the drinks. 

Room service was made by nice people…but how comes that I’ll find foreign boxer briefs behind a drawer in the wardrobe? Overall the room service was under the average, there were several things like glasses, coffees missing several times.

As usual in NYC the rooms are tiny, but really overpriced for what I have expected from a four-star-house.

title: Wonderful Hotel, Super Friendly and Helpful Staff
text:
Archer Hotel New York did not disappoint! My significant other and I travel to NYC several times a year to spend the weekend in the greatest city in the world. We pack our weekend with seeing shows, exhibits, etc. Here's what we loved about the Archer: the staff was super friendly and helpful. Tracie at the front desk answered all of our questions and was wonderful. There was always someone at the front desk to say hello, good morning, good night, and address our needs. And the lobby bar staff was awesome, too. I ordered food for our room on multiple occasions and I never had to wait to order. Nor did I have to wait long for the food. And that bar was busy! I can't say enough about the great, friendly staff. They are top notch.

We reserved a room with a king bed / Empire State Building view. The room did not disappoint either. I loved having an espresso machine in the room. It was so nice not to have to run down to the lobby for my caffeine fix. That said, I really appreciated the free coffee and water available in the lobby. It really is about the little things - and Archer gets this. 

Our room was clean and nice - and ready even though we arrived two hours before check in. It was cold and rainy when we arrived so we were grateful to get into our room. The bed was very comfortable and you can't beat that view. The bathroom was spacious for a Midtown hotel - a nice surprise. The storage underneath the bed was great because like almost all Manhattan hotel rooms it's on the small side - but it didn't feel too small thanks to the layout, storage, etc. 

Finally, if you want to be near everything in Midtown, Archer is a great choice. A ten minute walk from Penn Station, it's also two blocks from Bryant Park - which is great for holiday shopping at the outdoor market. It's also close to Broadway shows and Times Square. 

I have nothing negative to say about Archer New York. You can't go wrong staying here!

title: Decent - Few Quirks
text: The way Expedia translates the parking is that the hotel does indeed have parking but it was coupled with the parking garage ((near)) the hotel. It was okay- the garage was not too far and they only give us attitude like one time due to needing the vehicle and it being "parked in the back." As far as the actual hotel - It is understandable that it is tight and slim due to conserving space within the city. The hotel was tight, the room was a little tight - should have gotten adjacent rooms for more space but did not realize it would be needed. Room wise - the beds are super firm so not too beneficial for your back especially with the ultra flat pillows. Upon check-in we must have misunderstood as it was insinuated that the waters were complimentary but I did receive a bill for them after check-out. This should be explained a smidge better just for understanding. We did have to request more pillows, towels and blankets- due to a language barrier with some of the hotel staff we kept receiving slippers and robes instead of pillows and blankets. A little frustrating, but we did get it worked out. One of the beds did have a LARGE yellow stain that looked like a previous pee stain, and it did not look like it had been cleaned well as the color was still pretty deep in hue. The one wall was a large window and the cold burst of air coming from it was rather chilly, the window did also have a drastic amount of condensation coming from it - to the point of making the flooring wet next to it. Location wise, it was not badly located to surrounding areas.I don't believe we would be using this one again - but all in all it did the job and housed us for two nights stay.

title: Mostly great experience.
text: Check in is 3:00pm, but we couldn’t check in until almost 5:00pm due to a leak in our room.  The staff was extremely nice and accommodating while we waited.  Our room was clean had a great view of the Empire State Building.  The location in Midtown is excellent, as it is centrally located and allows you to walk to most tourist attractions in the area.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect from start to finish!
text: We planned a quick trip to NYC to enjoy all that Christmas magic the city is known for. The Archer hotel was truly the perfect place for us. We always take an early flight to the city and how shocked we were to be able to get into our room before 11am!! From start to finish this trip was one of our best stays in NYC and I think I’ve found my new place to stay. Special thanks to Scott at check in and Jonathan at departure. Can’t wait to see them again in the spring!

title: Nice to come home to
text: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Archer on our mother daughter weekend.  It was the perfect location to walk to all of the sights.  Our room was small but laid out well.  The entire hotel had a European vibe which we appreciated.  It felt very homey.  The view of the Empire State Building from our room on the 19th floor was incredible.  The beds were comfy and the room was very quiet and clean.  The rooftop bar was loud- not sure why the music was turned up so high- no dancing- 🤔 but had good drinks and a great view! The restaurant downstairs has excellent food and we ate breakfast and lunch there to avoid walking to crowded places nearby.   The front desk staff was super helpful giving recommendations and answering questions. We will definitely stay here again!!

title: Ten days in New York
text: In addition to being located in an excellent central position, your hotel is very comfortable throughout. We really appreciated the spaciousness of the bed and the comfort of the mattress. The accessories made available , even the umbrella ! An excellent, very comfortable hair dryer and not the usual wall-mounted hair dryer that gives off warm air! we greatly appreciated the refrigerator, spacious and really cold unlike the usual tiny mini-bars full of useless snacks! In conclusion we found ourselves very well thanks also to the kind and professional staff even if we would have appreciated more if at least one of your collaborators spoke a little Italian. . .thanks again for everything.

title: Quick Weekend Getaway
text: The Archer Hotel was a great hotel for our weekend getaway. The location was good, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The restaurant food was great. We ate breakfast there every day during our stay, as well we had lunch there once. The food was very fresh and the menu was varied enough that we didn’t need to eat the same thing each day.   The rooms were clean and comfortable.  We can’t wait to return on our next trip.

title: Anniversary Getaway
text: We had such a great time on our anniversary at the Archer that I needed to write this. The drinks at the rooftop were amazing and room was nice and cozy. The area was convenient to our events we had planned. Thank you for making it special.

I’ve never stayed at such a well thought out hotel. Everything from the plugs, coat hooks and mirrors. The best hotel I’ve stayed out. The beds were so comfortable and extremely clean! The Nespresso machine was the cherry on top!

title: Amazing location, friendly helpful staff, immaculate hotel with amazing views. And oh my word, the mattresses!
text:
From moment we arrived the friendly hotel reception staff were excellent- on check in they wished my friend a happy 50th (belated as was during Covid lockdown - had mentioned in booking) and then we found the hotel had put a couple of birthday balloons and complimentary wine in the room with wonderful view of Empire State Building.  The roof top bar also has an incredible view of the Empire State Building, which lit up at night is spectacular. The bar has very stylish decor and again friendly staff.

The breakfast food we had was delicious. The food arriving at tables near us in the Sky Bar looked amazing (we had already eaten) You can also order food to hotel from delivery services. There are some excellent choices of food places just across the street and we particularly enjoyed the cocktails at Havana bar across the street.

The decor and quality of fixtures and fittings in the hotel is up to date and in excellent condition, including our room.  But special mention has to go to the beds.  I cannot do justice to how comfortable the mattresses were.  It actually was one of the highlights of our trip!  My friend even had reception staff give her the name of the brand and type!  I still think of that mattress fondly!

title: It’s not like the Archer Hotel in Napa
text: Cute boutique spot in the City but it’s not quite as nice as the newly built Archer Hotel in Napa Valley. This New York spot must have been another hotel and then Archer management came in and rebranded it. The rooms are small but clean and decent. The plug outlets were a little raggedy. The bathroom had a shower and toilet. Nothing spectacular. Rooftop bar and restaurant on site. The location was amazing. Midtown off 38th so close to everything! Times Square close by and Bryant Park less than 10 min walk. No guys onsite but can walk to Clubsports gym which is 8 min away.  Staff was excellent and personable.

title: Location and Comfort in the Heart of the City!
text: My husband and I stayed at The Archer with our 7 month old and couldn’t have had a better experience. The staff was friendly and extremely accommodating. They ensured we had the largest size room to fit a pack and play in, went out of their way during our stay to check on us, and help our baby have the most fun. The food at the hotel restaurant was delicious and the location couldn’t be better. Walkable to major attractions, shops, and great restaurants. We would definitely stay here again.

title: 7 giorni a NY
text: 7 giorni a dicembre.. Eccellente posizione, ottimo rooftop bar (anche x una cena frugale). Hotel premuroso e pulito, cordiale il personale. Tornerò a New York e tornerò sicuramente in questo hotel perché è davvero comoda anche la camera.

title: A Boutique Gem in NYC
text: What a beautiful surprise! My corporate travel team booked this hotel for me during an unusually busy time with many hotels being sold out. I was pleasantly surprised by the lovely look and ambiance of The Archer. The staff was incredibly friendly and professional. Check-in was a breeze and when I got to my room (also very nice!) I was so impressed to see a full bottle of (good) wine waiting for me, compliments of the hotel. The roof top bar was also was very nice with amazing views of the Empire State Building. I hope to come stay again at The Archer Hotel!

title: Amazing Archer Hotel
text:
I have just stayed at the Archer Hotel for 5 nights, along with my Mum. 

From beginning to end our stay was simply brilliant.

The hotel is located on West 38th Street. It’s a great location - just 4 blocks from Times Square subway and 2 blocks from Bryant Park. Should you need it, there is a pharmacy a 2 minute walk away and lots of great restaurants and coffee shops are also nearby. The street is nice and quiet too.

The rooms are small (no smaller than rooms I’ve stayed in in London mind you) but, they are very comfortable and have more than enough storage room. 

Rooms are kept spotlessly clean and are serviced daily. The bed was the most comfortable I’ve ever slept on in a hotel - easily as comfy as my own bed.

The bathroom is a lovely size with a large waterfall shower and very contemporary fittings; also kept spotlessly clean.

There are lovely personal touches; a little sweet treat   is left for you each day, for example, locally made blondies. You are provided with slippers (really thoughtful) and a bathrobe.

The hotel facilities are great. AKB Bar provides a high standard of food and the Spyglass Bar provides not only delicious cocktails, but also  amazing views of The Empire State Building.

Finally, and most importantly, a huge amount of praise is due to each and every member of staff my Mum and I encountered at The Archer Hotel. It would be wrong to single anyone out because all were kind, courteous and unfailingly helpful.

I would most definitely stay here again and would reccommend to anyone visiting. 

Thanks for helping to make our trip so special.

title: Superb stay at The Archer!!
text: What a wonderful hotel, centrally located, well maintained, beautiful views from the room of the Empire State Building, great amenities, food and bar, and most of all superb service. We absolutely loved our stay and will definitely visit again.

title: Great Hotel - Five Stars!
text:
This is my go to hotel when I need to stay in the city.  Great location to Times Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central Station.  This hotel is not only very very clean, it is very safe!  You can not go up to the rooms without a room key and they have an employee checking.  

This is a small boutique like hotel with a great outdoor space.  I will be back!

title: Stay here!
text: Great location, great service and friendly staff. Empire view room is awesome. Small but upscale room. Good amenities. Loved the nespresso machine in the room. Even housekeeping gets 5 stars. Will definitely stay again when we visit the city.

title: Very nice
text: A great hotel with friendly staff and good food. The rooms are small but pretty and clean. Nice bar with a view and good drinks. Good location for all New York’s entertainment. I would stay there again.

title: Wonderful Hospitality
text: We received excellent customer service from before we even arrived at the hotel. They answered all our questions and accommodated a late night arrival. The manager was very attentive and kind. He even treated us to cocktails. The rooms are small but had everything we needed. My favorite touch were two storybooks they left in the room that highlight Christmas in NY!

title: Incredible Staff and Great Experience
text:
I recently stayed at the Archer in NY.  I want to say thank you to the incredible staff there! From the front desk to the housekeeping to the manager to the restaurant, this team is second to none!  It is clear that there is a culture of excellence and of taking care of their guests!

After having a great experience during my 2 day business stay there, I actually left an article of clothing behind in the closet.  The team emailed me the next day and offered to help me retrieve it back.  After I was having difficulty with fedex, they even took the lead to arrange the shipping.  Kudos to Fabiola, Lydia and Julia for all of your help!!!! 

Happy Holidays to you and your family!

title: Beautiful Hotel, ideal location, wonderful staff!
text:
The hotel is very sheik. Love the overall design and decor. The rooms are small/boutique style but totally fine and have great amenities. The staff was AMAZING!! Every single person was soo friendly, kind, helpful, accommodating and thoughtful! My son’s name is Archer and the staff would of course remember his name when we passed through which made it extra special. The
Small touches in the room such as water and daily treats were such a nice surprise!  The location is ideal!! I would definitely stay at this or any Archer Hotel again!

title: Affordable, classy, clean, friendly, and convenient
text:
Reasonably priced and conveniently located in the Garment District, The Archer is a mile walk or less (or a short cab ride) from many tourist attractions -- Rockefeller Center/Saks Fifth Avenue, Radio City Music Hall, NY Public Library,  Empire State Building, Times Sq., Park Avenue, etc.  

The hotel staff is attentive, helpful and friendly.  The atmosphere is welcoming and you'll enjoy the food and drinks at both the first floor and rooftop bar and restaurant.  The service was excellent.  

Secured parking is less than a block away (less than a 5 min. walk) and only $75 per day with hotel voucher.  

Although the room was  a little tight, it had all the standard amenities, including a refrigerator.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  I don't generally write reviews, but felt compelled to share this one about our experience at the Archer.

title: The Archer Hotel is the New York experience you need!
text:
First time in New York and the very first time at the Archer hotel. The staff was extremely welcoming and warm. The hotel was phenomenal. They went above and beyond and I would recommend them to everyone. From justin that helped us with the bags, he was very kind and accommodating and whenever he would see us he would offer his assistance right away. Tracie in the front was so friendly and informative. As well as Gabby those three come
Highly recommended. She helped with tourist attractions and also took the time to help, nothing was rushed. They really made the experience complete.

title: Great location and comfortable rooms
text: We stayed at the Archer for a long weekend theater getaway.  The location is ideal - walking distance to theater district, great restaurants in walking distance, Bryant Park around the corner, yet the hotel is quiet and restful.  Comfortable beds and luxurious pillows.  Helpful front desk and service.

title: Perfect location and great staff!
text: Archer is one of the few hotels that have ever had a room ready for us as early as 10am. I was truly impressed and made our trip that much nicer. The beds were too soft for my preference, but I'd be willing to stay at Archer again simply because of the readiness of the room plus the cleanliness and friendliness of staff. The location was perfect.

title: Excellent service in a prime location.
text: Archer exceeded our expectations even before we checked and through our entire stay. I was easily able to connect and ask questions via text to make our experience tailored to our needs.  Our check-in was quick and pleasant, all staff pleasant,  and I can’t thank Austin at the front desk enough for helping me find the closest place to get some heartburn relief at 1 AM when I couldn’t sleep. The room was not only very clean but the view terrific and all the little amenities in the room made it special like the Nespresso coffee, robes, water, slippers, soap, etc. we will definitely be back.  Being so close to Bryant Park, the subway and Time Square, especially during the holiday, made for a perfect location.  The Champion Parking was also very quick, easy, not too far from hotel and discounted with hotel validation.  Archer is definitely worth the stay.

title: Un hotel complet
text: Une situation idéale, des chambres et des lits confortables, des salles de bains amples et elegantes, un personnel au petit soin, un service de restauration très branché : notre séjour fut une réussite .

title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE
text: Even though the service is excellent and the cleanness is very nice, the room is too small and the price is too high for the size of the room and the area where the hotel is. I came with an art history study group and everyone commented the same thing.

title: Great stay in NYC!
text:
Overall, we loved the hotel. We liked the location. Our room was very clean. Honestly, it's the quietest hotel in terms of street noise that I've ever stayed in in NYC. The rooftop bar was really nice. It was cold the night we were up there, and I would've loved chairs and heaters outside so we could've enjoyed the view. The room was clean and well furnished. 

My only two complaints: 
- Size of the room. I expect small rooms in NYC, but it was tiny. It worked for us as for how little we were in it, and I would stay again though. 

- The bedding. Everything was really comfortable, but all we had was a comforter on our bed with no top sheet. One day/night it was warm and the comforter was a little too heavy. All beds should have a fitted sheet, top sheet, and comforter in my opinion. I should've called and asked for a top sheet the second night, but I was honestly too tired, and then it got cooler so it wasn't as much of an issue.

title: Archer: My Oasis in Manhattan!
text: After dozens of visits, I can confidently say I am a huge fan of The Archer Hotel! The impeccable, mindful service of manager Scott exemplifies the spirit of Horst Schulze's seminal work, Excellence Wins. It will take time, but, under Scott's guidance, I am confident that all staff members will one day reach his level of friendly, nuanced, and precise customer care; one that is keenly aware of context, and customer history and that is reasonable and adroitly flexible. Thank you for being my oasis in Manhattan!

title: Convenient Location and Great Staff
text: Started our mornings by grabbing a breakfast sandwich/pastry and coffee from one of the nearby delis or bakeries and walking the two short blocks to Bryant Park. Convenient location with easy walks to Empire State Building, Grand Central Station and Times Square/Theatre District.  Spyglass was a great place to relax at the end of each day and enjoy the spectacular view of the Empire State Building. Staff was friendly and very helpful.

title: You won't regret staying with Archer Hotel New York!
text: I think this was the best hotel experience I have ever had in NYC.  The attention to detail and thoughtful communication from staff made me feel like I was a valued and unique customer.  It's not something you find often when you stay at a hotel these days.  I felt like every dollar I spent was worth it and I will ensure I stay with you again in the future and encourage others to stay with you!  Great work!

title: Well situated hotel on Manhattan
text:
Well situated hotel, with comfortable and fairly large rooms with a fresh bathroom. Good to have access to a safe (free of charge), a fridge, free good wifi and a Nespresso machine. Good service from the staff at the reception. 
Easy access bar at the ground level, and a fantastic roof top bar at the top with a lovely view of the Empire state building.

title: Family Celebration
text:
My family choose Archer Hotel for my 80th Birthday Celebration. We choose well. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The location very convenient to midtown East and West and in easy reach of the theaters. The staff was professional, friendly and extremely helpful. The lobby was perfect for our morning coffee and gathering. Each day we enjoyed a tasty breakfast at the hotel before starting out on our NYC adventure.The icing on my cake was the view of the Empire State Building out of my window. 
We are already planning a return trip to NYC and a stay at the Archer.

title: Last minute dinner accommodations
text:
Scott was the first to greet me with a warm smile, he went out of the way to accommodate last-minute dinner plans.

At the rooftop bar, Elvis crafted cocktails while Nikki, Asia & Daniels were attentive! Aldo also gave helpful insight into the menu. It was a great evening thanks to the staff, looking forward to my next visit.

title: Great digs.
text: The rooms are cozy but well-organized enough to enjoy any length of stay.  I appreciated the details such as daily room cleaning (especially the little treats left by the staff), comfortable beds, and spacious bathrooms. I look forward to my next stay!

title: BEST place to stay in NYC
