text: The BEST hotel we have ever stayed at!!! We can't wait to come back soon!!!! Everyone was so helpful and friendly.  Absolutely spotless and SO CLEAN!!! We wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC! Empire State room with the view was so worth it!

title: Friendliest Staff
text:
Cannot wait to return to NYC and stay at the Archer Hotel again. Fantastic location and the friendliest staff and exceptional service!

Upon our arrival, which was hours before check-in, we were greeted by the most friendly Joseph. He offered to store our bags while we went about our errands in the city. 

I was in town for an event at Javits. Completely walkable distance. Food at the akb Hotel bar restaurant was amazing! There are also great restaurants within walking distance. 

Jonathan was the bellman and the most outstanding one I have ever encountered. On one occasion he went above and beyond to get us a cab. His smile is illuminating! He was so helpful and kind. 

In a time when good service let alone outstanding service, is hard to come by, I was beyond satisfied with my experience.

title: Great location, friendly helpful staff
text: I have visited New York many times and stayed in various hotels and locations. The Archer is a great location, you can walk to Central Park or to Times Square and Broadway. The staff are great, especially the reception and security team. In particular Jonathan is a fantastic Ambassador for the hotel. I would highly recommend and will be back and stay here on my next visit

title: Great location and incredible beds!
text: We moved here after leaving the original hotel we booked after the first night.  A couple of blocks in NYC can make a huge difference! This hotel is in a very good location for Broadway shows and for getting downtown or uptown and it is also on a quiet street. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and the bed was incredible! I loved the daily treat, the bath amenities and the lobby coffee.

title: Great hotel, sneaky waitstaff at the bar
text: Overall the hotel was AMAZING! I loved the little personal touches everywhere.  We did, however, get a surprise charge at checkout from the rooftop bar, even though we paid our tab before we left.  Without us asking. they gave us another round and didn't bring a check for it and charged it to our room.  It definitely put a bad taste in my mouth when checking out.  I would absolutely go there again, I just probably wouldn't go up to the bar.

title: Hotel is fine overall, but I had the strangest housekeeping experience
text:
I booked this hotel mainly for the location and convenience. 

+s:
+ Front desk was cordial and happy to help with any requests.
+ Convenient access to good food, public transportation, and various attractions
+ Bathroom and walk-in shower were spacious given the size of the room. 

OK:
= The room was small, but that was expected. Not really recommended for two people though, since you can't move around without bumping into each other and there's definitely not enough storage space.
= Noise level was great for the most part, but there was a Friday night where something across the street blasted music till 5AM.

-s:
- The bed was very soft. This is definitely more personal preference, but I prefer firm beds. 
- Shower water pressure was nonexistent.
- Housekeeping was very inconsistent: 
This is the first hotel I've stayed in where housekeeping would consistently not service the room until after 4PM. This is also the first hotel where I was told we had to call housekeeping if we wanted someone to service our room (which we didn't actually have to do, but I'm still baffled). 
The thoroughness of service also differs day-by-day. There were days when everything was very neat and tidy with all amenities replenished, some days when you could tell someone just came in, replaced towels, and left - and then there was a day where we were given a roll of used toilet paper from who-knows-where when the previous roll was finished. Really makes you question what housekeeping standards are.

All things considered I've had worse hotel stays, but I also don't want to return at the tail end of the day and have to wonder if my room's already serviced (and if not, when they'll come kick me out to service it), so I will not be booking this hotel again.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: Fantastic hotel a hop skip and jump from Times Square and the Empire State Building or anything also you’d want to visit midtown. From check in to check out it was a great experience for my sister in law and I. We booked an empire view room with two double beds and it blew my mind. The beds are the most comfortable I’ve slept on in a hotel and there was Enough storage space for our needs, the beds had space underneath to fit a case and a wardrobe with plenty of hangers,a couple of shelves and a safe. Lots of electrical outlets which is rare in most hotels. Bottles of water too. No mini bar which was fine with me but there is a bar/restaurant down in the lobby. The robes and slippers were a welcome bonus after a long day sightseeing. Every morning the maids left a little sweet treat for us 😊 I loved staying here.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: I booked this hotel for a conference nearby and I couldn’t be happier with my decision. Everything from check-in, the room itself, and check-out went flawlessly. The room had massive windows with a great view of the Empire Stare building. The room was clean and had nice touches like delicious treats every morning from local bakeries and confectioners. The staff were professional and friendly and willing to accommodate any needs. This last one might sound weird, but the elevators showed up quickly. I’ve been at other hotels where the elevators were so slow you consider taking the stairs instead. Overall, I only have good things to say about my stay here. Any future visits to NYC will have me staying at the Archer again.

title: Awesome experience in Midtown!
text: Had a wonderful experience from start to finish! Jonathan was so friendly and ensured our luggage was kept safe while we waited for our room to be ready. A woman at the front desk gave a wonderful lunch recommendation. Our room was clean, well-stocked and the Empire State view room was totally worth it! Nichole and Priscilla at Spyglass were AMAZING - made us delicious cocktails, suggested the amazing tuna wontons and went out of their way to take multiple photos of us with the views behind. Will definitely be returning the next time we visit the city!

title: Beautiful hotel and friendly employees
text: I recently stayed at the archer hotel and the service was exceptional. From the friendly gentleman named Jonathan who took our luggage to the staff at the desk, everyone was smiling, and very nice! Our rooms although small(to be expected in NYC) were clean and the beds were cozy! Jonathan continued to have great food recommendations and always asking if we needed anything! Highly reccomend this hotel for your next stay in NYC!

title: Fabulous stay
text: I highly recommend the Archer Hotel in NYC. The bed was comfortable, storage was great (especialy for NYC standards) and the location was convenient to walk to all of my business appointments. This was my first stay there and it definitely won't be my last!

title: The staff were absolutely amazing
text:
If you want to be close to the action this is a very well placed hotel. The rooms were tidy, a standard size for NYC and the bathrooms were quite generous. Housekeeping staff were fantastic and very helpful. I stayed in an Empire view room with a spectacular view of the Empire state building from my room. The room was equiped with a coffee machine, free bottles of water, and cute locally made treats each day. 

The staff at the hotel itself, particularly the front desk / reception were absolute gems - Jospeph and Jonathan, and a couple of the women (who's names I regretfully can't remember) were my absolute favourites - helpful, exceptionally kind, and quite honestly just beautiful people. So for your patience, kindness and help I want to say thank you. 

I experienced a minor issue during my stay and when I expressed this to the hotel, the manager Scott very graciously and kindly responded and resolved it professionally and kindly. 

Every staff member I was lucky enough to encounter was professional and kind. Fantastic staffing choices, very clean and well equipped premises and well situated for a visit to NYC.

title: Excellent Location & Staff Plus Comfort
text:
I recently stayed at the Archer for six nights. The hotel is well located for easy access to the subway and buses. My experience was exceptional from the warm greeting when checking in, to the wonderful upgrade to a room with a view of the Empire State Building, and the cleanliness and  comfort of the room. 

There was great attention to detail from the quality bath products, extra towels, umbrella in the room, and wonderfully comfortable beds. I especially enjoyed the hotel bar up on the roof with an outdoor balcony with a wonderful view of the city. I will definitely stay at the Archer again.

title: Consistently Good
text: I like the Archer when I blow into town. It’s consistent. Good checkin, nice breakfast with vegan choices, and clean rooms. Check out is easy. There is a sky bar that is nice with an excellent view of the city. I’ve stayed multiple times and they always hit the mark.

title: Great hotel, great location, warm welcome.
text:
Impressed overall with the hotel and staff who were all very welcoming and helpful.
Excellent location and loved the rooftop bar with its incredible views - thanks to Hugo & Mario for looking after us! 
Room was lovely. Might have liked a little more space for luggage (we were x3) however a minor point - will bring a smaller case next time :)
Our stay here helped to make this an excellent visit to NY (girls' trip)
We'll be back!

title: 2nd time and already returning next month
text: This is our 2nd stay at the Archer NYC within a month. From the happy greeting at the front desk with Ciera (sp) and getting us checked in with ease and helpful tips for the spyglass bar - we were set for a great visit. We brought another couple a us and they raved of the hotel . The beds are great - bathroom and room clean. It’s small but workable - especially you’re in NYC and should be out and about - having fun. Def make a reservation for the Spyglass and have a drink with a view of the Empire State -it’s impressive even for us tri-staters. We did grab some coffee in the am but we missed the breakfast time but it looked great - next time - we’re already planning to go back in a month - it’s in a convenient location and have to say  - our room was quiet .

title: So disappointed
text:
Way too expensive for the very small size or the room, the people at the front desk are, for most of them, kind of arrogant and not very friendly...(which is very rare for NY) 
However, food at the restaurant is good, the view from roof top outstanding and the people working there amazingly nice...( thank U Priscilla and Hugo, for your kindness and professionalism )

title: Great stay in a great location!
text: This was such a pleasant stay for my business trip to NYC. My office is in the Empire State Building so it’s a very close 10 minute walk. My boyfriend and I also stayed through the weekend and it was a great Midtown location right in the center of things. The front desk was very accommodating and was consistently there to help at all hours. I would specifically like to call out the bellhop Jonathan who went above and beyond to make sure we caught our flight on time. We had checked out and left our bags at the front desk on our last day. Instead of just taking our bags, he made sure to ask when our flight was, told us about the parade in town so we knew there was going to be extra traffic, and he also set us up with a cab that was much cheaper than an Uber/Lyft. Truly felt taken care of! Thank you Jonathan and the Archer team!

title: None
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Archer. Everything was clean and classy. 

Loved the treats provided each day. Rooftop was amazing - drinks and views.

The staff were spectacular and interacting with them definitely enhanced our stay.

title: Trip of a lifetime
text:
This was my first visit to New York and what a fabulous place it is.The Archer is a lovely , friendly hotel with the NewYork vibe. The location is perfect for sight seeing and the icing on the cake is the wonderful view of the Empire State Building from the  great rooftop bar.The hotel staff are second to none and could not be more helpful.Oh and the beds are like sleeping on a cloud.A fab place to stay.
Karl, Kathy & Charlotte.

title: Weekend in NY
text: Really great staff, lovely lobby and rooftop bars, calm oasis near the bustle of Broadway and Times Square. Very small but good bedrooms, great bed! V comfy. Most hotel rooms in NY are small and you will always pay a premium. Can upgrade to a great Empire State Building view,  Would stay here again.

title: Archer Hotel Manhattan
text: Very helpful staff great location for visiting attractions - close to subway as well - can leave bags when checking out early - close to Times Square and all the amenities - food good rooms clean and nice size along with excellent showing facilities

title: Hotel idéalement situé et très propre
text:
Hôtel très bien situé à Manhattan pour visiter la ville.
A proximité de Bryant Park pour s'y poser le matin et prendre un petit déjeuner dans le parc même si le petit déjeuner de l'hôtel est copieux et très bon.
Le personnel est aux petits soins et le roof top de l'hôtel offre une vue imprenable sur l'Empire State Building.
La chambre neuve et très propre avec un lit King size où l'on se perd dedans !
Le prix peut paraître excessif mais est en fait largement justifié pour New-York de part l'emplacement vraiment idéal.
Si nous retournons à New-York nous retournerons au Archer Hôtel, c'est certain !

title: Love this hidden gem!
text: The bed was SOOOOOOOOO comfortable and the pillows were perfection!!!  I loved that there was ample lighting in the bathroom AND a magnifying mirror!  I always travel with my own because i can't see without my glasses so i appreciated both the lighting and mirror.  Oh, and i can't forget to mention, the coffee in the room was amazing!  Thank you for a great stay!

title: Everything was amazing!!
text:
Such a great hotel. 
The room was clean, the staff amazing and very helpful. The location is fantastic!! Would highly recommend!!
The rooftop has the most beautiful view of the city and the Empire State Building. You should definitely check it out if you stay at the hotel.

title: Midtown Gem!
text: Trip started off with a little hiccup through the third-party app we booked the reservation on. Luckily for us, Tracie the manager saved the day and we had a fabulous stay. Like most older hotels in NYC, the rooms were a bit small, but very clean and from my standpoint and more importantly, the air conditioning was great and the hot water was plentiful. Room had a great view of the Empire State building, as did the Spyglass rooftop lounge. But truly, from the manager down to the bellman, service was first class and over the top.  We’ll be back!

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: Had seen Archer on a prior trip to Manhattan earlier this year and decided to give it a try. Very pleased we did! Impeccable service, great room and perfect location for a day exploring NYC! Don’t forget to checkout Spyglass, the rooftop lounge!

title: Empire State of Mind!
text: Welcoming staff all hours, room and view of Empire State Building incredible! We were upgraded for our #35 wedding anniversary upon our arrival with amazing views of Empire State Building. Comfortable beds, room dusty when I pulled out the desk chair like it hadn't been used or cleaned recently. Love the SkyGlass Roof top bar! Definitely will return.

title: Look no further.  This is THE hotel!
text: The Archer is my go to hotel in NYC after our stay with them.   Amazing views of the Empire Star Building from our room and the rooftop bar.  Great drinks and food on the rooftop too!  The staff was great.  The rooms are small but it’s NYC.   They have everything you need and are very comfortable.  The location is perfect in midtown.  Highly recommend!!

title: Wonderful staff,  great location
text: Inviting and friendly staff. Rooms small but very clean. Food was delicious. Both bars are very nice to relax in after a day of sightseeing. Again I’d like to emphasize that the staff throughout the hotel is so friendly and accommodating. I highly recommend.

title: Très bon sejour
text:
Excellent hôtel, très bien situé, 
Chambre confortable petite mais bien agencée avec vue sur ESB 
Service impeccable
Super Rooftop 
gentillesse du personnel
Attention si Chambre sur 38 th street très bruyante.
J y retournerai pour mon prochain séjour.

title: Phenomenal Hotel. Exceptional and Outstanding Staff
text:
This was my second stay at the Archer Hotel in New York  - I usually travel a few times a year to the City and found this Gem of a hotel on my last trip in May. This has now become my place to stay in the Big Apple. Great location, beautiful property and probably the nicest hotel staff I have ever experienced. From the time you check in until the time you leave, you are in great hands. The Manger Scott and his team of professionals make you feel at home - always a smile on their faces and always there to greet and assist you. The rooms are just the perfect size, and the location couldn't be better - just a couple minutes walk from Bryant Park,and a ten minute walk to the lights and shows on Broadway. They have a beautiful rooftop bar with great views, and a very nice lobby bar as well with an outdoor terrace. I travelled this past weekend with my daughter, and they helped us with restaurants, directions to Yankee Stadium and Directions to Metlife Stadium - everything was a breeze to navigate. If you are travelling to New York and need a great place to stay, this is definitely the place. Make sure to say hi to Scott and his terrific team for me.....
Andrew

title: Birthday trip to NYC
text: The front desk staff was very courteous and excellent.  They took care of all our needs.  The view from our room on the 19th floor was amazing with the Empire State Building.  It was a great place to celebrate my Birthday on the rooftop of the Spyglass bar.  Thank you for a wonderful experience.

title: None
text: Incredibly friendly staffed committed to a unified vision of excellence in customer service. Relationships are everything, and each and every member of the staff was authentically engaged. The property is maintained to an exceptional level of cleanliness and style.

title: None
text: The Archer is perfect in every way except for its lack of drawers and very limited closet space. Great room decor. Loved the Spyglass Rooftop Bar - great drinks and very good appetizers and plates to share. Very friendly staff.  The Empire State Bldg view is fantastic.  Lobby restaurant was excellent and very available.

title: Wtf
text: Super disappointed. David needs an attitude adjustment. I’ve never received such poor service at an establishment-  very subpar from the rest of the staff members. The rooftop is a mess. Beds are comfy. Food establishment- needs work but decent. Parking is poor.

title: Très bon séjour
text: Accueil et service impeccable. La literie est incroyablement confortable. Emplacement très central. La chambre était pas très grande mais convenable. Salle de bain fonctionnelle et le ménage parfait. Très bon séjour dans cet hôtel que je recommande vivement.

title: Average hotel
text: Location is superb, roof top bar is very nice food was good and view was nice as well .  If you don’t get a higher floor room you will stock like us at 9th floor with a blocked view of a building.  Staff not the most friendliest my husband asked front desk about any upgrades through trip advisor plus and she was like I never heard of this program and my husband showed her the list with their hotel’s name still she did not even bother to ask her manager.  We were going to extend our stay but decided to change to some other hotel.

title: Clean . Comfy . Beautiful
text:
CLEAN, COMFY & BEAUTIFUL from ☑️in to ☑️out.  Extremely friendly staff…warm welcoming decor… even the music playing in the lobby when we entered was one of my favorite songs, how did they know?   the bed AHHHHHHH🛌…the shower AHHHHHHH🚿… 15th floor very 🤫.  bottles of water and slippers and robe nice extras.  Will definitely visit again plus the location was perfect for our needs close to Broadway, close to the train station and a short trip to our favorite restaurant downtown. (ABC Kitchen if you want to know)  The Archers suggests a safe convenient 🚗  parking garage 3 minute walk The Archer's location supports a clean quick exit out of the city east or west  🧭 
(parking costs extra but worth it for a restful nyc stay, so ask front desk about it) 
Our room was ready for check in around 4 PM the friendly front desk folks kindly kept our luggage in a safe location while we adventured around the city all morning and afternoon.  ps They provide a spot for you to park out front while you check in at the front desk and a lovely spot for your friends or family to wait while you drop your car off at the parking garage which is about one city block away!

title: Awesome location, clean rooms, safe, and excellent staff.
text: I loved it here! The hotel is in a fantastic location, it was clean, safe, and the staff was top-notch. From check in to check out I was made to feel the staff really cared about my stay. I would absolutely recommend anyone to stay here. The next time I’m in the city I would definitely book another stay the Archer Hotel.

title: Wonderful hotel located in the heart of Manhattan
text: Had a lovely time staying at the Archer hotel. The hotel itself was chic, modern, and in a great location. Our room was cozy, cute, and clean. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room had several sweet, personalized, NYC touches. We were welcomed with water bottles and fresh caramels. We stayed in a room with an empire state view and it was so worth it. However, the window was pretty dirty on the outside which slightly obstructed the view. It'd be nice if the windows were washed a little more frequently. The personnel working at the hotel were always polite and helpful. Would absolutely stay at this gem of a hotel again.

title: Great Hotel
text: The Hotel is in great location to many things. The staff were excellent and they helped you with any questions you had with ease. The rooms were updated and the bed and pillows were super comfortable. We had breakfast in lobby and it was good . The only small issue was the rooftop bar closed early and they really hustled you out of there, but it was a great place to sit and have a drink and look at the skyline

title: Nice boutique hotel
text: Rooms are a little small, but that is to be expected. Room was very clean. The bed is really comfortable, towels are nice and thick, and they provide comfortable robes & slippers. Hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and accomodating. We were a little disappointed at how early the rooftop bar closed, we didn't have the chance to experience that. Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel.

title: Il miglior hotel in città
text: È stato tutto fantastico a partire dalla posizione  nel centro di New York, a due passi da Times Square e dalla 5th avenue. Camere piccoline ma moderne e pulitissime  . Staff gentilissimo sempre pronto ad aiutarti. Il rooftop dell’albergo è mozzafiato con la vista sull’empire. Vi consiglio vivamente di soggiornare in questo hotel!

title: This hotel does not refund the deposit amount. Don't choose it to stay in New York
text: What a disappointment, on the first day they withheld 200 euros as security. Upon check out they told me they would refund within 5 working days. It's been 35 days and I still haven't received anything and I've already sent all the requested documentation. Don't stay in this hotel lest you get ripped off.

title: schönes Hotel - mit sehr kleinen Zimmern
text: Everything was perfect. The staff very friendly but the rooms were very small and the rooms were book with view of the Empire State Building. From our second room #1508, we had not a good view of the building.

title: Great midtown boutique hotel
text: Amazing little boutique hotel. Lovely staff, super clean, cool decor, great rooftop bar and adorable perks like cute slippers and daily treats left in your room. Rooms are small yes  - but no smaller than one would expect in any midtown nyc hotel.

title: Great overall experience
text:
Very nicely situated hotel with excellent staff. The rooftop bar is a must to visit.
Our room was way too small for 3 people. The two queen size beds took up 90% of the room, so having three bags was a big struggle. The AC was either on full blast or off and it woke us up every night. Other than that we had a great stay.

title: Great central hotel
text: Great hotel - we paid for the Empire State Building view & it was well worth it. Good central location, friendly staff & nice room. Quite small but it is Manhattan! We didn’t visit the roof bar as we had a teenager with us.

title: Best hotel staff in NYC
text:
We had the best possible stay at the Archer - considering the circumstances. My husband was physically sick with anxiety our entire trip, and the hotel staff went out of their way to help us. They let us check in early so he could rest, brought an UberEats order of ginger ale and crackers directly to him in the room, let us tack on an extra night without making us move rooms, and even did a wellness check on a day that I was out sightseeing for longer than usual. Every member of the staff went out of their way to make us feel taken care of.

All of this on top of the location, the cleanliness, the hotel bar, the room view, and everything else made our stay relatively perfect. New York City has thousands of hotels that we could choose from on a return trip, but we will be choosing the Archer.

title: Archer New York is a fabulous hotel!  Do not hesitate, stay here!
text: The Archer Hotel is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in in Manhattan.  The staff is well-trained, professional, attentive and kind.  The rooms are gorgeous, spotlessly clean, well-appointed and quiet with THE most comfortable beds!  The hotel has a hip vibe with an awesome roof top bar with spectacular views of The Empire State Building.  It is super convenient to just about anything you might want to do in NYC.  We also found it to be extremely affordable.  We were hosting an event at Gotham Hall (just steps away) and many of our guests stayed at The Archer.  Everyone remarked upon what a great hotel it was!  When the staff heard we were attending our son’s wedding they delivered a chilled bottle of wine to our room!  The morning following the event we had a private breakfast at Spyglass (the rooftop bar).  The breakfast was beautifully presented with absolutely delicious food and coffee!  We returned, for a second visit, a month later and upon check-in found a fancy platter of sumptuous pastries in our room with a little sign which read: “just because”.  This is a place that knows that just a little extra goes a long way.  A big shout out to all the staff that made our stay exceptional: Aldo, Brian, Scott, Suri, Justin, Tracie and Alley!  Thank you!  We will be coming back!

title: Thank you
text:
The whole entire team at The Archer was second to none, their hospitality was so warm, the little gift in the room for our date getaway with my fiancée was enjoyed so much. The comfort of the bed, the pillow, was extraordinary, with view to the Empire State. The bathroom is a decent size and well furnished.
Thank you very much for your hospitality.
We have just found the hidden gem of NYC considering its location, pricing and service quality.

title: Great location and customer service.
text: Nice to have an updated and clean room in such a great location. A working a/c was welcomed. Customer service was spot on and we even got to keep the hotel slippers. Enjoy the ahi tuna on the rooftop! Will definitely stay again.

title: Great customer service Archer Hotel New York
text:
The website doesn’t do the Archer Hotel Justice... three of the most restful nights I’ve ever had in a hotel; the location is great for easy access to almost every attraction in Manhattan.
Great room service; and the staff at the front desk are to be commended for their excellent customer service skills; I will recommend the Archer Hotel to everyone I know traveling to New York

title: Thank you for the great vacation at Archer New York
text:
We stayed at Archer New York in July for 15 nights. It was the third time. As usual, we were very satisfied in terms of service, smiling face staff and a very nice place at Archer New York.

Scott Calderon, Director of Rooms, we will miss you so much. We would like specially to thank you for your responsiveness and solution-driven service. Hope, see you again at Archer New York  next year!

title: Not with the stay.
text: Check in was lousy. The staff was taking too much time and not very friendly. Rooms are very small. Location is nice. The bar and rooftop are amazing and fun. The bar downstairs is very good and fast service.Overall I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel in Midtown
text:
I stayed at the Archer for a week in the beginning of August.
Everything about this place was great - from the equipped room (Nespresso coffee machine !) to the good location and the very helpful staff (front, bell, cleaning team - all were fantastic. I would love to mention David at the front desk).
My room at the 21st floor had amazing view of the Empire State Building.
I would definitely stay there again on future trips to the city.

title: Great Hotel, excellent location, amazing service
text:
We stayed at the start of July in the Archer Hotel New York as part of a bigger US holiday package, and as our first stop of the holiday, we could not have been happier with the service, the location, and the room.

We chose to upgrade before arriving, to stay in one of their Empire view rooms.  This placed us on the 19th floor of the hotel with a magnificent view of the Empire State Building in all its glory.  Definitely worth the upgrade for that view.

The room we stayed in was compact, but had everything we needed, and was beautifully decorated throughout.  As a city hotel, we kind of expected there wouldn't be a lot of room, so be aware of this when booking!

The front desk staff, and manager, were always on hand, and always very helpful.  The manager on the day we arrived even took us up to the rooftop bar before it opened for a private viewing of the amazing view of the Empire State Building and to take photos.  We were here celebrating our anniversary, and son's birthday, which the hotel made sure was even more special with gifts of sparkling wine, sweets, and even an Archer cap for our boy!  Unexpected, and really appreciated.

The only downside we felt was that we had been told they had a complimentary continental breakfast available each morning, and were disappointed to find that it was only coffee, tea, and iced water, after being told there would be pastries available alongside these drinks.

Thankfully, this didn't take the shine off an otherwise excellent stay, and we would have no problem returning when we're next in NYC

title: Amazing Hotel Staff and Room
text: I was extremely satisfied with our room.  It was clean, spacious for New York,  and had the best view of the Empire State Building.  The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to welcome me and my son.  They came up to our room and gave my son some yummy treats to welcome him on his first trip to NYC. It was a wonderful gesture.  I also appreciate the wonderful maid service.  The room looked great every afternoon when we arrived after a long day.  Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Très bon hôtel à New York
text: Très bon hôtel, très bien situé (entre Times Square et l'Empire State). Très bon accueil, et des chambres impeccables (une vraie et grande douche à l'italienne, et non dans une baignoire !). On a oublié une veste qui a été retrouvée puis, nous a été envoyée à notre hôtel suivant à Washington. Nous recommandons vivement.

title: Outstanding!
text: Archer Hotel New York! Not just a hotel! Here you feel safe, in good hands - just like at home! Excellent service - starting with the doormen, through reception to first class room service! Archer sets standards in everything! That's why we love you! Your house has become home for my wife and me! Thank you for your great work! Tom Heger / Ludwigshafen Germany thomasheger@kabelmail.de

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: My boyfriend and I came here to spend his birthday. He and myself have stayed at plenty of hotels and this one by far had some of the most amazing and attentive customer service I’ve ever experienced. So nice and sweet and willing to help. The rooftop service was amazing as well. This is the place to come!! Seriously, you will be taken care of!!

title: Anniversary in NYC
text: The Archer is fantastic!  Well situated in Midtown.  Their attention to detail from check-in to check out was on point.  We came to NYC for our anniversary and were so happy.  From the caramels and local chocolates in the room to the quick check out and booking of our cab this hotel does customer service well.  We will definitely recommend to friends visiting NYC.  The rooftop bar, the Spyglass provides a great view.

title: Nice little hotel.
text: Comfy and well positioned hotel in midtown . 5 mins from Times Square, 20 mins from Central Park. 2 mins from Bryant park. Small but well presented rooms. Nice roof Terrance but under 21st can’t go up there. Great staff and lobby bar/restaurant.

title: Great hotel close to Empire State Bldg and Macy's
text: Stayed her for 3 nights for a work trip in July. Rooms are small but very nice! Very comfortable bed. Nice, big bathroom / shower. Restaurant in lobby was great for breakfast. The rooftop bar is amazing and must be seen, especially at night. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC. Would not recommend for a family stay but definitely recommend for a business or couples trip.

title: overall good
text:
The location is very comvenient. The rooms on the smallish side. The beds comfortable.  As Europeans, we are accustomed to breakfast included. Even at
expensive hotels. One negative was the staff, especially during the night shift. They seemed not to be able to handle the simplest request.

title: Fabulous Experience!
text: We loved the Archer Hotel! The Archer staff was always so friendly. Whether we were leaving early in the morning or coming in late at night, we were always greeted in such a kind manner. Our room was very clean and maintained perfectly each day. Every detail in this hotel is perfection! We appreciate all of the staff’s hard work in making sure our stay was incredible, and it did not go unnoticed. We will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting to NYC!

title: Father/Daughter trip for Broadway and shopping
text: Outstanding service and a great location. Far enough from Times Square to avoid the crowds yet close enough to walk. They provided some cute little cake bites as a welcome gift for my daughter's 18th birthday. This is my second stay here and I will come back again soon.

title: Cute boutique hotel
text: The Archer NY was an average NYC boutique hotel. It was very small which is typical of most hotels in this area.  The front desk attendants were not the friendliest. We had some trouble keeping the room cool enough. I felt safe as they kept a good eye on who gets on the elevator. But, I much prefer the Archer Hotel in Napa Valley. I probably would not stay here again. The view from the rooftop bar is great.

title: Absolutely Wonderful Experience!
text:
Probably the best experience I've ever had in a hotel. And this is a long review, but I'm just so pleased with our time at the The Archer that I want to tell all the details! :)

We flew in from Pittsburgh and arrived at noon to the hotel, fully aware that check-in didn't happen until 3 p.m. We were immediately greeted by the hotel manager, Scott, and asked how he could help. We explained that we'd just arrived and that we knew we couldn't check in until 3 p.m. and wondered if maybe the hotel could just store our carry-ons until then while we went out and explored a bit. Scott immediately said he could check to see if our room was ready and that if it was, he'd be happy to check us in then. While he checked, he offered us water and invited us to sit in the beautiful seating area by the front desk. A moment later he confirmed that our room was basically ready and that he just wanted to send someone up one more time to make sure it's perfect. Less than 5 minutes later, we got to check in. We were thrilled!

The room was so, so clean, and it smelled so fresh. Yes, NYC hotel rooms are tiny, but space is really utilized in a pretty creative way in the rooms at The Archer. We got a room with a perfectly framed view of the Empire State Building and a king bed. It was divine. We even had custom sweets and bottle Fiji spring water waiting for us in our room. We were on the 21st floor, the top floor of rooms, and it was very quiet, too.

I'd mentioned when I made our reservation that we were celebrating my husband's birthday, and about 10 minutes after we got to our room, Scott, the manager, knocked on our door, and when I opened it, he was holding a birthday card, two wine glasses, and a bottle of wine in a small chilling container with ice. The manager, you guys. Hand-delivered. Talk about classy.

We enjoyed our time so much that we decided to stay an extra day. We mentioned this to Scott and the front desk staff, and they said no problem. We knew we probably would have to move to a new room, and we were fine with that. Scott said that on our original day of check-out to just have all our bags packed and leave them in our room and that they'd move our belongings to our new room later that day. Sure enough, later that evening when we returned from a long day of fun, we stopped at the front desk, got our new room keys, and headed to our new room. It was equally as beautiful and clean, and our belongings were tucked neatly in the corner for us. We were so grateful.

Scott, thank you so much for treating us like family, for your warm smile, your joyful presence, and your extra special touches. You are definitely made to work in hospitality, as it is clearly a gift you have. On our way back to Pittsburgh, I told my husband, "I totally want to be friends with Scott." And he was like, "I know, right?"

To the entire front desk staff, what a joy it was to see your faces each time we left and returned. Thank you for your smiles and friendly, helpful attention. Tracie, thank you for the great lunch recommendation of The Bryant Park Grill on our first day (this gluten-free vegetarian and her carnivore husband were quite pleased!). And Gabby, what a pleasant surprise it was when we casually set a stack of books we were going to mail home on the counter of the front desk as we checked on our room switch, and you raved about the book on the top of our stack - which led to a wonderful conversation about books! Which we LOVE.

We absolutely cannot wait to return to NYC and stay with you again. Thank you all for being such a wonderful home away from home!

title: Archer Hotel, NY / a real GEM
text: Stayed at The Archer boutique hotel in Manhattan recently and thoroughly loved it.  Fantastic location - midtown close to everything and buzzy at night so walking around felt safe.  Hotel staff were friendly and competent.  Room was small but sufficient with two double beds and stocked with all the important accessories including Nespresso machine for my morning espresso!  Space under beds for luggage.  Upgraded to room with Empire State Bldg view - stunning - thank you E!!!  Would definitely recommend and next time in NY, will book The Archer for sure.  Stay there you won’t be disappointed.  Thanks to all for fantastic visit.

title: Wonderful experience
text: A fantastic stay at Archer Hote for 9 nights. I would absolutely stay here again. Yes, the rooms are a bit on the small side but everything else compensates for that. The staff is simply amazing. If you plan to stay with big kids I would reccomend getting a second room since the queen size beds are a bit small for two people.

title: Great
text: We stayed for 4 nights before boarding the Queen Mary 2. The hotel was clean and tidy as were the rooms. Rooms are a little small, but we are staying in the centre of NYC so excepted that! Great hotel and friendly staff. Highly recommend. Thank you

title: Wheelchair ADA room
text:
Good things first, there are automatic doors to enter the hotel, there are 2 lifts which are plenty big enough for a wheelchair. When we got to the room se just swiped the card and the door automatically opened, and a push pad for coming out.
We had a tub room and the bathroom had enough room to turn easily, with the usual ADA grab rails by the toilet, plenty room to the left of the toilet not quite enough for a front transfer. A lowered sink and bath.
Downside, the bedroom is 'compact', with 3 feet at one side and bottom of the bed, which was just enough to get by but no turning space. There was a half length wardrobe and one long shelf for clothes. The only place to put bags is under the raised platform bed, which makes the bed very high, around 30/31 inches. This made it virtually impossible for me to get in unaided and dangerous as there wasn't enough room for my husband to help properly.
The staff were very good and tried their  best to find a suitable room for us but all the beds were too high. We had booked a  7 night stay but they waived the cancelation fee and Scott helped us find a suitable hotel and the front of house manager even helped us move our luggage.
So would I recommend this hotel, yes if you are able bodied and don't need much storage space but definitely not for a wheelchair user.

title: An absolute delight from start to finish
text: We loved our stay at Archer. From the rooftop bar to the most comfortable beds ever! The location was fantastic and the customer service was impeccable. We will definitely be back! Thank you to the entire Archer Team for an amazing experience!

title: Fantastic NY hotel
text: Excellent staff who are always happy to help and provide a fantastic service, great food, perfect location, my room was cleaned to a very high standard daily, the room was also very well presented. I could not ask for more from a NY hotel!

title: Awesome ”boutique” hotel
text:
Excellent atmosphere. We had a rose and congratulations note waiting in our room as it was our honeymoon. Staff was friendly, rooms were cousy and NYC style. Rooftop bar had nice views and good food. Location was excellent in Manhattan: in the middle lf everything but still in quiet and calm street. 

Could definitely go again and recommend!

title: Nice family trip.
text: Really nice hotel. Staff friendly, rooms clean, location great. Only thing could have been better, is that some appetizer could have been available at the rooftop bar: of need to eat something have to order from their few menu. Breakfast also good.

title: The Archer Hits a Bullseye!
text: The room was very small!! Expect that going into the Archer…..but they make up for it in other ways. Beautiful room views of the Empire St. Building, great service, cleanliness, and the location is excellent! There is also bar area at the top of the hotel with a spectacular view of the city.

title: Turist
text: Best place,  TOP location, professional team, spotless cleanliness, stunning view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar and from the room, comfortable bed, amazing, delicious food, great cocktails!  I am fascinated!

title: Great Hotel in NY - High Recommend
text: This hotel was fabulous, good location very central to shopping and sightseeing experience.  Rooms were small but standard for the City, good facilities in the room especially the bathroom and a very comfortable bed.  The Skybar with the view of the Empire State building was breathtaking.  The reception and staff were all very pleasant and helpful.

title: Would choose again
text:
Looked for a hotel in the area near Bryant park and found Archer Hotel. We are very happy with our stay here. The limited size of the room is compensated by modern furnishings, quality products in the bathroom, cleanliness, comfortable bed and above all friendly staff. Welcoming staff should not be underestimated and as an Archer guest you will be greeted with a smile and there is a high level of service. 

We encountered some minor problems as the conditions in our booking had changed since the booking was made. However, this was taken care of by the front desk in an exemplary and fast manner.

The Archer hotel is centrally located in the city, the area felt safe and we will gladly stay here when we return to N Y.

title: New favorite hotel in NYC
text: Thoughtful. Clean. Memorable. Quiet. Quality. Archer hit all the important marks that so many other hotels miss. The overall feel was luxury from the room to the rooftop bar. The staff was welcoming and accommodating. Even the elevators were fast. This is my new favorite hotel and I'll be back.

title: Forget The Waldorf
text: Just stayed at The Archer in NYC having booked as a result of a great stay three years ago at the Napa ‘branch’. Fabulous and once again all down to the staff. Nothing too much trouble. A credit to the industry.

title: Not in unison
text:
The hotel itself is a lovely one. From the moment you walk in staff is very eager to assist you and everyone you encounter is nothing but beautiful smiles. I was traveling with my girlfriend whom as much as I love- is a very demanding creature (and I love her even more for it :p) 

My issue came with the rooftop, Spyglass.

Upon check in I was told about how as a guest I would have priority to the rooftop… (this was after I was given drink vouchers because my room was not ready until after 5 pm) however when I wanted to go to this beautiful oasis- I was told by the manager that they could not accommodate me as they had a part of the venue closed for a private event and the remaining space was occupied. The manager, Brian, told me to try again in an hour or two- okay, understandable. 

When we came back 2 hours later (after the sunset I had promised my girlfriend) I was told they were still at capacity… 

I am sure any competent person would understand how unacceptable and frustrating this encounter was. Even more so infuriating was the “managers” silly smirk, as if this was a laughing matter. 

I don’t know if they have the same management, but whatever it may be- the service is clearly not the same. It made the stay less than ideal. For the same price one can stay at Margaritaville with much more service, and attention to details.

title: Great experience!
text: We stayed several nights and were charmed. Lovely hotel, super quiet, and the staff were so sweet. They did the standard “what brings you to New York” when we checked in, then greeted us one day with a graduation treat for our daughter and an anniversary card for me and my wife. So adorable and welcoming! Would stay here again in a heartbeat 💕

title: Schönes Hotel. Haben jedoch mehr erwartet.
text: Wir haben das Hotel aufgrund einer Blog-Empfehlung gebucht, welches das Hotel als besondere Empfehlung für Veganer*innen gekürt hat. Da wir uns beide vorwiegend vegan ernähren und diesen Lebensstil auch darüber hinaus zu pflegen versuchen, waren wir neugierig und haben wir das Hotel für einen einwöchigen Aufenthalt in New York gebucht... und wurden durch unsere Erwartungshaltung etwas enttäuscht. Das Restaurant konnte mit dem veganen Angebot eher nicht überzeugen. Zudem waren die Drinks in der Bar, welche auch in veganer Form herausragend schmecken sollten, nicht als solche deklariert. Auch sonst war das Service-Personal in der Bar eher unfreundlich. Wenigstens die Toiletten-Artikel der Marke Malin +  Goetz kann man hervorheben. Pluspunkte gibt es dennoch: Das Hotel ist hervorragend gelegen und die Mitarbeitenden der Rezeption waren sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Zudem waren die Zimmer schön eingerichtet. Auch wenn die Zimmer schon arg klein waren - auch für eine Stadt wie New York.

title: A pleasant stay
text: We stayed for a week. The location was great, the food was yummy. The roof bar is beautiful. The room is a bit small, we didn’t have enough space to put our stuff. One day they didn’t clean my room, and when I inform the front desk, the respond was a bit dry, it was a bit disappointing.

title: None
text:
Hotel was beautiful. Our room exceeded our expectations. Gorgeous. Staff were amazing. They were polite, attentive and very helpful. 
Check in was fast and efficient. Coffee in room was tasty. Hotel is close to everything, but away from the chaos  and noise. 
Roof top bar had amazing tuna nicoise. Actually, we were not ever that hungry, but it was the best we have ever tasted.

title: Why haven't I booked here sooner?
text:
This was one of the best weekends I've had down in New York. Everything was awesome. The front desk staff was engaging and friendly. The room, decor, the little  touches like snacks and recommended books within the room we wonderful. The location and views far exceeded my expectations. Did I mention how awesome the staff is? They are!
This is a gorgeous boutique hotel central to everything. The moment checking in very interactive and friendly people. Elevators were fast- Never had to wait more than a minute for one. We drove down from the Boston area and we arrived a little early, we were able to get to our room sooner which was a bonus seeing it was over 90° that day. Room is gorgeous in the AC was cranking :-)
We were in town to pick up my daughter's wedding dress and to see a show and shop. When they found out we picked up the wedding dress they sent up a bottle of wine in celebration with us! Very thoughtful group of people there!
The sky top of far was absolutely gorgeous. Wonderful views of the city line. When we needed assistance with restaurant recommendations or things to do they had several, very knowledgeable staff.
Within the past year I've made several trips to New York and I wish I discovered Archer sooner. We will be back in the fall and I would absolutely return here. Highly recommend!

title: Great, newish hotel with excellent service!
text: I loved my stay there! Very central location for going all around the city; bldg is rather new, which makes for a nice room; Bryant Park a block or two away is lovely; and the staff (Evan, Andrew, Tracie, and Rosalyn--everyone) was so nice and accommodating! I even extended my stay 3 times. I've also booked another trip there next month. Highly recommend it!

title: Great location and SO CLEAN.
text: Great location and great stay. Everything was super clean and top notch!! Every amenity was well thought out. Some things I didn’t know I needed until I saw it!! The check in process was fast and easy. The location for our event at Gotham Hall was perfect!

title: Easy all around
text: The Archer is a well-located and comfortable place to stay. We paid a bit more for the Empire State view, which was a real winner. The beds are comfortable (although the pillows could have used a bit more loft). The bathroom was very nice, as is the mini-fridge -- oh, and don't forget the evening sweet treats! Different each night, and all delicious. We mistakenly left an item behind in the closet of our room and were contacted even before we made it home with an offer to send it back (you send them a pre-paid label from the carrier of your choice, they make sure the package gets picked up and sent to you). Extra points for that!

title: Disappointing for our honeymoon
text: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon because we absolutely loved the Archer located in Napa. However, the Archer NYC was disappointing. Only one bathrobe was provided, the treats provided were for only one guest and on our last day the room was never cleaned. Imagine coming home to a uncleaned hotel room on the very last day of your honeymoon! So disappointing.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Killer Views, Fantastic Service
text:
Next time I'm in NYC, I'll be staying at Archer! Everyone is so kind and helpful. The hotel is beautiful and clean, and the lobby and rooftop bars are great amenities. The location can't be beat - two short blocks to Bryant Park, a quick walk to the theater district and it's surrounded by restaurants and bars in all directions.

We had a top floor room with a view of the Empire State Building. There were three of us, so the fit in the room was tight because the rooms are small. We had two full beds - I think if you have four people you'd really be fighting for space. The size of the rooms wasn't really an issue because we didn't spend any extended amount of time in the room other than to sleep or get ready. Rooms have a small fridge, coffee maker with delicious coffee, and some waters.

The hotel also has a great entry way - LOTS of room, and pulled back from the street which sets it apart from other hotels nearby. We enjoyed playing games at the outside tables they have on the ground floor patio. Make sure you make a reservation to have a drink at the roof top bar with incredible views of the empire state building. 

You won't be disappointed with Archer!

title: Outstanding
text:
Simply outstanding!
The staff was helpful and courteous and the hotel was clean and the amenities perfect.
Lobby bar was great and the food was also excellent and advice on local places to eat was super helpful

title: BEYOND AMAZING
text: I come to NYC 5-6 times a year for long stays. ARCHER IS ACES! The Staff take unbelievable care of me…bordering on pampering. They really are incredibly attentive.  Restaurants are great. IT’S ALL FANTASTIC!! DON’T EVEN THINK OF GOING ANYWHERE ELSE. SERIOUSLY!

title: Great Service!
text: I stayed here for a business trip this week and had a wonderful experience!!! The staff is super nice and helpful.  We enjoyed drinks on the roof and ate in the restaurant multiple times!! Excellent Experience!

title: Archer Hotel stay
text: Wow - What a hotel, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay in the hotel. Scott and the young lad (sorry I didn't get the name) amongst others, couldn't do enough for our stay for our wedding.  The room was a little small however we didn't find this a problem, as the view of the Empire State building was breathtaking.  The cleanliness of the room in fact the whole building was to a high standard and we felt safe at all times.  The Spyglass bar was also to a high standard of cleanliness and the staff also very helpful.  You get a pair of Archer Hotel slippers and we would have liked the bathrobes but these were $100 each, so didn't buy any.  However, I highly recommend this hotel and we will stay here again.

title: Mother/Daughter Trip
text: Came into NYC for a mother/daughter trip and found the hotel to be amazing. Great location, unbelievably comfortable beds, service was great, and we upgraded to a 2-Queen room with an Empire State Building view that was well worth it. Absolutely no complaints - plus the store near the front desk had Tate's Chocolate Chip Cookies which are always perfect after a Broadway show. Can't wait to come back.

title: Vacanze
text: Hotel  centrale  vicino alla stazione della metropolitana e Time square Personale disponibile  e gentile. Camera piccola ma con letto king size molto confortevole, abbiamo dormito bene. Insonorizzata e pulita.Bagno  con doccia a soffione non troppo spazioso ma pulito. Macchina nespresso per il caffè espresso. Non abbiamo fatto colazione ma era disponibile alla carta.Consiglio questo hotel dove io e mio marito abbiamo trascorso una bella vacanza di 8 giorni. Da notare che non ci sono oneri  né extra da pagare

title: 20th Anniversary Visit
text: We had a fantastic stay at the Archer. We stayed for 7 nights while we were in NYC for our 20 year wedding anniversary and they went over and above for us! Each day housekeeping left little treats for us to come back to and did a great job with our room. We will definitely stay here the next time we are in NYC! Incredible customer service!

title: Very small rooms with big hearts
text: We were very happy with the location, the amenities, the staff and the food. Only one caveat rooms are very very small. The rooms have lots of modern conveniences and smart phone jacks. The layout reminded me of a boat with every inch used and thought out for maximum space control.

title: Excellent
text: The Archer host made our visit pleasant and easy. He check on our room and allowed an early check in. The quaint room had a perfect view of the Empire State Building that filled our window. The hotel is very clean. Staff was great! Wonderful espresso machine in the room woke me up in the morning. Everything was so great. Right down to the welcome candies waiting for us in the room. Looking for the best side of NYC? Stay at Archer and you will get it. We will visit again!

title: Great visit
text:
I think I found my new hotel when visiting New York. I always have a preference for a boutique hotel and so much better than a hectic big hotel, especially in NY.

Here’s what was best -

—The spaces are modern
—The bed was SO comfortable and shower was good.
—Room was tiny, but usual for New York standards.
—Location is perfect between 5th and 6th so good walk to broadway and also easy to get to the east side, around the corner from Bryant Park, close to the library and even an easy walk to both Penn Station and Central Park.
—The food at the newer restaurant was outstanding. Enjoyed both tuna tartare and avocado toast.
—Front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with special shout out to Tracie.
—-I took advantage of the online first time booking for 20% off
—lobby is small, but very comfortable and stylish to visit with friends/family. Coffee and tea available in the am.

Drawbacks
—the room doors are very heavy and I heard other guests coming and going and the housekeepers in the hall one morning opening and closing doors, either for cleaning or for their supply closet.
—I paid a little extra for an Empire State bldg view, but the main view was the office building across the street. While I could see the Empire State Building in the distance, it wasn’t worth an up-charge, at least not if you’ve been to NY before.
—when we returned from the theater on a Saturday night we wanted to see the rooftop lounge, but it had already closed at 11 pm.

I’m amazed at a few of the negative reviews here, especially talking about room size and “lack of valet parking.” I can only assume these people are not familiar with NYC, especially in early June. I think for around $400 a night (with the discount plus the usual significant NY taxes), Archer provided overall a great experience and I would definitely stay here again.

title: The Best!
text: We stayed at the Archer last week and loved every minute of it!  The staff was fabulous and location was perfect.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  Our view of the Empire State Building was beyond beautiful!  Will definitely recommend the Archer to friends and we will  stay there again on our next visit!

title: Lovely Hotel, close enough to everything
text:
After waiting 3 years after we booked the hotel, we finally made it out in April 2022. 

We booked Archer Hotel because of the views you could get of the Empire State Building from the bedrooms.  It didn't disappoint. 

The hotel is small but not too small - it has 21 floors in total and a rooftop bar. 

We booked the Double Double with Empire view and I emailed the hotel beforehand to request a high floor because we were celebrating a 40th birthday.  The rooms are small, 1 wardrobe and space under the bed to keep your suitcase, other than that - not much storage space really.  The bathroom was a good size, with a nice shower and decent lighting (most hotels struggle to get the lighting right for women to do their makeup etc) lol 

The beds have to be the comfiest I have ever slept on - they just moulded to your body without being hard like memory foam can be. 

The staff were all so welcoming and warm, loving our British accent LOL 

We ate at the rooftop bar on the first night, and for what we ate and drank, blimey - it's expensive - be warned. lol  For the 3 of us with drink (2 each) and 3 starter dishes and a Tuna dish - it was over $200 and we did have an issue with one of our cards being charged twice, which took almost two weeks to resolve - but it did get resolved in the end.  

We were left a bottle of prosecco with two glasses (had to ask for another glass and coffee cup as there were 3 of us in the room lol) - but such a lovely gesture. 

The nespresso machine was a godsend first thing.  We were always awake really early so the coffee got us started and we were all out of the hotel by 7:30am most mornings - which worked out well as was much quieter and we were able to see some of the sights before the tourist rush hour :-) 

The hotel is located a few blocks from Central Park (about 10-15 mins stroll) and we walked everywhere whilst we were there.  It's a really convenient location, lots of scaffolding on the surrounding buildings, but don't let that put you off (if you look on google maps etc)

title: Archer is perfect
text: This is the hotel we stay at every visit to NYC and we keep coming back because there truly is no better place to stay in the city. The rooms, the staff, the location, the service, the views, all are total perfection. The rooms are designed so well for a compact space, they feel cozy yet spacious at the same time. The beds are super comfy and the bathrooms are luxury minimalism at its finest. So many things to walk to that you often don’t need taxis or the train. Thank you, Archer, for being our fabulous home away from home!

title: Menos de lo que esperaba, pero aún una buena opción con excelente ubicación para adultos
text:
Habitación muy oscura, solicité una lámpara de velador extra, pero no la obtuvieron. Esta falta de luz no facilita una limpieza detallada. La cama tenía el colchón ya muy blando, necesitaba una renovación.
El reemplazo de "ameneties" no es detallado, varias veces tuve que solicitar jabón, algunos días dejaban un chocolate y otros días nada, algunas toallas muy viejas!!
En el front desk siempre me atendieron muy bien, los restaurants tienen buena comida y tragos, aunque la atención es algo lenta.
En este momento en la entrada hay andamios que no son muy agradables a la vista y no es lo más atractivo para sentarse.

title: None
text:
Overall the hotel was okay, but the level of service was inconsistent.  The room was nice and well equipped.  However during my one week stay, one day the room was not made, even though I was away from the room most of the day.  Some days I had a complete set of fresh towels, other days not.  The front desk was very friendly as were the doormen.  We went upstairs for drinks and the service was terrible.  Would never recommend the place to anyone.  Service was unfriendly and they basically ignored us.  We had to ask for the bill by walking up to the manager, since the server never came by.  

I also had read from previous reviews that the hotel provided a complementary continental breakfast M-F.  Was not the case when I was there May 2022,

title: Weekend visit
text: We stayed at the Archer while celebrating my wife’s birthday in NYC. After asking what brought us in they sent a bottle of wine to our room to kick off the celebration. Awesome customer service and friendly staff in the lobby and the restaurant. Unfortunately, the experience at the rooftop bar did not rise to the level of the rest of the hotel. Unwelcoming and unfriendly manager (assuming manager in gray jacket) and waiter. The manager asked who we were despite the fact that the lobby host called up to advise we were coming up and also unlocked the floor so we could go up.  After confirming our reservation he offered no greeting. The waiter seated us without a word and seemed to be in no hurry to bring us a menu or take our order. We walked out after 10 minutes and spent the evening in the lobby restaurant. We walked past the waiter and manager on the way to the elevator and neither bothered to ask why we were leaving. Despite their actions, we will be back but doubt we will visit the rooftop bar.

title: Excellent customer service
text: My second time at the hotel and I have to say the customer service is excellent here. This is a hotel that wants to please and wants its customers to be happy. Great location- an easy walk from Penn station if you're taking Amtrak. But not so close as to be in the Penn station area. Great breakfast. Room is small, but bathroom was spacious.

title: Hotel perfeito
text: Excelente localização, duas quadras do Bryant Park e diversos pontos turísticos. Vários restaurantes, excelentes, bem próximo. Metrô proximo, duas quadras. Já estive em Nova York outras vezes e achei o quarto com tamanho ok, roupas de cama, travesseiros, edredom e toalhas de ótima qualidade. As amenities de banho, maravilhosas, já conhecia, de um Boticário local. No quarto, tem Nespresso e todos os dias um docinho de produtores locais, deliciosos. Os funcionários sempre simpáticos, solícitos e atenciosos. Fomos super bem recepcionados. A funcionária Tracie, foi maravilhosa e facilitou muito minha estadia. O hotel oferece cortesia, de segunda a sexta, um café da manhã continental, básico, mas gostoso e você não precisa sair, caso não queira. Eu hospedaria novamente. Foi ótimo!

title: Good stay
text:
Jus stayed in fantastic hotel yes room are small but i only use them for sleeping had fantastic time stay are friendly room are great front desk big thumbs uo. My wife left a good review good location...
Tha ks to the staff .
Room 2008 
Good height excelent view best we can ask for

title: Wonderful experience
text: We had a canceled flight late the night of our stay.  I found this hotel.  Everyone was so extremely nice.  —very clean—awesome beds.  This was a great location as well.  You could walk to time square in 10 minutes. Excellent choice!

title: Great Service and Midtown NY Location
text:
What a wonderful visit to New York.  Archer is located in Midtown, walking distance to Times Square, Subways, Financial District, Garment District.  From the time you step in you are greeted heartily by the staff, and made welcome at every turn.  The lobby area, while small is very comfortable with a nice sitting area just outside the lobby, and in the adjacent bar.  The check in process was fast and efficient, and the elevators move very quickly.

The rooms are typical New York(small) but well appointed, desk, outlets throughout(who knew this was a bonus these days), iron, ironing board, safe, Nespresso machine and pods.

Bathroom was tidy, with room to spread out your toiletries. 

There is a rooftop bar that requires reservations, but we they were able to accommodate us every time.  The views from there were spectacular with the Empire State Building in the foreground.

The restaurant just opened the week we arrived, and food and service were on par for a newly opened facility.

They also have a complimentary coffee/tea/pastry service in the morning.

Prices for the bar and restaurant are in line with most other New York hotels.

My only downside was we had to ask for the Body Wash dispenser to be filled twice, which took two days to finally resolve, but they did have bar soap available.

I cannot restate enough how great the staff were, and the location if you want to be near Midtown.

Tip:  Book through the hotel website as prices were cheaper than any other site.

title: Not a good time
text: We did not enjoy our stay at Archer NYC. There were several shortcomings & I do not recommend this place.   It had some nice parts but cramped & rushed & not very friendly  Their famous rooftop bar was nice but the staff were unpleasant & rushed. Their is no place to load or unload and parking is not convenient. A valet service should be the standard. Also, do not try to get ice in this place…

title: Terrific Find in totally unexpected area
text: I choose The Archer thanks to the fab photo's online and its walking proximity to Times Square.  I do not like Times Square! but had to attend a conference being held at the Marriott Marquis.  The Archer was a 10 minute walk - delightful walk, past Bryant Park and along 6th Avenue.  The only horror was having to go to Times Square at all (yuck)....but coming back to The Archer each night of my 3 night stay was delightful!  38th Street isn't the most attractive,...but as soon as you enter the lobby The Archer welcomes you in a very mod, loungey-but-not-too-cool fashion. I just loved it! I am an old school, Amex Platinum, must be 5-start property kind of girl.  SO SO glad it is a new day in the world overall and that I branched out to try The Archer.  The room was beyond scrumptious (altho I could hear my neighbor's door slam shut every night), and the rooftop bar/lounge truly spectacular! So looking forward to a return trip.

title: Modern boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan with amazing rooftop bar!
text: Well priced Boutique hotel in mid-town Manhattan and a short walk to Broadway theaters. Rooms are clean, compact with a great bed & linens. Shower has foot rest for the ladies and magnifying mirror is a plus. Spyglass rooftop bar is amazing!!! Great feature of this lovely hotel. Friendly and helpful front desk staff too. We highly recommend and will stay on our next trip to NYC!

title: Perfekt läge
text:
Mycket trevligt hotell på perfekt läge.
Väldigt fräscht och trevlig inredning.
Rummen är små men det är dom ju alltid i New York.

Baren på taket är trevlig men se till att boka bord och va medveten om att man bara har sina platser i ca 90 min.

Läget är perfekt med gångavstånd till det mesta.

Jag kommer att bo här även i framtiden

title: Great way to enjoy NYC
text: Love the staff, the rooftop, the room (bed right next to the window looking out over Empire State Bldg) , comfy beds, bathtub, and outdoor lobby. Loved the location which allows me to go everywhere. And now I cannot end the review because it’s forcing me to type 200 characters.

title: Bullseye
text:
Always hits the the mark!  Friendly, clean, fun! Just like being at home.

The team is amazing. The management is attentive. The location is perfect. 

Highly recommend this place to everyone. 

Enjoy your stay.

title: Friendly and super effection
text: We had a great stay at this lovely hotel - great staff who were so very friendly and helpful. Though compact, our room had plenty of storage space and a wonderful view of the Empire State Building which we loved! The maid service was excellent as were the bathroom products provided. The hotel is in a brilliant location - easy walking distance to all the best sights. It was easy to get a cab to the ferry port for the trip to see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. We would  definitely stay at The Archer again. Thanks to all for a fabulous stay.

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of NYC!
text:
We visited the Archer Hotel in December 2021 for our first honeymoon for 4 nights. We absolutely loved the hotel. The rooms were gorgeous, staff were absolutely lovely and we loved the little touches like breakfast pastries in the lobby in the mornings. Reception staff were great, assisting me to buy theatre tickets on their computer as mine wouldn't work abroad.

If we were to return to NYC and stay in Manhattan, we would 100% return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the centre of NYC. We had such an incredible honeymoon and can't wait to return in the future!

title: Friedly hotel with
text:
I stayed in this hotel for a Broadway trip with a group of friends, but I had my own room. While the room was TINY, the space was used so efficiently and was very well thought out. The bathroom and shower was large enough to use very comfortably. I really loved the space and the location was very convenient for access to Penn Station and the theatre district. Staff was super friendly, always welcoming guests back upon their return and sending you off with a smile. 

I didn't check out the rooftop bar, but my husband and son did (after they joined me for one night at the end of the stay) and sent me a photo showing the absolutely stellar view of the Empire State Building. 

Note that the included continental breakfast (excellent pastries!) is available only on weekdays.

title: Mejores vistas al Empire State
text:
No hay mejor forma de completar una visita a Nueva York que irse a dormir i despertarse y ver el Empire State en todo su esplendor des de la ventana. Sólo por esta experiencia vale la pena reservar en el Archer Hotel. 

Pero cuidado, porque no todas las habitaciones tienen las mismas vistas, claro. No obstante, siempre tienes otra genial opción de este hotel que es disfrutar de su rooftop bar, el Spyglass, y tomarse una copa enfrente del Empire State. Los clientes del hotel tienen preferencia delante del publico general.

En la habitación no falta de nada: hay secador, plancha, cafetera nespresso, caja fuerte... la cama es comodíssima y el baño es muy amplio. El servicio fue muy atento y me atendieron en español. 

Quizás es uno de los hoteles de gama alta con mejor relación calidad precio, así que si piensas darte un capricho por unas noches, sin duda vale la pena reservar en Archer Hotel.

title: Very nice hotel
text: A well designed hotel, with a very helpful staff, and very clean and comfortable rooms.  The rooms are a bit smaller than what you might find at a Hilton, but not that small, and the bathroom was quite large.  We will definitely stay there the next time we are in NYC.

title: Nice hotel and great location
text:
This is a very nice hotel with a great location. I really enjoyed staying in the Garment District and being close to everything. All the members of staff we encountered were very friendly and accommodating. The view from our Empire room was amazing and we loved the small treats left in our room each day. Lovely products in the bathroom too and nice touches like the slippers (although only one robe was provided)
The downside is that the room is very small - this is of course typical of NY and they have done their best to make the most of the space. However, for this reason I would really only recommend for short stays - it felt claustrophobic staying in there for a week as we did. I would also have preferred a full length mirror on the back of the main door to the room - whilst there are mirrors on the wardrobe and bathroom door, there is not enough space to step back from these and see yourself properly. The room was also quite dusty.
We visited the spyglass rooftop bar on one evening, and whilst the view is great we were told they couldn’t serve outside and we couldn’t drink outside which seemed strange and was disappointing. The downstairs bar is still closed due to Covid even now which is a shame. 
Finally, after seeing reviews on here I had made them aware that it was my partner’s birthday during our stay. I noticed this written in our booking notes as we checked in, but nothing was done to mark this occasion which I found really disappointing - I understand completely that there is no obligation to do anything for this, but I would expect all paying guests to be treated the same. 
Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for a short stay only. I felt that we did overpay for this and could have got better value elsewhere.

title: Archer hotel
text: The website was great to research a room on. The rooms were so clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was superior!   The staff was extremely friendly and helpful!   The rooftop bar had wonderful drinks and delicious  food!

title: Great staff but expensive and broken TV
text:
The staff and location were excellent. 

The room was small (expected) but the TV didn’t work during our 7 night stay. Other guests and reviews reported the same issue. We said to reception three times but they were unable to resolve. For the price we felt we shouldn’t have had problems. 

Temporary free breakfast (covid related?) provided was fine. Just pastries and coffee. Didn’t expect it though so was a nice offer.

Views were nice (paid upgrade). Cocktail bar was nice with the views but limited menu, executed quite averagely. 

Sadly would not stay here again at this price, mostly because of the TV and inability to rectify / manage / compensate. It did not feel like value for money even in NYC.

title: Prima volta a New York
text:
Per la mia prima volta a New York ho soggiornato in questo hotel. Devo dire che è in un’ottima posizione. Centralissimo a pochi passi dalla quinta strada: ha vicino la fermata del metro di Bryant park e in pochi passi si è nella zona centrale della Mid town.
Le camere non sono esagerate come grandezza, sono nello standard americano.noi eravamo in tre con due letti King size, che non sono enormi, ma adattabilissimi. 
Noi eravamo al 14º piano e dalla finestra si poteva vedere chiaramente l’empire state building. 
Il bagno è spazioso, con una doccia grande, e dotato di bagnoschiuma e Shampoo in quantità generose( non i soliti campioncini!). 
Pulizia della stanza effettuata in modo corretto, anche il bagno pulito. Cambio della biancheria del bagno effettuato tutti i giorni nonostante non venisse richiesto. In più ogni sera rientro trovavamo un cioccolatino o un bonbon di bentornato… Cosa molto carina e apprezzata. C’è anche a disposizione una macchina del caffè nespresso. 
Forse l’unico neo della stanza è il fatto che non c’è moltissimo spazio per posizionare le valigie, anche vuote e l’armadio è un po’ piccolo.ma è tutto adattato alla misura.
Il personale è gentilissimo, Cordiale e disponibile per ogni richiesta.
Nel nostro pacchetto era compresa la colazione, che è un po’ misera, ma fattibile… Qualche tipo di brioche, frutta e the di vari tipi, caffè / latte nei dispenser, con possibilità di doggy bag per asporto. 
Sul tetto dell’albergo c’è il Roof bar, come molti alberghi lo prevedono a New York, ed è molto carino con vista diretta sull’Empire State building.
Abbiamo avuto un piccolo inconveniente legato al fatto che la colazione nel weekend non è servita, ma questo probabilmente è stato un errore della nostra agenzia italiana di partenza che non ne era al corrente e ci ha fatto pagare il servizio. 
Segnalo che non sono preparati per il gluten-free e al giorno d’oggi è una pecca non indifferente. 
È indicata una steak house interna ma nei 5 giorni del nostro soggiorno non era attiva. 
Comunque, tutto sommato, lo consiglierei, soprattutto per la posizione.a noi è capitato Mentre giravamo la città di dover rientrare in camera ed è stato comodo avere a disposizione un albergo centrale.

title: None
text: The staff at the Archer deserve a 6. The 4 rating is for the terrible tv reception, you could barley watch it, continuously freezing.
