And there was a nice bar downstairs but was not open and the rooftop bar was by reservation only? Again the staff were very attentive and helpful. And the room was small but nice and very clean.

title: Second Stay Still Happy!
text: This is our second time staying at the hotel and we are happy overall with the stay. There was a small incident during the first night, but the front desk team make it happened for the rest of the stay right after we voice our concern. The room might not be big, but we like the cleanliness of the hotel and comfort of the bed, as well as the friendliness of the staff. Overall the hotel is quiet since it's closer to the middle of the street, but remember to ask for the room away from the elevator (the one right next to the elevator make some noise if you're a light sleeper).

title: Great time, great service
text: My dad and I visited my son and stayed at the Archer. We were impressed with the service—friendly and helpful, from Jonathan at the front desk, to the cleaning staff, to the bartenders at the rooftop bar. Room was small but clean, and had a great view of the Empire State building. Proximity to trains made it easy to get around. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Lovely hotel in great location
text:
My sister and I stayed here for a few days to celebrate special birthdays and we had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location, close to the lovely Bryant Park and Empire State building. We paid extra to have an empire state room and this was well worth it. The staff on the reception desk were friendly and welcoming and we were delighted to discover the hotel offered a complimentary breakfast of pastries, fruit and tea and coffee each morning. This was greatly appreciated! The room was reasonably large for a New York hotel and had a good sized bathroom. The toiletries were lovely! We had a complimentary bottle of water each and each day we had some chocolates left for us. The only issue I had was my mobile struggled to connect to the wi fi in the room, but it worked in the bar area, my sister didn't have a problem though! There were robes and slippers in the room, but they were a pair with a moustache and a pair with lipstick lips on, yet we were two girls booked so would have been nice to have two lipstick ones or else gender neutral.
We had a meal and drinks at the spyglass rooftop bar, really great location with views of the city, lovely food and great service.
It was a lovely trip and we would highly recommend the Archer hotel, hopefully we will be back!

title: Sopravvalutato
text: Ho deciso di conferirgli 3 stelle grazie alla posizione centralissima a 200 metri da Bryant Park e dalla fermata della metro. In 5/10 minuti si possono raggiungere a piedi le zone più belle (Times Square, Rockfeller Centre, Central Park, 5th Avenue ...). Camere molto piccole come capita spesso di trovare a NY (in 3 con 3 valigie si fa un pò fatica a gestire gli spazi) con letti King size: consiglio quelle ai piani più alti con vista Empire State Building. Pulizia nella norma e cambio asciugamani tutti i giorni. Personale gentile e abbastanza preparato. Steak House chiusa ma la zona offre varie opportunità di locali per pranzo e cena. Grande pecca la colazione: nonostante il servizio fosse stato pagato dall'Italia, erano presenti solo due piccoli vassoi con pochi cornetti e qualche muffin ed una ciotolina di frutta (uva e mele). Caffè americano al dispenser. Ho segnalato la celiachia di mia figlia dall'Italia e, nonostante la rassicurazione del servizio dedicato, all'arrivo mi hanno presentato solo la frutta come prodotto. Assolutamente non attrezzati per gluten free. Senza preavviso, nel week end non servono la colazione (nonostante pagata nel pacchetto non è stata rimborsata) e nemmeno nei festivi (tipo lunedì di Pasqua): per fortuna che c'è uno Starbukcs dietro l'angolo. Vista l'ampia scelta di hotel che offre New York, sicuramente non lo consiglierei.

title: Gita a New York
text:
Gita di cinque giorni a New York. Nelle vacanze di Pasqua.Hotel con posizione ottima,centralissima a due passi dalla metro,vicino al Bryant park.camera vista Empire State building.cambio biancheria tutti i giorni(anche se non richiesto).
Reception gentile e disponibile.
Unico neo,la colazione mancante nel week end,non comunicato nella prenotazione(pagata) e l’assenza di cibo senza glutine(comunicato in prenotazione e confermato) che ha creato non pochi disagi.
Per il resto consigliatissimo.

title: Excellent location and service, but amenities fall short.
text:
Location is a 5- walking distance to Bryant Park, NY Library, Empire State Building and Times Square. 
Service is a 5- Front Desk staff and housekeeping go the extra mile to accommodate guest requests. 
Rooms are NY cozy, but bathroom is nice and big.  Cable was intermittent for the entire week and no ability to fix it. Other guests had the same issue. We had to stream on our laptop. 
While we had access to Spyglass, you have to jump through a lot of hoops to getup there, even as a hotel guest.   Food was good, but way overpriced for what you get. 
They advertise providing coffee and pastries every morning from 7-9 AM, but they don’t offer it on weekends and, for some reason, not on Mondays, either.

title: Male male
text:
Se cerchi una buona posizione e non desideri altro dal tuo hotel allora la location è ok.
Pulizia pessima, stanza vista Empire con visuale offuscata da vetri non puliti da non so quanto, polvere ovunque. 
Tutto strettissimo, stanza con doppio king x 3 ingestibile: un risico tra le valigie e x 2 persone il king è troppo piccolo. Anche reception angusta, ti devi districare tra chi entra ed esce  e chi impegnato in operazioni di check. Opzionato soluzione con colazione inclusa, a parte la segnalazione di 1 senza glutine x mia figlia celiaca non rispettata, la colazione è veramente minimal: solo bevande calde the e caffè americano, 2 selezioni di brioches e un po’ di frutta fresca. Ma la cosa curiosa è che senza preavviso, almeno la ns agenzia a noi non ha detto nulla, non servono colazione al sabato, domenica ma anche al lunedì nel ns caso perché era pasquetta… ottimo poi il Wi-Fi e simpatico il bodyguard in ingresso se cerchi sicurezza.
Da evitare come la peste, siamo stati altre volte a New York e c’è di molto molto molto meglio

title: Great hotel with view of Empire State Building
text: Staff and accessible room were wonderful.  Views, waitstaff and drinks at Spyglass Rooftop Restaurant  were great but food was mediocre.  Location was convenient and within walking distance of Morgan Library, Bryant Park, Empire State Building,  and NY Library.

title: Great stay at The Archer
text: Lovely hotel with a great location. The rooms are on the “cozier” side, however they’re well designed. I really loved the bathroom products as Malin +Goetz are one of my favorite brands and the beds were very comfortable.  The rooftop bar was an added bonus with a killer view of The Empire State Building.  I’d say what pushed this to a 5 for me however was the service.  The entire staff was so accommodating and even went the extra mile to send up a cupcake for my son who has a birthday next week.  They also helped us out with some very last minute reservations on Saturday night at an excellent Steakhouse.  Special shout-out to Jonathan for all of his help with transportation and our ridiculous amount of luggage:-).  So, yep we’ll be back

title: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION
text: Just half a block from 5th Avenue and within walking distance of many attractions, the Archer Hotel is perfect for the hardcore NY tourists who plan to hit the pavement all day.  Its cleverly designed rooms make the most out of a very small space with hidden storage under the bed and plenty of shelf space in the bathroom. Carpet in hallway and room showed a little wear and tear (which is why I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5), but our subway tiled bathroom was in tip-top shape.   A very cost-effective option given the location.   No room service (stayed in November 2021) with a basic continental breakfast offered in the lobby.  Hotel guests are guaranteed a spot in the popular rooftop bar or you can buy a bottle of wine and take it to your room.  Helpful front desk.  Closest subway stop is a 10 -minute walk away in Times Square.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Nice hotel centrally located, great staff. Tracy and Jacob were so very kind and helpful. Both went out of their way to meet all of our needs. Rooms small but clean. Only ate at a restaurant once. Simple menu but good food.

title: Great location and service
text: If you are looking for a unique hotel with a great location and service, then the Archer is for you.  We loved our room with a view of Empire State Building, the continental breakfast and most of all people who checked us in/out and gave us wonderful advice.  Five stars 🌟

title: Super staff , great location
text: We had a number of rooms for a small group and everyone commented how good the staff were. The location is great with lots of spots to pick up a coffee nearby and we enjoyed the rooftop bar. The rooms arent huge but everything is exactly where you need it from sockets to nespresso maker, slippers, robes and power cables to charge tech all made for a comfortable stay. We will be back

title: Awesome place!
text: we had 3 rooms - great location, great staff, clean, rooms a little small but not inconvenient at all - just worth knowing going in, they have set them up very functional, rooftop bar is amazing to have access to, I wish I could remember all the friendly staff's names - a couple were cory and evan but all were great! Stay was March 30-Apr 3.

title: Amazing Staff
text: We Stayed at this Hotel late March 2022, for 4 nights.  It’s in a good location, mid-town, with not too many rooms but large enough to be comfortable. The rooms are small even by NY standards but clean with maid service daily.  The beds & pillows are super comfortable it felt like we were sleeping on clouds.  Bathroom shower was good with lovely fluffy towels and hotel has a great rooftop bar with views of Empire State build and surrounding area.  Facilities are a bit limited, BUT the outstanding feature of this Hotel is it’s staff.  We were blown away with their customer service, nothing was too much trouble. They are so friendly, professional and always went that extra mile to absolutely make sure you have everything you want or indeed could want.   A problem was never an issue to them, if you needed something they would sort it for you. Tremendous customer service. We must mention  and pay very special thanks to Jonathan, Scott and Euan, these guys really helped us out when we had a problem along with Gabby, Andrew & Tracie.  Hope we haven’t forgotten anyone, you guys made our stay truly memorable.  We would not hesitate to stay here again whenever we return.. Thanks to all you guys 👍

title: None
text: 5 friends stayed 3 nights this last week and had a perfect trip.  Your hotel was a big part of that.  the location and walking distance to tourist attractions, the cleanliness, the roof top bar, but most especially the front desk staff and Jackie, treated us great!  I'm a travel agent with Frosch Travel and will definitely spread the word.  Todd Utikal

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This hotel had a great mid town location very close to Bryant Park. The staff were excellent with above average service. The restaurant recommendations were superb and the beds were heavenly. The surrounding area has a local charm that makes you feel like you're off the beaten tourist path.

title: Fabulous view of the Empire State, comfortable room, great staff and service
text: I was only at the Archer for one night but would return in a flash. Really comfortable quiet guest room with a great view, fun and caring staff, and a wonderful rooftop bar.  Extremely well located too, near Bryant Park.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
I was looking for a hotel with good views of the Empire State Building for myself and wife as it was her 40th birthday.
I booked the Archer Hotel due to the promotional photos of the King Empire Room. The photos are very accurate with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building and beyond.
The room is a good size for a City room especially the bathroom. 
The hotel is modern, clean and tidy.
The staff are professional, happy and chatty. Nothing was too much trouble for them. It was lovely to return to the room which had been cleaned to a very high standard, after being out all day.
COVID has obviously affected how hotels can operate. So a complimentary breakfast of coffee and pastries, is now provided in the lobby bar. Very welcome when not expected!!!
When booking the room I had asked whether a bottle of Champagne and balloons could be provided for my wife’s 40th birthday. On her birthday we went out for the day and when we returned a bottle of champagne on ice, balloons and a birthday card were in the room. A lovely surprise for my wife. So thank you to the staff for organising it.
The hotel is in the right location for visiting the majority of Manhattan by foot and has an abundance of restaurants within walking distance.
An excellent hotel which added to our New York experience.

title: Great hotel made for a great vacation and stay
text:
All the reviews are 100% on point. I usually do not write reviews but our experience at The Archer deserves a positive review. 
The front desk and customer service makes all the difference in a hotel. We traveled late March with our family of4 (kids ages 5 and 7). I read the rooms were small but the efficiency in the rooms did not make us feel cramped. 
The beds were comfortable and the cleanliness and housekeeping deserves a mention. The upkeep of rooms are on point and coming in from a long day and seeing a clean room with made beds made us feel so relaxed. Please tip a few dollars a day. They deserve it with the extra attention the housekeepers give! The candies and chocolates were our kids favorite when they came back to the room each day.
We had the Empire State room view. I’m sure the higher floors had a better view but floor 12 didn’t disappoint. And we liked the window can be cracked to get a little air.
There’s a small fridge - standard hotel size - that’s not a mini bar so we kept leftovers in there. And the complimentary pastries and fruit on weekday mornings was a nice surprise treat. 
We ordered pick up across the street at Havana since we got in late Friday night and it was delicious. We got the scallops and steak. 
While you can hear some noise from the street it didn’t bother us. The hotel is on a pretty quite street but so close to Times Square and several options of catching the subway about 4-5 blocks away - with Grand Central being one. 
The front desk service was amazing and they are so attentive and accommodating for every need. The kids loved picking out slinkies from the toy box. It might be their most favorite toy and they got lots of souvenirs.
I can’t say enough about The Archer. If you’re on the fence, just book it. Many things can be overlooked but Customer Service and cleanliness cannot for us and this will keep us coming back.

title: Fantastic stay at The Archer
text: We had a fantastic stay at The Archer Hotel - everyone were super friendly and professional.  They all made us feel totally at home.  Room is cosy for sure - it’s a tight squeeze for two but they have designed the room very well, great storage and amenities and we felt it was absolutely fine for our stay.  Had an amazing view of the Empire State which added to the pleasure!  The bed was so comfortable!! The most comfortable I have slept in!!  Spyglass Bar was great.  Location is very central to everything you would want to visit and see.

title: ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️
text: Had the best experience in every way possible at our stay at the Archer Hotel in New York!  From the customer service as soon as you walk in the door to check out!  Everything about this place is a Five Star experience!  Friendly staff, very accommodating, clean surroundings with a safe environment to name a few. The rooms are tiny but very “high end” from the bedding to the Nespresso coffee machines in every room. The amenities have all the comforts of home. A must stay hotel, I will be going back the next time I visit NY!  Thank you to all the staff!

title: Birthday getaway
text: Such a delightful stay celebrating my boyfriend’s birthday! The staff was incredibly warm, welcoming and they go above and beyond to make you feel at home and are extremely attentive. The room was very comfortable and the bed was heavenly.  Enjoyed the beautiful view from Spyglass rooftop and is a definite must see! Perfect location and there isn’t anything negative that could be said. Looking forward to visiting again!!

title: Perfect place to visit NYC
text:
Loved this hotel!! It was classy and quaint.  The rooms are small but the use of space was totally comfortable and the bathroom is quite large , clean and well appointed.  The staff was so very helpful! 
Bonus: Go to the rooftop bar , Spyglass, and be utterly amazed at the view!  The Empire State Building is RIGHT THERE!!!  Just delightful!  Highly recommend!!

title: We liked The Archer But Rooms  Were Tiny by NY Standards
text: Archer was a nice boutique hotel with a cool but tiny  rooftop bar and tiny rooms to match. Rooms were great but small. The chair by desk, the closet to bed impossible to get by. No restaurant on weekends. No bar on weekends. The toilet seat would not stay up. Location was good. Amenities in room were nice like candy at night, great service by front line, housekeeping, front desk, bar employees.

title: Quiet & centrally located boutique hotel
text: We had an excellent time during our stay at the Archer. Stayed on the 20th floor. Very quiet and comfortable room. The front desk service was outstanding! Great drinks and view from rooftop restaurant. Light breakfast included in stay. We will definitely return in the future.

title: Amazing hotel with amazing view
text: Staff was courteous, very helpful, and ensured our check in and check out was a breeze. I booked the room with the view of the Empire State Building and it was 100% worth it! I highly recommend this trip to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Great experience!
text:
Everything was great for our first time visit. The staff  was top notch...always attentive, professional and helpful. The room was small, but that was expected.  The mattress was very comfortable and room was extremely quiet, so sleep was great. 
We were given a $20 credit to the roof bar, Spyglass, with our room reservation - which is MUST see. Absolutely beautiful views. 
Thank you, Archer. We will be back.

title: A room with a view
text: Archer Hotel New York  is a nice boutique hotel in a convenient location, between 5th and 6th avenue. It ticked all the boxes: perfectly cleaned every day, attractive decor, comfortable beds with high-end bed linen, fast hot shower. I liked the complimentary coffee and croissants from 7am in the week, and at the weekend, there's Culture Espresso across the street. My room had a view of the Empire State Building which was beautiful. The service was excellent. The room was cleaned perfectly every day and the housekeeping staff left little treats  - like a cookie or a brownie. People like working there, and they go the extra mile. On my last day I overheard Evan, the front desk manager, thanking his team for a great job - clearly he values his team as well as his guests and that contributes to the great vibe. I did have to ask for a high room - twice, when I booked and again when I arrived - and without the view, the room would not have been special.  I did a lot of writing in that room and it made a difference. I also requested and got a late checkout. The room had two queen beds and I was on my own so it didn't feel particularly small. It was very cold out and the hotel felt cosy. There are a lot of boutique hotels in New York. What differentiated Archer Hotel was the vibe and the view. I would stay again, either on business or with my partner, but only in a room with a view.

title: Perfect in every way
text:
Myself and my partner stayed at the Archer Hotel for a 40th Birthday trip in February 2022. We could not have asked for more. Jackie arranged for us to stay in a beautiful Empire Suite which had the most incredible views of the Empire state building. 

Pro's:

The room had everything we needed, including details like charging leads next to the bed, gowns and slippers and even an an umbrella. There was plenty of storage for a city centre hotel room (with space under bed for our cases) and possibly the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever stayed in. The bathroom was lovely and a very good size and everything was immaculately clean. 

The location of this hotel is perfect for tourists. It's less than 10 minutes from Times Square, and the same from Macey's in the other direction and subway stations on every line in short walking distance.

Every member of staff we encountered were so helpful and friendly, it's that which really makes a difference to a trip - so thank you to the team at the Archer Hotel. 

Cons:

There genuinely weren't any! The was a mix up with out food order in the Spytop Rooftop Bar on our first night which meant our food was delayed. It was a genuine mix up and the lovely waitress was very apologetic and arranged some free drinks while we waited. When the food arrived it was delicious, and reasonably priced for a hotel bar. 

I've already recommended this hotel to some clients & friends who are due to visit later in the year. And if we're lucky enough to return to NYC in the future, we won't stay anywhere else!

title: Simple and Comfortable
text: The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and well maintained.  While the rooms were small, they were surprisingly well appointed, taking advantage of space for storage.  Lobby area was functional for working or meeting others.  Roof top bar had a great view.  Important factor was the rooms were quiet.  Hotel not located on a busy NYC street, which makes a big difference for excellent sleep quality.  Looking forward to return visit.

title: Outstanding stay
text: Do yourself a favour and do not hesitate to book this hotel. Staff are incredible, prime location and excellent amenities. Most comfortable bed I have ever slept on! Staff made an extra effort on arrival for my birthday. Always helpful and friendly on reception and amazing views. This is the only hotel I would consider when staying in NYC

title: First time in NYC
text: Such a lovely time. Hotel was beautiful, clean and tidy. Staff were also very helpful, friendly and knowledgable. Would definitely recommend anyone to stay here! Also amazing view of the Empire State Building from our room!

title: Spring break in NYC
text: This hotel had an exceptionally friendly staff and offered to help in anyway possible.  Location was quiet but close enough for us to walk to Times Square and the theatre.  We got connecting rooms which made traveling with our friends an even more fun experience.  Our rooms were comfortable, clean and updated.  I highly recommend this hotel for a visit to NYC.

title: Quick weekend getaway
text:
This place was clean , perfectly located and had great service. We stayed on 15th floor - quiet .
We had to extend our stay and they were very amenable. Bed comfortable 
We appreciated the complimentary water and caramels !

title: Great vibe!
text: The Archer hotel was exactly what we were looking for. It’s conveniently located and is close to other great bars/coffee shops and restaurants. The staff is really warm and professional upon check-in and for the duration of our stay. The room is tiny for sure but clean, comfortable and quiet. The best part of the rooftop bar with magnificent views of the Empire State Building. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Bravo Archer Hotel
text: Very professional and welcoming staff.  This is a little gem of a hotel with a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. Small room but this is NY and you are out most of the day. Very comfortable bed and amenities. The staff was lovely and very friendly and accommodating from the moment I stepped out of my car -- thanks, Jonathan! Bar with sweeping views.

title: First visit, won’t be the last
text: Great location and very kind, helpful and courteous staff! Decorated our room for our honor grad and Tracie at check-in even helped try to secure museum tickets. Typical small NYC hotel room but they make great use of the space. Very quiet in room (no street noise!!) and comfortable bed. Quick elevator with no wait. Enjoyed the little treats left in the room. Held our luggage after check out. Will stay here next time we visit! Thanks Archer!

title: Thank you Archer Hotel
text: A brief 3 days in NYC and we are so glad we picked the Archer Hotel. From the smiling face of Tracie at the front desk when we arrived, to the moment we left, we couldnt have felt more at home here. The location in midtown couldnt be better. The rooms looking towards the Empire State Building are stunning. We slept with the curtains open. Rooms not that small in our opinion and the beds very comfortable. We know where we will be staying again next visit. Thanks again Tracie for looking after us.

title: A Hotel Experience not a Hotel Stay…
text: There are so many wonderful things to say about this hotel. Truthfully, after reading some recent reviews left by other guests, my expectations were elevated in a way that they never are and I am pleased to say I was still WOWed :) we checked in with Tracie Friday late morning on 2/18 after being greeted at the door by Jonathan. I didn’t expect to have a room ready but they still offered to check before we checked our luggage with them. We already had plans to check out some spots so it was no issue to wait. When we got back mid-afternoon we were promptly checked in and when we arrived at our room, not only were the delicious caramels waiting for us, they also left a cupcake with a lovely personal note (we had told them we were visiting for my daughters birthday which was earlier in February). The room itself was designed very well, very clean. The bathroom was bigger than expected which was perfect for 2 adult women to have plenty of room to get ready. On the second night of our stay the staff left us another surprise treat in our room. That same evening the staff was super helpful getting us a last minute seat in the rooftop bar for dinner. Always accommodating, always a smile and a hello and never made us feel like a burden.  As we checked out the next morning, Jonathan was again at the door- he asked if we enjoyed the cupcake left for us, which just made me smile that he remembered. He then checked our bags for us while we explored some more of the city and when we arrived back to leave for our flight, there was a cab waiting and bottles of water for the trip. I have stayed in NYC several times but never have I had an experience like this one! We will definitely be back. Yes, staffing was a little short due to Covid so first floor bar was closed which was a bummer and yes, I have stayed in bigger hotel rooms but I promise you that NOTHING about their service is even remotely small. Thank you to the whole staff for an outstanding experience and a special mention to Jonathan and Tracie for you created 2 more raving fans!!

title: Uncomfortably small rooms
text:
Literally the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in.  No joke.  

The website indicates 197 sq feet yet none of the three rooms the warm and accommodating on-duty manager showed me got to that square footage.  They were all in the 150 -170 sq foot range.  Basically a large walk in closet.  Very small, even by NYC standards.  Apparently their largest room maxes out at 215sq feet.  

Also, many of the rooms face a dark indoor corridor facing commercial office buildings.  

The hotel marketing the rooms as “cozy” while promoting the under bed storage is disingenuous and frankly insulting. The rooms are uncomfortable. Especially if you are a couple and spending more than 1 night.  

Yes they have nice toiletries, though the one (only) Frette bathrobe in the room is so thin it can’t possibly dry an adult size human. And, they do offer Nespresso coffee pods.   

The staff was pleasant and professional, and there is somewhat of a cool yet unwelcoming vibe to the overall hotel aesthetic.  

The breakfast consisted of pastries and coffee.  Only served Monday through Friday currently as their restaurant is still closed.  

The location is convenient.  

Overall we regret choosing this hotel for our three night  stay. 

The room was just too uncomfortable for two people, even though we spent most of our time out and about.  The extra amenities they offer didn’t make up for this principle and critical flaw.  

One and done.

title: The BEST hotel stay & the BEST hotel staff!
text: We were in NYC for NY Fashion Week (& over Valentine's weekend) and while there we had a pretty intense schedule in a city we had never visited so we were a bit on edge, but the INCREDIBLE staff at the Archer New York made us feel at home and and at ease. To begin with, the hotel itself is beautiful, clean and in a great location. From the moment we walked in the lobby, the entire staff had genuine smiles on their faces, were personable, made eye contact while talking to us and went above and beyond anytime we needed anything. After finding out it was our first time in NYC they switched our room to one with the most amazing view of the Empire State Building. Each and every staff member would kindly greet us every single time we came in and out (which was a lot), I have traveled a lot and stayed in many incredibly nice hotels, but the staff at the Archer put all of the others to shame with their first-class service and attention to detail. They were invested in us--asking and genuinely caring about how our day was going and about the fashion shows and photo shoots my niece was involved in. They would remember and inquire about something after it occurred. We quickly became invested in them as well and tried to reciprocate the kindness we were shown because we greatly appreciated it. When we left we had made friends with a terrific group of people that we will never forget. If you are looking for a beautiful place to stay, located in a very great part of Manhattan where you will have the pleasure of encountering the nicest and most genuine staff you've ever met, make your reservations now for The Archer Hotel New York--you won't regret it! P.S. Shout out to Corey, Andrew, Tracie, Jonathan, Gabby & Scott (and everyone else on staff) for making our trip something we will talk about for the rest of our lives.

title: Highly Recommend
text: Great location if you don’t mind a 15 minute walk. Splurge for a room with a view of the Empire State Building. Rooms a little small but nice. Rooftop bar is a destination in on its own! Mask mandate was lifted while we visited - can’t wait for showing vaccine card is as well!

title: Great service, very clean, and super quiet!
text: We spent a great Valentine's weekend in New York with the highlight being the Billy Joel concert. I looked for a great hotel to stay in and found the Archer. When we walked in on Friday night we felt very comfortable. The room was small (typical New York City) but well equipped. We were on the 20th floor. Bed was comfortable, room was quiet. Plenty of hot water and it was very clean! We checked out on Sunday morning, but wanted to tour a bit more, and Jonathan was super helpful in checking our bags for the day. When we returned we needed a cab to get to the train station and he ran down 38th street to find one for us! We loved the experience and will be back!

title: A new NYC favorite place to stay!
text: A true NYC experience! Small rooms, which is to be expected in NYC. Clean, very friendly and helpful! Great patio bar with a view. As someone who lived in NYC prior and was back to visit, I was very impressed and will be staying here again. Great location without it being too touristy. Highly recommend!

title: Great option for midtown!
text: We stayed here for the weekend as a jumping off point for going to see some Broadway shows. We loved it! The rooms are clean and chic (they’re small, but that’s NYC). The room was (surprisingly) very quiet given how close you are to busy midtown. We loved the rooftop bar too. The staff couldn’t have been more helpful. Great stay!

title: AMAZING!!
text: This hotel is absolutely amazing! Stayed in other hotels in NYC and this is my absolute favourite. The rooms are fabulous, and have the most comfortable beds ever! Definitely if you can get a room with a view of the Empire State, you will not regret it! Staff were unreal, so sweet and helpful and ready to give you local recommendations. Special shout out to Evan and Andrew who were absolutely amazing! Also if you get a chance visit the Spyglass bar on the top floor. It was my birthday and the staff went above and beyond for it, especially Priscilla who brought me out a fabulous chocolate cake! Honestly would give the hotel more than 5 stars if I could! Thank you so much ❤️

title: You MUST visit this hotel!!!
text: This is our 4th or 5th stay at Archer NYC and you have to experience it for yourself! It’s central location (close to GCT/midtown/broadway makes it ideal for everything NYC! My favorite part of Archer is the STAFF-SO KIND AND HELPFUL with anything and everything from check in to dinner recommendations to room cleaning/requests!!! The room is chic NYC style with a small refrigerator if needed. You can request a room with views of the Empire State Building or simply go up to their food top bar and see for your self. If it is possible to feel “at home” while away from home-this is the place! Thank you Archer and see you again soon!

title: Winter trip to NYC
text:
We had the most incredible time. We dreamt about our trip for a long time.  The Archer is fantastic. Comfortable rooms, the view of the Empire State Building is stunning, the floor to ceiling windows ~ gorgeous, the bathroom fixtures and tile.. outstanding, yey Nespresso machine.  We had the valentines special ~ chocolates, a game and mimosas!!  The employees professional and easy going ~ great mix of cool and collected. 

Note kids under 21 are not able to stay at the rooftop Spyglass past 4 p.  It was a selling point for us and I didn’t realize that. The employees were generous with some time where we could check out the amazing view and take pictures.

We would stay again and highly recommend.

title: Reservation system
text:
The Archer's reservtion system is disgraceful.  

1.  I received online code promising 20% discount on my next stay.  When I put in code, I recevied message that code wasn't valid.  I wondered if it was just the dates selected and tried 5 other sets of days - none were valid.  That's a pretty fraudalent promotion.
2.  Even after this, I decided I'd still stay there and went to book online.  The system won't book me as a guest because it said there was an account associated with my name (I've stayed in Florham Park previously).  I didn't have any record of an account though and hit button to retreive password.  When I put in my email (three separate attempts), it gave message that there was no account with that email address.  
3.  I tried 3 seperate times to call hotel directly to resolve.  The first (only issue #1 had happened at this point) went to front desk.  They hurried me off phone saying the discount would show up if I just kept proceeding (it didn't).  The second time the person answering said he would transfer me to front desk only to disconnect call.  The third went to Lee who patiently heard me whole story and said she would raise it to manager level - only after she transfered me, the phone range for about 20 times before disconnecting.

title: Amazing view of the Empire State Building
text:
The Archer Hotel was the perfect place for us to stay on our first visit to New York.  The staff on reception were friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel was stylish and cosy, very clean and our room was great.  We had a full view of The Empire State Building from our window which was a real surprise!  The room was a good size, had everything you needed, very comfortable king size bed and great bathroom with lovely powerful shower. Another highlight was the great bar on the top floor called The Spyglass serving the best cocktails and a good range of wine, beer and delicious light bites.  You must try the rosemary chips and the Wintertime cocktail, they are awesome! The bar staff there were lovely and a special mention for Priscilla who made our two nights visiting the bar such great fun and making us feel completely welcome - all part of the holiday.  the Archer Hotel is perfectly situated to visit all the main points of interest, the metro, great shops and restaurants.
Would highly recommend this Hotel.

title: Smallest room in NY
text: I’ve stayed at Archer in Napa so was looking forward to another great visit. At check in they weren’t full and I asked if there was any way to get a room with a view/higher up—only available if I paid. Ok, fair enough. Our room on the 8th floor had no room to set a suitcase down (under bed area available but that’s not practical when it’s 12 degrees and you’re searching for the right clothes etc) and with two people and two suitcases it was a constant state of maneuvering. So much so that we didn’t have housekeeping any of the the three days because the room was in constant disarray and I couldn’t figure how they’d clean around our things.  Opened the curtains to the small window to see the side of a building. Wouldn’t have been that bad but the window is so small that the room was quite dark since not much light could come in. The location is good  for what we wanted to do this trip (shopping, theater) and we enjoyed the rooftop bar on the first night (hence the two stars) but I think there are better hotels for the price/location.

title: Comfortable stay in great location
text: Really nice experience for a work trip where I didn't have a huge amount of time to be in the hotel but when I did it was incredibly comfortable, from espresso machine in the room to the excellent beds and showering facilities. Really friendly and helpful staff greeting you by name at the door, incredible view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar and a location which places most things you'd want to see in New York within a 5 minute walking radius (including our office on the same street!). Although no gym facilities you're spoilt for choice with surrounding gyms and cafe/breakfast options should you miss out on the continental option at the hotel. Overall, for the time I got to relax in the hotel it was excellent.

title: Problème de gestion générant un double encaissement
text:
Globalement satisfaite de l’hôtel qui offre une bonne prestation et une bonne situation géographique au milieu de tous les centres d’intérêts. En revanche, je poste un avis négatif car l’hôtel m’a débité 2 fois le montant de la réservation pour un total de près de 4000€ !  Débité une fois le jour de mon arrivée et une 2nde fois lors du check-out. 

Et difficile de leur faire comprendre la situation après un appel auprès d’eux et 2 mails avec les pièces justificatives, je reste dans l’attente d’un retour de leur part. Cette situation me met financièrement dans une situation très embarrassante.

title: Hidden gem in Midtown
text:
We stayed at the Archer from December 23-29, and loved it.

The staff were very accommodating and attended to our every request - housekeeping was of excellent standards and left gifts every day, and the front desk staff were very helpful.

The rooftop bar is 21+ but as our daughter is underage, they let us go up to take a photo of the view before 4PM (this is just one example of their great service).

Breakfast was a good adjustment during Covid, by making it a "grab-and-go" system, it had a wide range of selections and was efficient.

While the room is small, it is a good use of space and doesn't seem its size, for how well they use it. And we had a wonderful view of the Empire State building from our room!

Would definitely come back here, cannot recommend enough.

title: Lovely room and stay
text: Stayed at the archer during visit to Bryant Park winter market. Close enough to Penn station to walk with luggage. Room was very small but had a nice standing shower and comfortable bed. Overall very nice stay!

title: Relaxing haven, amazing staff, great base for exploring
text:
The friendly and helpful staff, the great location for exploring, the clean and well-appointed rooms, amazingly large and comfy bed - all helped make our New York visit an unforgettable experience.

What gave this hotel a place in our hearts forever was that we got engaged in their gorgeous rooftop bar with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building behind us. It was absolutely the perfect location for it and the bar staff were great - even the other guests gave their congratulations and was a brilliant atmosphere!

It was a magical time - the staff were so friendly (even in emails before we arrived) and it is a place that we will never forget - thankyou.

title: Great Stay!
text:
I realize this property is really pushing for that 5 star rating. They do everything right.  Rooms are clean and comfortable, customer service was great, location and price both good as well. This property should absolutely be considered for your next stay in Manhattan. I may be a tough critic here but my honest experience was a solid 4 stars. It just didn't quite have that 5 star feel. I need a "wow" to get me there. 

Regarding size of the rooms... this is normal. If there is enough space to walk around all three sides of the bed(s) in your Manhattan hotel then you've done well. No negative marks from my perspective.

title: Great NYC Gem!
text:
So many nice things to say about the Archer! We stayed over the holidays as its convenient to Byrant Park,  Broadway and Rock Center.   3 generations of family stayed and we all enjoyed the hotel and agreed we'd absolutely stay again.

Hotel is very well appointment - a modern yet comfortable vibe.   While the rooms are small, the layout is efficient and uses every inch of space!   Super comfy bed and great bathroom. And the staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful!

While the restaurant wasn't open at the time of our visit, the hotel put out complimentary coffee and pastries each morning.  We also enjoyed the roof top bar with amazing views of the Empire State Building.

title: Zu Gast bei Freunden bzw. Archer oder nichts
text:
Es war dieses Jahr bereits unser 4 Aufenthalt im Archer Hotel New York...

Ich lasse meiner Begeisterung für dieses Hotel wie immer freien Lauf, dies wird man beim Lesen dieser Bewertung sicherlich feststellen...

Zum Hotel selbst muss ich nicht viel sagen bzw. schreiben... ein wunderschönes Boutique-Hotel im Herzen von Mannhatten. Zentral gelegen an der 38th / 6 Avenue

Egal was man an Aktivitäten in der geilsten Stadt der Welt vorhat, dieses Hotel ist der ideale Ausgangspunkt:

Grand Central Station, Madison Square Garden, Macys, Time Square, Broadway, Port Authority und vieles andere - alles liegt sehr zentral!

Alleine diese Tatsache hebt das Archer deutlich von vielen anderen Hotels in NYC ab.

Gewiss - Hotel kann heute fast jeder, großes Haus mit vielen Zimmern, zweckmäßig eingerichtet und sauber - ein Standard wie man in oft findet und eigentlich auch erwartet.

Aber hier trennt sich die Spreu vom Weizen, hier beginnt das Archer Hotel sich so wohltuend von der oftmals unpersönlichen Konkurrenz abzuheben. Es sind die vielen Kleinigkeiten, die Aufmerksamkeiten, das immer zuvorkommende Personal im Haus. 

Die  Mitarbeiter im Archer verstehen es den Gast zu verwöhnen, ohne auch nur im Ansatz aufdringlich zu wirken!

Beispiel: In 14 Tagen Urlaub immer wieder vergessen Briefmarken zu besorgen, die Leute am Frontdesk haben das zufällig mitbekommen. 

Gib uns die Karten, wir erledigen das für dich. 

Sendungen von Amazon wurden geliefert, ohne große Worte wurde uns alles in Zimmer gelegt. 

Jeden Tag irgendwelche Aufmerksamkeiten wie Kekse oder mal nen kleinen Kuchen aufs Zimmer bekommen. Wow - Spitzenklasse

Ich könnte die Liste wahrscheinlich noch um ein vielfaches erweitern, dies allerdings würde den Rahmen sprengen. Die Zimmer werden wie immer gründlich gereinigt, es ist einfach perfekt.

Am letzten Tag bekamen wir dann vom Chef persönlich einen Extra Late Check-Out weil unser Taxi zum JFK Airport erst um 16.00Uhr abfuhr!

Die kräftigen Jungs von der Tür / Security waren allesamt ein  Gewinn und trugen ebenso zur Wohlfühlatmosphäre bei! Schade dass die Tage immer so schnell vergehen!

Für mich steht abschließend fest: Archer Hotel NYC oder nichts!

Für mich dass Hotel in NYC!  

Ich hoffe Ihr bleibt gesund! ich freue mich schon wieder auf meine nächsten Aufenthalte in 2022! Grüße, Thomas (Tom) Heger

title: Mother /Daughter weekend
text: Perfect location for walking to many top areas!  Staff was very helpful; room was ready before check in time.  Room was well appointed and CLEAN!  Loved the in room coffee selection.  Bar on top of hotel has an amazing view of Empire State Building.

title: Great stay here, would definitely recommend
text: Rooms were a bit small, but can't be helped being in NYC and all. The room had pretty much all the amenities I wanted and staff complied perfectly if something was off. I did have some trouble with the AC, where it was confusing to turn on the heat or not. In the end, I mainly just left it off. The style of the hotel was what caught my attention in the first place, being a sleak, dark modern style that's not too flashy but very professional. The location is great to explore the city and walkable to many restaurants. I do wish there was a fitness center though. Overall, I had a great time at my stay and would recommend anyone visiting to stay here.

title: Incredible Stay - HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
text: This was our first trip to NYC and we couldn’t have been happier with our stay at the Archer. Beautiful property and conveniently located to everything. We literally walked most places or took a quick Uber. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the spyglass rooftop bar, it was the perfect place to grab a cocktail and take in the incredible views of the Empire State Building! If you’re considering staying here, do it! You will not regret it.

title: Wonderful staff, great location, most comfy bed
text: The staff was fantastic (they are the reason I booked a room - I had come to Spyglass in the summer and everyone who worked at Archer was so accommodating and helpful, that I chose the Archer as my place to stay in December) .  The room was beautiful and clean, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I'd ever experienced (every other bed has been hard as a rock and thoroughly uncomfortable, this bed was a dream - I'd almost come back just for the bed). The location is great, with an excellent view of the Empire State building from my room and from Spyglass.  Every time I emailed with questions before the visit, your concierge was prompt with replies and very helpful. And it was quiet.  I will definitely stay again.

title: Great service and great staff!
text: My family and I enjoyed a lovely weekend at Archer hotel. The room was small but clean and cozy. The staff without exception was the best we have ever experienced. The location was great and walking distance to most of the attractions on our list. The area is safe and felt comfortable walking at night. We love Archer and will be back next year!

title: Good Hotel
text:
Very nice hotel to stay in while enjoying the sight and sounds of New York, we found all the staff very friendly and helpful. Like most hotels in the city the rooms are not big but have everything you need after a day site seeing or enjoying a show. The Spyglass bar is a good addition to the hotel overlooking the Empire state building but you pay for the view through the cost of the drinks.
Plus sides to the hotel -
Its Staff - right up there with the very best we have come across.
The central location
The cost
Downside's to the hotel -
No restaurant at the time we were there (Dec 21) 
The breakfast pastries were taken away bang on 09.00, i seen a few grumpy guests and 09.02 
Our room overlooked an office space and was as easy for them to see you as you to see them.

Overall the hotel is a good, central place to stay and reasonably priced well worth a visit

title: Mother/Daughter Trip
text: We had a lovely stay at the Archer Hotel. We spent most of our time out and about, so our room was a cozy, quiet, and comfortable haven after a long day on the town. A few negatives, there is no restaurant or cafe on the premises, so no room service. You do have to walk a few blocks away to find decent dining. Our room door was accidentally left ajar by the cleaning staff twice, which made me feel uneasy, but our belongings were not disturbed. The staff was very friendly & accommodating. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, our bed was clean and comfortable, but the lack of amenities was not good value to me.

title: Excellent experience!
text: My family and I enjoyed our stay. We loved the pillows and beds, so comfy; the Nespresso machine was the best. All the workers were so polite. The hotel has a pleasant atmosphere and attentive service. We asked for a fridge and they provided us one. The service regarding the cleaning and hygiene was excellent!! We definitely enjoyed our experience.

title: Look no further!
text: The Archer New York exceeded all of my expectations. The staff were friendly & helpful. The hotel was an easy walk to several prime NYC locations - Times Square, Broadway, Bryant Park, Herald Square, and the Empire State Building. The room was clean & spacious (at least by NYC standards), and the treats at turndown were local & delicious! I've stayed in many NYC hotels over the years and this is the first to which I will absolutely return. I've found my home away from home in NYC.

title: Beautiful but NYC sized
text: The staff was incredibly service oriented.  When I arrived I sent out dry cleaning, they let me take part of the bar area meeting with some colleagues, they helped me pack some expensive bottles of whisky for my trip home, etc.  Really nice experience.  The rooms are nice looking and the bathrooms new with nice finishes.  My only issue is that the rooms are small.  It was fine for 1 person for 7 days.  But if I was with my wife, for any period of time, it would have been difficult to accommodate our luggage and clothes.  While small rooms are endemic to Manhattan, it’s still something you should be aware of.  178 sqft is not much space.  That said, the location was nice and the price was excellent as compared to hotels of similar quality in Midtown.  When I go back solo, I’ll stay there.

title: It's on par with big chain hotels and didn't live up to the hype
text: In all honesty, the hotel was fine and is in great location for walking to all the tourist locations and to the SOHO, LES and Greenwich village. I was simply underwhelmed because I read so many reviews that highly rated the Archer hotel and it didn't live up to the hype. The rooms are small, it only had one trash can in the bathroom which meant that I needed to have a bag collecting trash so that the room didn't look messy and I hate bathrooms that have community toiletries (I get that it is better for the environment but I find it gross). I didn't think this hotel was any nicer than some of the big name chains in the same location. The customer service was inconsistent, the women checking us in weren't the friendliest but the men at night and checkout were much friendlier. I would stay here again if the price was competitive but not for the experience. Our room didn't have a view so you need to ask if that matters to you.

title: Good Location
text: Good hotel, with a great location, very close walking distance to main places in the city, comfortable and complete room, special ambiance, in general with all the required amenities for a trip in New York City. Spyglass the best experience.

title: Work colleagues and daughters 21st celebrations
text: Lovely clean hotel, conveniently located. All staff from booking to leaving and porter assistant were always polite and helpful. Had a very enjoyable stay, would recommend highly. We stayed on 19th floor in double double room with views of Empire State Building.   The spyglass bar is lovely and social too with great views and great food.

title: New York at Christmas
text: Not all rooms have City views - be sure to secure in advance. Ice will be brought to the room; easier to mention at the front desk before you head to your room. Rooms are small but quaint. Disappointing for the price.

title: Perfect Holiday Getaway
text: Fabulous boutique hotel with outstanding service, in the perfect location.  The view from our corner room on the 21st floor of the Empire State Building was breathtaking.  Several folks went above and beyond to make our stay easy and relaxing, thank you Elvis and Jonathon.  Highly recommend

title: None
text: We had a delightful stay. The staff were incredible, so kind, efficient, and warm. They all deserve a Kudos for the hard work that they do with smiles!!! It was so nice to encournter friendly workers in each area of the hotel.  :) The room was small, but nicely decorated and had great modern features, as well as it also felt very warm and inviiting. The bed, pillows and sheets were AMAZING!! The bed and pillows made the smaller room more than worth it. :) We also really appreciated the little snacks left on the cute napkins from House Keeping each day. We had an amazing stay, and when we are back in NYC we plan to stay at the Archer again. Lastly,  Archer is in an ideal area for exploring many different parts of the city, it is a perfect location.

title: So much wrong versus right
text:
Unsure how this hotel ranks as high as it does- genuinely gutted we stayed here as was expecting so much more

Positives are the staff are good, location is excellent. 

Negatives which make it questionable that it’s ranked as high as it is: 

Noise- constant noise in the lobby areas and outside the hotel
Space- very very cramped rooms and the ‘views’ of the Empire State are a bit like Basil Fawlty pointing out the sea in the distance 
Cleanliness- poor in all areas including the bathrooms

And when we raised these issues at checkout- a Gallic shrug

Honestly having stayed in the city before there are better, cheaper and more pleasing places to stay 

What a shame- won’t be back

title: Hotel muy bueno, pero extremadamente pequeño
text:
El hotel está genial, pero tiene un problema bastante importante: es extremadamente pequeño, lo que hace la estancia incómoda. No caben dos maletas medianas en la habitación, el armario muy pequeño y apenas hay sitio para moverse. 
Es una pena, ya que el hotel en sí es precioso pero este inconveniente es muy importante.
Todo lo demás muy bien, cama muy cómoda, habitación moderna, ubicación perfecta, servicio de limpieza excelente, con detalles siempre que la limpian y ascensores rápidos.
Recomiendo reservar la habitación con vistas al Empire en los pisos superiores, es una pasada.

title: Archer
text: When in Midtown NY, there's only one place to stay. The Archer is centrally located to all the must-sees: Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and Grand Central a few blocks north; Broadway and Times Square a couple of blocks west; Herald Square, Empire State Building, Penn Station and Madison Square Garden a few blocks south. The staff is friendly and attentive - always eager to help. Jonathan was especially on top of his game, ready with bag check and assistance with car service. You can't go wrong.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: Archer was amazing! Great location. Clean rooms and the staff was the best we have ever experienced, helpful with all our questions! We saw the Spyglass rooftop and had a great view of the Empire State Building- just incredible, and the staff super friendly. We will be back for sure! Thank you Archer!

title: A great place to stay when visiting New York
text: The folks at the Archer Hotel are all polite, attentive, and courteous. The room was comfortable and quiet. The overall experience was a positive one. I would certainly stay again when I am in New York.

title: Highly recommended
text:
The Archer is in a great location in midtown for exploring the city. We stayed in a king room with a magnificent view of the Empire State. The roof top bar is well worth a visit for the view while enjoying cocktails.

The staff are excellent. Very professional but also very warm and friendly. 

I would highly recommend a stay at the Archer.

title: Surprise Trip
text: Surprised my husband for his 40th with a long weekend in NYC. Archer Hotel made sure to keep the surprise going by bringing a delicious cupcake up to the room with a card from the hotel. Staff helped us many times and answered all of our many questions. We would recommend the Spyglass Bar as the view was breathtaking.  The staff was engaging, food and drinks were wonderful. The concierge were welcoming every time we entered and left the building. They had our taxi ready at 4am for our early departure. We wanted the NYC experience and the Archer Hotel delivered!

title: Stylish hotel, friendly staff
text:
Visited the Archer for  a friends reunion in July, right when it seemed like the world would be opening up again. It was a happy  occasion, made even better by the staff and the service at the hotel. Everyone was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. 

The rooms are small but comfortable and well-appointed. Great bathroom. And the locations is convenient for tourist or business activities.

Special thanks to the staff of the Spyglass Bar, who gracefully and graciously wrangled our big group and personalities.

title: Absolutely superb stay at The Archer Hotel
text: This, by far, the best hotel we have stayed at with the attention to detail and great attitude of all the staff. Greeted by Scott on arrival and was so welcoming and it was as if they were really looking forward to our arrival. Gaby was absolutely delightful and so was Johnathon. Nothing too much trouble and they really do want to make your stay the best. Professional and courteous at all times but with a really warm and personal feel. Great location in midtown and will certainly look to stay again when we return to NYC.

title: Fabulous
text: What a fabulous place to stay in New York! Central to everything with underground station nearby too. We had the most wonderful view of The Empire State Building from our room, a real treat to go to sleep and wake up to every day. The staff couldn’t do enough to help us out at every turn, Jonathan and Evan were both outstanding in their attention to any requests we had. There is a fabulous rooftop bar too! Overall, although the rooms are typically New York sized, I can’t recommend this lovely hotel more. We will definitely book again, 5 stars from us

title: Great NYC Hotel experience
text:
Great customer service, very well located with easy access to transportation and walking distance to many attractions. You will feel very welcomed, the staff is always ready to help with anything. Rooms are comfortable and clean. 
Delicious easy breakfast for those on the run and amazing SpyGlass Roof top bar for an evening drink will complete the stay

title: Fantastic stay at the Archer
text: From the moment you enter and you are greeted you can tell your at a hotel where the staff are happy to be. This makes all the difference. Great mid-town location so easy access to transport and just a couple blocks to Bryant Park!  If on business or leisure you cannot go wrong with The Archer a true gem in the city.

title: A must see and stay!
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying and hosting a client event at the Archer Hotel New York. Let me start of by saying it was my first visit to the property and it did not disappoint. Upon my arrival I was greeted by the front desk team who were very polite and friendly even though it was 7am in the morning. I was expecting to have to leave my luggage and wait for my room to be available that afternoon, but they were able to check me in right way which was a huge bonus. My room had a view of the Empire State building which wasn't too shabby. The room itself was ideal, very clean, stylish although intimate in size. The evening client event that my firm was hosting was held on property at the Spyglass Rooftop Bar. Words can't explain the views and the service that we received that night. The event was a success. A special shout out goes to Jackie Galea the Archer Hotel Area Director - Sales + Marketing. Jackie worked tirelessly during the whole planning process to get this event just right, she is an asset to the Archer Hotel! Next time that you are in New York, stay here you won't regret it!

title: Great views of Empire State Building
text: Archer New York is a great hotel with nice though compact bathrooms and comfortable beds. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and my only real disappointment was with the small size of the room, though this may be typical for NYC.

title: Highly recommend Archer Hotel
text: Love the Archer Hotel! Great location and proximity to restaurants, shopping and Bryant Park. Easy access to train station.  Especially enjoyed Spyglass and the unrivaled view of the Empire State Building. ALL of the staff were super friendly and welcoming. The amenities were top notch, and the New York Christmas book in the room and turn down treats are a nice touch. Will definitely be staying at the Archer again!

title: Great service!
text:
Amazing customer service! 
I left something in my room 
Elizabeth from housekeeping contacted me and shipped to me 
Clean, quite and nice staff.
Great view from rooftop bar of Empire State Building.
I stay here often on business trips. 
Friendly and safe

title: Incredibly subpar check in process
text:
When we arrived at 1am, the woman at the front desk was running an "audit", so we had to wait for 15 minutes for that to finish. She instructed us to call next time if we know we will be arriving late, but I reminded her we had been on a plane. After the audit finished, apparently our rooms were erased when the audit occurred, and she could not book us new rooms (?) so she instructed me to get on my phone and book new ones (remember this was now 1:30am). One of the rooms types we booked was gone, so my colleague got a double we did not want. So, now we had three rooms paid for (bec the ones I had previously booked online were prepaid). We finally got to our rooms at 2am! It was frustrating that she could not make or alter reservations at the front desk, and that she ran her "audit" knowing it would cancel rooms for guests that had not arrived yet (I would imagine business guests coming in from across the country frequently arrive late?). In the morning, the front desk did sort us out and moved my friend to the room originally booked. But, there's never a second chance at a first impression, and being delayed at the front desk for an hour at 1am after a long flight when we are simply trying to check in felt very unwelcoming. I will certainly not be coming back to the Archer. 

Oh, and the rooms are TINY (but well appointed).

title: Another NYC hotel
text: Nearly all NYC hotel rooms are small and the Archer’s rooms are no exception but everything you need is successfully incorporated into the small space.  Not sure this is really boutique hotel, it’s all quite standard for a NY hotel but comfortable, relatively quiet, decent bathroom and small lobby bar.

title: Would I go back?
text:
Honest answer - no. Extremely small room. Over priced for what we got. Location ok if you like the hustle and bustle but not for me. I would prefer staying over by Battery Park if visiting again. 
Coffee and an unappetising roll available for breakfast in the lobby area. Staff friendly.

title: Love the Archer Hotel!
text:
Absolutely loved our stay! Great hotel, great customer service, great location! 
Traveled with my family, had 3 rooms. All rooms very clean and will stay here when we return. Front desk was always super helpful and went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay.

title: Great NYC Hotel and Midtown Location
text: Excellent location and staff. The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. Happy we were able to get early check-in.  Loved the Spyglass Rooftop Bar and staff. Only complaint was that the wifi was not great.

title: We love the Archer!
text: Wonderful little boutique hotel in Midtown - great location. Staff are super friendly and helpful! The rooms have lots of cool features that make good use of a small space. The hotel put out little care packages for the NYC Marathon runners which was a very nice touch and much appreciated!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: My stay here was one of the best hotel experiences I have had. The staff is very friendly, courteous, and helpful.  They always greeted me with a smile. The rooms were spotless and the bed was incredibly comfortable.  The turn down treats and expresso machine in the room were nice touches.  I love my stay and cannot wait to come back!

title: GREAT NYC HOTEL!
text: Great location - the staff was ABSOLUTELY the friendliest in the city. The bars are GREAT! Ask for a ciew of the Empire State Building. Our view on the 15th floor was STUNNING! We had great conversations with the front desk and the bartenders at the lobby bar and the sky bar.

title: Nice hotel; great location
text: Had a three night stay to watch the nyc marathon.  The room was very nice but on the small side.   Bed was very comfortable.   Bathroom was very nice with a great shower.   Location was great.  Spyglass rooftop bar was nice.  All hotel staff were great and helpful.  Overall good stay and would stay there again.  Only complaint is size of room and the storage being under the bed.

title: Service at it's finest
text:
From the moment we arrived,which was very early,the staff went above and beyond to accomodate our every need.We received text messages throughout the day with offers and tips that were very helpful. We will be back for certain. Thank you Archer Team.
Daren Perone

title: None
text: I absolutely loved staying at this hotel! The staff was very friendly, the food and drinks at the spyglass rooftop bar was excellent! And the bed was absolutely one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. I can’t wait to stay here again on my next trip to NYC!

title: Special Touches!
text: This was an anniversary trip for us so we were looking for something a little extra special. We got just that and for about the same price as an ordinary hotel. We loved the delicious, local goodies in our room each night, comfy room & rooftop bar. Thanks Archer for a fabulous stay!

title: Amazing First Class Service
text: This hotel was divine from the minute we checked in! They accommodated our early check in and even upgraded us with a view of the Empire State Building! Once the staff found out we were there for our daughter's ballet audition they surprised her with a hand drawn good luck note and a cupcake! They allowed her to warm up in the morning in the bar area which was so kind! Every day the room was cleaned and it was spotless. I am a travel advisor and have never been more impressed with a hotel! Top notch service and the only place we will go in New York!

title: Excellent Accommodations, Excellent Staff
text: Stayed here October 17-18 with my wife. Room was very clean and comfortable, Staff was amazing, from housekeeping to the front desk. Good location which is just blocks from Times Square. The area is safe and exciting to be in. Nearby restaurants and Broadway shows.

title: Very nice and clean hotel! Staff are worth the stay alone :)
text: Extremely happy with our and will highly recommend it to others! The staff was amazing and did an incredible job. Check-in and out was a breeze and they were very helpful and friendly. The night staff was friendly, accomodating, entertaining and gave great recommendations! Can not say enough good things about how great the staff was. :)

title: Love love Archer in NY
text: Fantastic place, right in the middle of everything, lovely staff and accommodations!! Spyglass rooftop bar is fantastic and drinks are A+!!! Definitely will stay here again on our next visit to NY. View was nice too!

title: Perfect NYC hotel stay: small, NYC boutique-sized rooms, but incredible attention to detail in the design.
text: Loved my recent stay. Perfect location near midtown, away from the noise of Times Square but only a 15-minute walk to any show. Homemade sweet treats nightly on your pillow. Malin+Goetz bath products. Quiet--only saw my hotel friends in the elevators, never heard them through walls, thankfully.  Located near several Garment District stores, so if you lose a button or some feathers off your boa, you're in luck. This was my second stay here, will definitely be back.

title: Great find
text: Excellent staff always willing to accommodate.   Great location.  Clean and modern hotel. Rooms are small but efficient.  Spyglass is a fun spot with great views of the city including the Empire Estate Building.  Would recommend this hotel for business and leisure.

title: None
text: Very nice room, very clean and modern, cheerful and comfortable. The street location is not glamorous and there is some construction going on, but it seemed safe and was very well-located - perfect at this price point for NYC! It was just perfect for my needs, and I would definitely stay here again on a future visit to NYC!

title: Comfortable and welcoming
text:
A friend and I traveled to New York to see the Dior exhibit and stayed at the Archer Midtown for three nights.
We each had our own room, king bed with a view of the Empire State Building. The view was fantastic and the room was a relaxing and clean respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. The mattress was comfortable and there were two types of pillows. I am doing research on the pillows now to order the same brand!
There was a Nespresso coffee maker in the room to use while getting ready in the morning as well as complimentary coffee, croissants and muffins in the lobby. The water pressure in the shower was good and the towels were fluffy. There was a full length mirror on the wardrobe as well as a wall mounted make up mirror.
The rooftop bar also has a great view of the Empire State building and the bar and wait staff were very friendly.
The best part of the stay was the service. Everyone seemed glad to see us and made us feel like they were happy that we were there. They were helpful with directions and remembered us when we returned in the evening. I would definitely stay again and recommend it to friends.

title: Magical & Exceptional
text: Flawless, magical and breathtaking. The atmosphere, vibe, location and rooftop bar are unmatched in NYC.  The staff provides exceptional service to ensure your stay is memorable.  This boutique hotel offers a fresh experience unlike traditional hotel chains with cookie cutter sterile mechanics.   I can assure you that you will make a plan to return!

title: Nice one night  stay
text: Decided on an impromptu overnight with a friend from out of town. Room was on the small side but comfortable with ample storage.Beds we’re very comfortable. Bathroom had good use of space and large shower. Staff were very nice. Enjoyed having a cocktail on the roof top with beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Enjoyed our stay. Would return.

title: Family girl trip! Can’t wait to go back!
text: Service, location and view are five star all the way!!! Jonathan is amazing and the entire front desk act like I’m the only customer in the hotel! First class service all the way!! Highly recommend to anyone!!! It’s my second time and not my last!

title: Meh
text: We usually stay at CitizenM but decided to splurge for our anniversary. The empire view room was nice but was incredibly small. Only had 1 robe, they didn’t replace the coffee mugs or coffee after the first night.   Tv only has cable , no streaming app hookups. My wife and I laughed because we got those fun slippers but it’s like, where are you even gonna walk the room so small lol. The bed was perfectly normal. Nice bathroom though and a great location. Definitely wasn’t worth the price difference (350 a night) between something like CitizenM though. It wasn’t bad just wasn’t great either

title: Great stay at Archer Hotel
text: Loved staying at the Archer.  Boutique feel to it- small room (NYC!) but enough space to store what we needed.  Comfy king bed.  Large bathroom with nice walk-in shower.  Great shampoo and body wash.   Had a later train out of the city on day of departure so stored our luggage for a few hours with zero hassle.  Friendly staff.  Definitely recommend!

title: Small room, Exceptional service!
text: While the room was excessively small (even for a NYC Boutique Hotel), the staff was simply exceptional. Grade A+ for the friendliness, courtesy, and professionalism of the people who helped us settle in and check out. The room was small, but clean with an extremely comfortable bed and down pillows. Overall, quite a pleasant experience.

title: Archer Hotel NYC
text: Lovely boutique hotel with excellent service and attention to detail. Rooms are small (intimate) but it is NYC. Breakfast croissants and fruit during the week was very nice. Enjoyed cocktails and light supper at the Spyglass Rooftop Bar. It’s city view of the Empire State Building was terrific!

title: Perfect Location
text: My experience at the Archer Hotel in New York City was amazing! I can’t wait to go back.  The staff was friendly, the room was clean and the location was perfect!  The hotel felt safe and the employees were extremely helpful and attentive.

title: Holiday
text: Amazing staff. Location is excellent as it is centrally located in Manhattan. Midtown is very busy but the hotel was always quiet. Staff was kind and attentive. Jose was so funny as he regaled us with NY stories. Entire front desk, spyglass staff all incredible!!

title: Not worth the price
text: Super small  and dark. A bit run down. AC fan never turned off.  Only two of us in the room but it felt like 5. The lighting was insufficient and we noticed a large tear in the headboard of one of the beds. The fan for the Ac unit would never turn off so it was always loud in the room. The few lights we had would start blinking after 5 min of use.

title: Great location, felt very safe COVID-19 wise
text: Awesome hotel! Probably the best we've stayed at in Manhattan. We don't like staying super close to Times Square. This was a 10-15 minute walk away from theaters and mainline attractions in that area and had excellent access to Subway Stations. Bryant Park (just a minute or two around the corner) is a gem.

title: Great stay in the perfect location
text: The location of the hotel can’t be beat. The room was a little smaller than we would have liked, but it had a comfortable bed and bedding, and nice finishes and amenities (nespresso coffee machine, robe, slippers, daily chocolate treats). For a midtown Manhattan room on the 19th floor the room was relatively quiet and dark at night. Most of the noise came from the elevator shaft (our room was next to the elevator), and the very LOUD AC unit. Luckily we were able to turn off the unit, because we were unable to control it on the wall thermostat. One cannot sleep with the AC noise or air blast hitting you in bed at night. The view of the Empire State was phenomenal and worth the extra charge. The Spyglass Rooftop Bar was also nice, but they do close at 11:00 pm so don’t get there too late. We were never able to enjoy breakfast at the hotel because it was only served until 9:00 am and we were there on vacation. Instead we would buy breakfast at a nearby bakery and take to Bryant Park to enjoy.

title: Archer Hotel - Great hotel atmosphere and location. I appreciate the safety and security of this hotel.
text: My friend’s first trip to NYC. hotel is one block to Bryant Park. So many great restaurants in the area. Walking distance to places like Times Square, Whole Foods, Rockefeller Center, great rooftop bars like Spyglass and the Refinery. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

title: Us Open with my son
text: We chose for the location and that they offer two beds in a room which can be difficult to find in NYC. It was a 5 minute walk to Penn Station and all of the staff were genuinely friendly. We highly recommend!

title: Staff that really cares
text: My husband and I met at the Spyglass rooftop bar at Archer Hotel NY 6 years ago, which we told the staff upon booking our stay for our wedding night. We checked in late after the reception and even though the bar was closed, they unlocked the balcony for us so we could take photos in front of the Empire State Building where we first met. Upon entering our room there were rose petals on the floor, a chilled bottle of champagne, and a personalized note from the staff. That level of caring was so appreciated, really made our stay special, and will not be soon forgotten!

title: Amazing Experience
text: I originally booked a different hotel. Upon arrival to NYC the hotel I booked was actually closed down for renovations, talk about frustration.  I was searching for a new hotel sitting on the corner with my luggage and found this GEM. I loved everything about the hotel, the staff, amenities, service, location. It was awesome.  One employee named Daniel, really went above and beyond.  I hope he doesn't get upset with me mentioning his name. He was AMAZING!  Rain was expected later that evening. We were headed to the US Open and he stopped to hand us a pair of umbrellas.  He saved us because Hurricane IDA and that flooding was scary. Never crossed out minds that we would have rain, let alone flooding of that size. It was just the kind gesture for him to be proactive and engaging with us. I am very thankful.  I can't say enough about. this hotel. It's a must stay.  My only wish is for the rooms to be a little bigger but its NYC can't expect TX size spaced.  I will certainly book this hotel again on my next visit.

title: Hotel block for wedding in august 2021
text:
There are not enough words in the English language to express how amazing our stay at Archer Hotel was! As the bride and groom, choosing Archer Hotel for our hotel block was the BEST decision we made. Jackie was our point person throughout the process. We had one call and she immediately understood  my vision. I had 5 ladies (including me) getting hair and make up done by 2 stylists in the hotel room. Jackie informed me about the size of the room and suggested putting me in an additional room to give everyone more space. This was the best idea and I had more than enough room to do hair/makeup and get dressed in the other room. 

 When we arrived, Evan was at the front desk and was ready for me to arrive. He knew me by name and took every opportunity to provide the best service I’ve ever had at ANY hospitality establishment!! We had too many things to bring over from New Jersey and had to make 2 trips. I left Evan with my wedding dress, the groom’s suit, my mother and sister’s dresses, our wedding favors, and welcome bags.
