He knew exactly what to do and had my welcome bags staged at the front desk while having all the other items brought to the room. When I got to my room, the gown was hung up perfectly, my mother’s and sister’s dresses were gently placed on the bed as to not get wrinkled in the dresser.  

By the end of the stay we new almost everyone’s names. It was like staying with family. The Archer Hotel team made sure our happiness was their number one concern. If you are thinking about a hotel for your wedding, choose Archer Hotel! Even if you’re planning on a stay in the city, choose Archer Hotel! 

I will be back 😁

title: Wedding Weekend Made Magical
text: Second stay at Archer hotel, this time for a friend’s wedding. Smaller than expected room was more than compensated by ambiance, amenities, accessibility, and cleanliness. Staff peerless in hospitality and assistance. Ever fueled by limitless supply of Nespresso, our hotel stay perfected a special weekend! Would stay here again!

title: Perfect - BOOK IT!
text: Book it....Great Experience! Clean rooms, friendly staff, perfect location. Beds were very comfy and the bathroom had nice amenities. Showerhead had incredible water pressure (Grohe brand) and the provided shampoo/soap was ideal. Loved the daily treats in the room and the thoughtful bottle of champagne for my wife and I. While we didn't use it, we loved that the room had a small fridge in it. Easy access to transportation, restaurants, and close to Bryant Park which is great. Daily housekeeping was on point and we were very comfortable returning back to the hotel and crashing after our days of exploring. Be sure to head up to the rooftop bar for a view of the Empire State Building at night. Breathtaking!

title: Bruce on Broadway / Birthday Weekend
text: The staff was super friendly and accommodating, they remembered us every time we returned to the hotel.  Spyglass Rooftop Bar had breathtaking views, even our room had a view of the Empire State Building!  I loved the quality of the sheets and the slippers were an amazing surprise.  One thing that great was the windows open about 4" if you want that city sound.  Just about everything was walking distance.  I have stayed here before with a friend but this was the first time I brought my husband for his birthday weekend.  We loved it and will definitely will return.

title: Best location, Clean room !!!
text:
This hotel is in a great location for exploring Manhattan.
Also, this hotel is very clean and friendly.
Always greet you with a smile.
And, it's really quiet.
And, there are many good restaurants nearby.

title: Second Honeymoon
text: Your property is beautiful and luxurious and we love it! We got married there last year and returned to mark our First Anniversary! Thanks for being part of our story.Jennifer Smith Burns and Mark Burns

title: Great Location, Great Staff and Plush Accommodations
text:
The staff was wonderful and the accommodations were "plush" for NYC!  We greatly enjoyed the view from the rooftop bar - a great oasis in the city. 

We love the central location -- thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Great Staff and Accommodations
text: Wonderful staff and well thought out accommodations made this a pleasant stay. I look forward to returning when the lobby food and drink areas are open for visitors as the rooftop did not allow under 21.

title: Incredible as always
text:
This is not the first time that we stayed here, and for sure not the last….. Thank you Archer team for your warmth and kind hospitality, this is a great place to stayed, near of everything safe, clean and comfortable with and excellent rooftop view…

See you soon!!
Hasta luego 👋🏼

title: Loved our family stay
text: We stayed at the Archer three nights in June 2021 with our teenagers and loved it.  The staff was friendly and helpful; they always greeted us with a "welcome back" when we returned to our room.  The location is great for getting around and made it easy for the kids to explore the area on their own.  The rooms are stylish with thoughtful touches (e.g., local reading material) and the beds allow for luggage to be stored underneath.  The rooftop bar has an amazing view - definitely check it out.  The elevators were speedy.  Highly recommend the Archer for a stay in NYC!

title: NYC Weekend
text:
Room was lovely. Front desk personnel was AMAZING. 
Spyglass rooftop bar was perfection! That view!!!
Location was great. Easy access to anything in the city!  
Would highly recommend to anyone traveling to the city!

title: Very Clean & Friendly
text: They provide a very clean room and building. And are at a great location for getting anywhere in NYC quickly. No complaints. Reservations are an easy process. They've always have had availability when I've booked.

title: Full refund on non-refundable reservation
text: My wife and I were looking forward to our first vacation since the pandemic and booked a room at the Archer. As our travel date neared, my wife became increasingly concerned by the spike in cases related to the Delta variant. It finally became clear that she would not be able to enjoy the vacation and now was not the time to travel. I called the Archer and they graciously cancelled my reservation without penalty, despite the fact that it was a non-refundable reservation. Many thanks to the Archer and we look forward to visiting hopefully very soon!

title: None
text: A sanctuary in the middle of the city!  What a treat to return "home" to the Archer after a busy day in the city.  And the spyglass was a great place to end there night.   Thank you for a wonderful stay! Looking forward to our next stay!

title: Great stay in Bryant park area
text: This was my second time to nyc and we decided to stay a little further away from Times Square. The Archer did not disappoint! The staff was so welcoming and helpful. The rooms were small but plenty of space for two and the bed was so comfy and the brick wall and views of Empire state building out the window set an amazing  feel  for being in the city. We were in room 1704. My favorite part was the roof top bar. Watching the sky turn from day to dusk to night as the city lights came alive was breathtaking! The cocktails and dessert hit the spot. I would definitely recommend the Archer and a room with a upper level  view of Empire State Building. Would stay here over and over again if I was in the Bryant park area.

title: My new favorite nyc hotel
text: The staff here were so incredibly nice and helpful-every since person we interacted with. Rooms were clean and updated, with special details (different local treats left each evening). I hope to return soon. Rooftop bar has a great view of the Empire State bldg.

title: Josè is the BEST!
text:
Service was the most impressive. Josè was THEE REALEST! For a true New Yorker he was most hospitable and personable human ever! He took us to see the Empire State Building at night! The hotel has a rooftop bar “Spyglass” that over looks the hotel and a straight view of the the Empire State Building. We enjoyed his conversation and his energy. He spoke from his soul!

Thank you Josè for sharing your presence with us. Please continue with your geniality. REAL people don’t exist like yourself. Take pride in yourself. Remain yourself. 

One.

title: Jose is AWESOME
text: Jose was great! It was my wife’s birthday and she wanted a view of the Empire State Building, so Jose took us to the Spyglass Roof Top Bar after hours to see it! She was beyond happy and it made her birthday even better! He was just so helpful and hospitable. His customer service level was TOP NOTCH! We couldn’t have asked for a better experience and it was all due to Jose!

title: JOSE IS THE LITERAL BEST!
text: I came to The Archer for my birthday with my husband and cousin, and it was great and then we met Jose and it was AMAZING! He was so personable and very helpful. He has made this birthday trip 10 times better with his customer service. Basically, he is the best employee the Archer has and if you want things to get done and also have a great experience…call him! JOSE IS THE BEST!

title: Wonderful gem in NY!
text: Wonderful experience all around!  The staff were exceptional - attentive and friendly without exception. Rooms and views were quite nice - quietest hotel experience I've ever had in NY (much appreciated!). Rooftop bar has stunning views and offers a great drinking/dining experience.  WiFi worked very well and allowed me to work on large graphic files without issue. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great New York stay!
text: Although small the room was well appointed. Made excellent use of space—just like on a cruise ship. There were even drawers under the bed. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Bathroom was brand new. Great coffee in room. Would stay again.

title: This hotel is a GEM!
text: This is our 3rd visit to the Archer Hotel and if it is possible to feel like you have “extended family” in NYC then the staff here meet and exceed that criteria! It is the staff that drive this hotel. Yes the location is perfect for walking, yes the rooms are lovely and well appointed (a little small but this is NYC folks) yes there is a wonderful rooftop bar with lovely views of the ESB and the city, but it is the amazing people that make this place special. We haven’t seen our 27 year old daughter who lives in Texas since 2019 due to the pandemic. She graduated from Manhattan College and is a “city girl” through and through. How fun to be reunited  in NYC at Archer and have everyone welcome us, and make our special weekend even better. They helped me surprise her with flowers in her room and helped with suggestions for dining options. They were “checking in” in with us via text to see if we needed anything. Everyone was gracious, smiling, and helpful. What a delight in NYC-thank you Archer!

title: FANTASTIC
text:
The room and friendly staff were amazing. The room is NYC small, but was thankful to be told about underbed storage.  We stayed four nights and never felt cramped. 
They are trendy with no top bedsheets, but housekeeping was great with our request.  Also, make reservations to the Skyglass Rooftop Bar to get front row seats.  Wonderful trip and feeling like we now have friends in NYC!

title: On Point
text: Every interaction with the staff was stellar. The room was perfectly clean, well appointed, and comfortable. The location, ideal. When my child started feeling unwell a member of the front desk staff offered to run to CVS to pick up medicine so I didn't have to leave her. They even delivered it with a handmade "get well soon" card. So very impressed. Top notch all the way around.

title: Not worth the effort. Stay somewhere else.
text:
I had an odd experience making reservations. I wanted two rooms connecting, and I had to make two separate reservation the agent wouldn’t make two rooms in one name even though I was the person paying for both rooms. I called prior to arriving to confirm connecting rooms but when I arrived they told me there was a note in the file that I had called specifically not to have connecting rooms. That issue was sort it out. It was as if the hotel was trying to be a casual hip experience.  Also at check-in I had to check-in for each room again even though I was paying for both rooms and they were both in my name they insisted that I check in for each room individually. Then one of the front desk people said that’s how they did it in Disney where she worked before.

I won’t recommend this hotel again even though it’s in a good location. There are plenty of other options available at that price. Plus they must have told me three times the checkout time is 11 AM and then I had to be out of the room by that time. But never did they offer any option that I could extend my check out even if it cost more.

When I made the reservation I asked specifically if there was room service in the hotel I was told yes, but  when I arrived I was told there was no food service but I could go to the rooftop bar and get some snacks or buy them from the snack bar in the lobby. 

There was no sense of real service for what professes to be a four and five star hotel. It felt like everyone had just started their first week at the hotel in the service industry and wasn’t quite sure how to treat people.

While the rooftop bar is absolutely beautiful with the incredible view of the Empire State building, the food selection leaves a lot to be desired. Check out the menu before deciding if you want to go there. It was great for a drink but I wouldn’t recommend the food. 

I checked out on Saturday more than 24 hours ago and I still don’t have a copy of my bill. I called the hotel and asked for a copy of my bill and they told me it was a clerical error. Then they tried sending me the bill and it took three times for them to get the right bill to me. So again a very immature and inexperienced staff at the hotel. No attention to detail. Look for something else. It’s not worth the hassle.

title: Hospitality is the name of the game
text:
What can make a hotel that has a great location and value even better? Amazing hospitality. 
This is the case with "Archer Hotel New York".
The staff was extremely responsive to any need that we had, and they made us feel comfortable asking for more, They were both pleasant and efficient. Who can ask for more?
Give this amazing hospitality, I wish to mention two individuals by name -- Scott and Sal. 
Thanks so much!

title: Great Hotel & Great Staff---Especially Reenie
text: Stayed at Archer Hotel From June 28 for three days. The Rooftop/SpyGlass Bar affords a magnificent view of the Empire State Building. Archer is a boutique hotel located at 45 West 38th  Street. Numerous restaurants nearby. The rooms are very clean and the hotel is well maintained. They also have a friendly professional staff. The senior front desk agent (Reenie) was extremely helpful on several occasions including making arrangements with limousine services. Reenie was personable. friendly and very professional  and went out of her way to be helpful. Reenie was a reflection of the entire staff at hotel. Would stay at this hotel again and I give it a five star ranking. Tim C.

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
text:
Very nice boutique hotel. Clean well designed small rooms.Particularly nice and helpful staff. Enjoyed the top flloor outside bar quite a bit. Convenient
location. Will stay here in the future. Good to find a well priced hotel
in NYC.

title: Archer Hotel New York
text:
It was a wonderful hotel. Beautiful entrance & rooms!  Every employee was very friendly & helpful!  The Spyglass rooftop bar was amazing! 
Can not say enough good things about our experience about the Archer New York Hotel!!  If you had a "10" rating it would be a 10!!

title: Lovely boutique hotel, superb service and location
text: Very impressed with this lovely, well-appointed boutique hotel conveniently located in the Garment district/Midtown. Staff is attentive, polite and wonderful. location is near Bryant Park and many subway stations. Would stay again!

title: Amazing chic hotel in the Garment District
text: My stay at the Archer hotel was perfect for a recent trip to NYC 6/15/21 - 6/20/21.  The front desk staff lead by Reenie and team ensured my stay was pleasant, comfortable, and they provided excellent dining options near the hotel (e.g. Deens Steakhouse, Havana NY, and Franchia Vegan cafe).  The Spyglass rooftop bar provided amazing view of the Empire state building and city.  Drinks and appetizers were good too.  Overall, the rooms are small but provide comfortable, clean, and quiet accomodations.  I would definitely book this hotel again!

title: Trip of the year
text:
We spend a great time at the Archer Hotel,
I was traveling with my two college daugthers and and find NY truly amazing after Pandemia times. 
People at Archer Hotel colaborate to spend a great vacation.

title: Great hotel at a reasonable price in a great location!
text: My wife, son and I stayed at The Archer from 6/16/21 to 6/22/21.  NYC was just opening up during that period.  Relevant observations:  #1, The Staff is great -- helpful, friendly, knowledgeable, professional.  This includes the front desk, security, room cleaners and people working at the rooftop bar.  #2, Great location -- 2 blocks south of Bryant Park, 4 blocks north of the ESB, 2 blocks from Times Square.  We also walked north to Central Park, south to Union Square, and west to the Highline, all no problem.  Your walking range is, of course, personal preference.  We felt comfortable walking to many of the sights in midtown.  We took the ferry from the 34th St. pier down to Wall Street and cabbed elsewhere.  #3, the rooftop bar -- The Spyglass -- is outstanding.  great view south to the ESB.  There was always a line waiting to get in.  But, as a guest, you get in whenever you ask.  So that's an extra benefit.  #4, price appears to be below the average for the equivalent hotels in the area.  That's just my estimate based on surveying other options.  It seemed like we got a very reasonable rate.  I have one other comment that really shouldn't be construed as a criticism:  the rooms are not huge.  The rooms are clean and set up well.  Just not spacious.  But we were comfortable, and we were visiting NYC so we didn't spend much time in the room.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

title: Sal and Scott are the best!
text: Seriously, it's the people that make this hotel stand out. The room view of the ESB was amazing, the room was cozy, clean and comfortable; but the people were the best. From the second we arrived they were really above and beyond. They text you ahead of time to say a hello and see if we needed any assistance in getting to the hotel. Texts are so convenient and I was able to confirm we had a room with a view of the ESB. Once we arrived, they helped us without our luggage, told us guests had priority at the sky bar, and even offered to let us bring the kids up to see the view during the bar's off hours (which we did do and Sal was a wealth of NYC knowledge). They made us feel so prioritized and welcomed the entire time. I would stay here again and again.

title: Clean but completely unacceptable in size
text: Smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Walls are paper thin so you can hear everything in the hallways and neighboring rooms. Staff was really great though and concierge service was super fast. The new food and snack selection is really lacking.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: We loved everything about the Archer. Rooms are exactly as pictured online and they are beyond accommodating. We came here midway through our stay because the other hotel was so awful. The location is great as well!

title: The best hotel in NYC.
text:
The best hotel in New York! We got here by accident, we had reservations in another hotel, that was cancel at last minute. It was 10pm, we’ve been driving for 24 hours, and the this beautiful hotel appears. Since the first moment we fall in love, we were with our dog so we were worried about -those- looks, but here, not at all! All the crew were so nice to us and to our baby, they even gave him a ball, some treats and a comfy bed! About the rooms, very Art Deco, really love it! Also, they have the best pillows ever, no joke. The bathrooms are so amazing, they have this cool frameless bathroom doors, all glass, just perfect. 

The hotel also has an incredible rooftop where you can see the Empire State! 

Evan was the best ever! We will definitely be back, we had the best experience!

title: You've found your home away from home!
text: This was our first stay at the Archer, it is now our #1 hotel of choice for future visits to NYC.  Blown away with the quality of service, from the front desk to the roof top lounge, and everyone in between.  Every staff member we encountered, went above and beyond, with a smile, to satisfy our needs.  Clean, comfortable and quiet room.  Location is perfect.  Highly recommend.

title: Tourist
text:
Great place to stay, clean,great attention.
*****,five star, great I will recommend 100%, Skytop rooftop have excellent views to the empire state.
Front desk have great service, hotel have great location.

title: Post-vaccine reunion
text:
I live in nearby NJ less than an hour away from the city without traffic, but I didn’t want to make the drive after a post vaccine reunion with friends in the city. I looked for a hotel with two beds (anticipating that I’d at least have one other friend who might need a refuge).  It might surprise you to know that there are very few hotels in NYC that have two beds.   
This hotel exceeded all expectations and may become the hotel I recommend to visitors. 

You’ll need a reservation for the rooftop. Easy enough. Desk will do for you at check-in if you remember to ask. 

EVERY staff member was friendly and helpful and you get the feeling that management has seen to it that they are (and happy enough in their working conditions to be able to do so).

Special shout out to Sal and Rick for going above and beyond.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
This is such a great hotel! The staff is extremely helpful, and go above and beyond to ensure that you are well taken care of during your stay.

The hotel is also close to really great food options, time square, and not far from the subway if you are taking public transportation when in the city.

The rooftop is amazing and the views are amazing!

title: Personalized Customer Service
text:
If you're looking to stay in New York City, The Archer is a great choice! I was headed to the City and had plans to propose to my now fiancé! The Archer has the Spyglass Rooftop which was open for me to rent in order to pull off the proposal. Jackie from The Archer hotel worked with me to make sure the evening and reservation went smoothly. The rain even tried to stop us, but while I was traveling Jackie even took the time to make sure I was aware they could move the event indoors, and everything was all set up! She even went as far as inquiring if I wanted to move up the time. Jackie answered every question I had promptly, had everything set up with her staff, and even customized a mock-tail for me and my fiancé! 

After I entered Spyglass for the engagement, we had the most incredible server Asia! Both Jackie and Asia took the time to be personal, friendly, and understanding in order to make my engagement an absolutely incredible evening.

We stayed for two nights, and had great amenities, and it is in walking distance to the Subway, the city, and food! We even had food delivered which was seamless. It was an incredible and unforgettable trip from check-in, the room, and the friendliness of the staff to help make our trip great!

title: Fantastic Stay!!
text: I can’t rave about this hotel enough! The staff was lovely, the place was clean, the security system was great and the view was INCREDIBLE! The only things I’d change were an extra trash can in the room, the blinds opened different directions and I wish the pillows were firmer. The room was a bit tight, but the view made it worth it. It still had a king bed and full bathroom.  All that said, I would 100% come back and can’t recommend this hotel enough!

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Such a great hotel. Super friendly and helpful staff. They met all our needs and even some wants. Clean and stylish rooms as well. Great view of the Empire State Building from our room. Can’t beat it with a stick.

title: Good location, Nice Staff
text: Stayed at Archer hotel for two nights. Due to the pandemic I was given a long list of updates at the front desk. Housekeeping every 4 days, put your room trash outside your door for pickup. Water pressure was pretty good and it wasnt noisy. Not bad for nyc

title: Very Comfortable Stay
text:
I recently stayed at the Archer Hotel in NYC in May 2021, and overall had a very enjoyable and comfortable stay. While the rooms are small (I booked a King room, and the bed nearly touched both sides of the room), that isn't unexpected for NYC. I'll definitely stay at this hotel again next time I'm in New York, as long as it doesn't get too expensive.

The hotel was very clean, bed was soft and comfortable, and the AC worked without issue. Everything in the room worked and was in good repair, including the TV, phone, wifi internet, Nespresso machine, blinds, lights, etc. The room and hotel in general felt very well maintained and professionally run. I also appreciated they had a little fridge I could store drinks in, and the welcome note with candy was a nice touch.

The staff were both friendly and professional, and they offer a bag check in case your flight doesn't align well with the check-in/check-out times. They have a rooftop bar called Spyglass or Spy something (I forgot the name). I noticed every night, a line forms outside of the lobby of people visiting the bar, so it's quite popular particularly since it has a perfect, unobstructed view of the Empire State building. I'm not sure if I broke the rules, but I went up there one night randomly, and the host graciously sat me without a reservation when I told him I was a hotel guest-- so it appears they give priority to hotel guests. The bartenders were friendly and knew what they were doing.

Because of COVID, I was disappointed that the downstairs lobby bar/restaurant, room service, and daily housekeeping were all closed; however, I asked for housekeeping service on my second day since my trash was overflowing, and they came up and took care of it and quickly vacuumed for me/got me fresh towels and shampoos/soaps/etc. I'm hoping when travel picks up, the hotel restores its daily housekeeping, opens the restaurant back up, and offers room service again.

Again, I had a very enjoyable stay-- my only regret is that I didn't stay at this hotel when I first arrived in New York (I had a bad experience at another nearby hotel and had to switch hotels).

title: Stay at the Archer Hotel
text:
The staff were fantastic and super attentive.  The bathroom floor was not as clean as you would like and there was no daily room service to take vacuum, trash, bring new towels, or make the beds.  Understandable that they could not do all this with Covid recovery but a few simple things like rash removal would have been appreciated.

Location was good.

title: Great stay!!
text:
Great hotel! Staff was super helpful. Very accommodating. Provided great restaurant recommendations. 

Rooftop bar was phenomenal!! 

Definitely would recommend. We travel here often from NC and will be back to this hotel.

title: Unforgettable Experience
text: Our stay at the Archer was amazing. Our view of the empire state building was magical. We haven't slept this wonderful in years, I literally wanted to bring the mattress and pillows home with me. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was friendly and attentive. I highly recommend this hotel. Walking distance to restaurants and time square.

title: Momcation
text: The hotel itself is beautiful. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We were welcomed with a chocolate gift, when we got to our Room we found the cutest little slippers for each of us. The staff is amazingly friendly, kind and knowledgeable.The momcation package came with a $20 credit to their restaurants but due to covid the restaurants were closed. No other compensation was put in place.  It's very close to Bryant park and at our window we had a view of the Empire state building which was beautiful. I totally recommend this hotel for any kind of stay.

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text:
wow just unbelievable!! ❤️
LOCATION IS PERFECT, hospitality could not have better better, so much around for food/drinks/entertainment and just a nostalgic atmosphere here! The manager Scott was so efficient and helpful with my stay even let me check in really early and check out late for work! I ended up extending my stay because it made remote work so enjoyable!
I WILL BE BACK!!

title: A little gem
text:
My cousin and I arrived in Penn Station by train and walked a few blocks to this lovely hotel for our first post-covid get-together. The staff were attentive and knowledgeable, the room was small, but very clean, quiet and cheerful. Definitely an upscale experience! Conviences included robes, a mini fridge, expresso maker, and, to my delight, a separate tea pot. We enjoyed the shopping delights of nearby Fifth  Avenue, lunched with a view of charming Thompkins Square Park, visited with another cousin, and retired to our comfortable beds. I left my bag with the staff, photographed the nearby Macy's Flower Show and walked to the Hudson Yards with more upscale shops and gorgeous architecture.  I then picked up my bag, had a cold drink in the hotel lobby, and returned to the LIRR to zip home. Unpacking, I discovered that I'd forgotten my robe in the hotel room. I called, they retrieved, wrapped it in tissue, and sped it home: No extra charge!
I'm still grinning!

title: Amazing experience at the Archer
text: Ever since my son was little, he’s always dreamed of visiting New York city and being close to the Empire State building. His dream became a reality when we visited New York City for his eighth grade trip. We were able to stay at the archer Hotel and had a gorgeous view of the Empire State building from our room.  Reenie went over and beyond after hearing about my son's  wish and granted us a room on the 21st floor. As we would go to sleep at night we could watch the changing colors of the Empire State building lit up at night. It was a a dream come true! Reenie even put a Empire State Building souvenir and balloons to greet us!  The room was clean, bright and welcoming. We will definitely return to the archer and highly recommend anyone that visits New York City to stay at this gem!

title: Love This Hotel!
text:
This was a wonderful property with the BEST staff ever!  The location was great, the room was small but very comfortable and the view was priceless!  Did I mention the staff?!?  A++++ 
Although due to COVID the restaurants and bars were closed, the staff had information ready for guests so we could make informed decisions as to where to eat.

title: Best Service in NY Bar None
text:
Let me start by saying that I am a New Yorker so I know the city inside out. We are staying out East between apartments during the pandemic so we need hotels when we visit the city. This our second such trip and we chose the Archer because our first hotel experience was subpar on every level and the Archer was very highly rated. 

The reviews for the hotel stressed how amazing the service was, how clean the rooms were (a must have especially during a pandemic), how small the rooms were and how lovely the upper floor views were. Absolutely accurate. The staff was extremely thoughtful, friendly and accommodating during our stay (5 nights in two rooms). They remembered our names and always greeted us with a smile and asked if we needed anything. Despite the fact that most amenities were unavailable (but reopening soon) and we opted out of any housekeeping, we were still comfortable as we were provided with anything we needed. The rooms were indeed small but very well appointed and clean. There were quite a few nooks and crannies to put stuff in and you can store suitcases under the bed. We experienced several floors and the Empire State views from the top floors are wonderful. 

38th street is not the most exciting but the Archer and two nearby hotels have roof tops. Bryant Park is great and only two blocks away. Rockefeller Centre and Fifth Avenue shopping are also very close and Central Park, and Times Square/Theatre District are also walkable. 

By far though, the biggest plus was the service. The four of us are picky (and spoilt) and yet we all agreed that the Archer provided the best service we have experienced in NY in a very long time.

title: Nice stay at he Archer
text: We spent one night at the Archer Hotel. Check-in was quick despite us having to complete a state-required travel questionnaire. Our room was on the 15th floor and was quiet. The room was average size for New York standards although the bathroom was bigger than New York average. The shower was quite large with a glass door. Making and Goetz amenities are included. The room needs an extra light though. Two modest bedside lights do not do enough to light up the room and closet.  The AC was fine; quiet and effective.

title: Best Staff
text: I only stay at the Archer when traveling to NYC for work. The staff is extremely helpful and considerate. The rooms are small but very cozy and always clean. The Rooftop bar Spyglass is also a treat. I would recommend again and again!

title: Great stay & helpful staff!
text: We had a great stay at the Archer hotel. The rooms are small but nice (great view of Empire State Building) and we felt safe with all of the Covid precautions they’ve taken. Unfortunately the restaurant/bar were closed, but you’re in midtown so plenty of other options. Staff was SUPER helpful & nice - especially Reenie! I accidentally had a package sent there after I checked out and she made sure it got to where it needed to be and stayed in touch with me about it the whole time. Could have been a very stressful situation for me so I appreciated how helpful she was even after we had checked out. We’ll be back!

title: Weekend away
text: With NewYork City in Dire straights due to Covid I took my wife of 33 years for a weekend getaway. Unfortunately the Lobby Bar and Rooftop were closed due to Covid restrictions however the staff did all they could .The Front desk staff went out of there way to be as accommodating as possible. Scott in particular was great. Room was small. however we had an awesome view of the Empire State Building and the bedding was unbelievably comfortable. We will be back as soon as NYC opens up even more . Thank you , Bob G.

title: Adorable Archer
text:
Spent two nights here in the midst of COVID for a quick getaway from NJ and to take advantage of cheap rates and nearly empty city.  Only about a 10 minute walk from Penn Station.  And location is mid-town Manhattan so close to all the main tourist sites (not all are open at this time).  Many restaurants are still closed or take out only or reduced capacity so plan ahead for meals.  Sad to see some smaller coffee shops still closed but lovely to experience the city when not as crowded. 

Hotel had all COVID protocols in place and masks, etc.  Room was small but to be expected for NYC.  But very stylish and clean.  Loved the slippers!

title: Perfect!
text: Room was beautiful! Great view. Everyhing was super clean. The espresso machine was really nice to have. They give you a cute treat at check in and gifted slippers. Service was very friendly & professional. 10/10. Will definitely book again!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Thank you for the warm welcome. The staff were amazing, the room and the view was fantastic. I'm satisfied  and I had wonderful experience. Definitely I will come back in the future. Worth every penny. I recommend the hotel and it's close to Central Park and Empire State Building.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: My husband, daughter, and I stayed at the Archer Hotel for a quick, last minute getaway to NYC during spring recess. It’s such a beautiful, chic hotel and felt safe because of it’s cleanliness and room key access into hotel and their elevators. Staff was friendly and helpful, extremely comfortable beds, and their location is nestled blocks between Midtown’s main tourist sites. Our double queen room was modern, immaculately clean, and though small, we didn’t feel crammed because of the under-bed luggage storage and draws as well as their space saving furniture. Our view of the Empire State Building was an extra bonus.  We will definitely stay again.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We stayed at the archer hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. We checked in around 7/8pm and the staff was amazing. I don't remember their names but they accommodated us to the upmost ability. They were quick, efficient, and kind. All the staff all around was nice. Our hotel had the empire state building view and it was perfect. I wish the room had a microwave though 😭 other than that it was a 10/10.

title: Exceptional
text: Celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary here. Room was cozy with a spectacular view of the Empire State Building. Came back to the room after dinner & was surprised with a bottle of chilled champagne & wine glasses waiting for us at the room compliments of the hotel. Hotel is perfectly located-walking distance  to Hudson Yards, Times Square & Bryant Park.  Hotel is very clean & although there is a pandemic, we felt comfortable due to the sanitary measures they follow.  Love love Archer Hotel & will definitely come back

title: Exhibit of Excellence!
text: Our recent stay was absolutely delightful due to the grace, attentiveness and kindness displayed by the entire Archer Hotel team!  Heartfelt appreciation goes out to Managers Evan & Scott for making the weekend ineffably memorable.  Upon hearing that we were celebrating a special occasion, namely the engagement and birthday of our daughter, the hotel staff was kind enough to provide champagne and a note of congratulations.  In terms of comfort, the room was elegant and spacious considering the midtown Manhattan location.  It’s a wonderful location close to fine dining, parks, and subways.  We will be staying at the Archer hotel during our frequent visits to NYC!!!  Thanks again!

title: Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommend!
text: When we arrived at the hotel, Scott checked us in and was extremely nice and accommodating throughout our stay. The hotel staff checked on us every time we entered and exited the lobby to ensure we had everything we needed. The hotel was beautiful and very clean. They are following great COVID protocols and clearly care about their guests. Jamal took our luggage upon check out and held it secure for us so we could enjoy dinner and shop before leaving the city. Scott also checked us out and brought our bags out to us, and was once again very helpful. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel!

title: Weekend trip
text:
What a beautiful and exceptionally clean hotel. Excellent staff. Highly recommend. 
Location is excellent. Can’t wait to get again in the very near future 
Thank you so much to all the staff at the Archer Hotel

title: Archer Hotel - midtown gem
text: Archer offered a flawless experience. From the efficient check-in to the high speed elevators, comfortable bed, Nespresso coffee machines and bath products. The rooms are small but very smartly organized. Bathrooms are large and clean. Scott at the reception was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent. It doesn’t have a pool or a gym, so it may not work for extended stays. With its understated elegance, and efficient operation, it has become my favorite hotel in NY.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: I was in New York for surgery for cancer, and needed a clean and quiet place to stay. I come to NY often, and since the pandemic started have found horrific conditions in some of the chain hotels. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at in NY. It was very clean, modern, and safe. The hosts Scott, Reenie, and Jackie went above and beyond to help me feel cared for, and even left a get well gift in our room! Truly, my stay here felt like a gift and it was a wonderful experience to be able to truly relax and recover in comfort and peace, with positive vibes all around.

title: Archer Hotel is EXCELLENT!!
text: Amazing experience! The Archer Hotel was very very clean and has super comfy beds. Reenie was great!! The room with the Empire State Building view, well was just incredible and it was a last minute accommodation for my daughter and I, forever memorable! Thank you again Reenie! Location is great, 4 min walk to Bryant Park where we went ice skating. We had an incident where my 5 yr old locked up all her toys in the safe, (forgot password) and the Hotel manager promptly came to our rescue. I can’t thank  all of the staff enough, they’re wonderful and really care about making your stay as comfortable as possible. I would stay here again without hesitation!

title: Archer Hotel was 10/10 FANTASTIC!! Highly recommend!
text: This hotel experience was amazing from check in to check out. Amazing service with very nice people! They decorated our room prior to our stay for Valentine’s Day and even brought a bottle of champagne to our room for us. Amazing Empire State Room view. Great location right next to Bryant park. The bed was super comfortable and clean! Bathrooms as well. I definitely will be back when the rooftop opens up and cannot stress enough how amazing the service and overall experience was!

title: Service! And that View!
text: We unexpectedly needed to stay in NYC. I hurriedly looked at some reviews and chose the Archer. Wow. This hotel is stunning. We had a top floor room with a view of the Empire State Building.  We just sat and stared.  I usually enjoy trying a different hotel when staying in the city. I feel certain the Archer will be on repeat for me. The reason is the service. The staff is helpful, thoughtful and kind. Reenie and Evan demonstrate excellent customer service. Thank you for your hospitality! We will be back!

title: Amazing views
text: We had a top floor view of the Empire State Building, It was breathtaking. Will definitely stay again. the staff were amazing and we were close to everything. this is the hotel to stay at in the city. A++

title: It's the right choice
text: I spent weeks scouring reviews and prices for great Manhattan hotels and I am so glad I chose Archer. It's perfectly located for everything you want our of an NYC visit and it's an amazing price. The staff are especially kind and helpful--thank you to Reenie and Sal for helping with our early morning and late night requests!

title: NYC at its intimate best
text: i had the mixed blessing of not being able to stay at my regular hotel in NYC during the beginning of the pandemic. i am often in the city 3 different times a month. having tried a few hotels, i then encountered the Archer. finding the Archer Hotel and its fabulous staff is one of the silver linings of the Pandemic for me.

title: Wonderful customer service
text: My husband and I recently stayed here and had a wonderful experience.  The room is small, but beautifully decorated with amazing attention to detail.  It has everything you could possibly need.  The staff was so incredibly kind and helpful.  We had a great stay and will definitely be returning!

title: Cozy and comfortable during COVID – great customer service
text:
My partner and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary and the hotel was very accommodating. We mentioned our anniversary while checking-in and they gave us a small bottle of champagne later that evening.

The  hotel is well-located and the room is New York City snug, but well-designed. The bed was very comfortable. The room and common areas felt safe and clean even during the pandemic.

We would recommend Archer for friends/family coming to the city who need a centrally-located home base.

title: Amazing customer service
text: We stayed at Archer for an anniversary celebration staycation. The room was comfortable, quiet, and very clean. We felt very safe thanks to the hotel's clear and effective Covid protocols. The real highlight was the level of customer service we experienced. The staff was friendly and helpful, and when they found out it was our anniversary, they left a complimentary bottle of champagne on ice in our room.

title: Getaway Weekend
text: Great ambiance, small room but very clean and it has everything you need to stay in and enjoy your stay. Bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was very clean. Room decoration upon request was an added plus.

title: Can't say enough great things about this Hotel
text: I wasn't going to let Covid sideline my annual Bday celebrations. I couldn't travel abroad, but choosing the Archer Hotel for my weeklong staycation was the right move. Despite the Global Pandemic, the hotel was great, no issues at all. The staff went above and beyond and took care of every detail and every request. The rooms ar a bit small, but the king size ultra comfy bed more than made up for it. And the extra trun down treats, chocolate covered oreos (personally made by one of the managers), and the cool Bday treat left for me made it a real joyful and pleasurable stay. The Artcher Hotel is defineetly on my list for my next getaway and stayation. HIghly recommend.

title: Awesome
text: Very clean. Perfectly clean (I am very picky at this matter)!!!! Very comfy bed. Friendly and professional management. Good location. I wish rooftop was open:) next time I ll stay here to check it out.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text: The room was very well appointed, with bathrobes, Nespresso coffee, chocolate :-)  The size was reasonable for being in center of NYC and bathroom was sufficient.  We loved the view from the window on the Empire State Bldg.  Would definitely stay here again.    The room and whole hotel was really clean I was not affraid of staying there even during COVID19

title: Would recommend
text: Felt very safe during my stay. Appreciated the communication from the hotel before and during my stay. Staff and management were very helpful throughout my stay, and were timely in answering/responding to any questions/requests. Would recommend!

title: Charming. Booked my next stay already
text:
I am New Yorker and I have decided to get a little gateway from routine. It is a lovely hotel that serves my purpose. The attention to details is amazing. I appreciated the windows and lovely aroma in the room. Nespresso machine and books about Christmas made me feel like at home. I appreciate that they don’t have a carpeted floors. The best part is the bed. It is the most comfortable bed I ever slept on. It is like a cloud.
The only downside is the size of the room, but it was expected and not a problem for me. The service provided is professional and friendly.
Thank you Archer hotel for being amazing.

title: Would recommend 100% during COVID times
text: The front desk manager that checked us in around 4 pm on 11/27/20 was phenomenal. We called on our drive in to ask if they suggested a parking garage near by and they offered an affiliate garage, Champion, which was perfect. Upon check in we felt extremely safe with the intercom system used to enter the lobby as well as the social distancing that was performed during our check in process. We were celebrating our anniversary and your team made our stay feel wonderful. Even during these unprecedented times your COVID procedures and team handled everything top notch. Room was wonderful and felt it was clean. We will definitely be coming back.

title: Great hotel and customer service.
text: This was a great hotel with great customer service. Rooms were gorgeous I wish I took pictures, I got the room with a view of the Empire State Building, it was amazing.  Beyond happy will definitely go again.  The rooftop bar was closed because of COVID but that’s ok it was still great.  Staff was beyond nice.

title: Amazing hospitality
text: All hotel employees were very friendly and personable. I ordered a package ahead of time and they delivered it right to my room after I checked in. They were very accommodating and even set us up with champagne and a sweet Happy Engagement note. We loved staying here. And the location is perfection!!

title: Fabulous Stay!
text: We loved our stay! Everyone at the front desk was super nice and helpful. The room was beautiful, clean and cozy and the amenities like the slippers, robes, toiletries and especially the turn down treats every night made our stay so fun and were such lovely touches! Even with everything disrupted because of Covid they managed to make us feel safe and pampered. The location was great, so convenient to get anywhere in the city! Right between 5th and 6th Ave., It’s about a 5 min (if even) walk to Bryant Park, with Rockefeller Plaza another 5 min away, and there is great shopping and food all nearby (Magnolia Bakery by Rockefeller Plaza and all the great stores on 5th Ave.!). It’s also a quick walk or even quicker Uber from Grand Central Station which is very convenient. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great place to stay for business or pleasure in NYC.

title: Lovely Experience
text: Staff was pleasant and hotel room was lovely and very comfortable.  The hotel took precautions with respect to COVID and in spite of the stresses and pressures of the pandemic the staff was hospitable, pleasant and helpful.

title: Save yourself a headache and book your trip to NY @ The Archer
text: We went to NY for my bday and booked a different hotel every day but let me tell you nothing compares to The Archer. I wish we would've just booked here instead of everywhere else, the service was A1, the employees there always went above and beyond our expectations and they even gave us recommendations for dinner and things to do. We will book a room at The Archer if they have one in the city we travel to. Forever recomend them!

title: Great location, friendly staff!
text: Tough decision to travel on these days but had to. I definitely felt confortable and confident with COVID protocols. The location is great! I am a frequent NYC traveler and for me is one of the best stays in terms of price-quality hotels I’ve stayed. Is just less than a block to the 5th ave and half a block from 6th ave. So you are very close to either east and west side within just a few minutes walk. The staff is very friendly and willing to assist you. Cannot say about the food since is closed due to the situation, however looking forward to go again and enjoy those other amenities. Clean and comfortable rooms. Definitely I recommend this!

title: Great sevice
text:
Reenie on the front desk was very helpful, as were the rest of the staff. They looked after my bags, gave me free bottles of water and hailed me a taxi.

The room was clean and comfortable. No complaints.

title: Great little boutique hotel
text: Great place. Modern. Chic. Clean. My boyfriend and I stayed for just one night last weekend and enjoyed our stay. Randy, who checked us in, was awesome.  Friendly and professional. He gave us a free upgrade to a room on the 21st floor with an awesome view of the empire state building. Of course the location of this hotel is prefect - in the heart of the City - blocks away from Times square. Of course any hotel stay right now during Covid is going to be unusual. The hotel did not have housekeeping. In order to get anything, you would have to call down and go pick it up. It was okay for us because we were only there for one night but if staying longer, it would be a drag not having anyone make up your bed with fresh linen or clean your bathroom. Also, their rooftop restaurant is closed because no dining inside allowed. Again, ok for us as we were only there for the night, and there is so much in the way of dining and bars very close by.  Bathroom and shower were great. Clean and modern. The bed was super comfy. Loved it. However, we didn't have a top sheet - just the fitted sheet and the comforter. Strange. Didn't like that.  But overall a great stay. Would definitely recommend the Archer. We would visit again - post-covid.

title: Love this place!
text: I had an amazing time here, the staff is wonderful and nice, and the room was beautiful and felt secluded (which I liked). Air conditioning was wonderful—full on had a wonderful experience here brought my Xbox and had no problem hooking it up. Would recommend bringing your own travel toothpaste.

title: Anniversary
text: We had the best experience ever! Evan was so kind & friendly, its like we have known him forever & Sal was AMAZING! Ebenezer was so kind also. Any single thing we needed or asked was done and also things we didnt remember to ask for. The rooms are so fresh & clean! We will be back! We loved every single thing about it! Thanks Evan Rodgers & Sal for everything!

title: Great Staff
text: I recently stayed at the Archer with my wife and son over the Labor Day weekend.  The gentleman at the door Saturday morning came to my Jeep  and immediately assisted me (forgot his name)  with my bags - he also provided parking info and didn’t rush me - The young lady the front desk named Reenie provided excellent customer service and went out of herway to answer our questions and assist in my requests. There was another employee that morning who also assisted. The evening and the over night staff were equally helpful and professional- the hotel is located  in a good location for what we needed and a great value.  We had a glitch when my wife had her wallet stolen when we went out for breakfast - NYPD was super helpful and I applaud them - this incident had nothing to do with hotel but they were super helpful and concerned -I recommend this hotel and Kudos to the staff and  Thank you Reenie !,

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city.
text: Beautiful hotel in the heart of the city. The Archer  is a wonderful hotel, located two blocks south of Bryant Park. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is very clean, and I had to pull myself out of the spacious shower. We had a beautiful view of the Empire State building from our room, the amenities were wonderful. And although we stayed during the Pandemic for our daughters wedding, inside the hotel everything was normal. I will stay here again and would recommend that you check it out as well.

title: Lax cleaning and maintenance
text:
This was my first time traveling since the pandemic and it was a big disappointment.  The most important thing to me was cleanliness and on this, the Archer completely failed.  There were visible urine stains on the toilet, which were disgusting and completely creeped me out.  If the cleaners missed those, then they obviously didn’t do a thorough or complete cleaning job, and that made me very nervous about the possible presence of Covid-19 both in the room and in the hotel more broadly.

In addition, there was no hot water in the first room I checked into due to a problem with the valve, and the second room only had lukewarm water.  I had hot water on the second night after I complained again.  That shouldn’t have happened.  

Also, the neighborhood is not very good, and the restaurants the hotel recommended appeared to all be lower-class tourist traps.  If this is your first time to NYC and you’ve visited to see Times Square and Broadway, then you might not mind and these places might be economical, practical choices, but given what wonderful food New York has, this was such a shame.  The hotel may know that their clientele prefers these type of restaurants, but I definitely don’t.  Fortunately, I knew where to go for better food, but it’s not to be found in the vicinity of the hotel. 

And finally, I checked out in person so that I could communicate these points, but the person who checked me out didn’t bother to ask me about my stay.  She just brusquely informed me that I’d receive my folio by email.  Par for the course.  It’s a shame, because my room was large, quiet, and nicely designed.  But the hotel is a low-class establishment, and I won’t be back.

title: Friendliest Hotel Staff & DREAM beds with a VIEW to match.
text:
The location is perfect. Exactly as described, just a few mins walk from Times Square and all the attractions. We had an excellent view of the Empire state building as well. But what made our stay ultimately so special were the finishing touches. It was our honeymoon and the first time in New York. They left a special treat for us and just these wonderful little notes. Throughout the room, there were high-quality items from the unique shampoos and mango conditioner to the down comforter beds. I think it was the most comfortable bed I ever slept in to be quite honest. We always felt welcome and checked on and the staff helped us with our itinerary and had excellent suggestions. Honestly, I have NEVER had better service from a hotel room. They were fairly young staff but fresh and down to earth. Approachable. They really made our trip comfortable in a time of uncertainty. 

Thank you for everything <3

title: Perfect Stay During a Tough Time
text:
My friends and I needed a place to stay as a pit stop. We randomly selected the Archer and couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. We checked in around 2 am. The check-in agent was pleasant and thorough for this time of night. He provided just enough details for our short stay. 

Our room was nicely decorated with amazing Malin & Goetz products and comfy robes. The bed was even better.  We had one minor issue with an appliance that was corrected swiftly.

During checkout, the other staff members were helpful and just as pleasant. They assisted us with storing our luggage until we left town and provided water (it was brutality hot that day). I will highly recommend this hotel and look forward to coming back if I'm ever in NYC.

title: It’s All About The View!
text:
I picked this hotel for the view of the Empire State Bldg and I was not disappointed!
The hotel was super clean and lots of safety measures in place during the pandemic.
Staff was very friendly.  No food served in the hotel due to pandemic but lots of options nearby.  Nice shower, big windows that open a little, part of mini fridge for personal use, water and a couple pieces of candy  as amenity.  
The room is New York City small but functional.

title: I could have stayed here forever
text: My guy and I stayed here as a treat on his first time to NYC and the staff did nothing short of roll out the red carpet for us. Scott at the front desk knew it was his first visit and was always checking in with us to make sure he was loving it. The staff even sent us the sweetest surprise it wa such a treat! Although I missed the restaurant and bar at the hotel, our room was comfortable, clean, and had everything we could want to enjoy our stay.  The room is small but for a place to rest and refresh it was perfect. We had an amazing stay and I hope we get to come back.

title: amazing beds
text:
First time to new york and we had a blast. hotel is in a great location and has great character. 

the beds were so comfortable and we had the best nights sleep!

the hotel was clean and the staff were very attentive.

title: Wonderful way to See New York
text:
We had a remarkable stay at the Archer Hotel with a view of the Empire State Building! In the heart of the Garment District off 6th Avenue, the hotel was immaculate! The staff were very accommodating day and night!! Everything was COVID ready and plenty of places to eat and shop.
I highly recommend the Archer Hotel! Pet friendly too!

title: Love this hotel!
text: I highly recommend this hotel. They have an outstanding staff that are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean. Perfect location. Parking garage for this hotel is a couple of blocks away, but the hotel validates & discounts fee. Will be back soon!

title: Exceptional Stay!
text:
Everything was exceptionally professional and clean!
I recommend this hotel to all. Stayed for my birthday and was accommodated as desired with spectacular view of the Empire State Building overlooking the window!

title: Excellent hotel for a short stay
text:
Our experience was a pleasant one. I'd say the best thing about the hotel are the staff. They're excellent and always ready to help out in whatever ways possible. It was a hot couple of days when we were there, so they were always offering water and other ways to help. On our final day, they were also happy to look after our bags while we explored the city in between our check-out time and transfer. 
The room is small but that is to be expected in NYC. After a few minutes in there, it become quite cosy thanks to the room layout, lovely bathroom, and great amenities. 
We came for a quick stay and the Archer was a great hotel that met our needs.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Archer Hotel staff was excellent. Very kind and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location was very safe and central. This will be our go to hotel in New York City.

title: Our stay at Archer Hotel
text:
We couldn’t have asked for a better stay at Archer Hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Little small but expected. 
Would love to see ice machines on the floors but the staff were very accommodating in making sure to deliver. 
We were most impressed with Scott and Sal who were literally at our beck and call. They anticipated our needs without having to ask for anything. 
We would definitely come back and visit! 
Thankyou Scott and Sal for everything! 
Mark and Victoria

title: SUCH a great visit!
text: We enjoyed everything about our time at the Archer - the room, the location, and most definitely the customer service. Sal and Scott were super helpful as we needed to store our luggage for the day while we wandered Manhattan. We will absolutely return!

title: Great hotel, very nice staff, minibar, espresso machine. Comfortable bed
text: We loved this hotel, very close to everything, very nice staff, quick check in! Comfortable bed, good minibar, espresso machine with variety of coffee, extremely clean room, bathrobes, slippers, complimentary Fiji water and chocolate!

title: Good location better staff
text:
Scott made this two days family trip much better.
Kindly gave a nice room with insuperable view, my daughter loved it
Sal was so helpful in the checkout, not to mention a late check was very appreciated since I traveled with a 10 years old girl.
Gracias

title: Cozy...Affordable...Cordial
text: My NYC trip began shuttling between two less-than-acceptable Holiday Inn Express's (beware the 4 star ratings...) Disgruntled, I began the search for the elusive combo of quality, location, and cost. After much hand-wringing, I rolled the dice on Archer. Good call. The King room is a bit tight, but the accommodations are lovely, certainly for one. The desk staff were incredibly helpful, tending to my every need, polite, responsive, friendly. There were some WiFi issues throughout my stay, but that can't be blamed on staff. Overall, it's definitely worth a look if it doesn't mean breaking the bank. The service was 100% on-point.

title: Weekend trip
text: Could not have asked for nicer staff. Despite the current situation, they went above and beyond. Many thanks.would like to have tried the rooftop, maybe next time. Gary in particular was helpful. Very convenient location.

title: Great room!! but no wifi
text: Stood in the city with my wife for a small getaway and handle some business but WiFi in the entire hotel didn’t work so I could not do any business until I got back home other then that empire view is awesome great staff great area close to everything!!

title: Gorgeous
text: We traveled here  for our anniversary in 2019, and we are still talking about this hotel.  The staff was friendly, the ambiance was incredible. The food was amazing. The walk to downtown was worth it - NYC is such a great place.   Our hotel room was small, yet clean & modern.  Lets not forget the great view of the Empire State Building.

title: Great hotel!
text: We loved our stay at the Archer hotel. The beds were beyond comfortable and the room was super clean. Our favorite part of our stay was the staff. They gave great recommendations and were very accommodating.

title: 4th of July Stay
text: Upon arrival I was greeted by Gary and Jamal and even thought they had masked on you still could tell they we're smiling. They were helpful and friendly. The view of the Empire State Building from our room window was amazing . The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable.

title: Best hotel Ever 💯🔥
text: me and my wife stayed for the weekend and had a great time despite the current state of things the hotel itself was nice and clean and the staff mainly one person was great our host Gary Simon was very friendly and accommodating. Mr Simon and his co workerJamal really made us feel welcomed i cant say the same for the rest of the staff the archer needs more people like Mr Simon

title: Friendliest Place in NYC to stay
text:
We had a great stay here at the Archer hotel in NYC. 

It's located in a great neighborhood that's pretty close to times square and other mid-town attractions.

There is a loading zone in front of the hotel so if you have a car, they'll let you leave it out there while you check in.

The rooms are pretty good sized for a NYC hotel. The bathrooms are very modern and sheik. The floors are heated as well, which I didn't think was a big deal at first  until my next hotel room didn't have them.

The staff are always helpful and offer anything they can to make your stay great. I had the pleasure of having Gary & Jamal as well as Randy for a few of the days. We had some great convo and they helped out with a few food recommendations.

This is probably the only hotel in NYC that I'd return to.

title: Birthday weekend at the Archer
text: I will never be staying ANYWHERE else when I travel to NYC. The Archer was so accommodating and their communication from the very beginning - when we booked the hotel - was amazing. They are so welcoming. They truly made the weekend the best. The room was absolutely beautiful too. Amazing location, amazing staff. Just amazing. I cannot wait to go back to Archer hotel!

title: Well priced mid-town hotel
text:
The Archer is well situated on a mostly commercial mid-town block. Pleasant but small lobby and bar. Rooms small but comfortable and well appointed.

Front desk staff Scott and Gary were extremely helpful and cordial. Terrific experience.

title: Wonderful experience!!! ❤️
text:
The Archer hotel needs to give Evan, Jamal, Gary and Michelle major kudos and a nice raise!! From my initial phone contact with Michelle about open restaurants to the exemplary, helpful attitude of Evan, Gary and Jamal I was made to feel warmly welcome and appreciated!

I was in town for a dress fitting for a wedding, and these guys went beyond the call of duty to help me rearrange my train schedule, provide me with complimentary water to stay hydrated, and paid for an Uber ride that required me to return to the hotel because of unforeseen restaurant restrictions. 

As far as the room itself.. super comfortable bed, great shower and a hair dryer that was gentle on my hair. It was such a pleasant, albeit short visit and NY was still in Phase 2 so I could not utilize the other amenities (gym, bar, restaurant).

Truly.. their friendliness and care during my stay needs to be recognized! 
They exhibited such an incredible level of customer service, that Archer will be my “go-to” hotel every time I am in NYC.  Thank you for making this visit such a wonderful experience! ❤️

title: Amazing bed
text: Scott was so amazing when during the pandemic he made our stay exceptional!! Will stay again.... the bed was super soft and comfortable! The rest room was a great size and they even upgraded us to a room with a tub

title: Clean, cozy, wonderful customer service
text: We definitely enjoyed our stay...The customer service was top notch. Scott was very helpful...The hotel is right next to Bryant park. Although the room was a little tight, it was very clean and cozyy so we loved it!!!

title: NYC Trip
text: Awesome service! Walking distance from Times Square and everything fun. Gary and Jamal were amazing! Both very welcoming and helpful. Oh and the bed is as comfortable as the Westin’s. Definitely staying here next time as well.

title: Love this hotel and their staff!
text: Jackie, Scott, Sal, Gary, Brian and Jackie's assistant were all true professionals. The entire staff were well mannered, professional, and beyond helpful. The hotel and my room was spotless. One of the most important business meetings of my life was due to occur earlier this week.  Due to the virus, Marches, and rioting I could not use my lawyers offices or find any other hotels that would allow for my meetings with 2 VIP's to take place. Jackie and staff solved that problem, true life savers! I will definitely make the Archer my first and only choice when I visit NYC! Of course I will also refer my friends to the Archer when they visit the city.  Kudos to the entire staff and management, an excellent experience.

title: Covid stay
text: I wish I would’ve wrote this review sooner I want to thank Gary and Jamal for the awesome customer service. Every time I came in from work they always made sure to ask if I was okay or if I needed anything. I never felt like I was a burden to them, they made me feel 1000 percent comfortable in every way possible. Best experience I’ve had so far I will for sure be coming back.  Thank you again  Archer Hotel for hiring great staff members Gary and Jamal they definitely make a great example for excellent customer service.

title: Great experience
text:
I loved the entire staff at Archer New York. They were extremely welcoming, friendly and supportive. With everything going on, I was staying in Archer and felt at home. The bathroom layout was nice as well. Thank you to the entire staff, you guys were awesome! Until next time!

- Leena

title: Cabin Fever
text:
I was impressed by the lobby area, being in the hospitality industry I know good decor when I see it.  It was very tasteful with an elegance which is almost intimidating...... until you meet the staff!
Everyone wants to feel comfortable and they were beyond a warm presence. We met Scott and he gave us a warm smile and all the info we needed about the hotel. Later that night we met the amazing Gary. 
      He was down to earth with an air of professionalism and timely. 
  He immediately made sure that we had all the required safety items for my stay. He was jovial and knowledgeable of the city. 
      Jamal was very concerned for our safety but let us know that we are still in New York and what to do here. He also informed us about the curfew. 
        Finally James the maintenance. I had an annoying light out in my room. As quick as I called about it, he was promptly in our room and fixed the light.  It was as if it never happened. 
     In these unsure times where New York feels like a scene out of Escape New York, this staff was a beacon of light. Letting us know all things New York! Make sure you take one of their treats at the desk, they’re delicious!!!!

title: My stay
text:
My stay at the Archer Hotel was amazingly comfortable room was superb extremely clean and cozy. 
Jamal Gary, as well as the rest of the Concierge etc, were so professional and hospitable. I would highly recommend this hotel to stay at.

title: AMAZING HOTEL, WONDERFUL STAFF ... A 10+++
text: I have FINALLY FOUND my GO TO HOTEL when I travel to NYC!! The Archer Hotel staff are friendly, courteous and go the extra mile to make your stay as comfortable and pleasant as it should be. We were fortunate enough to get a room on the 21st Floor looking at the Empire State Building & the view was spectacular!! The room was very clean, pleasantly appointed and the mattress was very soft & comfortable ... I won't be going anywhere else!! ARCHER HOTEL YOU ROCK!! ❤❤❤

title: Really helpful staff
text: I ended up going to NYC with my puppy during the coronavirus and it was incredible how accommodating the staffs were during my stay (Especially Scott o/). From helping me arrange food deliveries, to sorting out a parking situation, they really went above and beyond onto tailoring to my requests. At one point, they even offered me a complimentary upgrade to my room. Even during this strange time, I was really able to feel comfortable with my puppy in the hotel and would absolutely stay there again the next time I'm in NYC.

title: Great, Eloquent Hotel
text:
The service staff here is simply, amazing. From check-in to check-out, the front desk services has been nothing short of attentive and quick (Shout out to Gary!) 

The hotel has higher end amenities and was able to provide great service to make my stay enjoyable during this time. The location is situated near a lot of order-in services and close enough to walk to many establishments. 

Great views of the city skyline with a very comforting decor. 

Highly recommend for any traveler's staying in this area, or even a quick staycation to those stuck in NYC.

Thanks again!

title: A Peaceful Haven In a Tense Town
text:
Somehow everyone working at that joint is keeping much cooler than anyone anywhere else in the city. They kept control of the lobby space.  They worked efficiently and conscientiously.  They were sincerely warm and welcoming.  All of them!  
Everything was clean. Everything worked. 
They did not slack off on anything, including the interesting, clever touches that add to the cool vibe of the place. Pink slippers with red kissy lips or black with a silver mustache? ‘The Little Prince’ or E.B. White poems?
The ‘turndown treat’ was a couple of chocolate dipped fortune cookies.  The fortunes (attached photo) were words of wisdom from Archer himself that the walls of the place seem to already say.
I did not want to leave. 
Best hotel experience I have ever had. In the middle of a scary pandemic. Can’t wait to go back and see what it’s like when easier times return.

title: Diamond in the rough find in a great location
text:
I was recommended this hotel and glad I took up the offer to stay here. It is located in the heart of midtown with a five minute walk from major transportation including trains and buses. More importantly you’re steps away from Bryant Park, Timesquare, Herald Square, Flatiron District, and Union square.

The hotel itself prides itself in being intimate and they pay attention to details. Upon arrival I had treats for myself and my four legged companion. I love the his and her slippers that they give as complimentary gifts. The room has extra charging devices, cable tv, and wifi. They also give you a listing of food places in the area as the restaurant is not currently open. There’s also a refrigerator and an espresso machine, but they do not have a microwave. They do give the option of having your food heated up downstairs by the front desk. While at the front desk feel free to ask for free ppe of masks and gloves to help with protection in this 
“ new normal”. 

My room was very lush and I would love to have the name of the bed because it was that comfortable. The room is on the small side with not a lot of real estate in regards to a footprint, but what they lack in space they make up for in their layout and furnishings. I love how it is decorated and they give extra storage under the bed for your luggage. Even the bathroom is nice and I liked the pull out mirror for makeup. I enjoyed the water pressure of the shower and the toiletries given by Malin + Goetz with the cilantro conditioner being a favorite. 

All and all I’m happy that I decided to stay at this chic boutique hotel and enjoyed my brief stay here. I will be returning for my birthday and look forward to visiting in the near future.

title: Nurse in need of a room for work.
text: The hotel was beautiful. Staff very helpful and accommodating. Even provided free face masks and hand sanitizer for their guests! They tended to our  every need. Willing to call for info on which restaurants were open for take out. Since NYC has been on PAUSE due to pandemic. I would definitely visit again.

title: Kevin
text: Recently stayed at the Archer, during the pandemic the staff were friendly and  took all needed precautions to help stop the spread. I appreciate this as a frontline healthcare worker. The room was immaculate with a great view. There was an issue with hot water in my shower, I called the front desk and a maintenance worker James promptly arrived at my room. He was nice,professional, had a mask and gloves on, explained the issue, fixed the shower quickly. He even gave me a great recommendation to grab breakfast in the area. I look forward to another stay at the archer

title: Simply amazing!
text: From the moment you walk in and get greeted by staff, you feel like you’ve made the right choice and have inherited a new family. Look forward to an amazing night of sleep here at the Archer in NYC!!!

title: Ideal place to stay
text: Easy enough to travel anywhere from the Archer. I did though walk everywhere rather than using the nearby subway. Might as well see New York above ground when the weather is fine! Ground Zero around an hour to walk to, Central Park 30 minutes, Hudson Yards 20 minutes, Penn Station/Madison Sq Gdns both 10 minutes and Bryant Park less than 5(great wafels) . Staff welcoming and always ready to answer questions. Room on the small side(view of Empire State Building), clean and tidy. Have since bought Malin+Goetz products. Very comfortable bed. Breakfast was nearer 7am rather than the 6.30 am advertised at least when I tried the breakfast. Definitely use again when visiting New York.

title: Happy with my decision to book the Archer NYC
text: Enjoyed my recent stay at the Archer. Its was a perfect location for all the places we wanted to visit - close to the trains, easy to catch Uber and walkable to many areas.  The room is small but probably standard size for NYC, it was efficiently laid out with clean and modern furnishings. There is storage under the bed for you luggage but somehow I couldn't get mine to fit. I did find the bathroom to be generously sized! I appreciated the Nespresso Coffee machine and the nightly treats! Loved the view from roof top bar - great way to start the night off...even though my martini was served in warm glass. I found the new bar/club in the lobby to be ok, it does make the lobby a bit small and cramped as you exit the elevator. Everyone was friendly and helpful and I will now look for the Archer brand when traveling to other cities. Thanks!

title: Can't wait to be able to return & show our appreciation
text: Like so many, we had to cancel our long awaited holiday to NYC at the last minute due to the escalation of the COVID-19 health crisis.  Having stayed at the Archer eighteen months ago, we'd really been looking forward to another visit.  Without even asking, we didn't get penalised for cancelling on the day we were due to arrive - even though that was part of our booking terms and conditions.  We can't wait to return when the health crisis is over and show our appreciation and hope all the team will be rewarded for being so understanding. Stay safe.

title: Great location but really small rooms
text:
This was our 3rd trip to New York but our first stay at the Archer. Even though we expect a small room in New York, we thought the room was smaller than the other New York hotels we have stayed in. We did have an amazing view of the Empire State building.

Staff were very helpful and friendly.

We were there in the middle of winter so we couldn't stay too long on the outdoor rooftop bar. Would be very nice in the warmer months. Hotels on either side of the Archer also had nice rooftop bars.

Approx a 10 min walk from Penn Station.

title: Fabulous Boutique hotel in Manhattan
text: Really happy that we chose Archer Hotel for our stay on this visit. Unfortunately we had to curtail our stay due to the Coronavirus pandemic, leaving three days early, but the staff couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating. I fully expected to have to accept that we'd not be compensated, but without being prompted the staff advised us that they will refund the three nights, and that we must contact Expedia to receive a credit.
