I wasn't expecting it to be that easy. From the moment we arrived the staff made sure we  were settled in, explaining all we needed to know about the hotel, its facilities, and the local area. The room was immaculate, and was serviced and cleaned every day. Everything about the room was quality, from the bed and bedding, to the bathroom facilities, to the decor. The room safe was so very useful for storing our precious belongings, not that we feared anything. Once the pandemic is over we will return to NYC and our first booking will be Archer Hotel as I don't believe we will find better. Thank you to all the fabulous staff, we look forward to seeing you again in the not too distant future.

title: A Gem in the Heart of it all
text:
A fabulous Hotel. Incredible views of the Empire state Building from my room 1704 on the 18th floor and loved our drinks at the SpyGlass bar.
Beautiful Rooms,clean and lovely linen and loved the black and white bathrooms.
Appreciated the Turn down service each night.
Very friendly staff. Thankyou Scott, Nathan, Adam and Eddy.
I will definately stay there again on my next bite from The big Apple.
Very recommendable. hankyou to the Archer Team
Brett Southworth from The tug Restaurant, Namibia

title: The Best!
text: I stayed at the Archer for a 4 night business trip. The staff is very helpful from the bellmen and front desk to housekeeping and restaurant.  The food in the lobby restaurant is very good and everything my waitress suggested I enjoyed. I left something in my room after I checked out. The hotel emailed me to confirm it was my item then shipped it back to me free of charge. Stay here if you have the opportunity.

title: Recommended
text: Nice rooms with comfortable beds and a really nice shower :) The cleaning of the rooms was super, the rooftop bar was nice and the location is perfect, close to almost everything. It is quite expensive, but if we are going back and wanting to stay in Midtown, we would stay here again.

title: Archer Hotel and Covid 19
text:
We had reservations at the Archer since February for March 19 for a 6 day stay.  Today, I found out that Broadway was to be closed for the next month so one of our main reasons for going to NYC was removed.
I called Gary at the Front desk to explain my dilemma since we had a non refundable reservation.  Given these covid 19 times, he cheerfully said that he would refund our money.  WOW!!    The Archer will get my business when it becomes safe to travel to NYC again!!  My great thanks to the Archer for their GREAT service!!

title: Central Clean Comfortable Cozy
text: Great Boutique style Hotel, excellent reception staff. We were a couple with 2 large suitcases and 3 smaller ones and cannot complain about the rooms which were comfortable and clean. Proper view of the Empire State from the room and lovely Spyglass Bar on the top floor.

title: Gem of a hotel
text:
I've stayed at many, many hotels in NYC, and this one is a real gem. Super clean, wonderful service, great amenities. The bed is top of the line in terms of comfort and linens. The shower is extraordinary, too. Turndown every night is lovely - great local treats that change nightly - both delicious and a fun way of honoring NYC. Everyone who we encountered - from the doorman to the front desk to the maintenance worker (very small problem/question with the ventilation) couldn't have been more accomodating. I would definitely return.

 As far as "cons," there are a couple, but they are so minor that they would not  impact my choice in the future. The rooms are super small (not great if 2 people want to stay for a week or so, perhaps, but otherwise perfectly manageable); the towels, toilet paper, and tissues aren't as great as one would expect from a hotel like this (but I'm being super-picky here). Really, don't hesitate - stay here! I certainly will when I'm back in town. I was actually sad to be leaving!

title: Bachelorette weekend
text: We stayed with Archer one night for a bachelorette weekend with 9 women in 5 rooms. The room had great rates (with a special tri-State area discount!) and all of the reps I spoke to were friendly and helpful while booking. I told them we were there for a bachelorette weekend and we were greeted with bubbly, balloons, chocolates and drink tickets. We had happy hour at Spyglass rooftop bar and the views were lovely! The rooms were spacious for NYC, toiletries were Malin + Goetz, room amenities were plentiful, and the service was helpful. I live in NYC and love to take little hotel staycations, and I would definitely recommend this place for in- or out-of-towners.

title: Still my favorite midtown hotel!!
text:
I have been staying at The Archer since 2017 every time I am in NYC for business or pleasure.

New hotels are constantly popping up but The Archer is STILL my favorite! 

It is the perfect example of a boutique hotel. What sets it apart from the competition is the service. Definitely 5 star service-staff is friendly and accommodating! I have come to realize that service is really what defines a hotel and the quality of your stay.

Rooms are not huge but perfectly appointed-they have all the space you really need.

The small touches like a different sweet treat every night left on your bedside table, Nespresso machine with plenty of coffee pods all make your stay special.

The rooftop bar is a fun place to end the night with a drink.

I would highly recommend The Archer if you are looking for a nice stay in midtown!

title: Pictures look better than the actual property
text: Rooms are very small and there is no personal touch to check in etc. The hotel feels like a bed and breakfast where people are just arriving to sleep, which would make sense as there wasn't more to the hotel. The overall vibe is not comforting. You can find a lot better hotels in this price range.

title: Swanky midtown hotel.
text: Great boutique hotel in the heart of NYC with views of Empire State Building. Excellent location ( walking distance to most tourist attractions, Broadway, Times Square etc) and value. Kind, attentive and helpful staff. Nice rooftop sky bar. Recommend to all.

title: bom, mas o preço parece ser de uma classe superior
text: bem localizado, quarteirao razoavelmente silencioso mesmo estando entre a 5th e 6th. atendimento atencioso e simpático. otima cama, otimos lencois e travesseiros. banheiro muito bom, bonito, razoavelmente espacoso para um unico ocupante. quarto um pouco apertado , ar condicionado dificil de estabilizar e um pouco barulhento. café da manha fraco, espaço pequeno e nada que remeta à um hotel "boutique". foi ok, mas nao sei se escolheria nova estada no mesmo hotel.

title: Fanastic staff
text: Staff throughout was excellent! Only disappointed the steakhouse was not open...which gives me an excuse to go back! Staff especially housekeeping were very attentive & helpful. Great location close to everything.

title: I Love Archer Hotel New York
text:
I love the Archer Hotel in New York City. It has the perfect Midtown location, in the center of EVERYTHING. The rooms are small, but comfortable, and most offer great views of the Empire State Building. 

What sets Archer apart from other places I've stayed is their level of service. Reenie at the front desk is a DREAM. Each time I have stayed here, she has made everything perfect for me. The staff is genuinely friendly and you can tell they want your stay to be comfortable and enjoyable. 

This is my hotel of choice when staying in New York. Hopefully it will become yours too.

title: New York City Break
text: Excellent hotel. Rooms on the small size but still ticked every box. Friendly staff with a professional service. Rooftop bar can be a little crowded with limited seating, However I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues.

title: Amazing!
text: Amazing front desk staff! Amazing amenities! Amazing location! I highly recommend this hotel. Rock star staff all around! I highly recommend! Views of Empire State Building at night is the icing on the cake!

title: Fantastic!
text: Spent the past weekend in NYC and stayed at the Archer. Everything was wonderful.. the room, the staff, the location and the roof top bar was a treat.  Will definitely make this a "go to" place to stay in NYC.

title: Superb Customer Service in New York City
text: The Archer is a hip hotel in Midtown West that has been open for about 6 years. The staff is really great and they all make you feel comfortable. Julie at the front desk is an absolute gem. She made our stay at Archer feel like a home away from home. The bar on the rooftop, Spyglass is full of life and offers a beautiful view of the great Empire State Building. The rooms are very well laid out for their size. The bedding and towels are wonderful. The Nespresso coffee machine in the room was a very nice treat. The lobby bar has a great happy hour. We highly recommend this hotel, have already told multiple friends about it and we look forward to coming back!!

title: Emplacement fabuleux
text:
Que de mieux en arrivant dans votre chambre et en ouvrant les rideaux que de tomber sur la vue sur l'Empire state building ... Demander un étage élever lors de la réservation.. c'est magnifique.
Les chambres sont calme sans la climatisation.
Personnel adorable ..

title: Archer KILLS it!!
text: Great stay. Staff on point, clean and super comfortable rooms.  Great drinks at all the bars in the hotel and even soup dumplings that rock! Can’t say enough great things and I’ve stayed in a lot of places..

title: great staff, good breakfast
text: Staff is very nice, helpful, and quick to respond. Breakfast is simple but exactly what one needs to start the day for a fair price. Good location and quiet enough for NY standards. Nice rooftop bar. Rooms are small but very comfortable. Great bathroom.

title: Great hotel with excellent management
text:
We were staying in this hotel for 3 nights. Cozy room, nice rooftop bar, generally located in a coo neighborhood.
Had some technical difficulties the first night and experienced some real good problem solving skills by the hotel management. Special thanks to Scott who took care of us very well.
Will definitely come back.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The location of this hotel was so convenient to everything on our trip to NYC.  Added to the impeccable service, well appointed and comfortable rooms, and delicious snacks and breakfast you would be hard pressed to find a better deal!

title: Excellent service!!
text: We stayed here one night after The Eagles concert at MSG.  The staff is excellent.  Front desk, bellman and housekeeping.  Front desk staff are polite and efficient. Bellman are very efficient, polite and helpful.  The room is small, but typical in NYC.  It’s all very well appointed and the bathroom is very nice. Everything is clean and new. I especially appreciated the “turn down” service where they also replenished all the supplies such as coffee and bath amenities.  The roof top bar is not to be missed.  Great view of the Empire State Building. Great to visit during the day and again at night.  I was very happy with the experience.  Believe me, I researched many before finding The Archer. We will be back. It will be our “go to” when we are in NYC.

title: Trip to New York city
text: Stayed at the archer hotel, great stay, staff was great, view of Empire State Building was amazing . Restaurant was not open, so they offered free breakfast set up at bar area. Our room was not ready when we arrived, they offered us free drinks at the bar !!! Room was ready 10 minutes later!!! Awesome

title: Excelente servicio
text: Excelente te Atencion y servicio , el bar de la terraza del ultimo piso una vista inmejorable con una atención en el bar excelente , muy recomendable , excelente ubicación a media cuadra de la 5a avenida

title: Girls Trip
text: Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!  Would most definitely stay here again.  All the little touches to make our stay extra special.  Great location, cozy rooms and great service.  The staff even brought up a birthday cupcake for my daughter!!

title: Great front desk staff
text:
Went to NYC for a quick birthday celebration. We were greeted immediately by staff. Everyone was very pleasant and willing to help with any questions.  There was a huge cupcake with a note waiting for us in the room. 
Loved the little treats left daily for us. Room was clean and size more than adequate for 2 people.  Great location, walkable to many places we wanted to go. 
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great staff, restaurant closed for renovation, a little tight.
text: Got a room in the front ( street side) facing the Empire State building. That is well worth it. The Spyglass rooftop bar is great. The lobby and ground floor bar felt small - that may have been because the restaurant is closed for construction.  The room is a little bit on the small side too but that may be normal for Manhattan. Bed was wonderful. Great pillows. Room was immaculate.Overall the hotel decor was nice.  The staff are good, friendly, efficient.

title: All we could hope for.
text: Just got home from our weekend stay at the Archer. We can only say great things about this property. Very clean, and modern. The furnishings and bedding are top notch. They have turn down service, and my daughter loved the cookies they left for us each day. We splurged for an Empire State view, and that did not disappoint. The location is a quick walk to Bryant Park, or Time Square, but tucked away from the touristy stuff. We would definitely stay here again.

title: NYC girls weekend
text: It is a very nice small hotel. It has everything you need from great restaurants to and excellent roof top bar. Great place to stay. Clean, quiet, and near all good places to visit and eat. Walking distance to all the shows.  Taxis are available .

title: Great stay
text: A nice hotel with a great location in Midtown. Very good service and always friendly people. Stayed in a fairly small room but very clean, comfortable bed and a good bathroom. Fresh breakfast and healthy lunch options.

title: Great Service
text:
Awesome Service!  Troy at the Front Desk from the time we arrived to the time we checked out made us feel welcome and was always making sure things were going great.  His just asking how are you doing every time we left made you feel important.
The bed and pillows were awesome!

title: Definitely stay here again
text:
The hotel is very clean, beds are so comfortable, quiet and peaceful atmosphere. The staff are amazing, Jonathan and Troy were exceptional, printing out boarding passes out for us, getting taxis and basically being all round nice people. I cant fault the staff at all.
Brekfast was complimentary as there is building works going on but didnt infringe out stay at all. Food is overpriced in the adjoining resteraunt so I wouldn't personally eat here.
Rooftop bar is amazing and the view of the Empire state building is second to none. We are on our way to JFK as I'm writing this, we are so happy with our stay
 Would definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent staff, fantastic bed and pillows, great view and location
text: Archer Hotel New York has all the right stuff. It's in midtown and close to a ton of iconic NYC attractions and the subway. The rooms are immaculate, the beds are super comfy and the pillows! The best. We stayed on the 20th floor with a lovely view of the Empire State Building. Sky + Vine Rooftop Bar has terrific Manhattan views (and an up-close relationship with the ESB). Everyone (and I mean every single one) who works at Archer New York is so friendly and accommodating. Love everything about it.

title: Great Service
text: I stayed at Archer for 3 nights. It was very clean. They had excellent malin and goetz bath products. The service was also fantastic. Staff cleaned my room and left behind treats multiple times a day.

title: Terrific experience
text: This hotel is the best!  Not only are the service staff members amazingly friendly and helpful, but the rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. Their afternoon turn-down service is a very nice touch. Check-in and Check-out were both a breeze. Great food in the lobby bar area for breakfast and the Spyglass rooftop bar has a fabulous view (inside and outside) of the Empire State Building. And to top it off, I unknowingly left a pair of slacks in my room. Housekeeping hunted me down via email, confirmed that they were mine and shipped my slacks to me free of charge.  Now that's service!!  I will be staying here from now on.

title: Great value
text: Great beds, great toiletry products, most incredible minibar value I’ve ever seen, good location if you have midtown meetings. For last minute price it was tough to beat. The only drawback is limited room service option. There’s also basically no where to sit in the lobby so you’re in your room or the bar for the most part.

title: Fab hotel
text:
Stayed here with my sister for a 4 night break and had a great time. From the friendly greeting on arrival to checkout it was fantastic. 
The rooms were well designed and while average size they cleverly have lots of storage. The beds are so comfortable and blackout curtains make for a great night sleep. The little things are what makes this hotel eg turndown service, treats in room, and nespresso machine. The spyglass roof bar has a fantastic view of empire state building. 
The area is great. The street outside is relatively quiet but 2 min walk either direction you are into the heart of things. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Genuinely pleased
text: Every time we visit NYC, I try a different hotel, hoping for a winner.  I have the proper expectations as city hotels are generally old and very small, but even so, there are some that just do it better than others, and the Archer is one of them.  We had a Classic King room with a view of the Empire State Building.  The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom quite well done.  The Archer's location also can't be beat.  We were within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go.  By booking directly with the hotel, we received a small credit, which we could have applied to the room or other room charges.  Since it was during the holidays, the hotel was collecting donations for Toys for Tots and gave us the opportunity to put that credit toward the toy donation, which we found to be a very nice touch.  I would certainly stay here again if not for my innate curiosity of other hotels.  I will recommend to others.

title: Service with a smile!
text:
We stayed for two nights this past week and couldn't have been more impressed ... especially with the decor and the friendliness of the staff.  A welcome respite from the busyness of NYC and the day's events. 

ESPECIALLY the kind and attentive service of Johathan and Reenie. Extraordinary people. I will be back and in a large part because of them and others there who care about service. 

Way to go! Keep up the good work.

title: Amazing!
text: I could not be more impressed with the Archer Hotel Nyc! From the moment I checked in until I left they took such good care of me. I was pleasantly surprised when I checked in to have a view of the Empire State Building. The room was clean and comfortable. Check out the next day was so smooth! Upon returning home I realized I had left something in the room. Housekeeping got back to me immediately that they had located it and shipped it out to me that day. When it arrived, it was packaged in beautiful tissue paper and a little treat! Thank you Archer Hotel!

title: Always A Favorite
text: We love staying at Archer Hotel! Not only is it clean and has great amenities in the room, it has an amazing rooftop bar with great views! Whenever we come to NYC we stay here! An easy walk from Penn Station and a quick walk to Times Square/Bryant Park!

title: Good hotel in NYC
text:
The location is great and the staff is friendly and helpful, specially Evan and Gary Simon. They help us with a package that was delivered by UPS and we are very grateful. 
The room is very small! The bathroom is good!

title: Great hotel nice room
text: We stayed two nights at the Archer hotel. It was a great midtown location. Check in was very smooth. Julie was quick, friendly and very efficient checking us in. Our room was nicely appointed and very clean. The bathroom was very modern and clean as a whistle. The entire staff Julie, Evan, Juan, Chris and Dale were super nice. This place is very well run with an emphasis on service. It has a great rooftop bar and nice lobby restaurant. I can’t say enough nice things about the staff and hotel. I will be returning soon and can’t wait. Thanks for the upgrade!

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Hotel clean and beautifully decorated. Rooms were small but clean and beautifully decorated.The staff was courteous and attentive. The Spyglass rooftop bar was expensive, but the view was spectacular. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect spot!
text: Really enjoyed our stay. It was eth easiest check in process.  I arrived considerably earlier than I intended and they were so accommodating! Rooms were very clean, staff was amazing.  The bell staff was particularly helpful.  Great views from the rootop too! It ia an absolutely ideal location.  Highly recommend...

title: Superb service with beautiful views
text: We were so pleased with our stay at Archer Hotel. Upon check-in, I shared that it was my birthday. The staff kindly and generously gave us vouchers for two free drinks! Even though we arrived early, we were still able to get into our room. Although the room was a bit small, the views of the Empire State Building were priceless. Make sure you reserve a room with a view. The staff at the Spyglass Rooftop Bar was excellent, and we greatly enjoyed some delicious appetizers. I look forward to staying here again!

title: Girls night out
text:
This hotel surpassed expectations! The lobby staff was friendly and helpful at check in and each time we passed by (not to mention that they were impeccably dressed and beautiful to look at!). At check in they noticed that two women were checking in and they made sure to mention that there were complementary men’s and women’s slippers in the room and they would bring up a second pair of women’s (which they actually did- immediately, which is rare in any hotel).
In the room we were welcomed with complementary water bottles and caramels (very nice touch). The room was very comfortable, great beds, great shower, coffee machine, small fridge and a safe. Nice toiletries in bathroom, very pleasant. There was turndown service and we were left delicious cookies! Another unexpected touch. 
The rooftop bar was great too! Perfect view of the Empire State Building.
I’m not a tourist, I live nearby in a suburb but I like come into the city and stay at boutique hotels every now and then and this one was top notch.
The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars was because there was no doorman to take care of our car when we arrived, we had to go into the hotel to find someone (which would have been a problem if I were alone). And when my car was brought back to the hotel the next day (I was told I should call for it 30-45 minutes prior to needing it), it came back much sooner and was left in front of the hotel with key inside- and no one collected my valet ticket or was around when I went outside for it. Lucky no one else got into it and drove off!!
But I loved the hotel and would go back in a heartbeat.

title: Emplacement idéal pour visiter NYC
text: Très bon hôtel, personnel au petit soin. Chambre un peu petite mais acceptable. Grande qualité de literie, salle de bain très propre. Notre particulière pour toutes les petites intentions. A recommander.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend for our first visit to New York.  We were not disappointed!  Great reception when we arrived and as we had advised them we were staying for our wedding anniversary, we were even given special key cards.  The room was small but there was enough space for the two of us and we spent most of our time sightseeing so there was no problem.  The little turn down treats were lovely and we were treated to a bottle of bubbly for our anniversary which was a great touch.  Room was clean and toiletries were good.  Thank you for the complimentary water.  The position of the hotel is good - easy walking to Times Square, Macys and various restaurants.  It was a shame that the hotel restaurant was so pricey otherwise we would have visited.  If we come to New York again we would certainly stay here.

title: Excelente Hotel!
text:
Recomendo o hotel !!
Localização excelente, perto dos principais pontos turísticos, você consegue fazer tudo a pé.
Funcionários prestativos, sempre com sorriso no rosto e prontos para te atender.
Serviço de quarto impecável !!

title: Excepcional
text: las personas que trabajan en este hotel son todas muy atentas, las vistas al empire state son sobre el piso 12, muy buena ubicación, en el rooftop hay un bar excelente con vista al Empire, full recomendado.

title: Lovely Staff. nice amentiies and clean rooms.
text:
This is a well located hotel. It is close to Times Square (if that's your bag; it's not mine) so you can access the touristy stuff, but far away enough that it's not oppressive. It's close to Bryant Park, a short walk from Union Square, and doable to Soho if you like to stroll, which I do. Lots of great coffee shops located close by, and even though the hotel offers free visits to surrounding New York Sports Clubs, there is also a SoulCycle and a few yoga studios close by as well.
The staff are friendly and not fake. From the doormen to the front desk to the housekeeping, it seems that they are happy to host you. I handed out some customary tips, and people were super appreciative. Valet parking is simple and the cost is in line with other hotels in NYC. The rooms are small (like most hotels in NYC), but there is underbed storage which is nice if you want to unpack your stuff. The bathroom showers are big and super clean. Nice toiletries as well. Free water when you check in and out, and while I dislike plastic bottles, since NYC has not advanced to the level of many European cities with free water bottle filling stations, water bottles are a necessity. Oh, America. How much we waste. I digress.

Spend the extra money for the city view. My kid was entranced watching the Empire State Building light up at night. 

All in all, a lovely experience at the Archer. We come to NYC few times a year, and I would like to come back to this hotel. It was comfortable, inviting and convenient. Thanks everyone. Especially Eddy at the door; what a lovely guy.

title: Anniversary trip
text: The staff are polite, friendly and helpful. VERY CLEAN, Good food. The rooftop top has an amazing view of the empire state building worth the stay. They put a personal touch on everything. I loved the hand written notes with treats left in the room  everyday. I will stay there again and I am going to now try the archer Napa.

title: AU cœur de Midtown
text:
Très bien placé pour découvrir New York. Un personnel bienveillant, une très bonne literie. Des chambres petites mais calmes et bien pensées. U;roof top avec vue sur l’empire state 
Pas de Lobby pas de lieu de détente un restaurant moyen un buffet de petit déjeuner faible

title: NYC home away from home
text:
Archer New York has become our home-away-from home each year that we visit Manhattan. Located perfectly on West 38th between Fifth and Sixth, one has perfect access to everything: Broadway & Times Square, Herald Square, Rockefeller Centre, Bryant Park. The subway is only a couple blocks away. What makes Archer our preferred NY destination is the quality of service. Exceptionally friendly and helpful are all the staff. Scott, the Front Office Manager, could not be more gracious. 

The king room was compact but very comfortable with loads of storage for the irresistible purchases one must make. Turn-down service always includes delectable sweets. On this most recent visit (late December), we were welcomed with a bottle of  sparkling wine on ice; such a classy touch.

Scott and team, thank you for always making our stay warm and inviting. See you again in 2020.

title: Beautiful, Clean, Excellent Location!
text: This hotel is wonderful. The room we stayed in was on the smaller side, so initially I was a bit skeptical and thought perhaps we should have upgraded to a bigger room. But it turned out to be SO thoughtfully organized that the idea of a bigger room quickly left my mind. So many smart design choices, special touches and details that made our stay cozy. I have to especially compliment the bathroom – beautifully designed and executed. You can really feel the love and care that was put into the design of the room. I looked forward to returning to our room every night – it felt like our quiet, calm, cozy home in what can often be an unrelentingly hectic city.

title: Spoilt rotten
text:
We stayed here from the 28/12/19 to 2/2/20 and can honestly say this branded hotel is more like a 5*.
What’s provided:
Towels and flannels 
Hand tissues 
Toiletries
Coffee maker and coffee capsules 
Tea bags and kettle on request
Hangers /iron/ironing board 
Mini bar
Separate small fridge/ empty for milk / water ect ect 
Hair dryer 

The room:
is a bit cosy but for 2 people it was fine and the tv and channels was brilliant as it’s all English for a change with kids channels 👍👍👍👍👍👍and the rooms cleaned daily sometimes twice as a turndown service comes into play and done to a high standard also staff drop you boutique style biscuits in presentation bags which is a nice touch.

The staff:
Well I have never come across such decent, polite, professional, caring staff from the cleaners up to management from any of my travels and I’ve been around, also try room service it quick and professional and we ordered a couple burger from the restaurant downstairs for room service and it comes with fries which was truly delicious.
Thank you to all at the archer hotel for everything you have done for us in room 708 and me and the lucky lady ( the missus) have been truly spoilt and we will take your customer service to other places in the world and use you as our guide line for a bench mark.
I hope you show this message in the board room

Many thanks

title: Welcoming, friendly and helpful staff with great facilities!
text: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel over New Year. The hotel is in a great location only 5 minutes from time square. It was clean, modern and the staff were always very kind and accommodating.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to come back in the future!

title: Le tester, c'est l'adopter !
text: Très belle surprise dans un quartier bien placé entre Macy's et Bryant Park. Les chambres bien que pas très grandes sont très confortables et agréables (les petit plus: les petites attentions de chaque soir lassées par l'équipe dédiée à la préparation du lit, les bouteilles d'eau et les cafés Nespresso disponibles gratuitement). La literie, un vrai rêve tant les lits sont confortables et que dire des oreillers ... de vrais nuages. Les rangements sont multiples et fonctionnels. Le personnel d'accueil et "en chambre" est souriant, au petit soin et prêt à répondre à toutes vos demandes. Vous vous sentirez privilégiés en logeant dans ce fantastique hôtel.. Notre semaine dans ce merveilleux lieu fut un rêve. Un tout grand merci à toute l'équipe. La prochaine fois, on revient à l'hôtel Archer sans hésitation.

title: Special little Gem
text: All I can say is that this hotel goes above and beyond to make your stay feel extra special. Everything was perfect. View of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar was amazing. Treats every night left in the room was such a nice added touch. Room was super clean. Bed was so comfortable and bathroom shower was perfect . Location was close to everything in walking distance. We stayed at a different location in NY on our last night and wished we were back at the Archer. It felt super safe and comfortable.

title: Superb location; high quality hotel
text: The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street with easy access to 5th Ave, and is 10min walk from Times Square and 5min from Bryant Park. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but well appointed. Standard breakfast; nothing special. I would definitely stay there again

title: Christmas
text:
Stayed here over Christmas, location is great (just a brief walk from Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and Grand Central) but rooms are smaller than any others we’ve had in NYC.
Staff were eager, and incredibly keen to make our stay as comfortable as possible.

title: Really great stay, rooms on the small side!
text: Brilliant stay at the Archer in December. Room was clean, modern and the hotel was in a great location. Staff really friendly and helpful. Only slight criticism that for the price the rooms are very small, but I am told most of New York is like this so be prepared! Would stay again.

title: 4 Giorni a New York
text:
Hotel di impostazione Old Style in posizione centralissima, 2 minuti dall’inizio Empire e 5 da Times Square.
Tutto il personale gentilissimo e camere intime è molto pulite.
Volendo ci si può fermare a mangiare per la presenza di una Steak House all’interno dell’hotel.
Promosso!

title: A great find
text: Having stayed in many New York hotels in between Xmas and New Year this one was a great find.  Great value for money, breakfast at $15 was a steal and the rooftop bar was great.  Food was good and competitively priced.  In the centre for almost anywhere you want to go.  staff are extremely courteous and helpful.  We had an Empire State room view - worth the extra if possible.  Highly recommended.

title: Bien
text:
J'ai passé 1 semaine au Archer Hôtel en décembre 2018 avec mon fils de 8ans.
Point positif : L'hôtel est très bien situé à 2 pas de Time Square, le personnel est très aimable et au petit soin.
Points négatifs :J'ai trouvé les chambres très petites avec très peu de rangement (un minuscule placard), le ménage pourrait être mieux fait (il restait de la poussière dans les placards et des traces jaunâtre dans le WC).
Le petit déjeuner est à la carte comme dans la plupart des hôtels à New-York du coup nous préférions manger dehors pour avoir des tarifs  plus abordables.

title: Love staying at the Archer!
text: I loved staying at the Archer NYC! The check-in experience was easy, and the staff is beyond warm, friendly, and helpful. The rooms are spotless and very comfortable, and it’s central location makes walking to several favorite attractions very doable!

title: Un Noël à New-York
text: Cet hôtel nous a été conseillé par mon agence de voyage en fonction de la localisation que je souhaitais. Une très agréable surprise. Bien situé, personnel accueillant, à l’écoute. Les chambres sont d’une propriété irréprochables. Elles sont certes petites mais très fonctionnelles avec plus de rangement qu’il n’y parait. Nous avons beaucoup aimé les friandises différentes chaque soir ainsi que la lacions à café dans la chambre. Nous reviendrons, c’est sûr.

title: Will definitely stay again!
text: Great choice of hotel for a week's stay in NYC! It's location is perfect, it's clean and inviting, and the staff were incredibly friendly and hospitable! They even sent a bottle of champagne to our room after my partner proposed! Our room, although small, was very comfortable and had a great view of the Empire State building!! The Spyglass roof top bar had a lovely ambience, also great views of the Empire State and was open till 1am. Overall the hotel was amazing value and offered us everything we needed and more! Thank you to all the staff that helped make this pivotal moment in our lives unforgettable! Hope to see you again!

title: Tiny Room, Curt Service
text:
I checked in with my brother for a 2 night stay in Double Bed Empire State View room. In a first for me, I got a refund and ended up staying at the Kimberly Hotel (which was wonderful). 

1. Tiny. Like we could have rolled from one bed to the other. I know it’s New York and rooms aren’t palatial. Got it. A little room would be nice. 

2. No chest/dresser. I like to unpack. I hate living out of my bag. There was nowhere to put clothing. There was one small closet thing where the ironing board and safe are. I guess my brother and I could have crammed all our crap in.

3. The view... well, I guess we could see the Empire State building. But from our low floor level room, the view was underwhelming.

4. No waste basket. Fixable, but added to the other negatives, just not good.

5, Curt service. I called down to ask about the room size. Informed all rooms are the same size. Sad, but okay. I asked why there’s no furniture and where would I put my clothes. Whoever I talked to said I should store it under the bed. Because, we’re camping? 

That just about did it for me. In a personal first, I cancelled my reservation and hightailed it out of there.

title: Highly recommended hotel,  and fantastic location
text:
We've just gotten back from a short break to NYC, and stayed at the Archer. 
The Hotel is in great central location for everything,  shopping, site seeing , eating out.
The staff are wonderful,  and couldn't be more helpful,  really make you feel at home.
The rooms are very comfortable,  and have everything you need to make your stay restful,  after a hectic Manhattan day and night.
We will stay here again the next time we are in NYC.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is very nice. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to many attractions. My family I enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to friends and family.

title: A jewel in Midtown
text: Although we live only 15 mile from NYC and my husband works in Midtown we sometime like to stay in the city for a few nights and see shows and not worry about driving home.  I chose the Archer Hotel by location and it looked nice online.  We were so happy with our stay at the Archer.  It was very personal with the staff being exceptionally pleasant and accommodating.  The rooms were small but very nice and functional and we loved having the bar in the lobby where we could grab a quick bite before the theater or just get a drink when we came in at night. It is now our go to place to stay in NYC!

title: Lovely little hotel!
text: Great stay. Super clean. Always friendly at the front desk and excellent location. Yes rooms are tight- if you plan to spend all day on your room this is not the place for you. If the room is only for sleeping and resting then this is ideal. Surprised by how quiet it was. Hotel was full and we never heard any neighbors. Also we were 3rd floor and never heard any street sounds.  Rooftop bar is a must see!!!  Also enjoyed shopping the block. Culture coffee across the street was perfect as was the steak house in the hotel. Well Done Archer.

title: Weekend Before Xmas
text:
We stayed for two nights in the Archer Hotel at one of the busiest times of the year. Nonetheless, the staff were pleasant, helpful with every query and housekeeping even offered turndown service!
The room met our expectations on every account: small, yet clean and modern. The facilities on offer seemed lovely (although we did not try them all out).
Overall, we were very satisfied with the quality of this hotel and would very happily stay at The Archer again.

title: Amazing service
text:
We stayed at the hotel on 11th December for a week.
Having an eleven month old baby, I was nervous about the hotel as it looked very adult only.

The staff could not have been more amazing!  A massive thank you to Johnathan who took the time to always talk to us and help with any advice as well as the manager who even kept our baby milk when we had checked out.

The room with a view of the Empire State Building on the 18th floor was something we will never forget!

Thank you Archer Hotel for making our Christmas holiday in New York the best! You guys were awesome.

title: Perfection!
text: The Archer Hotel has meticulously clean, compact and perfectly appointed rooms. The beds are the most icomfortable I have experienced in my extensive travel. The location in Midtown is central to everything. Staff was so friendly. Really could not have been better!

title: Perfect hotel
text:
Just stayed at the Archer Hotel for 6 nights and I cannot fault it at all. The staff are super friendly, really helpful, polite and all round nice! The room is cozy and the bed is so so comfy. Its a perfect location on West 38th Street which is great for Macys (5 mins walk) and only a few blocks from Bryant Park which has a nice Xmas market and loads of other sights around the city.

Please do have a steak in the restaurant too as its amazing! 

100% recommended.

title: James D
text:
Arrived Monday with my daughter, front from the chap helping us bring our luggage in to the front desk, all were professional, polite and friendly. We couldn’t have asked for a better start to our week.
The room very cozy, clean and well stocked with food and drinks as well as reading information.
The location couldn’t have been better. With such a bustling city, the room was quiet and so many good places to eat and drink and see so close.
I would recommend this hotel above any for the staff, cleanliness, service overall ambiance.

title: Such a lovely experience!
text:
Staff on the front desk are very welcoming and informative. Rooms are small and cosy which is perfect after a long day of sightseeing! We had Empire State view which was amazing. 
Hotel breakfast is a simple buffet and there is a steak house attached to the hotel which has really good portion sizes. There is also a rooftop bar! 
Location is a short walk from Times Square and has lots of little cafes and shops around it. 
If you fancy treating yourself then this hotel is amazing!

title: Fantastic Archer Hotel
text:
Great boutique hotel in a great location. Location is far enough away from Times Square to breath but close enough to walk to shops and nightlife. On a quiet street traffic and pedestrian wise. 
Foyer Bar was a great spot for an evening drink before heading out and also used the bar for breakfast on a few occasions (breakfast was excellent quality and value). 
The only reason I have not awarded 5 stars is solely down to the room size. (Room 202). This was by far the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in when visiting NYC... room was functional on all fronts but just extremely compact.
Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Archer Hotel and would gladly stay here again in the future (but book a larger room)

title: Fantastic Birthday Celebration
text: Stunning. Everything about this hotel ticked every box but mainly it's about the staff  without exception, friendly, welcoming and cannot do enough for you. The purpose of our trip was my wife's special birthday. We didn't announce it but a bittle of champagne arrived.  The Empire view room was small but well proportioned. A fantastic bed and bathroom and the maid service exceptional, even down to a birthday muffin.  Located in the centre of mid town on 38th West, also the perfect location. We'd return anytime and thoroughly recommend this hotel.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: I had a first rate experience at this hotel. The location is great. The view of the Empire State Building from the rooftop bar is second-to-none. The staff was friendly and did a great job. There were some really nice personal service touches in the rooms and the showers are fantastic.

title: Archer hotel
text:
Simply fantastic from start to finish. Staff, service and hotel were all perfect.If you're considering this hotel, go for it. You wont tregret it.
Thank you to the Archer hotel and all the staff for a wonderful stay.
Until next time. 
George

title: Outstanding Service, Location & Experience
text: The Archer provides the BEST service of ANY hotel in NYC! Front desk staff, quick check in & out- concierge- just ask & it’s there in minutes! The special cookies before bed each nite- wonderful touch. Very secure, great location- quiet, but close to everything. Super clean/private.

title: Perfect Again
text: Thank you to the Entire staff at the Archer, perfect again. This is our seventh trip there and this is the first time we had the “Empire View”. Well worth it. High ceilings. Just great. The restroom are bright and perfect for the girls to do makeup. Internet works great.  Visit the roof top bar. Amazing views

title: Exceptional Service at the Archer Hotel New York
text: We had an excellent and fantastic stay at the Archer Hotel New York!  From the moment we checked in, we were greeted by Brielle at the front desk with Big Smiles and a very warm welcome upon checking.  Our check in was seamless and pleasant and was a great way to our start to our vacation in New York City!  Troy and Scott from the front desk were also truly amazing with their service and hospitality by being so very helpful with recommendations on places to visit and eat.  They were both genuine and accommodating with all our request.  Brielle, Troy & Scott truly lived up to the Archer Hotel experience they are known for.  After going up to our room and freshening up, we headed down for dinner at Charlie Palmer Steak in the hotel.  Highly recommend the bone-in Ribeye steak.  After dinner, we headed up to the Spyglass Rooftop Bar at the top of the Archer NY.  What an amazing view of the Empire State Building, especially during this time of the year!  Great location for a photo of the Empire State Building in the background.  Our bartender Teo made us feel like we’ve been friends for a while, greeting us with a friendly and warming welcome…highly recommend the pineapple punch cocktail especially during a cold night in NYC…brings back warm memories of tropical Hawaii (were we’re originally from).   Scott Troy & Brielle and Michele (General Manager) went above and beyond by providing exceptional and world-class service, ensuring our stay and was relaxing, comforting, and a very enjoyable time.  We can’t wait to return to the Archer Hotel New York!

title: Pleasantly surprised...
text:
We just came back from a 5-night stay, in the double-double empire room.  Check in was very efficient, with very friendly staff.  Our room was nicely designed, nice bathroom.  The room was very clean upon our arrival, and the beds were comfortable.

This is a great boutique hotel, with a wonderful location that is close to many subway lines.  We were up on the 19th floor, and this is a very quiet hotel.  We didn’t hear any noise from housekeeping banging around in the morning, traffic sounds, nor did we hear noisy neighbors.  

The slippers and local treats are a nice touch.  The Empire State view is really great — just like the pictures.  

We were very disappointed with the restaurant. We had room service from Charlie Palmer restaurant twice:  one of the breakfast items was incorrect, and we ordered a dinner where the salmon came up undercooked when I requested a specific temperature.  They did send up a second one.  My husband spoke with a manager who said they would take the salmon off the bill, but never did.  I thought the food at the restaurant was just ok. There is a real breakdown in communication when placing both orders; the girl I placed our orders with did not get either of our orders correct.  0/2.

The size of the rooms have been an issue for many.  Read the print.  Expect your room to be roughly about the size of a cruise ship room.  We didn’t have any problem with it and found it to be quite cozy.

One problem with the room:  we had a very hard time regulating the temperature in our room.  It would either be too hot, or become like an ice box.  It almost had a mind of it’s own.

The price of the room is great for what you get.  I would definitely stay here again when we come back to New York.

title: Christmas time
text: Hotel staff are amazing and location of hotel is perfect to walk to all the sites   Restaurant was very good and sky bar is always great. We had fun seeing everything.  Hotel was very clean and bed was very good

title: Ideal central location
text: Archer Hotel is in a prime spot for exploring the city, a few blocks from Times Square, Grand Central is close as is the Empire State Building. Had a great burger in the Sky Bar which gives a superb view of the ESB. Didn’t eat in Charlie Palmers so cannot comment on that. Comfy beds, well maintained rooms with all the mod cons needed. Only draw back is that the rooms are exceedingly small. ‘Intimate’ as the receptionist described them. Would not stop me staying again though and with so much in NY to do and see a spacious room is not a necessity is it? Few nice touches such as complimentary umbrellas provided and little sweet treats from housekeeping.

title: Best Team + Best Location + Best Service = Amazing hotel for your next NY stay!
text:
Not sure if this review will do the staff justice, but honestly, I don't think I've had a better stay in the last 10/15 years and I have traveled to 58 countries, and stayed in thousands of hotels. I used to even work in hotels so I'm very critical on just about everything and this hotel did not miss. Anything!

Where do I start?! The Epic Birthday Dinner for my wife that the staff arranged prior to check in? The spotless room, the swift checkin/out with a smile?  Maybe the bellstand and concierge team that anticipated my every move? It's hard to pick one, but let's start with the hotel. 

Perfect location, very fairly priced for services you get! If you are new to Archer brand, shame on you, but you are now welcome. Hopefully after reading you will be a fan as well. 

Granted there are literally hundreds of hotels in NY to stay, but there are a few that truly get it right, at every turn. This hotel (as well as every other Archer brand in other cities I've stayed at) truly knows how to cater to their guests. They value you and not just your money. 

Ex. Nathan at the desk and Jacob did not stop at helping us pick the perfect location for drinks and dessert one night. They must have called 15 locations to ensure there was not a private holiday party prior to us walking out their door. Most hotels would give you a name and send you on your way.

My wife loved the little carmels that you get in your room at check in. Though they sell them in the lobby, when my wife raved about them to the FD team, 10 minutes later a knock at the door with a bag filled with a few more just to say good night?! 

The special birthday dinner we had in their restaurant was top notch! The steaks were perfectly cooked, and my wife is a tough critic when it comes to her filet, and it was perfect. The staff in the restaurant was awesome. I did not get all the names, but Precela? & Mario were fantastic! Kudos to the chef as well!

I could go on and on with examples like this throughout our stay, but I think you get the point. If you stay somewhere else, you might be doing yourself a HUGE injustice.  

It's really difficult to beat what this hotel and team have to offer for your special NY visit. Take it from me, you will not be sorry to give them a try!

You are Welcome!
-J

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
I absolutely love this hotel. First off, the location is ideal, just a few minutes walk from Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center and Fifth Avenue. The customer service was second to none. Nothing was too much trouble for them to help us out with. The staff was absolutely phenomenal. We had been checked into our room less than five minutes, when the concierge came by and gave each member of our party a complimentary drink voucher.

Archer hotel, is also big on luxury touches, nightly turn down service with delicious local treats, complementary slippers , and cozy robes to wear during your stay, just to name a few! lastly the hotel was beautiful, And the view from both the spyglass bar and Our hotel room were stunning. The Empire State building was our night light each night. Beautiful. 

I can’t wait to stay at archer during my next trip to NYC!

title: Great stay
text:
Our third visit to New York and I think we have now fine tuned our hotel choice on location etc. We found the Archer to be incredibly convenient for shopping and sight seeing with plenty of choices for eating nearby to make the visit perfect. 
Check in was very efficient with service with a smile. I had messaged the hotel to inform them that it was my Husbands 50th birthday and we were met with a birthday greeting and champagne and cake in the room which was a lovely touch. 
The room itself although small was very well planned out with plenty of under bed storage for cases meaning you don’t have issues with the low amount of space around the bed. Again we opted for a room with a view and were certainly not disappointed. Being able to clearly see the Empire State Building from bed is amazing. We were on the 21st floor so we had uninterrupted views of the iconic landmark equal to what you have on the rooftop bar a floor above. 
The Kingsize bed was very comfortable and there were plenty of sockets available for gadget charging etc. Great bathroom with a spacious shower and plenty of amenities available. The in room WiFi was good with no issues for speed etc. 
The room was also reasonably quiet with the occasional noise from neighbours arriving with kids but no issue at all between rooms. Being a little further away from the lift is probably a worthwhile request as you do hear it if close although to be fair this stopped at a reasonable hour. 
Housekeeping and turn down services were all faultless and again helped to make our stay very comfortable. Very nice boutique hotel which I would certainly recommend.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text:
Perfect location midtown Manhattan, very warmly welcome, very clean with excellent service all round
Rooms a tad small but very clean and well stocked, lovely touches with notes and cookies/chocs.
Would always stay here again. Thank you

title: If you're searching for the best hotel in midtown, look no further
text:
I've had the great fortune of staying at the Archer on multiple occasions this year, and every single time it's been nothing short of top-notch. From their super unique treats to the free umbrellas they provide when it's raining, Archer is meticulous about every little detail. Every room even comes with a multi charging cable that accommodates pretty much any smart phone, so if you forget yours (which I have done in the past), you don't need worry about it. Their hotel staff are kind and friendly, their food is fantastic, and many of the rooms have just the most amazing view of the Empire State Building. Not to mention the location - it's smack dab in the middle of midtown and walking distance to the ESB, Bryant Park, Times Square, and some of the best restaurants this city has to offer.

I will add as well that my company now has a full year corporate partnership with this hotel due to the wonderful experiences we've had working with them. We have around 30-40 attendees stay there every 1-2 months, and they have never dropped the ball. If you work best with folks who are sweet, thoughtful, and easy to count on, then you'll have no problem partnering with the Archer. 

But please know, corporate partnership aside, I would still recommend this place as my #1 spot to anyone visiting New York :)

title: Very Comfortable and super practical
text:
I had one night only but it was a excellent experience in Manhattan. The hotel staff has been super friendly and helpful to organize a late departure (not a late checkout!).
The room was spotless and comfortable with a nice bed. The situation of the Hotel is manifestly extremly practical right in Midtown to walk to any point of interest!
Depending of price, I will do my best to come back (longer) at this hotel.

title: Inesquecivel
text: esse hotel alem de aconchegante e muito gostoso! os elevadores  estão sempre disponíveis, o quarto apesar de não ser grande e muito limpo, e a disponibilidade de poder tomar cafe no quarto e muito gostoso. As toalhas são sempre branquinhas e limpas. O atendimento de todo o Staff e muito gentil.

title: Great hotel
text:
Last day of our visit and we are sitting in reception awaiting a cab to JFK and we both agree that this has been an incredible hotel
Perfect location for both sightseeing and for shopping (of course!!!)
Excellent attentive staff spotlessly clean and spacious (for NYC) room, we went for the Empire View king room (unbelievable view to go asleep to and to wake up to).
Will stay again

title: Clean and great Mid-town location
text: Loved this MidTown hotel that is VERY New York.  Located right off of 5th Avenue and minutes from the Empire State Building, whether you are here for work or play, this hotel will be quite satisfactory.  I left a boxed/unopened Ipad among other items, in my room (I know...facepalm) and by the time I realized it, the housekeeping staff had already emailed notifying me of missing items and to confirm a shipping address.  And, the bed is so comfy and luxurious.

title: Archer - Perfect in Every Way!!!!
text: The Archer was perfect in every way,  location, service, cleanliness, rooms are beautiful.   The little touches of a nightly turn down service with locally made treats - adds an even more welcoming feel.  So many little touches that other hotels at that price point do not offer.   Perfect perfect perfect!?

title: Excellent 3 night stay in Manhattan
text: e'd had a bit of a harrowing experience getting into NYC from Toronto and as soon as we arrived at the Archer all of that became a distant memory - starting with a couple of free drink tickets from the front desk staff who could see that our flight in had been stressful - what a very welcoming and thoughtful touch.  The room was ready, super clean, comfortable and nicely appointed.  Having arrived later in the afternoon than expected, we wanted to get a quick bite before our 7 p.m. show.  The Charlie Palmer bar/restaurant was perfect - a delicious light meal and glass of wine with excellent service that got us on our way quickly.  All in all a really lovely hotel with excellent staff that made our three night stay in NYC super enjoyable.  Thanks so much!!

title: The worst experience in New York
text:
I love nyc . Been there so many times. 
And I have never experienced such a terrible hotel and service than in archer
Impolite staff. Bad equipped, dirty rooms , issues with payment , invoiced breakfast however included in  price . The breakfast is just awful shame . No bread , no vegetables , no cold meat, no scale , no change of offer in  a week
This hotel is just a shame for nyc . You can find easily better one for this price

title: Worst
text: The hotel is one of the most dissapointing hotel I have ever stayed. The breakfast is very limited (no cold meats, no vegetables, no tea and so on). They also tried to charge us for it several times even though the breakfast was included in the price we paid at the start of our stay. The bathtub was dirty, the heater is extreamly loud. During the cleaning they rearranged our stuff in an unneccesary way (like putting our stuff in the baggage we left on the table on purpose). The were unpolite during the whole stay. The only good side of the hotel is the excellent location but there are several 4 stars hotels here for the same price.

title: Trevligt hotel
text: Trevligt hotel med hög service och snygg design. Små men funktionella rum. Sköna sängar! Trevlig takbar med fin utsikt. Bra läge. Lite väl dyr frukost, men ej dyrare än på andra hotel iNY. Bor gärna här igen.

title: Modern hotel in great location
text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Archer Hotel in NYC. Check in was easy, rooms are small but well organised. Food in the restaurant is amazing and don’t miss the view of the rooftop bar. I have already recommended the hotel to some friends!! will be back soon

title: Archer wasn't up to standard I thought it would be
text:
The room wasn't what I booked. Put on 4th floor rather than room w view.

The bright spot was the front desk. They were very friendly. Sadly only staff members that were. 

The manager for breakfast could not have been more miserable. Barely acknowledged us. Walked by the table to seat us and just pointed/kept walking. Had question over temp of food. No complaining just asked for warmer sauce. Manager came over to berate and try to embarrass me over it. Then late, literally threw the bill on our table.

Had to order room service for dinner due to one person's sudden illness. Food was sub par. Again - cold and steak was under done. 

With so many hotels in NYC, we'll try another hotel next month.

title: Excellent hotel
text: The hotel was booked by my wife as part of a surprise trip to New York for my 30th birthday. She made an excellent choice - we had a lovely room that oozed New York with a view of the Empire State Building. Very helpful and friendly staff, delicious food in the hotel restaurant that can be ordered late and delivered to your room, cool bar at the top floor and, best of all, the location - close to the very heart of the city. Would definitely recommend!

title: Beautiful Hotel in a wonderful location!
text: This hotel was perfect for our stay. It is so close to many things and we enjoyed all of the extra touches. Treats at turndown, wonderful coffee maker, clean and bright bathroom. Wonderful view of the Empire State Building where each night we could not wait to view it to see what color it would be. The staff were friendly and we will definitely stay here again when we return. Highly recommend.

title: Excellent base for a fantastic visit
text:
We stayed here for my husband's birthday, and had a great room with a bird's eye view of the Empire State building. The rooms aren't the biggest in the world, but they are very clean and beautifully decorated, as well as extremely comfortable after a long day on your feet. The bed was large and comfortable, the bathroom well-stocked with various lotions, potions and fresh towels, and of course the complimentary 'whimsical slippers' were found tucked away in the wardrobe! 

The bar downstairs has a happy hour every day between 4 and 7 which certainly eased the pain of New York prices, and Charlie Palmer's Steakhouse is convenient for breakfast on site. Disappointingly we were turned away from the Spyglass Bar a couple of times due to private bookings. This is really the only negative of the whole review, as one of the selling points for making the booking is this feted bar, and we were a bit put out as hotel 'residents' to be turned away. 

Location wise we couldn't have picked a better spot. The hotel is five minutes' walk from the so many iconic landmarks, and there any number of subway stations near by. More importantly, it felt safe and secure. 

Finally, the excellent staff. Every one of them was accommodating, professional and extremely helpful every time we spoke to them, even making restaurant bookings for us and commandeering taxis. We would like to say a special thank you to Eddy for looking after us, to absolutely lovely Brielle - still working on our cab hailing skills! - and to the Maestro behind the bar, Adam, who invents and mixes the most wonderful cocktails for the Archer! 

This is an excellent hotel, and we will not hesitate to book again when we come back. Thanks everyone.

title: Another Amazing Stay
text: Once again the Archer Hotel New York gave me and my family an Amazing stay over the Thanksgiving Holiday. The staff, beginning with Katelyn during reservations, to John at the door, and Troy at the front desk make the Archer welcoming and friendly. The staff go out of their way to make sure you are enjoying your time at the Archer. The rooms are always Clean and comfortable, and you can't beat an Empire view room.  The location is perfect for access to the nearby subway and All that midtown has to offer. It's nice to be remembered when you walk in the door from a previous stay and we will no doubt stay at the Archer when we return to NYC.

title: Disappointing
text: Upon check-in we were told the room is “intimate”. Intimate indeed - likely the smallest hotel room we’ve ever stayed in. And we travel a lot. The room itself is modern and nicely appointed; the bathroom is a decent size. Housekeeping showed up both days around 530 pm just after we returned to rest. Sigh. Staff is friendly and helpful, but the other issues were disappointing. All in all our stay was fine, but don’t believe we’d rebook here in the future.

title: Only one fault.
text: The hotel is in a great location, It's central but is just out of the hustle and bustle areas.  There is also plenty of restaurants, cafes and fast-food options in walking distance.  The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms clean and tidy.  The hotel was upmarket, but not pretentious,  which Is what I like in a hotel.  I can not fault the hotel itself.  However, I have only given it 4 stars and not 5 because we had breakfast one morning in the hotel and I was not overly impressed with it.  I had Eggs Benedict, which was $13, a reasonable price for NY.  However, a cup of coffee was $6 and juice $5, and it was sub-standard.  I much preferred the Panera coffee, juice and breakfast which I had most days previous, and it was half the price.  I would stay here again, but I would not eat in the hotel again.

title: Fantastic!!!!
text:
Excellent stay 
Deserves 7 *******
 I was there for the third time and I am definitely going back. Great hotel, nice staff 
Great experience. The location is absolutely fantastic. Midtown near Macy's department store, penn station, Bryant park. Do not miss the great view from the rooftop bar

title: I love Archer
text: This hotel is my favorite in the city. Conveniently located to everything. I was able to walk right out from the hotel and grabbed a perfect view of the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day parade. The staff is always helpful and the food is great as well.

title: Un oasi tranquilla ed elegante nel cuore di new York
text:
Ho trascorso la settimana del Thanks giving a new York  con mio marito. Dopo lunga ricerca abbiamo optato per questo boutique hotel e siamo stati ampiamente ripagati..... nel centro di Manhattan  tra la 5th e la 6th avenue ciò nonostante camera tranquillissima come richiesto, materasso ultracomodo e pulizia eccellente.
Ma se potessi darei una sestaStella per l l'accoglienza e l l'attenzione dei ragazzi che vi lavorano . Senza essere invadenti pronti a consigliare e a risolvere ogni problema e con un
Sorriso.  Ora anche noi possiamo dire : we love New York,  we love Archer Hotel.

title: Nice but....
text: Todo bien, la ubicacion, hotel instalaciones, decoración. Lo unico que debo decir que nuestra habitación era extremadamente pequeña y algo oscura. El resto todo bien. El personal fue amable. La terraza con vista al Empire State digno de visitar disfrutar  un trago con una excepcional vista.

title: BOOK BOOK BOOK
text: The hotel was fantastic. from when we checked in to went we left we had no issues at all. the room we were provided was simpley stunning with views of the empire state. the staff are very friendly and the hotel is spotless and modern. The location was in a great position, ideal if your looking to see the whole city. don't look anywhere else people, just reserve and enjoy the experience.

title: Love this brand
text:
I decided on this gem based on my stay at their Florham Park, NJ location. We celebrated hubby's 55th bday with an overnight stay and Nets vs Knicks tickets - Go Brooklyn!

The hotel is a prime location within walking distance of Madison Square Garden, shopping and dinning. 
While the room was tight (guessing the norm for Midtown) it was well appointed, modern and EXTREMELY clean. We had cocktails at the Skytop bar and enjoyed a wonderful view of the Empire State building. 

Our room service breakfast was on the expensive side (again guessing it's the norm) but very good and arrived at the time requested.
We will definitely be repeat visitors.

title: Excellent
text: First visit to New York, stayed at archers, lovely big bed, very comfortable, loved the pillows. great staff, very central would defiantly recommend, great view from top floor terrace of Empire State. Building.

title: Beautiful but small rooms
text: This hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of Penn Station in mid-town. The decor is chic and the roof top bar offers very good bar food and drinks. Our room was clean but very small, even by NYC standards. Service was friendly and helpful..

title: Good hotel in good location
text: The Archer is a small hotel off 5th Avenue.  Reception area is small but the staff are very helpful.  The rooms are small with room under the bed to store bags, but very well designed for use.  Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.  It has a restaurant and bar which are ok.

title: Nice hotel, central location.
text: Nice hotel for a very good value in midtown.  Nicely appointed rooms, albeit not large with well appointed nice sized bathrooms including walk in showers.  Two nice bars.  Very good value relative to other options.  Limited room views I would suggest a higher floor.

title: Fantastic base for trip
text: We stayed in this hotel for a family trip in September and the hotel couldn’t have been better. The location is perfect for exploring the sights, easy walking distance to Times Square, 5th Ave, Bryant Park, Grand Central...this place is perfect for a stay in New York sightseeing. The staff are very friendly and attentive, and the rooftop bar is unbelievable! Honestly just book this place, it will not disappoint.

title: Excellent
text: Rooms are very nice and clean, all staff from front desk to turn down was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Great location...walked to our show and to shopping. I would highly recommend for a visit to nyc

title: Most fantastic boutique hotel
text: I stayed here for 4 nights  with my daughter. The location is perfect the service fantastic would really recommend , and the view of the Empire State Building from our window was just perfect!  The roof top bar is nice and has amazing views. Every night room service would leave a little treat on your pillow for when you got home! We would stay here again.

title: Fabulous service.
text:
Nothing to much trouble, Champagne left in our room for my 60th birthday at no charge..
Great service lovely food, Roof top bar was amazing, the view of the Empire State Building on Halloween was amazing.

title: Diamond in the concrete jungle!
text: Awesome hotel in a great location, so easy to get to anywhere from here. We stayed for  2 nights but wish it could have been more. The hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming and there was great service overall. We had a higher floor room with the most amazing view of the Empire State Building. The room was on the smaller side, but we expected that in the middle of this city! The bathroom was lovely, with a great shower and toiletries. There were additional touches such as welcome sweets and water, plus cookies the next day! Can't fault this hotel in any way and would highly recommend it - this will be our hotel of choice the next time we visit this beautiful city.

title: Amazing find with great service and a fantastic view!
text: We LOVED our stay at the Archer, not only is it right in the middle of everything with fantastic views of the Empire State building from our room and we had EXCELLENT service from all of the staff. The rooms are definitely on the smaller side, but it's NY so that's par for the course - they are decorated very nicely and have a large, spacious bathroom. Steaks at the restaurant downstairs were excellent, and the staff was simply fantastic. We will definitely be back - my new favorite hotel in NYC!

title: Awesome hotel - watch out for the accounting
text: Fantastic hotel, recommended it to friends until I got home and realized I received my Visa bill and was double charged for the room. It then took 30 days to refund my credit card. I had to pay my credit card company $1,500 USD extra until my refund came back the following month. I didn't have funds to cover the overage in my account which is how I discovered the error. No email, phone call or communication from Archer hotel, even though they had my email because they emailed me my hotel receipt. I called in several times a couple weeks later after I discovered it myself and all I was told was next couple of days - they double charged everyone.....over and over. This was a surprisingly low level of customer service - the way to properly handle this would be pro-active. Or get the refunds to people ASAP. I would be afraid to stay at Archer again after this headache!

title: 10 out of 10
text: This is my second time at the Archer Hotel . I cannot really find anything wrong about this hotel. Location is 100 % the best. Its literally round the corner from everything. 34th street train station is 3 minutes away which connects you to both uptown and downtown, shopping and Times Square are literally round the corner. Apart from the location i cannot not mention the extremely helpful and very attentive staff especially the reception staff. So nice and welcoming above all. Room is spotless with towels changed everyday and free water daily. And lets not forget the bar on floor 22. the view AMAZING. Don't look any further .... the Archer hotel is simply the best choice in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Excellent hotel and service
text: The staff at this hotel are friendly and so helpful. The rooms are gorgeous, and the thoughtful touches of slippers, water and cookies made the for unexpected delightful surprises. I would recommend a couple of drinks on the roof bar the views are stunning. I felt safe and the bed is really comfy. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Fabulous Girls Weekend
text: The Archer was the perfect hotel for our memorable girls weekend.  We came to New York City for wedding dress shopping for my daughter. Our group of 11 had a perfect stay!  The hotel and staff were so accommodating and welcoming.  They situated our rooms all together.  When I asked for treats for our guests it was no problem.  They even created cards to be delivered to each room along with the champagne. The location was perfect. We could walk most every where. The roof top bar is wonderful.  It has a direct view of the Empire State Building. I highly recommend this hotel and will only be staying here from now on!

title: Extremely helpful staff, great location
text: I've never had more attentive staff and concierge team. There was an unforeseen mistake in my booking of the rooftop bar, and the team bent over backwards to accommodate me elsewhere and make my evening pleasant. The hotel is very centrally located and an easy walk to everything. The room is a bit small but normal for NY, and there was a Nespresso machine in the room. Very pleased and will visit again.

title: Annoying
text: A decent enough place,  but tries too hard. You are constantly being sold the restaurant, even to the extent they put post-stick notes on the mirror in the bathrooms to remind you there is a steak restaurant downstairs. Just not very relaxing to be constantly sold at. I’m in NY maybe 4-5 times a year with work, will give this place a miss going forward. Just a bit irritating!

title: A wonderful stay, helped by wonderful people.
text:
Wow! What can I say? Archer NYC you are amazing. Thank you so much for making our first trip to New York so memorable. We visited for my mum's 60th birthday, and your staff could not have done more for us. From a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room, to chatty, interested and knowledge staff. A big thank you to Troy on reception! 

We stayed in a double twin room over looking the empire state building, which was phenomenal. The beds are comfortable and spacious. The rooms are small but fine for two people, and there's loads of storage for bags. The air con is a bit loud but we didn't need it much in November!

The bathrooms are great, really bright with a great sized mirror. 

And the treats! So many lovely little treats left by house keeping. 

Keep up the good work! And try the steak at Charlie Palmer it's so great and the staff are just as friendly. 

Thank you once again all at Archer NYC - we will be back! 

Rebecca and Kate

title: Nice hotel, great location, serviceminded staff,
text: Hotel located close to 5th aveny, serviceminded and friendly staff. Quit small hotel with small rooms, but with wonderful beds, Nespresso machine, new cakes every day, fresh bathroom, soft bathrobes. Fantastic breakfast.

title: HAPPY BUSINESS TRAVELLER
text: Great hotel and attentive staff especially for business travels.  Quick check in.  Bag check, and water in hand to get you to your appointment on time.  Front desk team and Bell men team are top notch.  Renie is welcoming and ready for you upon arrival.

title: Fantastic Hotel~ Recommend
text:
My wife and I stayed two nights at Archer on a spur of the moment holiday. We read up on this hotel and made the decision to stay here based on the reviews. They are fairly new, about 5 years old. 
I do not usually write hotel reviews, but this one is an exception. The interiors of this hotel is spotless, great amenities and overall service. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. 

Unlike most hotels, Archer really knows how to appeal to all demographics. The decor is chic and they really pay attention to the little details which we appreciate. The rooms are not huge, but it is NYC and it worked well for us. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and the free wifi worked excellent. 
Big Perk: Great rooftop bar with view of Empire State Building.

To make things even better, most staff members were friendly and helpful. Julie in particular offered genuine customer service, talking with us during our check in and then asked the next day how our show was which we told her we were going to. The location of the hotel was great, walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Bryant Park.

Overall, we felt wonderful staying at Archer Hotel and enjoyed the 48 hours of being pampered. 
Highly recommend this hotel, we will be back!

title: Wedding anniversary
text: I can't say enough about how incredible this hotel was!! The location was perfect to get around the city, the ambiance was fantastic and the staff were unbelievable! They made our 2yr wedding anniversary absolutely memorable including sending us complimentary champagne!! The rooftop lounge is a great place for after dinner drinks and it's right in the hotel! I can't wait to go back and we will probably make this place our anniversary routine!! Thank you for such an incredible time at your beautiful hotel!!

title: Best hidden gem!
text: My husband I decided to celebrate our 2 year anniversary in the city and we booked the Archer hotel. We fell in love with it! Everything from the stylish trendy ambiance, service, staff and cleanliness was phenomenal. We were greeted by the concierge and front desk who asked if we needed any recommendations anywhere. The front desk advised us where to brunch and we couldn’t of found a better spot for mimosas. Once we settled in our room they called to make sure our room was perfect and it was. The decor in the room was so modern but yet still cozy. They truly made our anniversary so special by paying attention to small details.
