They sent us champagne and later on in the night we needed up going to the rooftop for a night cap and it was great! The music and even the bartender made it such a fun night. The location of the hotel was perfect as well we were able to shop around, take trains everywhere and walk around the city without being too far away from our hotel. Next time we have friends coming into the city or are celebrating another event we will stay here again.... our second home :)

title: Archer Hotel - Recommended
text: This is a great hotel. Go for the rooms with a view of the Empire State building or simply head up to the rooftop bar in the evening and watch the light show - beautiful! Comfortable bed, lovely staff and a great location. Highly recommended.

title: rapport qualité/prix tres moyen
text:
c'est un hotel tres charmant avec des chambres bien décorées et bien equipées mais beaucoup trop petites (je ne viens pas à New York pour rester dans la chambre, mais j'aime aller dans la salle de bain sans etre obligé d'enjamber ma valise....)
De plus, le fait que le petit dejeuner ne soit pas inclus nous fait passer tout droit de la rue vers l'ascenseur, aussi, nous ne ressentons pas l'atmosphere ni l'ambiance de l'hotel...
Le "hall" d'entrée est minuscule donc la chambre devient notre seul lieu de vie possible...
A ce prix, on aimerait profiter des installations d'un hotel...
Le Roof top est sympa et le personnel est assez accueillant.
L'emplacement est idéal.
Compte tenu du prix et du peu de service disponible dans cet hotel, je crois qu'il vaut mieux payer moins cher pour un lit confortable (nous etions 2 dans la chambre qui contenait deux lits (inferieurs à 140)) et une chambre un peu plus grande.

title: surprisingly sad experience
text:
i booked the room with the empire state building view for my husband’s birthdays months ago in April for the trip in Nov, and we were very looking forward to this as the highlight for our 10-day trip as we love the empire state building a lot.
we checked in as usual, never been informed about the change of room type and when we entered our room, opening the curtain with joy and that is not one with the empire state building view, they said that was an inventory issue so they do not have enough rooms with the view. We know these things do happen sometimes but it is the attitude of the staff pissed us off the most.
They offered free breakfast to compensate but that is really not the point, I was really very disappointed and cancel the booking and booked elsewhere last minute.

title: Loved this hotel, perfect location and little touches
text:
We stayed here for 5 days in October and we absolutely loved it! 

Couldn't of wished for a better location, right near to the empire state, Macy's and 5th avenue. We could see the top of the empire state from our room! We also regularly walked to times square which was only a few blocks away.

The beds were extremely comfy and big. Extremely powerful shower and modern style rooms. The lifts were quick and you didn't have to wait. The road itself where the hotel is on was fairly quiet but like anywhere in New York there is always a bit of traffic noise (we were on the 10th floor). I found that wearing ear plugs helped to block it out.

We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but would often just find what was close by. Although we had some drinks and snacks in the bar on the last night which was delicious. Spyglass rooftop bar has amazing views of the empire state building.

The staff were all so friendly and attentive, just saying hello when they see you makes a big difference. The turn down service at night was great as they left little treats/snacks e.g. mini biscuits and cookies. As it was my 30th birthday they left a little Happy Birthday card and tin of cookies which was a lovely gesture.

Overall we would definitely recommend this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

title: Perfect place
text:
When i visit this hotel i find it more comfortable and accommodating..
It was one of my favorite hotel 🏨
It has all the facilities... 
Rooms were very well organized..
Clean.. and well developed

It is a perfect place to spend nights 🙌

I have a very pleasant experience here. Thank u

title: 5 STAR!!  LOVE this Place!  Will Stay Again!!
text: Traveled to NYC with my 16 year old daughter from Tampa stayed here 3 nights.  We shared a King size bed.  Bed and Pillows were unbelievably soft and comfortable. Yes, rooms are small, but has lots of storage. Bathroom is of decent size and even has 4 levels of shelves. We unpacked everything.  Small closet but I travel with velvet flat hangers just bring those, you can hang everything.  Extra drawer in closet for socks etc. 2 drawers next to the bed too. Make-your-own-code safe in the closet.  Big enough for jewelry plus ipad.  Bathroom has a strong magnified mirror for makeup (im 52 and blind...this mirror worked GREAT).  Windows crack open for fresh air.  The bathroom is so clean, it is incredible.  Fun gourmet treats every night placed in your room by house keeping.  Staff will gladly help you with transportation to airport.  We used Uber and staff told us when our Uber driver was there.  Uber ride to hotel was $48, uber ride back to airport was $41 and is approximately an 35-45 min drive (Lgdria).  We walked everywhere else during our trip.  We walked to Time Square, American Eagle Outfitters, Anthropologie, American Girl Doll, Gap, H&M, Gucci, etc CVS is on the corner next to Archer.  We walked to broadway show "Frozen" then to John's pizza (it was mediocre). Had dinner at The Elgin (fantastic!!!) and brunch on day at Valerie (excellent!).  Rooftop bar was small....we only took a peek, did not eat there, as my daughter was too young.  Overall warm and fuzzy place Will DEF go again.

title: Amazing Staff
text: I came for a conference and the Archer Hotel was booked for me. The staff was so friendly, attentive, and helpful. Everything was clean and beautiful. If I ever just visit NY, I will certainly stay there. I absolutely recommend it!

title: great things in small packages
text: I liked everything about this hotel starting with the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept (well) on.  The room was small but had everything I needed -- and everything was of great quality.  Small finesse point: the minibar prices were reasonable. $5 for a nip, $3 chips ... The staff were genuinely nice without exception -- even passing in the halls. The sky bar puts you eye level with the Empire State building close enough to touch and the lobby level bar and restaurant are warm and welcoming.  Easy walking to almost everything.  The only drawback I can possibly come up with is, if you have a loud neighbor you will hear it through the doors.  But overall, one of my favorite hotels anywhere.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
Excellent emplacement proche de Time Square et du métro mais quand même au calme. Nous avions demandé une chambre dans les étages supérieurs et nous étions au 20ème, avec une vue magnifique sur l’ESB
Il y a au 22ème étage un rooftop très agréable pour boire un verre le soir. 
Nous étions 3 et avions une chambre avec 2 lits doubles, très confortables mais malheureusement en 140cm. 
Belle sdb avec grande cabine de douche, les WC sont dans la sdb. 
La chambre n’est pas très grande mais plutôt cosy. 
Le buffet du petit déjeuner est bien sans être exceptionnel. 
L’hôtel est de dimensions humaines et le personnel charmant

title: Brilliant
text: Right from the moment we stepped out of the cab we knew we were in the right place. Concierge took our cases, reception was very efficient and informative. Nothing was too much trouble and so friendly. We had asked for a room away from the lifts and we were put in room 709. It was tucked away in a very quiet corner as requested. Huge bed in a small room, beautifully decorated. There's not much in the way of cupboard space but "enough". Great bathroom and shower good quality accessories. Nice coffee machine with complimentary coffee & tea. The bed I have to say was just the most comfortable I think I have slept in anywhere, magnificent after a long day treading the New York streets! Now for breakfast - Mrs had continental beautiful selection all fresh and tasty with free tea and coffee. I opted for Avocado toast with 2 poached eggs simply lovely oh and a pot of tea $6!!! So we had breakfast in hotel each morning of our stay and it was beautiful. We also ate 2 nights at the hotel and again the food and service were wonderful. The Hotel is in a great location just a stones throw from most of the attractions and quiet enough to sit outside and enjoy a coffee. I cannot recommend this hotel enough it was perfect for our 5 night stay.
